0p0qYW6Ri01JQtZgml2Y6w.text: Brotada and I wanted to try something new/fresh.  This place kept coming up in searches of new restaurants.  We had a BLAST!  Food was so fun....so tasty....so many things going on.  Kwan was our server/mentor/Jedi Master.  He navigated us through for some delicious outcomes.  Get the lamb skewer for sure!  I want to point out that my brother has some food sensitivities to dairy and nuts.....and Kwan expertly guided us into selections that would honor those restrictions.  Seriously one of the highlights of our trip......we made some friends in the couple sitting right beside us!

This is a place I'd love to go back to, with friendly staff, such as our great server Deni who took time to explain how things work and his recommendations on food, very friendly. 10/10 would come back and recommend to friends.

lZVqRwzZb0B6GobY2gx6hA.text: we went tonight for my wife's birthday... the ambience and the food was great. we ordered the house original soup base and its exceptional. as for those who crave spicy soup base, their hell soup base is right for you. the price is affordable... their combos and platters is a great add on. we would like to commend the staff especially our server, matthew for his exceptional knowledge about the menu and his outstanding customer service. i do recommend for you to try this. we will definitely going back and let friends know how great our experience had been. thank you!

pcR0JoTSc8_lHcqdeA4gcA.text: Wonderful hotspot place about 10 mins from the Strip where we are staying. Soup base variety better than haidilao, and very fresh seafood such as clams and fish fillet. Sauce and appetizer bar is great too. Really enjoy coming here on our trips to Vegas (from LA).

56VdCKeg_P4PDF4WE23ViQ.text: Hot pot is definitely one of my favorite things to eat. Sadly, Vegas doesn't have many hotpot options. I had to resort to try Chubby Cattle. I have been here 4-5 times, every time I have had a pleasant experience. The only issue is that this place is completely overpriced for the amount of vegetables and add ons. The meat quality was soso, and the broth wasn't spectacular. I recently tried the tomato broth and I do recommend that over all the other broths. Also, I would recommend trying the side dishes they have at the sauce table. There was lotus root one time when I went and it was delicious. Another time there was this wood mushrooms. Overall, I would give Chubby Cattle 3/5. It is though the better hotpot places in Vegas.

EN3lUvCCLIzQ4dlSwNHnug.text: Best hot pot place in vegas,always my first choice to bring my friends or clients from other city to show them what's real chinese hot pot are! And accidentally saw the owner prepared some Christmas gifts to his employees. I will always keep support it!

_bMvWj70s6_vKYAm_6ntTQ.text: I love coming here with friends!! They go to this restaurant like every week and they got me hooked!! It's fun and easy to do! Their kids love it too!! Tl5gpu_F9vJ4gLW3UtHWnA.text: Nice and chill place to enjoy real hot pot with friends! Service is excellent! For busy holidays seasons stuffs are very professional and organized.

-_WuYQ-snvBH9nTUxQ2AzA.text: This was our first time at a Hot Pot restaurant! I was excited when we sat down because the conveyer belt reminded me of some restaurants in Japan and Hawaii! I was also excited that there was an option of soup base that didn't have nightshades! (since I'm allergic to nightshades; potatoes, tomatoes, peppers, and eggplants) I chose the mushroom soup and my husband chose the ox tail soup...which looked delicious!! If they didn't have pepper in the broth...that would've been my choice as well! BUT...my broth was just as delicious and I was very pleased with it! We also ordered the meat combo and lamb skewers. The lamb skewers came out with dried crushed pepper flakes which wasn't mentioned on the menu, so we ordered another one without the dusted peppered lamb and I LOVED it! I could eat the entire skewer plate....and I did! Lol since we had two orders of lamb now, my hubs ate the peppered one and I ate the non peppered one.  When our soups came, we waited for them to start boiling and began making our dips and extra seasonings for our broth. I chose to add fresh garlic, cilantro, sesame oil, green onions and salt into my bowl. This mixture ended up into my soup and my broth was even more to my liking. I couldn't tell you how much in love I am with this place!!  I was also exited about the chayote they had on the conveyor belt. I only eat that stuff when my dad makes it in his delicious Filipino soup called Tinola. But I decided to put it in my hot pot that night and I loved it as equally as I did when my dad makes it! I love this place and I wish it was here in Maryland.

ksEHBPpehV3Sax_SX5-EKQ.text: Chubby Cattle is, in my opinion, one of the more prominent locations for hot pot enthusiasts. From a wide variety of meats, vegetables, seafood, and noodle/tofu varieties; it's difficult to not find something that will eventually become your favorite. I highly recommend that if haven't had hot pot yet, this should definitely be your first spot. Chubby Cattle sets the bar high for how how pot should be served and enjoyed; all with fair prices. Our server, James, provided phenomenal service which made our experience here much more enjoyable. I plan on coming here again soon.

9sGB4ROeJe5KCD4wS5KdjA.text: Stopped here wanting to try something a little different. That's exactly what we got. The experience was fun, and the staff was very friendly and helpful explaining everything.   Cooking the meat in the broth was fun, and trying all the sides coming by in the conveyor belt was pretty cool. We were there 1.5-2 hours, and it felt like we would still occasionally see new items come by on the belt.

j2kVJYUinimEIEzhAdf0Rg.text: Omg amazing, can't wait to come back. Saw this on an Andrew Zimerman show and we came to try it!!!

zRQJ_hTA1ou3JRZxmMrL5Q.text: Everything in tonight's experience was spot on from start to finish. We had a work party of 8, upon getting on the Yelp page to check their great reviews, it actually let's you set an appointment. On top of that, they actually message you back to confirm the reservation! Much more than most of vegas area where there no service and communication, this place is spot on!   As for the food was amazing! When we sat down a server explained the menu, process and everything we should know very well. Again these days it's very hard to find this type of place to eat where they are so service oriented!  The quality of food was fresh and great!!

gWiSWLwy5dKguyq-jIpg1g.text: This is the worst hot pot restaurant I have ever been. Their services always busy, it takes 15 minutes for a cup of ice water, and the attitude is rude. Vegetables are not fresh at all, half green half yellow. Also we tried their  MOST FAMOUS live lobster, unfortunately, it is frozen. So, don't waste you guys' money and time here.

TMbfaPNNuEUlr-DO7VrqGQ.text: Some friends went there together to celebrate for the holiday,I expected to have a wonderful hot pot experience. BUT The meat was NOT really fresh. Taste not very well. Not like other Chinese hot pot restaurant at all. Everyone was so disappointed :((((((

gp-vBzeYurCW3CVQxPK_Eg.text: Love hot pot.  Brings back so many memories. I love the idea of the conveyor belt hot pot.  Last time I saw something similar was in mainland China.  Food quality was good and the plates on the conveyor seemed to be rotated fairly regularly.    their "original" broth is flavorful and their "hell" broths are great!  All in all, a great restaurant in terms of the food.  Minus the one star because the server we had spoke too quickly, mumbled a lot, and called us (4 guys in the party), all "bro".  A lot.  like every few words.  Listen, I'm not your "bro".  Until I spoke Chinese to the waiter (towards the end of the meal), he did not seem too keen on offering good service.  I hope they address this training issue.  Food food, it's 5 stars. For service, it's a 4.  I'd definitely go back again.

tL4ZkwKRiwnFgYfYvNQx0g.text: We love this place and Kwan is the best. The food is amazing and Kwan took care of us whenever we are here. Highly recommend, you won't regret it.

NBAgJWzOvPChx1OoZX0CSA.text: The broth was good. The conveyer belt thing was so fun. They have so many quality options for meat and seafood. They had weird stuff like brains and feet too. They also have a sauce bar with some sides. I don't know if it's because Ive been craving hotpot for a good five days or what but we came here because we had a long ass day and had a layover in Vegas and everything was delicious! The broth especially was soooooo good. I loved the Chinese/Szechuan numbing spice flavor. I usually eat Shabs with ponzu and raw garlic but they only had fried garlic which was a tasty alternative. I actually like that combo better now. I would definitely come back. No complaints whatsoever

Plus the price is not high at all. but parking is hard to find during rush hours and tooany people waiting. better make reservations.

bvHi2ZM0NB7OLghsL-d56A.text: This is my most favorite hot pot place here in Vegas. The flavors are amazing and unique! My server Zoe and the manager Joyce were extremely hospitable.   I definitely recommend the tomato soup base and the Heavenly pot. The soups had earthy essences and the atmosphere was chill and classy.  They recently renovated the place, and they now have complimentary side dishes!  The place is upscale, but very family oriented.

W_VqdS889a_BNIsp9t3oug.text: First time we've been here and we liked it. Service was fast. They refill your soup right away. Meat portions are enough but not so much with the seafood. Noodles small serving. The sauce area needs some cleaning. Waiter is friendly and explained how things are. For the price we paid, i say its worth it  I just wish conveyor plates have labels in it, we we're afraid to grab it and later on dislike it.   Restroom needs some cleaning too.   Will definitely come back.

kXLtLW06dC9JFeRPeEAF5g.text: First time at Chubby Cattle was great!  SERVICE Our server XiaoXiao was polite, fast and came to check on us throughout our meal. I felt like we were pretty needy customers, so to accommodate our hangry demands with a smile and as quickly as she did, 5 stars for XiaoXiao! Our waters, soups and bellys were never empty =) we were also seated in a timely manner, although it was very busy.   FOOD $7 Two soups  $5 Vegetable noodles $6 Grilled oysters (2) $6 Beef brisket $6 Homemade Cuttlefish Balls $1 Steamed Rice $2 Yellow Plate Conveyor Belt Item (3) Total bill for two: $42.06 The food was healthy, delicious and my favorite part was the sauce bar. The sauce bar is a delectable self-serve counter where you can choose from several sauces, including black bean sauce, fried garlic, house sauce, sesame oil, peanut sauce, etc. You can choose to dip, mix and eat your food with any number of sauces. Awesome, right? The food on the conveyor belt was fresh and didn't smell, due to the high turnover rate of customers. I enjoyed my meal and so did my boyfriend.   ATMOSPHERE The music and ambiance of the restaurant was fun. Great for groups, dates and families. Very clean and interactive.   Overall, I'm glad that the conveyor belt culture has come to Vegas. Will come back again =)

hfVw_OYRktOIWo6YTg8OAw.text: What a great find!  My wife and I had never been to an authentic Korean Hot Pot before and the staff could not have been more helpful and the food was great.  Our waiter took the time to walk us through how everything worked and made great recommendations based on questions he asked us about what type of food we like.  Great experience and so glad we gave it a try.

ak5FCom6V76GIwQDx2xaJQ.text: My friend is a hot pot fanatic so I did quite a bit of searching on yelp to find a good spot to have dinner for the both of us. The food and experience here was enjoyable. Service was nice. The conveyer belt is a great idea since I prefer only eating certain sides, I can pick and choose however I please. Their sauce bar had hot cheetos, which was a plus for me. I thought it was very sincere of our waitress to warn my friend that the spiciest broth was very strong. However, don't doubt my friend, she'll drop 10 more hot drops if she has to. When the broth came out, it wasn't spicy enough for her so she was disappointed with the hype. She liked the flavor nonetheless. The only thing that made her lose her appetite was the sour peppers she kept biting into in the broth. She recommends the kitchen puts the spices in a spice bag.  If there is one thing that irked me about this place was that I did my research online before I came and the price for the Kobe was $25.99 for a 3 oz, $49.99 for a 6oz. The 3 oz was what we ordered. It was the only meat that doesn't state the price on the actual menu which seemed kind of sketch because it seems like they could just decide however much it could be at that point. I was too trustworthy. They charged me $50 for this and when I asked, they said the 3oz was for $50 and the 6 oz was for $100. I felt cheated and super annoyed. I probably should have brought up their menu online to confront them about it. I didn't want to ruin my experience here though by bringing up conflicts considering it was my friend's and my first time here and we did like it a lot... except for the sketchiness. Next time if I decide to come here, assuming I'll get over this situation, I'll ask for their prices first before I order.

photos.caption: Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu Online shows the price for KOBE, actual menu doesn&#39;t.

IGZ9-vtORddHol2E4swqeg.text: This is definitely the best hot pot place you can find in Las Vegas. I had an original pot and my friends all had tomato pots. I liked my pot a lot although their tomato pots are tastier. Their servers are so friendly. Alex and Angela are so great. It was such a great experience.

cMM-YXTF87_KFgKlSxcseQ.text: deni is very nice and accommodating, he knows how to handle guest perfectly.  food is superb. fairly priced. dont believe me? read more yelp reviews.

_uDl3p8il_EWEmiu1kd72A.text: Chubby Cattle definitely brings out my gluttony side, especially considering that I already have a weakness for hot pot. No matter the weather nor time of day, I'm always up for hot pot. And this place is one of my favorite hot pot places in Vegas. The meat quality is generally above average and I usually just get the house original pot for soup base. The conveyor belt is a great idea, although a bit dangerous. I just keep having urges to take colorful plates out of it. And next thing you know, I have a mountain plates next to me. It's not always fresh so be careful. Better bet is to order from the menu. Service here is a bit volatile but they generally try to provide great service. I remember James was our server twice and is super nice and attentive. There were a few others that were nice but not as memorable.

eCmWzw1iqgVN706ZxNRExA.text: I came here many times this is favorite place.The food excellent. Deni is friendly. Very good service.

nIZsR8T0lafU1JvxtJNDcA.text: Wow came back here and it was a very good experience! The waitress who was serving my boyfriend and I was awesome! She was very helpful with all our questions and very attentive. The food was great! They have a lot of choices and the soup base has plenty of flavor. Will definitely come back again and again and again haha. They also have ice cream on the house when you're done eating ! What a plus lol

CmZ0HOKiJieTGlzD5LorTg.text: Heard about this place from friends and decided to stop by. The food was great and the environment was great. Good music playing was playing and that was a plus. jYjv3_IFi715dX92Hi11mQ.text: Fun concept for hotpot! You get individual pots with your choice of soup base. Happy hour starts at 9:30pm- buy one get one free off the conveyor belt which has assorted veggies, seafood, tofu, and noodles. The plates range from 99 cents to 3.99. You can also order off the regular menu which has assorted meats, seafood combos, etc. Our server Kwan was very attentive and helpful. He even gave us free ice cream  They don't serve alcohol, so BYOB!!

Dn1HE9Sdcq47b5MYVRLl4w.text: The options can be overwhelming so take your time looking at the menu. Good food! Good service. I'd recommend the seafood soup

Qdee_Bpw9VwqELzZ6k-mlw.text: Super fun experience! The colorful plates on the conveyor feels like something out of a Tim Burton film. You get to pick your own broth (I had mushroom) then add in noodles, veggies, meat and seafood. You can also pick extras off the conveyor to throw in. There are lots of interesting options to try and Deni, our waiter, walked us through everything. I'd come back to try this again, but word of warning, the parking lot is a nightmare.

Ho2sE-3CGHSm2_ImZDjEqQ.text: I've been to Chubby Cattle quite a few times now. It's my go-to spot for hot pot. They used to have a casino and student discount on Sundays and Wednesdays where it's BOGO free. However, they have now changed that. Instead of BOGO free, you sign up for a pre-paid card (much like a gift card) and you get an additional amount of $$$ (I've attached a pic). So if you place $100 on the card, you get an extra $18; purchase $200 and you get additional $38, and so on.   The broth is what keeps me coming back. I've had the tomato, original, oxtail, and spicy pot. Only one I haven't tried is the mushroom. My top 2 is the tomato and original. I also recommend the beef combo, and the juicy beef balls. The beef balls are filled with soup in the middle so be careful and make sure you don't chomp down on the whole thing! It burns! I speak from experience.   They also have a wonderful sauce bar where you can make your own sauce for you to dip your food in. If you look at the top of the sauce bar, there are signs that'll give you samples of what sauces to mix to go with whatever meat you're having (great for people who are kitchen-challenged, such as myself).  I do enjoy the conveyor belt and it's fun to pick the food you want from it. If you're at a table that isn't connected to the conveyor belt, you can always order from the menu bc it's the same items.   The only thing that keeps it from being 5 stars for me is the service. I always have to ask for a water refill and that's a pet peeve of mine. Or there will be silverware missing and it takes them forever and a half years to get the items to you.   Even with that said, I will still go back to Chubby because I truly do enjoy the food.

Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New promo

zgRxVcsAcAj1IxQ9ITmXhQ.text: Really overpriced.  The food isn't bad.  This review isn't about the food but the selection and what you get for the $$$.  So if you've never had hot pot style cuisine, yes, this would be an good experience.  Touristy kind of vibe here and you don't get much food for the amount.  Usually there's stuff provided like veggies as a filler.  Or there's all you can eat places that has crabs, roes, shrimp, all sorts of seafood, tofu stuffed items, all sorts of beef, etc.  While here, my gf and I ordered a 13 oz beef plate, a veggie plate (which was just a basket of veggie, no tofu, no mushroom, no variety of anything) and some noodles here for 60.  I just wanted to come here to see what the rave was all about.

gWeu5BglsScsKaR7v09umg.text: Delicious late night with 50% off conveyor items! Good selection of meat plates, platter FULL of meat for $18.  Don't order veggies or shrimp if it's late night cause you can get it from conveyor belt for half off$!

q4Au8aYGqcnotUZzwecUjg.text: We visit Vegas from Seattle three times and year and we always take the time to visit Chubby Cattle! It has high quality ingredients and the most delicious broth options. Whether it's a busy Saturday night or a aid back weekday the service is always top notch. Huge shout out to Kwan, our awesome server, during our last visit to Chubby Cattle! Once again we were impressed with the quality ingredients and amazing service. This place has the best Hot Pot in Vegas!

WymVMF9JZd1Ki1bVgJaJBQ.text: Super fun place for hot pot in LV. save it for those cold dessert winter nights.

ax5OT4V5DPDIc7RW-iuCFQ.text: First off, I'm super impressed by this entire Asian food plaza. It has all the popular restaurants on Mountain Spring Road. From fancy Vietnamese food to sushi, and now Mongolian Hot Pot, Vegas' Asian food scene is so hot RIGHT NOW.  I came to Chubby Cattle right at noon on Sunday morning and people were waiting to be seated. I had no idea this restaurant was featured on the Food Network, so I noticed the TV hype as patrons mentioned they wanted to try this place due to ZimmernList.   We wanted to order the Wagyu (which they advertised on Yelp too), but they were sold out. So we ordered the Beef combo with a veggie platter. The veggie platter came out in 30 minutes (it's raw veggies, we cook it ourselves, c'mon) and our beef came out 1 hour later (again, it's raw. we would have to cook it ourselves).   The veggie platter came in a large wooden basket with a variety of vegetables but what I didn't understand was the romaine lettuce. I get bok choy and cabbage, but I don't get why you would cook lettuce in broth. It's just weird.   The beef combo was actually pretty decent once it came out and the meat was nicely marbled.  There is a rotating conveyor belt (like a sushi belt) of toppings that you can choose from for your hot pot. All the toppings were not labeled nor did the ingredients looked very appetizing. The rotating plates were color coordinated to different pricing, so we got the price but the frosty covers don't reveal much.  At the sauce station, the variety of sauces was nice, but there are a million signs of how to develop "recommended" sauce combinations.   All in all.. there is WAYYY too much going on here. The gimmick of these random features fall short.  I think Chubby Cattle should just concentrate on executing good quality meats/veggies in a timely manner. The entire restaurant was not pleased with the slow pacing of the food coming out (our server was pleasant, at least!).  Interesting experience but probably never would be back.

Pukq491HXwUJMf9tjl_w3w.text: My favorite hotpot place in town. To me, hotpot is foremost  about how great the broth is and Chubby Cattle's medium spicy hellish broth keeps me coming back and back for more. There's also other broths you can pick from, with a variety of spice levels, from no spiciness all the way to hottest hellish. The meat selection is great, with changing daily specials that includes certified wagyu beef and even Kobe. They also have a good seafood selection. The vegetable selection is also pretty huge, even if I only get the bokchoi. They also have a huge selection of mushrooms. This place is also different from other hotpot places in that they have a conveyor belt throughout the store that you can pick dishes to throw into your pot, priced according to the color of the plate. Only downside might be that it is a la carte and can cost more if you're used to eating at AYCE volume, but if you're here for quality over quantity, then this place is for you.

bn0KK3I1oNatperoy-A2TA.text: Came here on NYE and they were super speedy in getting us a table. For larger parties, they have individual rooms with round tables and each person can choose their own soup base. For smaller parties, there are tables were you can choose your hot pot items from the conveyor belt.   The servers are extremely attentive and polite. The food arrived fairly quickly. We loved the tomato oxtail, tomato, and original soup bases. According to the servers, the mushroom one is a bit bland in comparison. The mushroom basket and beef combos were worth. They have a station for sauces and they have a lot of options.   Loved it and would definitely come here again!

bjEZZER_nNHnAddwB1z90A.text: My Fav Hot Pot Place, They probably have the best broth  with the combo of the spicy and original, their beef combo is also very good with reasonable price plus supper supper delicious fish tofu.

1W8wn99BFP7KpIg0bCpTZQ.text: Excellent food. There's nothing not to like. All the soup bases are excellent, especially the tomato oxtail and the mushroom. Deni, our server was very friendly and accommodating. It's such a gem in Vegas. Great for family and sharing. Meats are high quality and house shrimp paste is excellent.

qxCrR9r8xKBd2b677tPcng.text: Chubby cattle is my go to place for hotpot!!! I've honestly never been anywhere else. Why? Cause I love the service and  the food there! I love the idea of having my own pot and not sharing with any of my friends!   The service is always amazing! They really know how to take care of their customers. My friends and I always end Mn the back room. Maybe cause we're too wild for everyone else. But we love it!   This last time Denny took care of us!!! Made us feel welcome and hooked our drinks up! Thanks Denny!   Ps the music is always poppin in here.   No complaints here

ONdu0wPX2gL_PqfF8TYLlA.text: I've been coming to Vegas a lot and I recently started to find places outside the strip to eat. Walked in with a group of 5 on a Saturday night around 8pm with no reservations (tried to make one via phone but their line seemed to be disconnected?) and we were quickly seated. Must have gotten lucky because as soon as we were seated the restaurant was packed with people waiting. We all did individual pots but they do have family style pots as well..  Tomato Oxtail Pot (added spicy) - 5 Stars: Great flavors with chunks of oxtail meat. I asked for more of the oxtail meat and they brought out more with no problem. I made my broth extra spicy and you can really taste the authenticity of Mongolian style hotpot.   Meat Combo - 4.5 Stars: The quality of the meat was on the medium-high grade and quantity of the meat portion was excellent. The meat combo was only $18 an order and we ordered three between three people who eat meat.  Vegetable Combo - 4 Stars: Great combo, lots of vegetables, and you can also order separately if there are things you don't like. The combo was only $13 an order. An order is good enough for 2 people.  Mushroom Combo - 4.5 Stars: Great variety of mushrooms, love mushrooms and it also cost $13 an order. An order is good enough for 2 people.  Sauce Bar - 5 Stars: There is lots of variety of sauces and condiments to personalize your own sauces!   Aside from order combos, there are individual price points for individual items. There is also a conveyor usually containing vegetables or seafood.   This is also a Vegan/Vegetarian friendly place. We had two people in our group (one was vegetarian/one was vegan). They do have two options of vegan soups - the Assorted Mushroom Pot and the Beautiful Tomato Pot.  Service - 5 Stars: Deni was great at going over the menu, because it may be overwhelming at first. He was always on top of things. He was very attentive and always came back to make sure our pots, water, and trays were filled. He also makes sure your table is well taken care of and food will come out on a fast pace.  Price - $$ It is not all you can eat however their price point is decent.   Overall, I would definitely recommend this place if you're in Vegas and craving for some authentic Mongolian Hot Pot. They have a great variety in their sauce bar and vegan option on their hot pot. They have great service and great food. It is one of the best hot pots I've had and I can say it's better than all Mongolian hot pots in San Francisco.

71SmoTR7v1FskOgR-cDcBg.text: Yum. Service was good. Quality was good. It's not AYCE so it can get pricey. The assorted noodles were delicious. There was no lunch special despite the photo on the Yelp page. I would've rated it higher if there were a lunch special or some sort of combo option. I don't like ordering ala cart.  There just isn't the same variety when it's ala cart.

zuGzHzB-mEvEKVtH7NjVQA.text: Food was ok, but it was pretty expensive for what you get when it comes to the meat, vegetable and mushroom add ons.. $12 for a mushroom basket that was mostly white button mushrooms that cost $2 a pound.. We also got the dumpling special which was a complete ripoff..  The broth was great, but that is about it..

dgKFOx-uIK5ieWdxTSMd_w.text: We went here on Thanksgivings night and had a great time! Our server Jenny was a super caring and cheerful server who made our dining experience fantastic! The food was delicious especially the white soup broth where we keep refilling it! Will definitely come back again if I have the chance!

cQ9DpjiHuI1MeuLUzHYwxA.text: My very first hot pot experience!  I came with extremely high expectations. Their rating on yelp is baller and a couple of my coworkers have raved about how amazing this place is.  Pros: - Huge menu! Overwhelming but always great to have a variety of options  - Conveyer belt of goodies which are constantly cycling. Veggies, meats, egg - you name it! There's a sign with the prices per colored plate and you can grab what you want off the conveyer belt at any time. Whatever you take will be added to the bill at the end of your meal, kind of similar to the dim sum concept - Individual hot pots available so you can choose your own broth and place whatever you like in it. The group I dined with opted for this instead of sharing one large hot pot in the middle. I was with 5 others which made this a better option - if there were 3 of us total I wouldn't have minded sharing 1 large hot pot - Love the self serve station with spices, sauces, and pickled sides - so you can make a concoction to your liking to either add into your hot pot or use as a dipping sauce for cooked meat/veggies - Servers come by to refill your hot pot! If you're running low on broth, just request for more!   Cons - Service was slow. All the protein and veggies came out slowly in a random sequence that didn't make sense. We didn't receive our mushroom basket until the very end of our meal, which would have been nice to have had cooking in our hot pots earlier during our meal  - Small portions (but very reasonably priced!) Make sure to order an abundance of any proteins if you're sharing, they go fast   Overall this was a fun, new experience as I've never been to a hot pot restaurant before. I love soup, meat, and veggies... so this place is right up my alley! I will definitely be coming back to Chubby Cattle!

0_lJtrcgURfNrojJ6IZcQg.text: One of the best places in Las Vegas to get some hot pot! They even have a happy hour for the revolving belt of meat, vegetables and noodles.   There is a bar full of different sauces where you can make your own concoctions. I'd recommend asking for an egg and putting some sauces. Might sound weird but it's bomb!  You choose your own soup base. One dislike that I have about the spicy soup base is that here are too many red rectangle pepper things. I honestly don't know what it's called, but every time I tried to scoop out some meat, I got some of those things along with it too which was kind of annoying.  Servers were polite and our drinks were refilled. They have a TV where they had the game playing. Pretty nice modern interior decor.   Parking can be hard to find in this plaza, but it has always been this way. When there's a will, there's a way. Usually I will find a parking spot even if it is super busy.

sKtQDUUThtjiYeIEU-jLFQ.text: Good food and the price is very reasonable too. The meat is very fresh. Especially the lamb. Also like their sauce session very authentic style. Will come often.

xb2HviXm_c3kYAMvU5RF_A.text: Chubby Cattle is a MUST if you are visiting Vegas! The concept of a hot pot restaurant is so smart and is executed very well here. The variety of meat, vegetables, noodles, seafood was fabulous and delicious! The value/prices of the dishes was also super reasonable and the portions were perfect! The sauce bar had all of the hot pot sauce favorites including Chinese BBQ sauce (a childhood favorite of mine), oyster sauce, sesame oil and tons of other options. There is a helpful card/sign with recommendations on sauce combinations for the food you plan to cook. The service was very friendly and fast, we were sat and got our individual broth/soups very quickly. To try more soups, you can opt for individual pots or a larger one that the table can share. (GENUIS!) I tried the mushroom broth and the flavor was perfect and so hearty, everything I cooked tasted SO good! Our table also tried the original/house soup and the oxtail and tomato broth (both were phenomenal as well). We are absolutely recommending this restaurant to anyone who is planning a trip to Las Vegas and we are so excited to visit again the next time we are in town! Thank you for your hospitality and delicious food!

4ySI9QZxX3BAX7p28dy9zA.text: We passed by this place and were curious about the name. Needless to say we were pleasantly surprised, what a fun dinner experience! But we were confused because there were empty seats still available." I guess two people cannot assigned at four people table size. I felt sad for the owner. Good luck with your business. If you plan to go to this place, make sure you have more than two people because there is no seat for two. Terrible service!!!

JHZ2wkrxexDyrVNWKYvG4A.text: Honestly, this place is good but it's way overpriced for hot pot. The bill for two ran over $70 and we didn't order much! The waiter was pretty aggressive assisting we order the combos. The seafood combo was a rip off with 5 shrimps, 5 tiny clams, 4 mussels, 4 small scallops, and two tiny octopus....see I remember because it's not much food!  We just want to check it out since it's new and we won't be coming back....

VrQshXcnNXVwGl_BNjWB0g.text: How do I even start? By far THE worst customer service I have ever experienced in Las Vegas! First let me start off that we had a party of 8, when we arrive they tell us they do not have a table to seat us together. We are disappointed but nonetheless we wanted to try it out so we agree. But we are at two separate tables. As our waiter keeps "asking and waiting" for people from the other table, and I ask him "why?" He's like you're on one check plus 20% gratuity for 6 or more people. I explain that I understand but we are not even sitting together, why would be getting charged together, then I explicitly state TWO checks. His manager, says thats fine. Well our food came our delayed, he never came to check on us, and never refilled our water. He was too busy caring for his two large parties who came after we did and left before us. We FINALLY get the check and guess what?! Wow one bill, then obviously irritated and upset with the poor service we received we did not tip him well, he actually has the nerve to make comment about it!!! Apparently he didn't keep track of who ordered what, of course.  Lastly I will say this, the food isn't that great. Conveyor belt is a fun idea, small portions and expensive. I will not return and my net promoter score would be negative!

OalGDjaFmKh6L1USwifdYA.text: First time here for my dad's birthday. The food was very good. We got the heaven n hell broth with the beef, veggie, seafood combo. The dark broth was spicy but bearable to not ruin the experience of food and it gave enough flavor that I didn't even need to use my sauces. The light broth was simple and good. The environment screams good vibes. And the staff gave us good service. We drop our chopsticks and they gave us another one in seconds when we didn't ask for it. Thumbs up to them. They also played Happy Birthday song for us when they put the cake out. Our server was Deni. He and all of the other staff gave us great attention.

fJjFMysBIhMz7tiFEuPp-g.text: This place is good!  You pick food off a rotating conveyer belt and put it in the soup you order.  Sunday- Thurs is happy hour from 9:30pm - midnight.  The rotating plates are buy one get one free.  The house special soup is the best.  I come here weekly.

sqUIKYntTYJ1tKocR1mWHQ.text: Wow! This place is amazing. Let me start out with the awesome conveyor belt of food! It's so cool! Actually, let's start with the how. You start by ordering your base. There are lots of flavors, I would recommend asking your server. Then, you get to choose your meat. We did the beef combo and it was plenty of food for 2. We also picked some veggies and noodles from the conveyor belt. I did green tea noodles. Boy...they were delicious! I also added some mushrooms in and made sure to make a special sauce from the sauce bar in the middle. I read so many reviews saying how expensive this was. I'm unsure how anyone spent $80 here for 2 people! The prices are amazing. I could see how getting different foods from the conveyor belt could be expensive (they are charged by plate color) but overall, for 2 of us it was $35 which I thought was amazing! I can't WAIT to come back here and try so much more off of the menu.   I also wanted to give a HUGE shoutout to Sylvia who was extremely helpful and walked us through everything. She mixed special sauce for us and explained what everything on the conveyor belt was. The service is so amazing. There is not 1 negative thing I have to say about Chubby Cattl

qcnc-TR7iwXSu1oFynr9jw.text: Super awesome! Demi was our server and he gave us a lot of great suggestions. It's fun to watch the conveyer belt go around with all the yummy dishes!

photos.caption: Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood platter with spooky Halloween decorations!

_vMwizDQ85MAF8-3qm58tQ.text: This is the most authentic hotpot I have had in the US. As visitors from the hometown of hotpot in China, I can absolutely tell you that this is the real tasty hotpot! And we really appreciate Deni's service, he is so nice and considerate! We are having great dinner here! We highly recommend the beef and lamb combo and mushroom combo, that's awesome!

photos.caption: Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NbplJ0529-xcqGsUziLmVQ.text: Wow, this place is amazing all around.  I'm not a die hard hot pot fan like some people, but this place will have me coming back again and again and again.  The quality and variety of food will meet most people's cravings.  The conveyor belt of food is fun, you never know what's coming up next (yes!  They have blood, tendon and tripe) The service is incredible-thank you Kwan for always checking in with us throughout our meal.  You really made the experience 5*****.  The free make your own sauce bar is brilliant-suits even the pickiest of tastebuds.  I'll be back soon now that winter is approaching...

liY24DPMUewzFB3JxApsgw.text: Fantastic place for delicious hot pot!! Open late so it gives my coworkers and I time to eat after a long shift.  Highly recommended!!

photos.caption: Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hot pot!!!

xRnZPa8w55TkhWQ__5hEvg.text: This is the best Hot Pot in the west coast and their original soup base is to DIE FOR! $3.99 for the soup? How can you beat that?  Get the beef brisket with the potato noodles. Best combination so far! They hand make EVERYTHING from scratch and you can taste the difference.  My favorite part about Chubby Cattle is their innovation. The conveyor belt is fun, but it's not overwhelming like other places. It's truly an experience to eat here, but you won't have to burn a hole in your wallet to get it.  Most important aspect of all - Service.  Gia is my favorite server here and you have to request her when you eat here. She takes the time to explain the process to you, especially if you have people in your party who are unfamiliar with conveyor belt hot pot. This is a big deal because I have a lot of friends who are intimidated by Asian food.

LIgXWK8_zivojFWqjPOGmQ.text: We love this place.  All of my kids can eat a ton here! The hot pot is reminiscent of hot pot in Taiwan.  It is really authentic.  Some of the best items include house made fresh noodles and it comes in green and purple which my kids love!

60CzfLUXr-SlAAZKBZhcNw.text: 5 stars all the way. The waiters were fantastic and attentive. The food was very filling and priced right. Fresh ingredients and super spicy. You can't go wrong with anything at Chubby a Cattle. You can go full cave man and order tons of meat or stick to veggies and tofu and go more healthy. And don't forget the awesome sauce station that gives you the option to heat up any order. The conveyor belt is just a great plus to the restaurant. They have a limited alcohol menu but with soju and some wines and beer I can't complain. One of the best restaurants in the area and a mainstay in a top food corridors in China Town.

6o3L2ucSQZVOuilHEF6lRQ.text: I am so happy to have this hot pot place less than 10 minutes from my house. They're open only during dinner hours, but once they do open it gets packed! I was here and every table was full.  The meat is high quality and affordable for the quantity. They also have a great array of items to put into your hot pot! Everything from fish balls to pork blood.  However what really set this experience apart was the great service! I had Matthew as a server and he was extremely attentive. He would frequently check up on our table, and answered any of our questions.   Highly recommend!

0FMNd--tJKOGMObqE_IdWA.text: We came here last time at Thursday night but they about to close so I choose to comes back again. We choose original and spicy for our base. They both no taste, totally plain. In the soup pot there are a lot of herb, but still does't make any taste. The services was ok. The meats was so so.

photos.caption: Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9SNQAzzW8r0lRW-ZdRQUfA.text: I loved the concept of this new restaurant. You have the option to pick from 5 different broth choices. From there you can pick your vegetables, and your meat. If you sit next to the conveyer belt you have to option to pick any of the items you would like just at your reach. They also have a great selection of sauces, so if you feel a bit adventurous you can mix them and create your own. They had several meat and seafood packages which allowed us to try some of their most popular meats. I had a great time picking and creating my own soup. However, the service was just terrible. It was almost impossible to get out waters refilled. On top of that we ordered a side dish with our server and he never delivered it. We even reminded him twice and no luck. Thankfully this restaurant had an excellent manager. Joyce was very friendly and tried to accommodate us and help out as much as possible! So I was torn I couldn't give this restaurant a higher rating, but without their manager our overall experience would have been below expectations.

bwqvme7cFGqbYQChQDqqYA.text: It's a very nice and upscale place the food is fresh and services is beautiful this place is a must. Also I love the presentation of all the plates. But most importantly this is the only hotpot restaurant ice been to that serves Kobe beef.

w3PNTOPPEivdbR5ltQn2ZQ.text: This is one of the best, highest quality hot pot restaurant I have been to in the States. Very high quality cuts of meats and seafood, and their prices reflect that too. They're also unique in that they've got raw dishes of food on a conveyer belt you can just take yourself and pay per plate, but we weren't seated next to the conveyor belt so can't comment on that experience. We just ordered full plates of food from the menu. Their hand made shrimp paste recommended by our waiter was out of this world good. Very bouncy texture. And surprisingly their service was very attentive, which isn't the norm for Asian restaurants in general.

7elCY2o9g8t3X1P-jcic2w.text: Really good experience, I will definitely come back here! Hot Pot was amazing!! This is my first time trying hot pot and the soup and wagyu beef was great! Trust me you have to get the wagyu beef!! My waiter Deni was very good at instructing us what to do also.

SDIIj_JA8nyT0dcD4jl7Jw.text: Food are good, but service are really bad. We have waited for more than 40 minutes. No respect for Veterans even on Veterans Day! I could understand that no military discount on a regular basis. However, "NO!" With an ATTITUDE was not acceptable for a group of military personnel on Veterans Day!!! At least go and ask your manager!

z20DGK_0bKdoovTfgfMkmQ.text: It was the first time I've ever had "Hot Pot" and it was such a great experience! We had a table to 6 adults and 2 children and they first had us placed at a tall bar type of table but since the kids could not reach they moved us over to a booth, then after that they said that we could not have a high chair on the sides because someone has to run food through there. We had no problem in making it work and then the manager gave us a small room free of charge and gave us a great experience. Thank you so much Chubby Cattle staff!! Will be back!!! Amazing food and service!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YUrhw8nrNwEmlRMSQwSV8w.text: Chubby cattle was yummy! Really enjoyed the conveyer belt. Xiao xiao was kind and attentive with all our dining needs!

v0KDuCGtY-UOKvEJSC38jQ.text: I've never been to a Mongolian hot pot until now. There's a conveyor belt where you can pick and choose additional items besides what's on the menu. Deni was our server. He helped us pick out 3 selections and the type of hot pot. I will come back to try more!

KWhimvskMHTQXr3qHbDOKA.text: came here on a raining day, bec I really wanted something soupy and yummy. We came around their opening time and got seated the right the way. Our server was Deni, not only his service was great but he had a great smile. We ordered beef and lamb meat combo which portion was very reasonable for its price. We only got brunch of small side dishes, my fav was the oyster mushrooms. Pretty good place for hot pots.

aanBuFUcYELYaJXaC9g_6Q.text: Food was great and service even better. Deni and Alex we're both super helpful and made the meal even better.  Never had to ask for more water or napkins once.

qN-h7M-mxwHX8WVi2uDxmg.text: First time trying this place and it was an interesting experience. Don't know if it is a weird night, or  just my bad luck or if this has happened before but the whole night was just interesting.   Walking in the door I noticed that they do not accept credit or debit card for the night because their machine is down, not a problem, between my friends and I we have enough cash for the meal.   We started off sharing two soups: the original and tomato - I thought the original soup was delicious, very sweet and savory, also very healthy. Not a fan of tomato so did not care for that. We got a vegetable combination; came in a little basket which is really cute, good variety of veggies too. Got a beef combo which came with brisket, rib-eye and something else. And a noodle combination which came with 4 different types of noodles.   Here is where it gets a interesting: -They informed us that they will be substituting one of the noodle in the combination with something else because they are out with the one that was supposed to be included in the combination -We ordered chicken breast and was told their machine is down so no chicken, then we asked for free range chicken and was told they did not have that either  -Then we wanted more meat and same story - meat cutting machine is down so no other meat besides the hand-cut angus beef - they took $2 off the angus beef because we had no other choice but to order it -My friend wanted the taro knots...they also did not have that -After the meal we wanted to try the fondu for dessert.... and you guessed it - they did not have that either - our server told us that they only had the fondu for the first few days of opening and they stopped it after that because it took too long to prepare and it wasn't profitable... they should take this off the menu then!! They only offer 3 desserts and the picture of the fondu takes up half the page...heavily promoted for an item they no longer offer   So that is that... our meal was not 100% enjoyable because they did not have anything we wanted to order...I will say that the soup was really good, the items that they did have tasted very fresh and delicious, service was also great. All the staff were very friendly, attentive. Shout out to Brandon who was very funny and friendly!

fnhBZZIt_5TUb_oNeTWdTA.text: 'This was my go to place... I love hot pot and went regularly... they use to have pleasant service, food was well and the whole experience of cooking your food is fun... i wonder what happened to the old staff... who was always pleasant and proactive to checked up and asked how everything was and all... but this will be definitely my last time going here... from the moment they sat us down... we waited about 25 min for them to take our order... and another 35 min to receive our order.. i would understand if it was full restaurant busy... but in total there were 4 other people sorted at tables and total of 9 people? I will tell you fast to clean up and bus tables when people left... Our waiter KWAN attention to service was horrible... did not check up on us... did not refill water... when they brought our order they continuously mixed up with the person next to us... just disappointing.... this does not compare to Hai Di Lao... just aweful and disappointing... If you just want to wait 40 min + in total of wasted waiting time to just cook your own food and have a horrible waiter like Kwan be my guest... 5 star for shit service !

8OREOdPt4BiVjPnY5Mfu1A.text: This was my first time at anything even remotely like a hot pot restaurant, and it was phenomenal!  The place smells wonderful when you first walk in,  and is spotlessly clean.  Our server Xiao Xiao was extraordinarily helpful and very patient, explaining the menu multiple times until we understood hot hot pot worked.  I had chicken, mushrooms, park dumplings and a little mini-pumpkin pastry for dessert. All nicely presented.  My roommate had the seafood combo and it was a huge buffet of things, shrimp, prawns, scallops, mussels, clams and fish. WELL worth the price.   I give this place 5 stars, will definitely be back with more friends!!!

1GBSHrpupMi0cBi0UJAbeQ.text: The only thing I can say is so good.If you like to eat meat,come to this place will never go wrong.By the way,service is amazing.Especially the girl named Queeny,she always comes with her smile what makes you feel comfortable and friendly.Anyway, If you want to try Chinese hot pot,why not come to this place to  give it a try?

mrktX4ZmZwpQ6jTil0HOrw.text: This place is the best Mongolia Hotpot in town. And they have very good customer services.  Special thanks to Deni the waiter, he's supper nice. ( the only unconvinced things is they don't accept America Express Card) I think they should change the policy. It's not convinced for customers.  Special thanks again to Deni.

Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VSx2H0DVNcLtEeQwE2rixA.text: If you've never had conveyor belt hot pot before this would be a fun experience.  However I go to one near my home in the San Francisco Bay Area all the time, but decided to visit this based on Andrew Zimmern's recommendation.   Maybe it's because we went at 9.30pm on a week day, but the variety of items in their conveyor belt is sadly lacking.  It was happy hour so conveyor belt items were half off, but there was only 2 types of veggies, two types of tofu, 3 types of fish balls, and almost no mushrooms.  We had to order those basics from the server where of course there was no discount.  There was limited meat and seafood variety too.  We're used to Little Sheep or the dozens of other hot pot restaurants near our house, and while Chubby Cattle has some interesting cuts like their brisket, the other portions were small and nothing special.   On the plus side, we liked that they had different spicy levels of spicy broth, and the numbing spicy was pretty spicy.  Overall it would be a 3.5 Star place but rounding down since the service was soooo slow despite the restaurant being only 25% full.

photos.caption: Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Initial stab of conveyor belt items while waiting for our soup.  The selection was wimpy compared to what we&#39;re used to

Yae8GuIvfiK3fPdHlT2gvA.text: Me and my friend have been trying to find a good hot pot place in vegas for a while! Finally we tried Chubby Cattle! This place was great!   Since it was our first time there our server (didn't catch his name sorry!) explained everything to us. He recommended the oxtail and the spicy soup! Which was amazing! My friend absolutely loved the oxtail soup and I fell in love with the spicy soup! We ordered the beef and lamb combo. Which probably would have been enough for three people to share...   I don't have anything negative to say! The price was great. My friend loved the conveyer belt! All in all was a great spot and will be back! Yum!

photos.caption: Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy Soup  Noodle Combo
Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef and Lamb Combo  Spicy Soup

ZPZmflLgWNWEPj1hg7CpUg.text: We come here pretty often and enjoy the food every time! Not only the food, but the service. Our server was Kwan and he took a very good care of us. a food selection was various and we had fun trying a different kinds of sauce. We recommend this place if you wanna try a yummy hot pot in town!  We will be back again.

7rvzmf-xa7HxkGvUAkkdBA.text: This is my go to spot for hot pots. Since I discovered this place last month, I have come back three times. That's how good they are. They take reservations, and are on time with their reservation time. There was one time that some how my name was on one rsvp list, not the other (they have two). I had to wait a little, and got seated 20' later, which is not bad at all. There are two styles: family and individual. The family pot is a big pot that has dividers to allow three different types of broths at the same time. It serves up to 8 people. The individual pots are 6" pots that serve only one broth per person.  I have tried tomatoes oxtail broth and the house spicy broth. Both are amazing. The house spicy medium can be very spicy since the broth is boiling hot at all time. Meat is served at good portion. Prime rib and ribeyes are sooooo tender and tasty. Fish filet is a good addition. Their taro noodles, tomato noodles, and the green noodles are delicious. Great change from egg noodles! Last but not least is the friendly and efficient customer service. Our waiters had smiles on their faces. You can feel that everyone is trying their best to make customers happy. We always leave this place happy .

photos.caption: Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

kyLEsynV45_HR7s3wxqLnw.text: I loved it here. Fresh and great quality meat and vegetables and averagely priced for a shabu place! I did the beef combo and also ordered mushrooms and spinach.  I ordered the entry level House Hellishly Spicy Pot and let me tell you, it was hot. As someone who loves spicy food, I was even challenged by ENTRY LEVEL. I recommend trying it if you're a fan of spicy food but just be cautious and aware that they're not lying about it being hellishly spicy.  The biggest downside: parking. I'm always hesitant to go to any food places in this area because this plaza's parking sucks. You may end up circling the lot countless times until you get lucky getting a spot!

jaj8_qmJu8wa5pKvEGGDog.text: I love eating at Chubby Cattle hot pot soup! The meats are fresh and delicious. The soup broths are varied and flavorful. I enjoy the variety of options for additions to soups as well as the seasonal specials. I recommend the beef combo and the brisket wrapped enoki mushrooms. Bok choy is always a good choice.   Deni was our server and took fantastic care of us. Some of our group had been here before and some were first timers. Everyone is eager to return soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jeT58RembyThWmMi1CfMYw.text: Service here is very good. All their servers are nice but especially Server Kwan. He is the best server ever. He is very very nice and sooooo patient and kind. I have been there couple of times but each time He explained anything we asked. There are a lot of unfamiliar names of food on the menu but he explains until you understand with smile. I think he is the best server I know. Because of him and with delicious food, I love this place.  Food is very good. You can enjoy here as meat lover or as vegetarian/vegan!!! i will definitely go back many more times!

Qw-VjSiKiPorMwLEnWLRgA.text: If you tried this place prior to their remodel and wasn't a fan, I'd give it another chance. Since the renovations, the place definitely smells better when you initially walk in and the sauce bar makes better use of the space now.   You get to choose your soup base and the cost of the meal will depend on how much you decide to add. Brisket is always a go to for us. And no pressure to order everything at once, they have a conveyor belt with add ons depending on the place color, they'll charge.  No matter which soup base you go with, you'll end up adding things to make it tastier unfortunately. The broth is super bland.   Can't really expect too much service since it's kind of a self serve place...if there's more than a 30 minute wait to eat at this place, I'd honestly pick to eat somewhere else.  Don't get me wrong, this isn't a bad place to eat, I just wish I didn't have to customize my food so much and end up with a bit of a pricy bill :(

photos.caption: Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FchSW14XTbZWN1Oe63JCYw.text: I'm a huge fan of hot pot especially the ying yang style. I was a little disappointed when they didn't offer the ying yang at that time but my wife got the spicy soup and I got the regular one so I guessed it worked out fine. Our server Dani? and Kevin were both amazing. Our server explained the menu very thoroughly. He recommended the beef combo for our meat and it was definitely a good choice! He also recommended we get the noodles combo and I can't be happier with it.   The food and soup came and I must say their broth is not as savory as other places I've been too, but, as the meat and side dishes started cooking in the soup the broth got a little better. The meat was definitely high quality and the noodles are made fresh daily so I'm really impressed with the noodles. The prices were pushing it a little but it was nice to try fresh noodles and the good quality meat.

ZxFyNkPoj6QnNu6MwIdEpw.text: The best hot pot in Las Vegas. Food is tasty and fresh, you can find what you wanted, just feel free to ask Deni, he will come right away to help you and give you good hospitality. Thanks again Deni

VqBRqX_n7_XU3NYMAygnrg.text: Had a fantastic time here celebrating on the eve of our wedding with our parents and siblings. We weren't sure what to expect for a large party (12) here but the staff, and in particular server Deni, were extremely accomodating and helpful. We each had an individual pot which gave us flexibility, and Deni took our tastes into account and ordered all of the meat/vegetables for us since virtually everyone at the table was new to hot pot. He also explained how to do the sauces, cook the foods and answered the numerous other questions we threw at him.   The food was delicious, especially the wagu beef, in both slice and dumpling form.  Plentiful vegetables and mushrooms. The ox tail broth recommended was wonderful.   Highly recommend this place for groups and those new to hot pot.

ZbCF3MrrBb-mNM6oE_MTFQ.text: I Love chubby cattle, the waitstaff is super attentive to everyone around them. The mushroom broth is really earthy and rich in flavor, be careful with the spicy broth because they really know how to kick you in the tastebuds with the heat.     It's not all you can eat, but they have a convenient conveyor belt that travels along the whole restaurant. The colors of the plate you pull off dictates the price so keep track of your stack.   I recommend coming with the family for a fun dining experience !

aH73zk7rOP7oERPszh6uEg.text: Dani such good, very service  Nice place, good service, good hotpot.   Soup based are solid.

3L50jXH84NkNldt5Vj6AIw.text: As far as hot pot goes, this place has the highest quality products in town.  They also have a conveyor belt that you can choose what you want from if you choose that option.  I really liked it.  I wish they had an all u can eat option as I would pay more for it.   The one thing that I didn't appreciate was that during EDC they did not honor the listed special that was advertised.  They called this a holiday weekend.  I kinda felt like it was price gouging in a way.

photos.caption: Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. These are some of the plates we ordered!  Beef combo and bok choy veggies.  Very high quality on these!

97_YMsCDuzItrSFDB0xzKg.text: Oh my god, this place is amazing!!!! We've never had Chinese hot pots before but we were curious about this place because we saw this featured on one of those food network shows (either Bourdain or Zimmern). Now, I've been to a couple of these restaurants that were featured on many of these shows and some of them were overhyped. This one did NOT disappoint.  I was expecting this place to be much more crowded, but we got here a half hour or so after they opened so there wasn't that many people. I got the tomato broth and he got the regular broth. Basically you order your meats, noodles, and some veggies. If there is something you forgot, you can always ask the server for the menu or you can grab one of the rotating plates on the conveyer belt. All have different price points depending on the color of the plate.  Our servers were super nice; they kept checking in with us and always refilled our waters. By the time we were finished we were so full!  It's kinda pricey but absolutely worth it and in line with what you'd pay on the Strip anyway. We are definitely coming here again the next time we are in Las Vegas. Keep in mind this is off the strip so you'll either have to drive or take an Uber if you're not local.

VdzjtnaLQ2SrRRki6Fp9Rg.text: Love this place, come 2x a month, Jenny's a sweet server, very attentive.  Love the shrimp paste and hot pots are great!

36yny6mpsZGKOaf-RNQvtg.text: We went on a Wednesday night during happy hour and man was our bill affordable! $135 for 5 adults and we had almost everything on the menu including nigiri, wagyu beef, and a tonnnn of side plates. The quality of the meat was A+ and it definitely beat going to a Vegas buffet because of the familiarity of the food. I enjoyed the huge variety of the sauce bar but wished they had a straight up goma sauce like most shabu places. I loved the little glass inserts on the table where you can stick your phone but can still see your messages! The conveyor belt was a nice touch and convenient so we didn't have to keep ordering from someone or get up. The waitress was Jenny I think and she was very sweet and knowledgeable. Would definitely come here again.

33fgGHBP5VCxuU58lf4pWA.text: This place is excellent! When you first walk in, you might be a bit overwhelmed, trying to figure out how it works, but no worries - your host will explain this patiently to you. I ordered the vegan mushroom soup, and we chose a number of seafood options, as well as tofu and vegetables.   Participatory/creative food experiences are a fun way to try something new, and this was no exception. As our items came, we dropped them (sometimes clumsily) in the soup, and adjusted the heat accordingly. Honestly, this is a bit of trial and error, but you aren't likely to really overcook anything. The scallops and shrimp are must-haves here, after a few minutes in the hot pot, they are incredibly tender and fresh. An Asahi or Tsingtao goes well with this experience too. Skip the strip and visit Chubby Cattle next time. Despite the name, this place is very pescatarian and vegetarian friendly.

cb4iEFuzquGiyi2-43vtsQ.text: Chubby Cattle is the best! My family and I come here regularly and love it. The staff is attentive and welcoming, Kwan especially. He always remembers us and welcomes us with great service. Definitely give this place a try if you wanna eat hot pot!

CvHViacZFqvi_KGZMR3V9w.text: This place is banging!! BANGING BANGING! OFF DA HOOK! Luv the food, luv the BBQ, the booOozee and the people and more. Very very busy. Come early and show your yummy tummy who's the boss! DO IT UP GINO!!

photos.caption: Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
