-XXbgHH27pXIrFi3ScAyVw.text: Came here after Andrew Zimmern show. Ehhh, not too impressed. The rotating plates did not have high overturn and the sauce area needed some love.   The meat quality was above average and had good choices but the broth was average.   Service was good but an overall underwhelming experience.

o7dRimQ-87icmU_H-yI0tw.text: This is pretty close to home for me. I'm always looking for good hot pot and this place is awesome. Servers are good, tonight we had Kwan and he was awesome. Get here early because it gets really busy, if you can't make sure you have a reservation!

yYB-mKutvZ8enLvUGCMJLQ.text: We've been wanting to try this place. Its a chinese style hotpot that has a rotating bar much like that of a sushi spot that has extra ingredients you can add to your hot pot.  Theres a sauce bar that has all kinds of yummy sauces to add to your soup as well. They also have bottomless edamame and congee- although at night when we were there the porridge was out. You get your own little soup burner and they bring the additional meats or items on menu out to you.  We got the spicy soup base which was a szechuan style mixture and the oxtail soup base which was also very good.  The ingredients were fresh. The servers were very nice and helpful.  If you don't like close quarters do not sit at bar. Its a very asian style dining and youre just there to eat and leave.  It reminded me of the food stalls in Korea. Sit at a table if you really want to enjoy the experience.  Its a little more expensive than most places in chinatown about 30 per person. Cheaper than the strip though and the food is good!   Happy souping!

photos.caption: Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VuZTZjeYmOPt1ih5d60YHQ.text: I cannot complain about the food. I underestimated the green noodles and I would definitely order the oxtail broth if you don't know what to get. The 4 stars because the area where the temperature dials are greasy and grimy. Needs a good cleaning and degreasing. Yummy food though

A0zADVNSt3Io_bojdk6tvA.text: This is one of the coolest restaurants I have ever been to. We sat in front of the conveyor belt and was picking items off to put in our oxtail broth.  I usually hate going to restaurants where you have to work to eat but this place has customization down pack.   The oxtail broth was super flavorful. All the ingredients we picked off the conveyor belt were fresh. We order a plate of beef with all types of variety. And they all were delish.   They have a cool bar where you can make your own sauce. It also included kimchi and edamame.  We saw this place on Andrew Zimmerman's show and it was so worth it!!!

0kIHSCX0B0h6ma0fOYtNpg.text: Happy hour is 930pm to 1230 am but they close at 1145pm.... odd. I guess they serve until 1230am?  Round 2, tried their house special and the spicy tomato soup base. The house special was pretty bland out of all 4. The spicy tomato was very flavorful. So far the ox tail and tomato soup base are the winners.  Went on a Thursday and the spicy tomato was 50% off but they charged 3.99. The regular tomato is 4.99 and +1 for making it spicy. Not sure why it was 3.99 at 50% off.

nMP4vNsdy57niuwXE5aBqA.text: I really enjoyed the concept of the conveyer belt and picking out items as needed, though it is very dangerous if you have no self control and pick out everything!!   My friend and I opted for the beef combo and picked other items to our liking. I had the mushroom broth and it was very good but I liked the tomato broth way better which was what my friend chose.  Friendly waiter and great service. Very prompt and followed up frequently.

photos.caption: Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mushroom broth and custom made sauces and scallops at the top right
Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef combo

JUI8sBBwikRaC9LMv_ZGmQ.text: I recommend the tomato oxtail base soup. This is my second time within 4 days and I really love this place . Our server was excellent. Our party ordered the shrimp paste today and that was so fresh and good. I would definitely come back.

3WnI_EWwAmw5YHUZEMUrrw.text: I love Mongolian hot pot!!!  Little sheep being my favorite!  Even if I have a favorite place that I go to, i still love trying to find better!  However when I yelped a place in Vegas, this chubby cattle place got very good ratings.  To much of my excitement I was immensely disappointed.  I was intrigued by the idea of conveyor belts and grab what you want type style of eating.    The conveyer belt - NO good choices and very poorly stocked.  The same items kept flowing by making their millionth rounds bc no one would grab anything.  An utter disappointment.  Meat - low quality and old.  I specifically asked for lamb shoulder meat, but the waitress indicated it can only be ordered as a combo with beef.  That was fine, as I like beef as well.  The lamb shoulder was not lamb shoulder.  It was lamb leg.  Dry and tasteless.  The beef, well it was also dry.  I wanted beef belly.  I typically enjoy fatty meets.  Since they don't carry beef belly, the waitress suggested brisket.  I know my cuts of meat, brisket isn't fatty.  The meatballs were also tasteless and wasn't enticing in any way.    Seafood - shrimp skewers were good.  I can't assess anymore in this since that's all I had in this category.  Veggies - like any other place.  Service - was alright, could always be better!  I gave this place a 1 Star bc I was excited and it turned out to be everything opposite of what I hoped for.

JVdUeydq5-gWTA3dugu0sA.text: The food is good. But the service was not. There was also another thing that turned me off, it seemed like a lot of the locals were friends with the servers. Even though I was in line and put my name on a list, it seemed like they were a lot more attentive to their "friends" than to the person who has been waiting for a table for a while. So they got a table first and more attention from the waiters.

photos.caption: Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ZuvGlw9EgETZDyCv8EPVjw.text: We love this place.  It gets a little pricey if you don't monitor how many bowls you grab from the conveyor but it's fun and well worth it.  It's one of those places we take visitors from out of town to so we can show them a great off-street Vegas night.   The service is also very good and the staff pleasant and helpful. We will be back to this restaurant many more times.

photos.caption: Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JbQT08q8MW_pDQn5I8jseQ.text: No place like it. Friendliest staff, especially Deni! He will make some great recommendations.

fTRWO47yy1B3ePcsUr49Lw.text: I got engaged here, so obviously it has to be five stars!  The food is decent, and the environment is great. The staff is friendly, and the price is reasonable as well.

LcFPKXcw1L3vbew-yu4SMw.text: This place was so cool!  It's super cheap and tasted really good. This was my first time eating hot pot and while I loved it I could have used some serious help. Meat and noodles are ordered from the server and everything else you get from the conveyor belt.  My problem was not knowing what the stuff was on the conveyor. But the hand made noodles are very tasty and the meat sampler is amazing.   I also highly recommend the meatball sampler which features beef meatballs, pork meatballs, fish balls and shrimp meatballs.

WxiUlH1gXo-bq1aP7dEkAA.text: We love this place! It's perfect for my vegetarian self and meat loving hubby. Fresh veggies, homemade noodles, mushrooms,  quality meat. And reasonably priced!

M05z1CIw8ADpyfKEp32R0g.text: Awesome place for large parties.  8 of us,  must have drank over dozen pitches of beer, lots of seafood (a la carte), lots of meat, lots of veggie, the bill is very manageable and we will certainly be back for another party, large or small.  They have both "personal hot pot" and "shared hot pot",  smaller party, definitely the shared one, but us 8, we are glad to have our own flavor of broth.  Highly Recommended.  Great Service, Awesome atmosphere, excellent food.

RdVBGLV6RFM32qTmT_nuwQ.text: I've eaten here a couple times and I've enjoyed the experience. I'm vegan, and the vegan tomato broth is really good. Today, it was a little bit different, because there's also a non vegan tomato broth and I didn't even notice they gave me that one until maybe thirty minutes into the meal when I finally noticed an OXTAIL in my pot.   I'm not sure how other people eat hot pot, but I sort of just drop stuff into my personal pot and pull it out with chop sticks after it's cooked, so I can see why I didn't notice the oxtail at the bottom until there was less broth there after it cooked out (for anyone curious to how I didn't notice it earlier).  I asked for a replacement, and they happily obliged, and apologized. I wasn't mad, but this could've turned out differently if it was someone else. I'm just hoping that this doesn't hope to anyone following other dietary guidelines based on beliefs/religions, because I've seen how put off people can get.   Also, when someone else in my party wanted a refill on their broth, a server had THEM refill it. We don't work there, why should we do your damn job? That honestly bothered me more than being given meat broth by mistake. That person being really far into the booth wasn't an issue either, because another guest on the opposite side of the table didn't have to refill their own pot. Also, the person that had to refill their own broth ALSO ordered the vegan tomato broth, and they also found meat in their broth later on in the meal.   I shouldn't have to worry about simple things like the wrong broth because I like to have faith in the employees. Now when I eat here, and I will have to put more trust in myself and less in the employees because of the mistake of broths made today. The other guest having to refill their own broth just made it worse.   On the plus side, the self serve dipping sauce bar seemed to expand a bit on ingredients (or maybe because we ate here earlier than usual) and the sauce I made was faaaantaaaastic. The garlic and the garlic and chili paste made the dipping sauce way better than anything I've made before.   Overall, good meal, but could've been better.

Syj-RrN8oDWPbYizxaLQlQ.text: Just walked into this place at 9:31 pm Sunday (today). This sign is up clearly said sunday-thursday happy hour 930-1145 but the host said they do not have happy hour. Waited 30 mins for this information that is clearly stated on the board in the restaurant. FALSE ADVERTISEMENT. BEWARE.

photos.caption: Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. False advertisement. No happy hour.

5SSlVKo_CKhBPvfE5wQADw.text: I suggested this place since I had came here before and enjoyed it   Sadly I was EXTREMELY disappointed this time.....   We ordered the half and half pot half original and half spicy..... they started bringing out our food before we even got our broth so we just sitting there staring at our food!!!!    Our waitress had suggested we get the Kobe fried rice..... which we NEVER received .... when we asked about it they told us we had sold out.... why would you SUGGEST it but not have it and 2nd why would you not come back and let us know ??????   I also ordered a kabob which I NEVER received either .... when I asked about my kabob the lady told me I didn't order it even though EVERYONE at the table told her I did .... but she CONTINUED TO TELL ME I DIDN'T!!!   Had to also ask for my mushrooms I ordered!!!  Asking for water???? Lol good luck.... when someone did come fill our water it was filled HALF WAY!!!   I'm not sure what happened from the first time to the next time I went but I was embarrassed to suggest a place to have such a shitty experience I WILL NEVER RETURN

TwzHYx5gtsTbUyXVEUDobQ.text: Our server was named Deni. It was an amazing time with the family, kids had a blast trying new things and me and my husband had a blast watching. My oldest got the coconut juice and they served it in a coconut that he broke  with his bare hands! It was awesome. The food was amazing, it had a lot of options from nice and warm to burn your mouth  off spicy.  The conveyor belt they had was an awesome idea, add small ingredients to your meal to make it better. The way they served everything was also amazing, we ordered the seafood meal and they served it on a mini boat! We all had a great time and definitely will come back.

_-vJ9vHAdtK6gl5XO19Dzg.text: I love this place but I came 2 days in a row because they only had someone who made fish balls at certain times. I called, they said I didn't need a reservation. I Uber over and have to wait 30 minutes. I don't care, I love the food but I ask the manager to have the chef prepare me fish balls because I specifically came for them. After questioning me about whether or not I would eat them I ask for an order that the manager assured me of. I finally sit down with my party of five to receive my food to then find out that the fish balls I ordered were not only never made but the person that prepares them had left. I make an annual trip to Vegas and honestly I felt like a second rate customer. Possibly because we are a young group of males, I feel that the employees just never took us seriously and thats the fault of youth. It really sucked getting grilled from the manager about something you specifically want and they completely ignored the request when I show my patronage and support. My annual trip to this place may not happen anymore because of this. Damn shame, but honestly I felt almost disrespected by the fact that they ignored my eager desire to eat something they make specific hours for. I'm only writing this because the waiter asked me to write a review and be honest, hopefully they see this and listen when a customer speaks regardless of me being a tourist, a single male, or Asian. Was going to make it 3 stars but I had made a big deal about eating the stupid fish balls and showed up an hour and a half before the chef was supposed to leave, at 10:30pm, and yet i didn't get what I mainly came for. Couldnt give me my simple request and I felt patronized when I asked for it before sitting and expressed my concerns to it being prepared prior to me getting a table which could have been after I was seated. Really really sucked to be ignored when I spent money on a sizeable meal.

9f19ZtVv0diJ2Hp3GE6Q5w.text: A friend of mine recommend this new hot pot restaurant to my friends and I. The food here was great and the service was fantastic. Our server Damian was super friendly and took great care of us. The  restaurant had a great atmosphere and looked very modern. Everything was delicious.     The broths we tried were original house pot, sea view, and entry level hell. The broths were very flavorful and fragrant. My personal favorite is the sea view broth.      They had a variety of items on their menu such as meats, vegetables, sauces, and BBQ. My friends and I tried the beef & lamb combo, lobster, fish balls, etc., and assorted vegetables. My favorite sauces would have to be the Thai chili and house special sauce.       The presentation of the food was beautiful and clean. They have a conveyer belt with assorted cooked and uncooked items which is a very unique feature for a hot pot restaurant. A great place for family and friends!

It was so good and I'm definitely coming back to try other things to put in my hot pot!! So many things to choose from and I only could eat what I could! I got the spicy broth in medium spice level which was kinda hot but still good also got that seafood platter which was amazing and it looked so pretty..bf got mushroom broth with Kobe beef and pork belly..it was his first hot pot and he loved it..I can't wait to come again..definitely going to be busy in the winter time!

OHeeUezCk7DH50MkKyofxg.text: I like Mei, she's the sweetest hostess. Customer service on point. The innovative conveyer belt is super cool however it is pricey. I recommend the meat combos. But Mei is super nice, I like her.

aiJldFmX9CrvngoK1e2uew.text: Place is really fun, good food. Service was solid and Deni made sure we were always getting anything we needed. The coffee ice cream  was a perfect way to end the meal. Make sure to check it out!    For sports guys/girls they have tv's showing the game.

1wgy_XQpOIG29PUO2gk1bA.text: We waited for 30min and it was our last meal in LV Probably it's the best meal we had in Las Vegas, a lot of choice of beefs,we ordered wagyu beef and highly recommended it , the soup taste just like we had in China, the environment is typical China restaurant style, loud and friendly , but in terms of quality food and the price, it definitely worth it!

udP55vQm0XyeNFO-OUyl8g.text: A new Chinese hot pot restaurant in town! Very tasty! I like the spicy hot pot soup base, and the lamb meat is great! Highly recommend if you a hot pot fan.

QrTBvFThfelkI9M57eX7rQ.text: We do hot pot at home, but not so much in restaurants.  So, we weren't really sure what to expect.  This place is new and had lots of positive reviews, but I can't say that I'm a fan of this place...  Fellow Yelpers have disappointed on this one, which makes me wonder if all the reviews are real.  Everything here adds an extra costs to your meal.  Soup base = minimum $4.  Want noodles in your soup?  Another $3-4.  Meat?  Anywhere from $5 and up.  Each little plate that rotates around = additional cost (from $1-4).  Some plates are reasonable, but others are just ridiculous.  I think we paid like $3 for a couple pieces of lettuce, because it's considered a "daily special".  Perhaps there's some better way of ordering, but it was not explained to us very well.  For two people (that just drank water), the bill ended up over $50 for some noodle soup that wasn't impressive at all.  Service for us wasn't too great either.  Seats were available, but the hostess told us to sit in the corner only to come over less than a minute later and tell us our seats were ready.  We weren't given a menu, but there was one nearby.  Turns out, it was originally given to the people next to us.  But, the hostess pointed out for us to use it when we were sat down.  We ordered noodles, but those didn't come until long after we started.  And, I paid the tab with a $100 bill and the women who took the money asked if I needed change...  Really?  I'm not poor, but I'm not wealthy enough to be tipping the same amount as my bill.  Especially when I'm cooking my own food.

KsFrGor4_ibskfG_0Tt2hw.text: Pretty good dinne experience.  ,and also you can creat your own place at sauce station,love it so much

photos.caption: Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xh00vypFhA6vkoAFLuBSeQ.text: Came with with a friend for girls dinner. We were seated promptly and told how the conveyor and hot pot works from the most helpful waiter. I even dropped my chopstick at one point and he saw it and promptly swooped in with a fresh set before I could pick mine up! Food was fresh and delicious and the sauce bar is fully equipped with many tasty sauces and condiments. They even gave us Java ice cream at the end which was a perfect sweet ending. Exceptional customer service and overall experience, start to finish. I will absolutely be returning.

Po8inILcD-1lcDNzTjaKuQ.text: Conveyor belt hot pot!! Great prices, friendly service (thanks Deni) and an all around fun time. Go with friends, try the different combos (highly recommend the mushroom, meat and seafood.) Make your own sauces. The choices on the conveyor belt range from quail eggs, tofu, crab, taro and more. No alcohol at the moment, they're working on getting their alcohol license.

WdouFm9Upe6ucrV5Pb6ATg.text: A really great authentic Chinese hot pot restaurant. It's about 20 min away from the strip and offers individual pots as well as family style. The original broth and mild broth is what we got and both tasted amazing. The spice level here is a little more than average though so for those with a low spice tolerance. They have a bar to mix your own sauce with a lot of variety of sides to go with it. On the menu the portions are broken into small and large but the smalls are like 3-4 pieces. They're all fresh items though. Xiao Xiao is extremely nice and always checked up on us to make sure we had everything. Make sure to reserve if you want to do the conveyor belt though otherwise it's menu order.

ar2uecHEgbUoP4UopshDcQ.text: Just ate here for my birthday. It was a great experience to eat great food with great presentation. I would recommend this restaurant to anyone. Servers are very friendly and especially Joyce she's really nice. We will be coming back here again soon!

BExuOtqx3ZqzU8M_KHH9Iw.text: Best hot pot in Las Vegas! Customer service is great, which is hard to find in Las Vegas!

79hVvitpKl0a_HulsMwVRQ.text: I've been here three times now and I can consider myself a regular. My first experience made me want to come back a week later! Sadly, the second time was horrible - no sliced meats, poor service, and not accepting credit cards. I was randomly craving hot pot so I decided to give it another chance. I'm happy I came back though! Xiao was our server and she constantly made sure to check on us to see how everything was. Quality meats and a lively atmosphere makes for a great conversational meal.

CvYw_K3NBtpyTVVYneCwfg.text: Great service! We loved Mei! She's super kind and helpful! Great attitude as well! Please work on sauce though, it wasn't salty or flavorful enough. But loved the service. Would come back.

aByzvmr_QfstdRI622IenQ.text: This place is pretty cool.  It's kinda like the melting pot but better.  My server Kwan was great.  It's not a must try but it's way different then you have done before.

ddBxGX_Y3s2iKIamkpFtFQ.text: Had a craving for hotpot and decided to try Chubby Cattle. The restaurant was packed but we were able to get seating by calling ahead to guage how long it would take. We were seated within 2 minutes to a larger table, and our waiter was very helpful with all of the different options. He recommended we do a split pot, which gave us the choice of two different broths. Everything came out promptly, and having the conveyor made it easy to add our ingredients. One of the most interesting dining experiences we've had here in Vegas, and I would recommend it to anyone.  Def plan on bringing friends and family here next time.

TuRwEyVK429nrxCH5DDbGw.text: It was a good food experience. The service was great and the meat/veggies were fresh. The broth was average and wasn't particularly good or bad. However, the price is quite high for what you get. We ended up paying $100 for 2 people. I'd recommend getting the items from the conveyor belt as it seems to be cheaper (by a little).

6-hrJ70d2dg1RMaHnZZKAw.text: This was my first time visiting chubby cattle. We didn't make reservation so we had to wait around 20 mins which isn't bad for a Saturday. The hostess was friendly. Our waiter Gillbert and Kwan was very attentive. We are satisfied with the service. We had the individual hotpot. Flavor of the broth was good so was The quality of the meat. Some of the dish was pretty price for the portion. I like the fact that management really take customers feedback very serious. Definitely will be back again

QFamchVoF_pR9WoO_TjGZw.text: I'm not one to write reviews, but this place is so delicious.   The broth is flavorful and the conveyor belt with all the condiments was a brilliant idea. And not to mention our server, Xiao was very attentive and so kind! Definitely recommend this place.

WbgcAVvqpjfVfEjOo6vmDQ.text: The ingredients are definitely fresh. The service is good. We had Dani as our server and he is excellent. The only thing is that the soup in the hot pot is not that flavored. But overall, a good hot pot place.

65S-NypiwAqhCZq7OX6Pkw.text: I love this place but really wish the prices where a little better. Even for happy hour our bill ends up to $30 a person. Everything is really yummy especially the soup bases but much too pricey to eat as often as I would like.

oysPXi_f30kiXRwAc9el3A.text: Great food and amazing service. Be sure to ask for Xiao Xiao. She will take care of you and help you navigate through the sometimes not so obvious choices. Highly recommend the prime short rib with egg.

2rdbfqyANKFfCReHmNLd_A.text: This place is bomb.  Food is amazing.  You have a conveyor belt system that rotates the small plates of seafood and veggies on,  so you can pick whatever it is that you want in your hot pot.    We also ordered some beef too.  We picked the spicy broth and house broth and both were tasty.  Nice clean atmosphere and the vibe is great.  Our server was so nice and was attentive to everything.  Highly recommend this place if your looking for a different hotpot experience.

CTCkDYelqVM9wvwib60jWQ.text: Came here with my family wanting the have the proper hot pot experience. I'm happy to say that our server, Deni, made all of that possible. For a family of 6 very hungry people, Deni was patient and helped guide us to have a priceless experience for the whole family. The food was exceptionally delicious. Not only does it look grade A, the taste reflects its beautiful presentation. We will be definitely coming back to share the great experience and wonderful food with the whole family.

photos.caption: Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The presentation has character that makes you feel like royalty, yet treated like family. Very delicious food.

Ik0KFUoKHQUszwQfArxWUQ.text: I ate the dragon seafood broth mixed with a little of the spicy broth. It's cool cause you can mix your own sauces and they have combos for the meats and noodles. And there is a conveyor belt for extra sides. Overall our meal was really good! Our server was Deni, and he was nice

_V2W9aOIfWXUaiasvRKlHg.text: We were greeted by friendly host and was seated after 10 mins.  Waited awhile for our waiter.  We appreciated him acknowledging us that "he'll be right with us" though. We can understand it's busy, happy with his effort.  We're not big on meat, ordered a plate of lamb and small size veggies for variety.  Also tried their gizzard and lamb on skewer.  The sauce station in the CENTER of the room drove me crazy. It's impossible to huddle around many hungry people to fix a sauce.  I wish it was against a wall where there can be some form of a line system  The bill came out to $55 for 2 which isn't too bad, but considering we have small appetite and only had 1 plate of meat and no seafood, quite overpriced.  If you have a big appetite, 2 people easily $100+  After reviewing the receipt. We noticed the $3.99 for my house broth and my moms $6.99 for her Hot Spicy Broth.  Also $2.99 for sauteed sauce.  I am familiar with hot pot restaurant that charges for broth, but usually they have a complimentary broth and you may pay for upgraded broth.  But I took a second look on the menu and noticed even for the larger shared broth is charged per person vs other competitors charge by pot regardless of the size of the party.  Pretty much the moment we sat down, before we can try anything on the menu. We already spent $10 on the broth which is a must have for hot pot no?! lol   Service was great, food was overpriced. Would come back should a friend wants to go but not on my own.

9rXLupMYfCgWfQ8wIHzVIg.text: Vegas finally have a nice hotspot place to go. Server is nice and our server deni is great. Very friendly. Enjoyable experience must go

uQ7B9dfDcJuyVXX3nZlH2Q.text: Food is pretty good. Just a bit more than I want to pay since I have to cook stuff myself. 5$ for like 3oz. Of shiitake mushrooms is a bit much. We ended up spending $50 we could have had ayce kbbq or sushi. We barely had any food. I probably would have enjoyed it more if I didn't feel cramped and had more space to put my uncooked food. I space factor is want killed it for me. Once again they didn't have the chubby cattle special that they so greatly advertising on the tv all the time. I keep coming for that.

YU0-9Ad669XIT7OVLlt23A.text: We love the food here, we really REALLY do. If it was based on the flavor and quality of the food alone, then I'd easily give this place 5 stars. Unfortunately, service plays a huge factor in the overall dining experience.   We've been here twice now within a week because the flavor and quality of the food is that good! However, the staff is very clearly inexperienced. Some don't even really speak English that well either. I can speak Mandarin too, so I don't mind because I can just switch languages to accommodate. But they don't really know their own menu or the fact that the soup for children 12 and under is marked as half price on their menu. I get that they're new, but part of the hiring process should include hiring experienced management who can teach and lead a successful staff... and training that staff prior to opening.   When we came here last week, the hostess gave me a business card so I can call and check on how we were progressing on the 45 min wait we were quoted. We weren't planning on going anywhere so I didn't have a need to call that day. Today, I did call because I knew they took reservations. Guess what? The phone number printed on their business card is wrong. The number here on Yelp is correct though so I was still able to call. When we got there, I mentioned the error to the hostess, who then pointed it out to the manager who had no idea of the typo. He even grabbed a phone to try calling the number himself (though I would think that most people should know the phone number to their job and just recognize the typo). Did everyone from the owners, management, wait staff, etc not notice this?? Or is this more a reflection of a staff that doesn't care?   Now let's talk about the dining experience. On both visits, it took a while between getting seated until anyone acknowledges you to take your order (in the 20 min ballpark). Once you've ordered, it will take equally as long to get the soup. The stuff you order from the menu won't come out together either, or even relatively at the same time. For example, today we ordered 3 plates of meat and 3 large bowls of noodles off the menu. The noodles and one plate of meat came out quickly, but we were literally done with all of that and everything we took from the conveyer belt before the last 2 plates of meat arrived. Our drinks didn't come out together either! There were 4 of us and only my juice came out before the food. After the food came out we asked about the 3 waters... which was met with the waitress bringing one and walking away. Which led to us having to hail her down again to get 2 more. Really? I also saw the waitress talking to the table next to us... and one of the bussers interrupted her from helping those guests to show her/comment on the tip that was left by the next table over. That was probably a conversation that could have been saved for when the waitress wasn't at a table in the middle of talking to a customer. Whatever the case, with all of the delays with their service, both visits we've made have turned out to be 2+ hour ordeals, which is excessive for hot pot. After today, we're totally not that motivated to come back anytime soon. Based on service alone, we'd rather pay more and drive further to go to Red Pot even though their food quality isn't as good.

kN9O-5jOguqcSdpt9yuz_w.text: It we our first time trying hot pot.  May was our server and she was awesome!  She explained how it works and recommend what we should get!  Love our first experience here!  :)

maEOwlteCUbCbNLkkwJmGg.text: Chubby cattle is a good place for a family dinner. My 6 year old son really enjoyed the experience and really like the food. Our server Deni made the whole experience more enjoyable. He was very helpful with making suggestions and very attentive. Definitely a must try!

MtE4al0e2TOLmT0NtTYhGA.text: Chubby Cattle is the best hotpot restaurant that I have ever been to, better than Hai Di Lao Hotpot by far! Our wonderful server Xiao Xiao was incredibly courteous and patient in guiding us through their easy-to-use menu and explaining the convenient conveyor belt, which contained numerous goodies including fish balls, beef balls, and scallops, and even salmon sashimi (not to be put in the hotpot). The service was fast and presentation beautiful: the Kobe beef even came with dry ice in a separate pot for a dramatic effect! It just melted in your mouth--in fact, everything did. The lamb, beef, and chicken were all sliced so thinly and delicately. This was an immaculate dining experience.

HuNVDk0zlHpZYsMDs-IFUg.text: Our server was very nice!Multiple table ckecking,and my friend had a great birthday celebration here!

ntidQRQZaBv2DYAJMht6ag.text: Our sever Deni was very nice. The food portion is a but small but overall it was pretty good.

AtTv603I0gC0AQpD7WutuQ.text: So delicious!!!..... Great service, great food and on Sunday night... Happy hour is such a great treat!!  Run to the chubby!!!

KwnroDXp1zgOSnOPEXnM5g.text: This is by the far the best out of 2 hot pot spot that I've been too lol more than satisfying! Shout out to kuya Deni for the great helpful service and for making my peanut sauce! (:

Lqmgeb4Lan9-H7O1H2mGlw.text: A good business would NOT have seated us without telling that HALF OF THE MENU was "out" and allowed an entire table to dine on just vegetables (the meat cutter was down so we were told 30-40 mins into dinner that we would not get any meat!!!). Our check was $73!!! We were still starving and had to stop by McDonalds on the way home. WTF!  First and foremost, this review is due to the fact that almost everything I wanted on the menu was met with a "we don't have it right now." So they didn't have any of the ramen on the menu or any fried tofu, etc. So we were left with getting a vegetable variety and beef brisket. We were starving so we ate the vegetables and other random items that was rolling around the restaurant. 20 mins later, when we still haven't gotten our beef brisket, we asked for it. Our waiter came back and said that the machine was down. Mind you, we have been asking for everything at least twice before receiving it (including our water and our broth). Needless to say, our table of five had VEGETABLES for dinner, no meat! We asked for our check and was extremely upset.  The two stars I left is for our waiter. Though we had to continually ask for water and broth, we did eventually get it. He was extremely busy. I feel bad for him because he had to be the bearer of  bad news about the meat cutter being down.  Needless to say, I will never be going back here.

nxJ2b21pxCBYbb5jK5u90w.text: Pick a soup base ranging from $4-$7  but seafood is more. then you can order ur choice of meat with the waiter, and lastly pick your choice of small plates on the conveyer belts (color coding plates) and enjoy.  We were sated at the bar which I felt was a bit tight in space, can't move around too much. We decided to order soup base of ying yang but was told can't do it at the bar, so we asked to be moved to bigger table but will be charged 3 times the amount listed in the menu. Ridiculous! We weren't even told there were dipping sauce for us to chose from the sauce station, even the person next to us didn't know about it. First time here, gotta inform us of such! Felt that the conveyer belt is lacking green veggies. Was told that Soup base was cooked for hours with chicken bones and other bones with no MSG and has  lots of Chinese herbs. The host girl went around and asked if the soup has any flavors and  I told her it was bland, but I drink the soup at the end of my meal, it has better flavor and sweet too , good!. So taste the soup at the end not beginning. Price was a bit steep for the pocket on a regular bases . I will only come on special occasions and they need to work out all the kinks as mentioned.

mzxjUe6SYqxsgwgRVGSJlg.text: We thought we'd get creative and dine off-strip for a change. The price was fine, and the sauces were on-point. Soup base was fine, a little oily. We ordered "vegetable platter" and got a basket of whole vegetables that was more like a bag of groceries than a platter. But fine, veggies are veggies. Meat was average quality -- the beef sampler platter was better than the house special. Didn't get anything from the conveyor belt.

K7CnnPReHh06uETg58AcBA.text: Too honest, kill people, we eat eight to $one thousand, and there is no and we said the price, this restaurant should be closed immediately, hope you don't go, don't be deceived. Making money is legitimate, don't cheat!

aG7naGN2gkE7HdOyPnlYGw.text: One of the best hot pot I've had in the US. There's no single bad dish. I am surprised to find this in Nevada as I didn't expect good Asian restaurants here. If they open a store in the Bay Area I would expect long lines lol. We enjoyed our visit and will definitely come back when I visit Vegas again

B1uzEVJytetrL8nmk8hImA.text: Made reservation day of through Yelp messages for 4 people at 6pm on a Saturday and they responded promptly. James was our server and he was super awesome, recommended us a lot of good choices, explained how the belt works, and made sure we didn't over order so we weren't bursting at the seams (still happened anyway). Food was delicious, everything was incredibly fresh. We were in town visiting family and even though it was 106 degrees outside, hot pot was amazing. Great selection of meats, veggies, fish balls, tofu, etc. Sauce bar had so many choices! Delicious! I can't wait to come back again when I visit. This compares really well to Little Sheep Mongolian Hot Pot in Northern California, except Chubby Cattle's sauce bar has way more options!

b6BniC67BBfRHEsIpViOwg.text: between three people we ordered the meat combo, thick rice noodles each, shrimp, pork dumplings, and potatoes. everything was amazing. tons of variety, the meat was of the highest quality, and the sauce bar was delicious.  the noodles were freshly pulled. all at about $20 per person without tip.  this is probably my favorite restaurant in vegas currently, let alone hot pot. what a unique place to eat!!

BbeZXSYWf-oWBb2Pbd32mg.text: Authentic Chinese food with nice service - sold!! The food here is fresh and authentic. The seating and moving conveyer belt is a creative and fun concept for dining. You can get up and make your own sauces at a condiment station. The prices are definitely higher than other hot pot places, but there aren't many hot pot places in Las Vegas to compare it to anyway. The waiters are always attentive and genuinely polite, which is so rare in Chinatown hah! Our waiter today was Deni, nice guy! I've come here four times and was never disappointed, come give it a try!   P. S I recommend the watermelon juice.

-Di0A-lxn0_sAXWJKo9DHw.text: My husband and I travel to China for business and discovered Hot Pot's there..... then we found Chubby Cattle and needless to say it's just like being in China. The Beef is the best in Las Vegas and honestly, it's the best hot pot in town. We come to Vegas for a week every year to exhibit at a trade show and we eat at Chubby Cattle 5 times in 7 days. So what does that tell you. It's freakin phenomenal and the bartender is super awesome. We  Chubby Cattle and we're headed there tonight for our last meal before we fly out tomorrow.

qzZc0JG4kUo8OK7OTFzAGg.text: Best shabu shabu ever!!!!! Food was fresh, best service, and highly recommend their authentic Mongolian BBQ!!!!!!

j5g5v75MEHm5cjC63tphDw.text: This place is great!! If you're thinking about coming here think no more! I would come here every night if I could. Everything was amazing from the service to the food. I love the conveyer belt it's such a cool idea! I would recommend going after 9:30 and taking advantage of their happy hour because it's so worth it! Buy one get one free off the conveyer belt! There's so much on it from veggies, seafood, random stuff and several different types of tofu! Check the conveyer belt before they come to order because we didn't and some of the stuff we ordered was actually on there! Get the beef combo it's so good! The broths are so good too but the hot is extra hot I could barely eat it! They have all kinds of sauces that you get to serve yourself which is cool! Definitely check this place out you won't be disappointed!

-Ndm1SKKPb8jQj_CSm0rkQ.text: Awesome!! First time? Ask for Kwan to be your server, he's very informative and makes sure you have an amazing experience. Food is delish, love the conveyor, pick only the ingredients you want! Happy hour 9:30pm to 12:00am buy one get one conveyor plates. Sauce bar allows you to be creative and make your own dipping sauce. Everyone was very friendly. Loved it!  By the way, the two star review from Sasha couldn't be more False. I sat at one of the smallest tables in the restaurant, using two pots of broth, the largest meat combo plate, 10 conveyor plates, 6 sauce plates, 4 bowls, 4 drinks, 2 plates and plenary of room. Restaurant smells like curry and traditional Chinese herbs, and I was never pressured to write a review at any point (no free dessert offered either). I wonder if she reviewed the correct place...

Great selection on their menu and good recommendations from our waiter. He recommended the beef and lamb combination and it was a good choice. The revolving belt of condiments and proteins a good touch. Pricing is decent and the broth was delicious. At the end of our meal they gave us complimentary ice cream too(green tea).

6GXfHHuWKZsLMrvdwLQQFg.text: Great food, great service, a new high end way to experience an Asian classic!   We ordered the house and mushroom broth , beef combo plates, combo noodle, and vegetable combo platter....and we couldn't be happier with our selections. We also had apple and peach soju which was delicious and went perfectly with our food selections!   The restaurant itself is super clean, trendy, and fun especially for groups settings!   We can't wait to come back and try some more!

dM266N0d7KzKHAqMBd9Maw.text: What a nice gathering place in vegas. It offers authentic Chinese hotpot and various meat and veggies. The spicy  hotpot has the right amount of flavor and no dipping sauce needed.  They also have a variety of sauces and condiments you can mix and match.  Good food! Good selection! Recommend!

22ozDNvQFQhrm0eDLWwI9Q.text: I've come here a handful of times and every time I leave full and happy. The service sometimes were better than others. Always busy, so I've learned to use OpenTable to reserve a table prior going. Their food is always yummy. I've tried the oxtail, original, and mushroom broth with entry level spice. We always order a beef combo plate, seafood plate, vegetables, and noodles. My favorites here are: taro noodles, tiger shrimp, and their brisket! Lastly, I do enjoy their pricing. Their meat plates are resizable you could spend at least $20/per person and still get a lot of food. My first choice for hotpot closest to home.

OiDMF6No-MXv2KatfUOzsA.text: To start off, I'd like to say that the staff is very nice. That being said, it was still a disappointing experience. I'm a newbie to hotpot, and I was used to the checklist format found at Little Sheep. To say the least, I was a little intimidated by the thought of a conveyor belt. I ordered the mushroom broth and my S.O. ordered the medium spicy pot. We sat in front of the conveyor belt for 10...15...20 minutes with no broth. We started to wonder if we were supposed to go somewhere to actually get the broth.  Finally, the broth came out, then the veggies, then the meat. The meat was decent quality and the veggies we ordered were fresh, but the pieces of cauliflower garnish that came with my tomato noodles were moldy - not like a few spots of black that one may just cut off at home, but like an entire half of a piece was trimmed off to account for the mold.  The food from the conveyor belt, however, was dried out. We went during happy hour, so it was understandable that the conveyor belt wasn't a fresh as possible, but some of the items were shriveled enough that they weren't readily recognizable as food. Also, the conveyor items come on cafeteria style plates, with plastic covers (most of them cracked and frosty), giving a very cheap feel.  The food was good, but not good enough to warrant the price tag.

QuCIus0MTMSzGsgE8Btzbw.text: Love this place. Affordable delicious hot pot with plenty of options as a vegetarian. All about that mushroom pot!   Thanks Kwon for taking care of us! :)

5hsry1fJTwwS1LMaUS7MEQ.text: So I really love eating here but a few small things keep it from being five stars. First the good, love the concept of individual hot pots and pulling the mix-it's from a conveyer belt. It's engaging, interactive and fun. The staff is generally nice and the most of the food is really tasty. I know now what I like and I get it every time and so I know it will taste great. Get the tomato broth base its phenomenal with mushroom a close second if you like it filled with all kinds of different mushrooms. The spicy soup base is almost inedible, just avoid it. It's too frustrating to eat because it's filled with so many inedible herbs and roots, like eating a soup of tree bark. And it forces you to separate your edible mix-ins from the inedible items which takes forever. You're trying to eat a noodle and it's wrapped around a stick, arghhh.  So the few downsides, the array of side snacks (along with sauce mix-ins) is so often depleted well before closing. We show up with hours until close and the bins of things like edamame or fruit or crackers or whatever that day are almost always empty and don't get refilled. Secondly the conveyer belt selection is hit or miss and there's no rhyme or reason to what they put out. Sometimes there's a lot of one thing and nothing of others, and it's frustrating that seemingly the two sides of the belt are not connected, so often I see something on the other side of the room that will never come to us. So I've taken to getting up and walking over to the other side of the restaurant to check the other selection.  Also the pricing is weird and ordering something from the server is often 2-3 times the belt price which is frustrating when you have to ask for it cause they forget to restock the belt. They don't consistently give everyone the same utensils so I go to serve myself the soup and I have a slotted spoon but others have a ladle. You have to ask for what should just be there. Overall these are all issues of inconsistency. It doesn't ruin the experience, just annoying when I love the food. But it doesn't seem to bother most people cause it gets pretty crowded. I'm one of those regulars so for all it's flaws, it's still pretty great!

Bt18bpQVQjeZ2Q40K1lI0A.text: We celebrated a birthday at Chubby last night. A group of seven, with 4 first-timers to the hot pot experience (always an adventure).  Dinner was delicious. They had a wagyu beef special, that was outstanding. Definitely recommend the tomato/oxtail broth.  I tried it for the first time last night...yummylicious. Deni was our server.  He was so attentive, fun and friendly.  He was more that eager to answer any questions, and show the newcomers how it's (hot pot) done.  Thanks for the wonderful service Deni.

SrTaQAODEZRq4FheHshqfQ.text: I've been here a few times and it is a decent place if you are craving some hot pot without having to serve yourself as everything comes out family style and you just cook it in the broth yourself.    One time I had the tofu I ordered smelled really bad like it was old and not refrigerated with the rest of the vegetables, when I asked that they need to replace it, they rolled their eyes and travesties me horribly for the rest of the night. The service was really rude, but that is something I cannot put up with.   The final straw why this place will never get my business again is that I called to make a reservation and the lady on the phone said they do not take reservations. So I showed up and she immediately asked me if I had a "reservation" which I said you told me on the phone you do not take reservations which she said "oh yes that's right."    Behind her there was a huge sign that said CASH ONLY so I asked where I could get cash from and she rudely told me to walk across the street to the supermarket to find an ATM.    To top all of that off I asked how long the wait was, she walked around in a full circle without even checking the tables and said 30-45 minutes for three people with no one in front of us.  If you continue to eat here you must enjoy bad service, limited options to pay, very rude staff, and a long arbitrary wait.    I'm very happy there are superior options in town which I will be frequenting.

z2UjjTHUBUqhBkZXahy0WA.text: I was sooooo excited to try this place. I found out about this place via a video on Facebook and I was so glad to have found out about it when I did because we were going to Vegas! Revolving hot pot sounded like a dream. Also wanted to make a disclaimer that this is NOT an AYCE hot pot restaurant.  They open at 5 and we had a concert at around so we tried to get there as soon as they opened. We were initially going to be sat at the high top tables, but soon realized we wouldn't get to experience the conveyor belt of ingredients. So we told the hostess we were willing to wait.  When we were sat, we ordered our broth. I got the mushroom and my boyfriend got the tomato oxtail. I definitely messed up cause his was honestly the best hot pot broth I've tried thus far. Perfect amount of spice and a generous amount of oxtail.   In terms of the menu, we ordered both the tomato and green tea noodle as well as 2 orders of the lamb shank. We underestimated just how much lamb it really was... 2 rows of highly piled lamb. We were determined. How the conveyor belt works is each plate/bowl has a color. Depending on the color, determines the price. We grabbed spam, imitation crab, and enoki mushroom.  While the broths were boiling, we made our own sauces. There's plenty of ingredients so you're bound to find something you like. What I think skewed our experience was what makes this place worth it/special from other hot pot places is their basket/specialty baskets/plates. Those were a bit on the more pricey side, hence my boyfriend and I ordered what we ordered. But the couple next to use ordered a mushroom basket as well as the wagyu beef with egg. So if that's what you're after, then I think this place excels there.  However, the ingredients (specifically lamb and the conveyor belt ingredients) weren't the freshest. But what do you expect, I guess? After all of that plus a hot tea, it was still very affordable. Not sure if that's because we were in Vegas or if it's the restaurant. But it was good for what it was worth!

2K1uMcuegOv1Viq8q9S3jQ.text: Chubby Cattle was such a unique experience. It is unlike anything my family and I have ever eaten at. The food came out very quick and it was easy to cook! There is something for everyone here and the food was delicious!  Thanks Jenny!!

Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

UEU1DMf3CzkglhL39BZgUA.text: Eating here at chubby cattle! Found their Instagram page and needed to check it out. The service is phenomenal and their soup bases are great! I had the tomato ox tail base and my friend had the original. Their meat is extremely fresh and the conveyor belt idea is great! If you haven't been, you will need to try it out.

photos.caption: Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

t39lBORrnKlT7wbpVykCrg.text: I went here for the first time with my boyfriend and can say that this is our new favorite hot pot spot in Las Vegas. We are from Southern California and have had some very disappointing hot pot in Las Vegas in the past that we don't even bother trying anymore. After finally crawling out of our comfort zone, we decided to give this place a try and it delivered. Service was attentive and quick, and the broths are very flavorful. We really like the variety of selections they offer as well and the DIY sauce station. Although we still prefer hot pot in SoCal, this place really hits the spot for Las Vegas. We will definitely be repeating customers.  On another note, they have a conveyer belt as well. It's kind of cool, but we still prefer ordering to ensure fresh quality lol

eUs5cF6UX-7qaL64xWmHSQ.text: A group of 6 of us came in around 9ish. We were gonna do the regular sit down shabu but the host told us that at 9:30pm they do a BOGO special with the conveyer belt. So we decided to wait for that.   We picked the house spicy sauce and oxtail tomato broth. I really liked the oxtail, it was really good and reminded me of Tom yum soup.  The dishes on the conveyer belts are vegetables, udon, fish cakes, rice cake, clams and tofu (basically all the side stuff).   You order the meat with the server. We got the beef combo and lamb combo. The quality of the meat was okay, it kinda broke apart before we could cook it and it was thin.   There's a station for sauces where you can make your own. Thought that was pretty cool.   In the end we split the bill and it came out to be about $17 per person which is pretty good for shabu dinner. I think the BOGO made it worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Q7zaQzCRE_LQwErAatxVeQ.text: What a fun concept.  The broth is very tasty here. You can share a pot or have individual pots. There's a conveyor belt that circles around with veggies, dough sticks, taro, glass noodles etc. You can also order off the menu for meat combos, lobster, and crab.  Plates on the conveyor belt are small. They count per plate. Cost wise it's expensive and although i'm glad i can say ive experienced it, there are less costly delish shabu/hot pot places to go. Plus with a big group it's difficult to eat out of 1 pot on a square table and you have to disturb the people by the conveyor belt to grab the items you want. Service was good,  place is clean, items were fresh.

photos.caption: Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobsterrrrr
Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wagyu with egg
Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy and original soup base

A3bbc2_mGdP9-KWxOsoRbg.text: Alex went above & beyond to make sure the issue was handled. Specific staff was suspended.   Thank you Alex for taking the situation seriously. Will definitely recommend as the food like i said was great.

R0BgLW43bS-vcILpw82lcQ.text: This is simply the best Hot pot restaurant I have been to here in Vegas. And believe me when I say it cause I have been to one. Kidding aside really a great place to go to. Their meatballs are juicy and the Oxtail broth is very tasty. Could get really busy though so be prepared to wait a little. Also, if you het seated on the private room, you'll smell like hotpot when you leave.   Jiaming is very accomodating and really caters quickly to all your requests.   This compound gets busy to parking is the only downside for me.

SqGBQ3-8HKIowprgTWQyfw.text: Delicious! Best hot pot in town :)  Meat is so fresh and tender.  Great service... Shout out to Kwan!

ZD80acE40t4TRBj-ToCWww.text: Back to this very good hot pot place in Las Vegas.  The line is certainly much longer and the crowd is now more diverse instead of mostly Chinese or Asian in my previous visit.  This is most likely due to Andrew Zimmern put this restaurant sometimes ago on between my two visits, on his TV show "The Zimmern List" which boosted the restaurant's popularity.  Here's the summary:  0. Get the spicy brother and order either beef ribeye ($9.99) or beef combo ($18.99) and you're good to go (if spicy is your thing too).  The ribeye was the best meat out of the 6 different ones we ordered that night.  1. Staff was still very friendly, no doubt.  2. Soup base (spiciest) was good.  3. Sauce bar selection was good.  4. Beef (didn't order pork or seafood this time, ordered and tried everything except A5 Wagyu) was good but not as good as it was.  The brisket plate which I raved about on my previous visit is no longer the same.  Quality and serving size of different beef plates are now smaller so it's now pricier.  *Missed taking pictures of some beef ordered as I got busy feeding my kids.  5. The noodles are made fresh in house using what looks like pasta maker, it was pretty good.

photos.caption: Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Smoked beef ($20)
Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Two orders of different veggies
Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Signature hand cut Wagyu beef (I would skip and get ribeye)

nMLZulncZxWsGW6rENygrQ.text: Probably the best hotpot place in town, but there aren't even that many choices to begin with. I've had their beef combo, short rib and egg, lamb, and pork, and the meat quality's been pretty good. I've only gotten the spicy pot for my soup base, and it's got a lot of spices and flavor.   The sauce bar is a nice addition. I try to come up with a different concoction of sauces every time.  They also have that conveyor belt, but it's only worth it for the happy hour IMO. Food can get a little pricey, because it all adds up. If you're a big eater like me, you'll probably end up spending between $40-$50.  And I gotta throw this out there. Man, during our last visit, our server was trying waaayyyy too hard to upsell every single thing on the menu, like c'mon bro. Get off deez nuts!

photos.caption: Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Short rib and egg special
Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meat galore

W6wGL-xnEBfsQ7V4arQGqA.text: Make sure you come early because there wait can get up to over an hour!! We had a large party of 11 and was able to get the private room. The service and food was both excellent. My favorite is the tomato base soup it was perfectly seasoned. The beef combo is a great deal to have a variety of premium cuts to share. They also had their Kobe beef special that's served with a raw egg it was half off and soooo delicious!

5i8HHNFqiSNYpQB6NAo1gg.text: I went to Chubby Cattle to celebrate my friends birthday. It's a fun atmosphere where everyone has a steaming pot in front of them. I chose bone broth for my pot. CAUTION: Be careful with your phone's one drop it one of those pots and it's over. Thankfully not talking from experience lol. They give you a choice of meats and veggies to put in your soup. They serve the veggies in these wooden  bowls that looked very cool. The veggies were all fresh I didn't see anything wilted in the bunch! I had a big appetite that day so I had to have the lamb too so good! The meat was tender and  had no weird gamey taste to it. It's a fun place for a group of friends or also for a fun date.

photos.caption: Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The lamb
Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My bone broth creation

Hl-TB0POaDNt4gOzBRmBhw.text: This restaurant has extremely good food!! I had never eaten at a restaurant like this before I dined in at Chubby Cattle. I went in with a group of friends and none of us had any clue on how to order. But, luckily for us Deni was our waiter so that did not matter. He did an amazing job coaching our whole table through the menu and all of his recommendations were spot on. The spicy broth is pretty spicy so don't let your noodles sit in there too long.  Definitely will be back not only for the food but because the service was so great. Once again want to mention Deni because he was the best waiter I've had at any restaurant. Keep up the good work!

p9kwk94ToiR0a6bUxGCv7g.text: Best Chinese hotpot in town, good quality meat and everything is fresh. Individual pot is convenient. Most of all, phenomenal service!

JsimfBSuf0WvqnPGXD42MQ.text: We had lunch ar Chubby Cattle and it was quite impressive. It is a hot pot Mongolian style restaurant. The conveyor belt system is really cool, running right in front of you by your seat at the counter,  but since we were new to the restaurant we took the good advice of our waitress and we had the lunch special which meant that we didn't have to figure out what was going by you on the conveyor belt. It was terrific ! If you have enough experience with Mongolian entrees You should choose the conveyor belt items.  Highly recomended

Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The hot pot heated in a well in front of you at the counter
Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Conveyor belt system of menu items

FBcyRTT94TXIfp-tEkX-2g.text: Find me here Sundays through Thursday at 9:30 for happy hour- BOGO on all conveyor belt items. Such a great deal. First, choose a broth for your personal hotpot. I'd recommend the heavenly tomato broth. It is SO GOOD, I don't even have to use sauce. Get it if you like Tom yum soup. Order the handmade noodles of your choice and a small amount of veggies for an extra dollar. Order any meats you'd like. Remember the portions are pretty filling!  Then keep an eye out for your faves on the conveyor belt, which are veggies, noodles, some seafood, and tofus. The color of the place tells you how much each one costs. So many options. So little stomach room.  There is a sauce bar toward the front of the restaurant - add whatever you'd like to the sesame sauce base.  Oh, and Chubby cattle also has a bar!  The only thing is that this place gets busy, so it's hard to track someone down for refills.

9Rre3aQmEN7-yD-q0iruPg.text: This was our first hot pot experience. Our server was Deni and he was AMAZING! He was VERY patient with us and explained everything step by step and helped us choose the dishes by our taste preference. He made it a truly personal experience.   We opted for the Spicy base and a mushroom base. I asked if I could get the mushroom base spicy and Deni was happy to accommodate. We also ordered the veggie combo, noodles, seafood combo, deer platter special, the sea bass special, and a beef combo. Everything was amazing! Thanks to Deni, we knew in which order to cook the foods and how to eat them and how to work the heater.   There is a conveyor belt of hotpot dishes, but if this is your first time, I highly suggest letting the server know. Deni told us of a vegetarian who picked up a black bowl from the conveyor only to find out vegetable dishes are NOT in black bowls. So, he asked us to hold off on the conveyor until we could ask what was in the bowl. (LOL)  We are definitely going back. We're so happy to have accidentally found this spectacular place. I highly recommend the Chubby Cattle, especially for a unique dining experience and for those special holidays like Valentine's, Anniversaries, or Birthdays.

photos.caption: Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Assorted Mushroom Pot &amp; Hellishly Spicy Pot. Noodles. Seafood Combo. Deer platter (night&#39;s special). Veggie Combo. Asahi beer &amp; Vegas Ice T

0CkxiOfabOTfiAngEKZeeA.text: I am a big fun of chubby cattle. Server Jenny is very helpful and nice to us. The best server! The cocktails are good, made us a happy. The broth is really tasty. Original and tomato oxtail are my favorite. The must-try-dish will be the sushi. The mix of wagyu and uni or the mix of wagyu and foie grass, I swear, it's soooooooo good. Also, Jenny suggest us the special meat-A5 wagyu beef. It's pricy but I love it, the good quality always come with high price, and it is actually very worthy compared to the Kobe beef.

photos.caption: Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. cocktails
Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. family style pot
Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A5 wagyu without egg

QcLPf_vayrmDyvxIMDK4pg.text: My family is very critical on food, especially Asian food. We have too many savants and cooks (not of the classically trained caliber, but True Chinese women that slave in the kitchen for hours). This was one of the best hotpot meals outside of our home. There will be a wait if you have more than 2 and don't want to sit at the counter, but trust me when I say it is worth every minute of the wait. Fresh Wagyu beef, sparkling and smoking seafood displays, and a conveyor belt that circles in and out of the kitchen making sure all items are fresh. As one with a plant based diet, can I tell you how awesome it is to leave full (and not on just rice).   Aside from the delicious meal we had, our server Deni was THE MAN! Again, I have a demanding family and they will at times "bark" orders at our servers. He was patient and quick with every request. I'm from the service industry and know it cannot be easy to be on top of every table when you are at max occupancy and have people waiting an hour +. He is definitely an asset and great compliment to Chubby Cattle's staff.   All in all, don't go hungry because you may have to wait, but be ready to eat.

photos.caption: Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Deni and his sparkling personality!

_cSZfnwYo5oqPfeFqktxGw.text: This is on of the healthiest restaurant for who want to take care of your body. I love the house base soup which has Chinese herbs in there....Great service...I will come back here again....highly recommended!!!

g1rZmzwvDAKDwHkr9oVAVQ.text: It's everything you'd expect in a hot pot restaurant. All the ingredients (vegetables, meat, and conveyor belt items) were top notch and service was great. The seafood combo platter was a little on the expensive side given the quantity ($20, which came with 3-4 pieces each of mussels, scallops, shrimp, and crab sticks). The soup comes with free refills though! I ordered their oxtail soup, which is now mixed with their tomato base, and found that the tomato flavor was a little overpowering (good for people who like their soups sour I guess). The mushroom and original soups, on the other hand, were perfect and had the right depth of flavor. Our server, Deni, was very accommodating and constantly checked up on us for our party of 5, despite it being a busy Friday evening. Overall, I would recommend this place if you want to sit down and enjoy some soup!

zlRuJMUjhP-Tzd5xhKhr0A.text: My husband and I have never had hot pot style dining before, this was an interesting experience! The waiter was very knowledgeable and patient while he explained everything to us. We will definitely be going back, but the only thing I see that could be improved would be to label the dishes in the conveyor belt. Most of the stuff was not labeled and we had no idea what it was so we didn't try it. The broth was delicious, and the meat was very fresh and tender.  We loved the concept - so fun!!

photos.caption: Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hjCa-ekrNyTiI7kBiYOQKA.text: Great spot! So happy they opened up a place like this in Vegas. James was our server and was very sweet and attentive. Food was amazing. I will be back!

hKPUThMBReJAsivvg0TQEA.text: first time here and had a great time!! Food is super delicious service is on point. Ask for Deni He's great!

5cnG58ZgiZnJlawb5itz8w.text: Very warm and friendly restaurant. I called in advance to check seating, and was greeted by a kind employee who assured me that my belly was not about to go hungry that night(hehe). Upon arriving there, she thanked us for calling in advance. How nice of her to remember!   I was reccommended to this place by a friend, and I was no doubt satisfied. In Las Vegas there are basically no conveyor belt restaurants, but Chubby Cattle happened to be an exception! I still wish this included sushi as well though. Anyways, on to the good stuff. This restaurant is hot pot-based, with the side dishes rotating around on a motorized conveyor belt. I LOVE IT. Different dishes have different prices usually ranging from $1-$4 I believe, but its all pretty affordable. I ordered the house pot, which tasted like mushroom or chicken broth, which was delicious. From the conveyor belt, I decided to take sliced beef, tteokbokki(korean rice cakes), chopped spam, spinach, and what looked like buckwheat noodles. All of these made a delicious combination. The only thing to watch out for, is the temperature of the soup. When you aren't cooking the ingredients, make sure to deactivate the heater, or else you are in for quite the tongue-searing ride.   Between this and Pho, I would definitely choose hotpot. Why so? Hot pot is customizable, and can be heated right from your table. This plus the conveyor belt truly ended off my shopping trip with a bang. If you are coming to eat here, make sure to bring some friends! If you don't, then have no fear; there is a bar-like seating area for those who are riding solo. CHECK THIS PLACE OUT!

photos.caption: Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. An elegant shot of your prospective at the table.
Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A view of the interior
Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The front sign

CQlR0733_K4voJkBYQSZhg.text: Loved the whole experience. Our sever Ting guided us through the concept and had great recommendations. I'd definitely go with the tomato soup and the short rib. From there grab what looks good from the line.   They also have do it your self sauce bar. You can mix a variety of ingredients together. They even have a few signs to help guide you in the right direction.

kCdE7lVbYQ-RpqRF5NBjHQ.text: I really. Really. Wanted to like this place.   Me and my party of two came here on a weekday about 2 hours before closing. The smell when you first walk in is very overwhelming, but not in a bad way. It's in a way where you get excited to eat!   We were greeted by a very pleasant hostess. In all honesty, she is the only reason I am not giving them just a 1 star.   After we explained that it was our first time here, our hostess was kind enough to explain how the menu worked. She went over the soup bases, meats, what was on the conveyor belt, and any additional side items. It was neither of ours first time going to a hot pot. But it was the first of this nature for both of us. And our hostess made ordering easy.   The soup was tasteful and flavorful, while the brisket was my favorite menu item to order from. The conveyor belt idea is very creative and I'm glad to have experienced it.   A reason for the negative stars is because we were both extremely dissatisfied with the service given to us by the other employees of this location, especially our waiter. We asked three times for a bowl for soup and rice (each time we ordered a new meat, we asked them about those two items) and we NEVER received EITHER of it. Not once did he check up on our table, but he did manage to find time to talk to his friend who so happened to visit. We were very upset that his friend ended up getting a bowl of rice, even though we ordered way before he was even seated.   Overall, I wish again that I could like this place. But the (lack of) service that was shown to us really left a bad taste in our mouths. Maybe we caught our server on a bad day, or we just sat on the wrong side of the bar. Either way. We will not be returning.

vJ-_VA4yGGClaAye6yGASA.text: See Deni for the best service! Menu is a little overwhelming, but the severs will walk you through it. Make sure you utilize the sauce station, as it really makes the meat personalized to your taste.   Oh and portions are pretty big, so make sure you order gradually.

n8F-gHffkH4HHPIJr5wlIg.text: First off, when you first enter the restaurant it had kind of a weird smell from the raw seafood. You get used to it after a while. What's cool about this place is that you get to build your own soup. The restaurant has this conveyer belt style so that you can choose what you want in your soup.  So my man and I never really go to a lot of shabu shabu style restaurants. We decided to try this place out. We were soooo confuse. Our hostess gave us this attitude like she was shock we didn't know how to do it. Lady, that's why we were asking how to do it. Luckily, our server Matthew was great. He explained to us how to do it. So we ordered the original soup base and a medium spicy soup base. Let me tell you, I can handle a lot of spicy food but man that medium spicy soup base was SPICY!! I literally was tearing up. I had our server change my soup base to original.  So if you decide to get that spicy soup base, beware.  Okay the reason I'm giving this place 2 stars is because our experience was not so good. We were confuse. They had charged me for the spicy soup base when I only had one bite of it. I changed it to original. Usually restaurants can accommodate  that for you esp. if they notice you were burning up and tearing. And I didn't like how that hostess was rude to us. Also, the oysters wasn't fresh. :/ I did like the broth but I didn't like how the aromatics they put in the broth made it hard to enjoy. I found myself trying to spit it out. I know they gave us the slotted spoon but still it was hard to enjoy.

eHHcI_HHZpNzwQ6szBfT9w.text: This place is very delicious! First time was a little overwhelming as there are so many options to chose from. Have gone back a couple times since and couldn't be more happy. The service is quick and if you need any recommendations or questions the servers are always on top of it. Awesome date night or even a group of people would be fun.

bnlo0ev_U-E5wKFYew8UoQ.text: Food was delicious. Staff was friendly and attentive. Highly recommend this place. I tried the house broth and it was yummy.

gKI9qn7mfn-GQVL-k1_b2A.text: Great place for Mongolian hotpot with a conveyor belt option. Pick and choose what you like to eat from the belt or order bigger sizes from your waiter. There's a generous sauce bar where you can make your own dipping sauce. The hot and spicy base (its spicy!!) and the tomato base are a must try! Will come back again and would definitely recommend 10/10!

kNK7ButMjUOD2qbQm29TkA.text: Don't let the name fool you this is an excellent restaurant. The bowl of noodles was large and very good. The ox tail was fall off the bone tender.

JRTPv2G2XFTuKyGt2gWuag.text: One of the best Chinese hot pot in United States. Visit this place everything I visit Las Vegas. Hope someday there's one in LA too. Soup base is good, meat are refresh, and there're a lot on the turn table

UCjfKwKKMDr6OWfPIFK8bg.text: Long wait not what i was expected no return for me. Had better experiences at other similar places

FgayVDvqcT1PnQmjfAWdyw.text: Good place. The food is good and nice. Service by Den. Nice guy. The hot pot is very especial that you can pick up what you want.

ohIxvRWDqGW8vU6lmyxwbA.text: This is the spot for hot pot.  Don't let the conveyor belt fool you.  It's great to select the veggies and pasta and single portions are perfect. The service was GREAT.  Kwan helped with suggestions on how spicy the pot was and was very friendly.   I was going to order medium spicy pot but Kwan strongly suggested entry level instead and it was a great suggestion.  He even assisted with a dipping sauce.  The ribeye, chicken and pork were high quality and the sake was the perfect addition to the meal. The place was busy too, so that is further evidence of the quality.   We will be back!
