3VcFT9dofjsS53ONIDpLkw.text: Hot pot places isn't usually the first thing I crave but we have heard and read so many good things about that my boyfriend and I thought to give it a try. What really caught my attention was the conveyor belt feature they have because there is no place in vegas that does it. Unfortunately it's too bad it's not a sushi place. We expected it to be busy since it was a Saturday but the wait wasn't too bad. About 25 min wait to sit for 2 near the conveyor belt. So there is a few different areas, there is a bar style, booth or like big family round tables. Service was great as soon as we sat down. The waiter was super nice and explained everything we needed to know. First you order the broth. They have a few choices to choose from. We decided to get 1 house special and 1 house special spicy. By far, the spicy broth was way more flavorable and you can decide how spicy you want it. The house special was alright if you simple taste. Then u order the type of meat. On yelp I saw the cool seafood platter so that's what I got (which was a mistake) and my boyfriend ordered the lamb and beef combo (good choice). Those 2 orders alone had me really full. Unfortunately, I didn't have the energy or space to pick something out of the conveyor belt but it was nice for pics. The dishes inside vary from meat to seafood to veggies to noodles. The reason why the seafood was a mistake was cause most of it was on the conveyor belt like the shrimp, scallops, and mussels. It was the display of the seafood platter that really only caught my attention.  The other cool part about this place was that you could create your own dipping sauce at the sauce station! The 2 things that really stood out in this place was the broth and sauce station hands down. Oh, I believe rice is also free because my boyfriend ordered a side of it.  Cons about this place is the limited space u have if u eat at the bar area where the conveyor is. It's pretty tight when u have people on both sides of you.  The meat was alright. The seafood was alright. Nothing special. Fresh though. But what really gives it it's taste is the broth and the sauce u create with it.  Overall the bill was about $50. But only because I think we mistakenly ordered the seafood platter which was about $20. The lamb and beef combo was about $16.99 and I believe the brother is $3-6 bucks. My boyfriend said he wasn't full but just about right. However for me, I felt super full. Definitely worth a try! It's also fun to take pics on your experience. :)

photos.caption: Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef and lamb combo
Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood platter. Even had the little smoke in the back. Looked kinda empty but it was a good amount tbh.

FlzXDOhTEbx_LfN42X5jqQ.text: I really like this place, and the service is always excellent here. The waiters are really helpful if you're a first timer and they are full of suggestions. They still remembered me when I came back for more, too.  The meat is always so goooood. I love the rib-eye and brisket. I've tried the spicy broth, house original, and mushroom. When I ordered the spicy one, I didn't really take them seriously and went for a medium level, I think it's best to start with the entry level spicy if it's your first time here. I honestly can't tell if I like the mushroom or original hotpot better, both are really tasty. The mushroom is a more subtle broth but if you love mushrooms like me, it's great.  Honestly, I really, really like this place, but I can't give in 5 stars because it's sooo expensive, overpriced in my opinion. All of the Shabu-shabu places I've been to charge for their meat, and the choice of broth comes with your order of meat. Those shabu places also include a vegetable platter and a bowl of rice. At Chubby Cattle, they charge you separately to add rice, any veggies are their own prices on the menu, and the broth itself is also charged to your bill. Everything adds up so fast!! I feel like at least rice should be included because it's kind of hard to just eat meat in sauce for an entire meal.  Also, the cilantro in their self-serve sauce bar could be a bit fresher... (some of it is turning black sometimes...)

yl9Oy4GTGZpMg255JaCxQQ.text: I came here on the recommendation of a friend for the oxtail soup. Food is great, staff is terrible and is always trying to solicit drugs from me. Never again.

9lKtNCD2CkRMKTJTqiT7jw.text: This place is always busy whenever I go. I love the concept of conveyor belt hot pot. Definitely a new and interesting idea. I love hot pot especially when I can cook everything myself. The only down side of this is that it can get a little costly if you eat a lot. Their service is always on point. The servers are always right there when you need them. They have a create your own sauce station so you can create your own dipping sauce. I was very disappointed while looking at the options at first, but I worked with what I got and made probably the best dipping sauce ever.

XlEUq-W9grnG6ibj-SypTQ.text: I love the concept of this place, a conveyor belt bringing food to me. Yet, something gets lost in translation. First, the broth, I liked mine, it was entry level hell- at first really spicy but as I ate it down it was fine. I made myself a decent dipping sauce, but would love it if there were some suggestions. Meat and vegetables seemed very fresh, but too expensive for me. The amount of meat given per dish was not that much for the price. The amount of vegetable was fine. I didn't partake of any rice or noodles but they seemed very run of the mill. I didn't take anything from the conveyor belt, and I didn't notice anyone else taking any either. I sort of question the freshness of the dishes and the dishes themselves, some sort of informational chart would be helpful.  The people around me seemed to enjoy their food. Service was slow because they were crazy busy. We asked for soup spoons, twice, then received iced tea like spoons. We never had our water refilled, and didn't get much attention. Deni was our server, he was just too busy for us. He came by to ask us to fill out a survey and check in on Yelp to get some free ice cream. Another server plopped down the ice cream when we weren't done with our food - honestly I would have ordered more, but they never asked. For the 3 of us, the total was about $62, I'd much rather go to an all you can eat KBBQ place and pay a little more. I'd say Chubby Cattle, is good to try once, but I wouldn't come back.

SmaKdhrrljRMLY8ZdpyNNw.text: First time I came here was little than a week ago. I came here with 2 friends and my girlfriend and we're very excited off of the reviews, let alone the sound of this place. To start, the first time was amazing, great service and great food. Our waiter was attentive and the hostess made sure things went well. HOWEVER the reason of my review is because of our second trip which was tonight.   My girlfriend and I went because the first time was amazing. However, it was one of the most irritating times I ever had at a restaurant and usually I'm very easy to please. The hostess was PERFECT as always but the server wasn't. I don't know if it was his first time or not but I see it how if you mess up once, fix it. First we ordered the beef combo and got a lamb and beef and after I tried politely to tell him it was the wrong order, he told me I was the one who ordered it and it wasn't his mistake. I didn't order it and what I originally ordered was more expensive so why would I lie about that in the first place when I'm about to pay for the more expensive one that I ordered?? Second, through our meal it seemed as if we offended him with getting what we originally ordered that he stopped attending to us. Our drinks were empty for almost the entire meal til we had to stop someone and ask for a refill. Next our server attended to the people to the right of us, skipped over to the left of us and finally I was frustrated and made eye contact til he finally came over to us and checked on us. After that the group to the right of us interrupted us while I was asking for something and he walked away to attend them! He also interrupted us in the middle of our meal to ask if we're done, keep in mind we started way after the people around us, felt as if we were being pushed out.   Got to the end of our meal and my girlfriend and I wanted to take our food home because we were full. We had A LOT leftover and the server came to us and only brought 1 container and said they don't have anymore. I was upset because not only did they not have anymore containers for myself to take home the extra amount of food I'm paying for and had leftover, he said to us "You guys should try and finish it." ARE YOU SERIOUS? How are you going to tell a customer to finish their food because YOU'RE out of containers? Let alone he told us multiple times to try and finish it?! The nice hostess again stepped in, ran to another restaurant and helped me. After all this, one of the chefs in the kitchen they have opened to the customers eye's to see, I saw him staring at us like we were ridiculous and laughed. He was the white chef with glasses. I also heard him clearly joking around with his coworkers about how we made them run around to get us stuff for our leftover food. SMFH. I was highly pissed off at this point.   I feel horrible ever writing a post like this and I barely ever do but my girlfriend and I were highly disrespected here. I worked and managed restaurants and kitchens as well as have my own business. I know what customer service should be.

ApzmyRhu4pRYs_TFkaLBpQ.text: Decided to try Chubby Cattle based on the high Yelp rating! Being Chinese-American, I grew up on Chinese Hot Pot (fondue). Chubby Cattle was wonderful! We had the beef, veggies, shrimp paste, meatballs, seafood tofu, shrimp & three different types of noodles. Everything was delicious. Our server, Deni was super nice. He explained everything & answered all of our questions since it was our first time. We will definitely go back next time we're in Vegas.

IT-hwtkSF_86ovYwLmaKIA.text: Even though eating this kind of thing in the middle of summer is as strange as having a popsicle in a snowstorm to me, the fragrant scent of boiled meats and other delights coming out of the kitchen squashed any of those concerns upon entering.  I walked to the table as quickly as possible to dive into it all.    The excellent ingredients and presentation totally take this place to the next level.  Their beef and lamb combo platter was sliced red meat pornography and tasted even better with their vast array of sauces (the BBQ one seemed most popular).  The seafood combo platter packed with shrimp, scallop, octopus, squid, and mussels with its dry ice center garnered the "oohs" and "ahhs" it was looking for.  Even the people at a neighboring table came over to snap pics.  We also ordered the meatballs, live scallops (huge!) and the short rib; all top notch.   My only real gripe is with the menu itself.  There are a lot of options and it could be daunting for first timers to the restaurant, let alone this type of dining experience as a whole.  It's probably even more annoying for staff since they have to constantly answer questions that could easily be clarified on the menu, like portion size.  To save everyone time, offering combo meals for 2, 4, and 6 people with a little bit of everything should be considered.  - While a cool novelty, the conveyer belt will go ignored unless dining solo or if you're the only one yearning for a plate of blood tofu or cuttlefish.  We ordered a lot and it was more than enough.  It isn't important or as fun to sit by as I thought it would be.      - Dipping high quality beef into boiling water is never worth it.  Avoid the "Kobe".  - I really want to go spicy next time!  - Can we PLEASE STOP calling this fondue?  4.4888888889 stars

lUbc7GBNEX12dOHAo2AqSg.text: Our first time and I'm really impressed. The place is open and airy, clean... Staff was very friendly and accommodating.... You make your own dipping sauce....  Food was awesome... Got medium spicy broth and it was awesome...... I love spicy food and this hit the spot.... They have other broths for people who don't like spicy food... The idea of a conveyor with color-coded plates with ingredients for pricing is also smart... Don't be afraid to try stuff as they ave vegetables, fish, tendon, noodles, and duck feet too. Just like the terminator.... I'll be back !!!

OSBuUZgOk_z2zAXBUJM5xQ.text: Interesting take on hot pot dining which ended up in unexpected pig out. I definitely felt chubby when I struggled to get up from the chair to leave. Good food and service made this experience a memorable one.  We sat at their bar tables with conveyor belt around which offers small hot pot items like mushroom, tofu and cabbage. I noticed that most people order with the servers and not picking off of the conveyor belt. It seemed more like a display. I hope those items are not spinning around for days and weeks.   Simple concept. Choose your soup, sauce then meat/veggies. I got to try their original soup base and tomato soup but have to say tomato soup is a lot better. As for sauces, you can either order one off of menu ($2 each) or walk over to their sauce station and grab your own. If ordering a sauce, I recommend their original sauce. If are going to the sauce station, I recommend mixing the soy bean sauce with green onion and spoonful of garlic. More garlic the better. I overloaded mine with 2 spoonful of garlic and it was a bit excessive...ha  As for meat, I must say their beef tongue was off the hook. It was the perfect slice, not too thin nor thick. You are eating the meat shabu-shabu style so you don't feel heavy or bloated after eating, which can be good or bad.   Skewers were good also. We got the lamb and beef. Lamb didn't have that strong gamy taste. Both were tender and not chewy at all. Servers couldn't tell the difference which was kind of funny. "I got lamb and beef here. I can't tell the difference but you will know once you eat it".   Talking about service, you can tell they are new and trying hard. Our server constantly checked on us and gave some recommendation, though his face was way too close to my face (so close his facial hair brushed a few times on my cheek which made me flinch every time). Training should focus on menu knowledge as he didn't know what was included in the combo or the difference between certain items on the menu.   Is it all a hype? Not really. Cool concept and good quality food served here. I can see myself coming back here again.

8pLHdcSaxDy0Wi2IX5a7Ng.text: Really good hot pot place!! I sauce station is everything!! It's fabulous!! You can look at food move by you on the belt. My only request is the quality of meat can be better, it doesn't look that fresh.

dmKqsOTRmYJYO0hjMEIuqw.text: I love this hot pot place! there are several hot pot based that i get to pick. i got entry level to hell and my husband got original one. we all got individual pot and the awesome part about this place is its sauce bar and its ergonomic sauce tray. it made the dipping sauce part interesting and its great variety of sauce option made the good even more delicious.  All the ingredients are really fresh, i love its lamb shoulder especially. it is so tender and fresh. tried it black cod it is extremely fresh. i am usually super picky when it comes to seafood bc i care so much about its freshness. i gave five star for its freshness. it has great variety menu items to choose from. i love its entry level to hell soup base, it is actually really spicy already not sure if i would be able to handle the regular spicy level.  this place soup place is similar to little lamb magnolia but better.    I would definitely come back again! and the price is reasonable considering it is in Vegas

eA0deoVem5ithwhIV105YQ.text: Wow, vegas is full of surprises. The asian waitress came out running after us to nag for her tip. Well the problem is you didnt do a good job. We were kept waiting while you were serving the older people that came after us. They got their broth before us. When we were walking out you dont thank us, smile at us while i was smiling to you. 2qxFpd6pGhme8g5-lv2DYQ.text: Visited on Saturday 8-20-16 at 5:30 pm.  We were asked if we'd like individual hot pots or a communal one and we chose the communal pot.    The process is easy...pick what type of broth you want, then order your raw items to throw in it, and you can pick up more items from the conveyor belt if you're sitting close to it.    For $75.28 we got a yin-yang pot of broth, a small order of enoki mushrooms, grilled shrimp, grilled chicken gizzards, fresh thick noodles, napa cabbage, hand-cut angus beef, beef meatballs, steamed rice, pork dumplings, chicken breast slices, three soft drinks, scallops, sausage, salmon, and crab sticks.   After ordering we were urged to check out the condiment bar in the middle of the restaurant.  It's a circular table with pots of seasonings and sauces and everything was labeled but the writing had faded off of the labels so it was impossible to tell what was inside.  After peeking inside all the containers I chose a spoonful of an unknown brown goo that turned out to be quite tasty.    They were out of a few items we wanted to order like the wagyu fried rice, duck flippers, and the server didn't even know what the pumpkin cake was even though it's on their menu.  They are still pretty new and trying to get the hang of things I guess.    Grilled chicken gizzard skewers were tasty! They were a little spicy but tender and yummy. The "grilled shrimp skewer" from their menu was just 6 grilled shrimp on a plate. No skewer LOL weird!   Items coming down the conveyor belt are not labeled and I couldn't really tell what all of them were.  There were a few items that looked like they were fried balls or dumplings but the case is refrigerated so that didn't really make sense.   We chose half house broth and half tomato broth.  I didn't really like either one...neither was salty enough and they were both very...herbal?? Like a pho broth but thicker and pungent.  All of the items we ordered appeared fresh but none were presented in cool containers like I see in other pictures on yelp and their website.  I think you have to order one of their more expensive "combos" to get the neat presentations with the dry ice and dish gardens.    This place is definitely worth the trip and I really enjoyed my first hot pot experience here.  The decor is awesome as well and I love love love their light fixtures and modern tables.

pR-RsuNfp15aN6JHKm_wdg.text: Wow. Just wow. Such a exquisite selections of palatable entrees to appease my tastebuds. Service is excellent as well as the dishes. Our server Kwan was a delight and attentive to our whole dining experience. I would recommend this place to friends and family. A++   I love eating hot pot and I would say this hot pot is the best that vegas has to offer. Everything was top quality from the food to the service.

lrLbxVwr7NQ_0Qp_O61Ecw.text: Chubby Cattle, I really wanted to like you. I have been waiting for you to open for ages. Ever since I heard wind of "Little Lamb" opening and that it is a similar concept to Little Sheep Mongolian Hot Pot, I had been ecstatic.   Chubby Cattle has a very interesting concept when it comes to hot pot. For half of their tables, everyone at the table gets their own individual pot. The other half gets a shared pot for those who don't mind. On top of that, they have a conveyor belt for certain hot pot items that you can grab. The items are on different colored plates that differentiate the cost of each item. Just keep in mind that meats and a majority of the seafood items won't be on the conveyor belt.   My friends and I came here last night for dinner. When we first got in, the hostess greeted us and proceeded to ask if we have reservations. Her question threw me off because I have never been to a hot pot place where they asked for reservations. She then told us that she could seat us but it would be shared pot and it will not be by the conveyor belt.   We want to be able to experience the conveyor belt and we told the hostess that. Instead of giving me an estimated time, she just gave me negative statements such as, "I just can't sit you there right now. I have a reservation coming in at 7:15, 7:30, etc. I just can't." Well, that's great. Why do I care about what reservations you have coming? She eventually told us that it'll be a 45-60 min wait. She said she'd call us if the table was ready early or we can come back in an hour. Sure enough we came back in an hour and when she saw us, she told me, "I tried calling you but it didn't work." I was really tempted to say, "Well, did you dial 1 first?" Without another word, she walked off. So, the hostess is unprofessional, not personable, overwhelmed, and doesn't know how to use a phone.   When we got seated, the table wasn't completely set up. Why? Because the hostess sat us without taking that into mind. It took a while before we got to order our soup bases and when we did, our server told us they were out of their original and original spicy. Well, why am I here then? I almost walked out but the manager came up to inform the server that if we were willing to wait 10 minutes, then the original and original spicy would be ready. And of course we opted to wait. In the end, I ended up with their original spicy soup base at medium. It was pretty bland in flavor. The soup tasted like spicy water that smelled like spicy herbs.   When we looked through the menu, we were a little curious about some of the dishes. There were single dishes and then there were combo dishes. We wanted to know the differences between them -- like, what is the better bang for our buck. We asked our server and he knew nothing. The manager had to come over to explain. Even then, according to the server, the beef & lamb combo platter, they don't serve the dishes by weight. The kitchen just does the best that they can to fill the plate up. So if I knew someone who worked in the kitchen, I can get a hook up right? We ended up ordering a plate of beef brisket and lamb shoulder. The quality of the beef brisket wasn't that great but the lamb shoulder slices were decent.  Aside from the meats, we also ordered napa cabbage and watercress. The napa was fine but the watercress wasn't fresh at all. A lot of yellow and browns on the leaves. We also ordered their fresh thick noodle and when I was ordering it, the server suggested the noodle combo. Of course, being curious, I asked what's in the noodle combo. He told me it was random and the kitchen decides on that. Well then, why am I ordering from a server? Should I just order from the kitchen directly? Maybe they'll know more about what's being served to me. On that topic, the fresh thick noodles were not fresh -- they were dry. They were also not thick, they were thin. They were thinner than spaghetti noodles. The texture of it was really good though and tasted great when cooked in the spicy soup base. I just wish they were thicker.   From the conveyor belt, we got some king oyster mushrooms, enoki mushrooms, and glass noodles. They were pretty okay but we also noticed that a lot of the plates were not consistent in the amounts. Some plates looked like they had more product than the next even when it's the exact same item.   Our server did apologize for his performance. It was his third day on the job and he was overwhelmed and his knowledge was limited. I'm not sure if that's the greatest excuse but I do appreciate the apology though.   Bottom line, I'm not sure if I would return. The establishment has a great outward appearance to everything they do: conveyor belt, presentation of their seafood plates, table set up, etc. But the service wasn't great from square one and the quality of certain items were only average unless you spend a lot more. I've experienced better in general. The conveyor belt was a fun experience though! Was worth it just once.

zJFCC5MW312VifNQ6vwfWA.text: I really wanted to love this place so bad, but afterwards just felt kinda meh about it. Don't get me wrong the concept is great and there's nothing else like it in Vegas so I definitely recommend giving at least one try, but I don't think I'd come back.    About 5 of my friends came on a Thursday for dinner. We had made a reservation so had no problems with getting a table. The server was very good with welcoming us and giving a brief explanation of everything, but during our meal she wasn't super attentive with clearing plates or refilling our drinks. Maybe they're just overwhelmed by still being a new restaurant, but it definitely effected my overall experience.  Food wise it wasn't bad, but I honestly prefer doing hot pot at home better. I do love that they have tons of sides and meat choices and that you can get your own individual pot. As a group we definitely ordered too much food so I recommend starting with a few items and ordering as you go. For the broth I went with the spicy entry level. I personally did not really care for it. My boyfriend had the mushroom which I tried and thought was much better. I did enjoy the concept of being able to mix your own sauces, but wish they had some type of guidelines of what to mix or just some basics.   Overall I'm glad I tried this place out and think it's still a great one time thing, but I'd rather do my own hot pot at home.

The soup will set you back a few bucks but it's worth it.  They have a sauce and a small appetizer bar at no cost which is a nice touch. Everything else here is a-la-carte,  I would opt out their certified Waygu grade 5 steak and stick with their beef and lamb offering. Their seafood was ok but not something you should go out of your way to try. They offer a few variety of "balls" so if you had to choose one, pick the fresh fish ball; the other variations didn't work.  They do have a sushi type carousal but I didn't see any price charts for the different color plates.   As usual expect yourself to smell like what you ate..

d2zDgumks-YyYvmFtUenRA.text: Been here many times and my review here has been long overdue. NOTE: If you work at a casino you get a buy one get one free on the meats you order, and you're not limited to just one order so feel free to order away if you're starving (though the portions are big) or if you have a big group. This is a hotpot place and is very clean. What I really love is that there is a conveyer belt with side dishes going around that you can grab and add to your hotpot. What's always amazing is that there is a sauce bar and you can make your very own sauce to dip your food in. If you like spicy like me, here's my signature sauce creation. 2 scoops of spicy garlic hot oil, 1 scoop of soy sauce, half a scoop of bean paste to round out the flavors, and a small amount of green onion and cilantro. The food is great, the service is great, I always come here when my family and I decide to go out to eat.  Update: There is no longer a buy one get one free anymore but rather a gift card of where you spend X amount and get a portion off your next meal.

nIKWynHlb_98QCkERlzTRw.text: Take a normal hot pot place and then bump it up a notch. It's such a fun spot. The menu is easy to order from, the sauce recommendations were super helpful, everything off the conveyor belt was super tasty. I wish we had a different hot pot place for more everyday hot pot, but I wouldn't change Chubby Cattle. It's more high end, offers special cuts of meat and great veggie options. Their dumplings were delicious, and they had lots of types of noodles. If you like hot pot but also want to shake things up or feel more fancy, this is the place to go. They also had yummy cocktails as well as soju, so we left happily tipsy. Overall, it was a great experience.

g6YBc-KcW_1IifuMN3eNrA.text: I didn't get the chance to eat here but we wasted more than an hour in this establishment. I called the restaurant asking how long the wait was for four people and David replied 40 minutes. I asked if I could put my name down as we were coming from the hotel, and he happily noted yes and I got a text confirmation. When we got to the restaurant about 20 minutes later, we checked in and he noted that the wait was about 40 minutes... I didn't understand how the wait did not go down since it had already been 20 minutes. We waited for another 20 minutes and he was not able to give us a time estimate. He noted 40 minutes.. I may not be a mathematician but 20 plus 20 plus 40 minutes is not close to the original wait time of 40 minutes...  The staff is a joke. There were 3 girls there trying to help and all they decided to do was look at their system and then give an extremely random time estimate. There were multiple parties ahead of us- one party waited for almost two hours when the original wait time was an hour. A few other parties had reservations and were still waiting. David was too busy fixing his Santa hat and taking selfies and snaps of himself in the restaurant instead of helping the guests that were there.  We were a party of four and there were two sets of tables with four openings and no one decided to seat any parties. We let them know and then they went back to their computer system to see if it would magically tell them what to do. It obviously didn't.   Please figure out how to service your customers as currently, it's a disaster.

LRVKB2-DMadzr9Fdm2iTqg.text: I have friends that I am sure give this place five stars but I always groan a little when they suggest coming here.  For me there are two issues.  After being cooked in the hot pot pretty much all the meat comes out tasting the same.  It is a good flavor but for a whole meal it leaves me a bit unsatisfied.  The sauce bar can help a bit but I'm no cook and some times the sauce I end up mixing together just isn't very good.  I'd prefer at least some pre-mixed ready to eat options.  Lastly the price never seems to match my enjoyment.  Maybe I'm just not the hot pot type...

dPci84au2kVM_3k_B7Qysg.text: Ugh, I had such high hopes for this place, but my coworkers and I agreed that we wouldn't go back. We went around 9:30pm on a Thursday night for their buy one get one free happy hour. Even with this, my bill came out to be around $16. I got the tomato broth, beef brisket, enoki mushrooms, another type of mushroom, tripe, and jelly noodles (ju luo). Maybe I think it's so expensive because I'm used to eating 5x more food at AYCEs for $25.  Another reviewer recommended the tomato broth ($4.99), so that's what I got. I hated it. It tasted like tomato paste from a can and was really salty. My coworker got the original broth and I liked that much much better.   For the meat option, I got the beef brisket ($5.99). It was the cheapest option on the menu, but it was still tasty. Came with about 7 slices. The beef here is definitely the star of the meal, with wagyu/kobe options. Honestly, if I were to ever come again, I'd just splurge on the combo and skip all the other stuff.   The 2 mushrooms were $1.99 each, jelly noodles $2.99 and tripe $3.59 (pre-happy hour discount). SO expensive. I also really wanted the chrysanthemum greens, but they were $2.99 for a single serving. At the Chinese market, you can get enough chrysanthemum greens for 10 people at that price. I definitely wouldn't come without the happy hour discount. I'd only come if you weren't that hungry. If you're really hungry, go to an all you can eat.   The conveyor belt was really limited in options. They didn't have qual eggs or a variety of fish/meat balls. It also didn't really look that fresh. Maybe it was basically it was late on a slow night.  I will say that the service was really good. The waiter refilled our waters, got us beers and even split our bill for us, which was much appreciated.

weQ0Ix122lmdwCv9fJmYPg.text: My first time here and it was an unforgettable experience! We were a party of 6 adults, plus an infant and a toddler, so we ordered several combination platters: seafood, beef, veggie, noodle, mushrooms, etc. We chose their house (original) broth, oxtail broth, and spicy broth in our shareable family-style hot pot. The food presentation was lovely and service from our main server, Deni, was impeccable--he went above and to make sure our large party was served within a reasonable amount of time and always checked on us to make sure everything was going smoothly. Will definitely return and recommend to all our family and friends!

NpzKC0bce8ohJ3L3dVxBxQ.text: I'm going to simply join the Chorus of Yelp Reviews and give it my endorcement. Food is good and tasty, service is very prompt and polite, and I did not walk away hungry.  Since everyone else has already reviewed this place in detail, there's not much for me to add.   However, I suggest going there Sunday thru Thursday, when there are 2 for 1 specials, and specials on the conveyer belt ingredients for your "hot pot" meals, but again beware; you need to be a Student with an ID Card, or in the ACTIVE Military.   The only reason I "lowered them" to 3 Stars is they are a little pricey, and very stingy offering promotions. So, beware, this place will most probably cost more than a really good "all you can eat" sushi place. At least most Sushi places give you a "comp" meal after 10 purchases.   Quality is very good, but don't go here looking for a Chinese food bargain. As I have warned, though it's good food, your wallet probably won't like the check.

I'm not sure if we will ever go back to place again, because I really don't want to be harassed by the staff over a tip.

45R-DFT0kkWnOXRSmQy6Ug.text: The food is delicious and they have lots of ingredients for you to make your sauce. Just wish the waiter would come by more often to refill our broth and take more orders.

Z0AlyQcDYtDnjf2PCGxkpw.text: Went here yesterday with my family while they were in town (Party of 5).   None of us had ever been here or anywhere like it.  Deni explained the whole process including how to order and gave us recommendations.  We ended up getting the Lamb, Kobe, Seafood platter, Veggies and all three noodles.   WOW couldn't have had a better experience or been happier with the meal.    Def give it a try. Their homemade noodles included green tea, tomato and a purple sweet potato.   These seemed a little weird but we liked them so much we ended up getting another order of the green tea noodles.   We were all full but decided to share a slice of the green tea crepe cake.  20 layers of delicious.   Not only are the noodles homemade but they also cut their own meat in shop as well.    Def worth a visit.

Op0wm3-cIsRCvqtfxE4Jbw.text: This place was very very good. Friendly staff that will make sure you order what you want and whats good.  *THEY HAVE A GIANT SAUCE BAR. I REPEAT--- THEY HAVE, A GIANT, SAUCE BAR! You can blend spices and sauces to enjoy with your meal.  I recommend getting the giant basket of mushrooms with any hot pot to share with the table. I went with my gma and husband and we all got different broths and just ordered a bunch of different stuff for the table to share. It was priced very fairly.  Only bad thing was the kobe beef was very expensive and the quality was not nearly as good as the basic, inexpensive beef.

xmPkiLNS_aMYFFp1McVeXA.text: I love this beef combo,it's great,and also the best hot pot in lasvegas,my mom said it's very delicious

Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

TGKgK0fEh6QTNcZ8FWE0JQ.text: Absolutely love coming here! My grandpa loves coming here so we can't say no to him. The food is very good and comes very quickly.  The restaurant is very clean and the staff is proactive. Our server Xiao was very helpful and she welcomed us with a warm smile. Highly recommend this place.

yuowAkUJ80cG0_eYnBMM1g.text: Very good balance between price, service and food. generous portions, kind and continuous service, clean.  I liked the sauce bar and the hotpot, which tasted excellent. Certainly, a place to repeat.

oyhGrap_nyvNqnur1OaIbA.text: Meat quality was good but I didnt care for the soup. The portions are kind of small for the price.

jSc56IA0V5kXXqReSAiapQ.text: Great service, good broth...beef combo was delicious and they have a diy sauce station!! Overall, i liked it and will definitely come back! Also, happy hour is from 9:30-12:30am.

tVwpAQEfGweqAm2gwB7n3g.text: It is always a welcome experience to find the hidden new gems in Las Vegas.  I am always a little apprehensive when I go out to Asian for hidden ingredients as I am a vegetarian.  Our server Kwan was outstanding.  He was our tour guide offering suggestions and explaining the food, extremely personable and great sense of humor.  We had a great table by the conveyor belt and selected a wide range based on the tables preferences including seafood, vegetables, and meat.  Everything was fresh and well prepared.  Two of us had the mushroom broth and one had the tomato which were all good flavor and a healthy alternative.  They also have a variety of sauces at a sauce bar to accent your food.  We finished dinner with a blueberry and mango cakes which were equally amazing.  Overall, great service and exceptional value, along with a very contemporary setting that is a welcome addition to our local  restaurants.  Great for vegans, pescatarians and carnivores!

CnCwcwV1EYbPFSjwxg7lUA.text: I don't critique many restaurants unless I am compelled to do so. Five stars really does not do this place justice as the quality of the food, the quality of the service is AWESOME! All you have to do is make a reservation first because it is a busy and popular place. The level of cleanliness of the condiment bar is fantastic. I travel the entire country every week and feel like I found gold in Denver.

photos.caption: Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Av7y8jsmygkZ6HbLtBVy7g.text: Hot pot with a conveyor belt system for small dishes now that's pretty awesome. I got the original broth and it was good, but it reminded me of Little Sheep's broth. My friend and I ordered the beef combo, beef brisket, and small juicy beef balls. Good quality, fast and definitely yummy. The beef balls are made in-house so you can taste the difference of quality and believe it when they say juicy! Soup kinda squirted out when I was eating it. They also have $1 noodles and I believe it's one order per person; also made in-house. Sauce bar was awesome with a variety of goodies and also small side dishes. I will definitely come back if I'm craving for hot pot again in Vegas!

JTGu6mvbOrmEOMahELe1sw.text: I have very good experience with my friends in this restaurant today. I will come with my family and friends again. Great place and good service. Good job Jiaming!!

3LDxbFpoeNUnzQBW54PrmQ.text: This was my second time here - I waited two years to come back!   Things had changed, but everything was wonderful. The menu is compact, but full of variety. The oxtail soup base was great (though it's a shame individual pots can't have split soup bases!) The wagyu and rib eye were amazing. One of our party ordered the kobe and it was so good, his eyes rolled into his head when he ate his first bite.  I called about an hour ahead needing last minute tables for a very large party. We were able to get two rooms with three tables and the staff was very nice, polite, and accommodating!  Most of my large group had never seen hot pot before - none were disappointed and I'm still getting "thank you's" for taking them here :)  Thank you for a great meal and happy friends!

jfU0ywrA7rBxARcZltsdcA.text: Favorite spot in town! I always have cravings for chubby cattle whether it be hot or cold. They have the best broth in town compared to other hot pots.. the service is also up to par! Servers are always attentive but when it's rush hour during happy hour, they can be harder to get but overall, still pretty good. Recommend getting the tomato oxtail soup and the heaven and hell soup. Come visit! Andrew also served us and was an amazing server!

Vn5lez15HjVNeXLXTTTA2g.text: We tried the Chubby Cattle last night (our first night in Vegas) two of us had the original broth and one hellish hellfire pot.  We ordered the lamb/beef combo and a rib eye, a large udon and a large glass noodle plus a veggie combo. Grabbed a couple of items off the conveyor belt and got down to business. Delicious.  As we were leaving my party was already asking when can we go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I&#39;m concerned as to why this *needed* to be posted.

07E5nRYClpIdZfDljLVf0w.text: My friends had taken me here for the first time and I really enjoyed it. We shared a large group pot and sat in the corner and did everything a la carte. I really like how they have their own sauce station to create your own sauces for your meat and I enjoy how lovely the servers were. We were able to do a split pot for two different choices of broth for our base. A lot of good small dishes and great choices of meat. They had a conveyer belt and also great birthday song themes. I would like to come back again to try more things. The only thing I personally found funny was how there were cattle and cows all over the place as I was eating meat. I couldn't stop staring at it lol.

mCrWiMFLnt0V1sAQ549imw.text: Delicious!  This is such a fun experience. The food is great, the service is amazing and the atmosphere is awesome!!  All of the soup bases are great, but medium is as hot as you want to go.  The sauce bar is super fun and the conveyer belt is crazy awesome.  If you have friends in from out of town this is THE place to come. Love it!!

Love the plating and quality of hot pot ingredients! Mala broth was truly spicy and flavorful, no sauce necessary. The tables were a bit tight with little room for hot pot ingredients. bo3XffM6THpz9DMXPvrNXg.text: We really enjoyed our vegan-friendly hotpot.  We have never done the hotpot/shabu-shabu thing, so it was a new experience from a-z, but we will definitely be doing it again.  VEGAN SURVIVAL GUIDE: - Try to block out the name of this place from your mind. - Get a table in the back away from the live seafood butchering area. - Ask for a two broth combo: half Tomato broth, half Mushroom broth. These are completely vegan. - Get a veggie basket, a mushroom basket, some tofu (soft or fried) or tofu skins. - We tried the green tea noodles & they were bomb. A+ - At the sauce station, stick to a mix of soy sauce, green onions, and garlic. Optionally, add chile. Dunno if other sauces were veg. - Since you are preparing your own food from baskets, you can control a lot & rid your mind of the dreaded meat cross contamination worries. - Get the hot jasmine green tea.  It comes in an adorable serving pot. Sooo warming.  All in all, it was a fun, yummy, toasty way to spend an evening.

7pnMuL82AYSW-XqUBc-KLQ.text: First time, and won't be the last. The food was amazing and service, you need to ask for Dani, great help for first timers. Everything was delicious

tNIhd12OzywVlXWky-_JCQ.text: gotta be the best shabu shabu experience in town. the broths are very good. best friends and i decided to go for the family style with a two broth combo. we tried the spicy and numb & the original. overall, the service was friendly and the server was knowledgeable about the menu enough to go over some key points about the differences in broth styles and meats.   i really liked the spicy & numb broth, but it was somewhat overpowering with bay leaf. if it had a little less of that i think it would've been perfect. the original was beautifully subtle and great for a simple broth for the beef.  beef combo & tiger shrimp were all great.   overall, great spot. they also have a sauce bar you can make your own dips in.

ERMG4uHXp1IYbdBEOZLxtA.text: First time here and absolutely loved it!!! My family was greeted by a very friendly hostess. We didn't have a reservation but were very quick to accommodate! Our hostess helped us out with a booth table to accommodate the high chair for our baby. **high chair by the way is the cutest thing ever.  Our waitress was very helpful with giving us recommendations to us since we were newbies.  Food: house original soup base and tomato oxtail soup base. R4-zjc41wH8uVj-KQfWPRQ.text: Love the vibe and service here. Extremely fast, warm and friendly. The hellish soup base is kinda hot so a little tip for anyone who wanna try this out: be careful LOL. otherwise the tomato ox tail base is totally delicious and flavorful! love it!

C55y8CwghynLSdVxr7lUEA.text: My wife and I lived and worked in mainland China for over seven years.  One of our favorite cuisines was hot pot or huo guo (in Mandarin).  The quality of the meats and vegetables at the Chubby Cattle were exceptional.  You will also find a full array of ingredients for making your dipping sauce.  Our waiter, Deni, was helpful and fun.  Sonia and I agreed that the Chubby Cattle in Las Vegas was at least as good as our favorite hot pot restaurants in China.  Highly recommended!

Se-b5Gkf3-akzVfqanmcZQ.text: This isn't the typical hot pot place.  Is perfect for parties or 6-8 people sharing a table.  Each person can order his/her own pot of broth with variety of flavors.  The meat is fresh and the sides were spot on.  I would definitely come back again

uuZA6EBd5yA0I7pRsCQhcg.text: Good for the first time but you may get tired with their broth base choices on the 2nd visit. The material they used to make the broth are unhealthy and questionable. If you are health conscious peeps, this place is not for you.

N9xHl4NHkxzDsXT7SceoSw.text: Took my little brother here as he loves hot pot cooking. We both LOVED it! We order the heaven/hell broths with wagyu and tiger shrimp. (Threw some bok choy in for color). That he'll broth is nothing to play with, but damn it was good! The heaven is excellent. Both are full flavored. I liked the meat with the hell broth and shrimp with heaven. Yum to it all. We'll be back for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HY1n2TLopUrDYSB_N4Rw7g.text: First time in, on a Saturday night, with a party of ten people.  I was excited to try this place. We were looking for some good hotpot, and this place lived up to even my unrealistic expectations.  Pretty straightforward. It is NOT "all you can eat" so you pay per item. This is fine though, because it seems that the quality of meat is usually better when it's not AYCE. With larger parties, they said they only had the option of individual hotpots, which worked out just fine. They also recommended that we get different meat and veggie combo platters to share with the table. This also turned out to be a great option for sharing so everyone could try something different.  Since I don't eat pork, I always tend to go for the vegetarian soup base option at places like this. Most of their soup bases are made from a beef & pork mixed broth, including their House and Hellishly Spicy. So I couldn't try those. But they did have an Oxtail base, which was all beef, and two vegetarian options (Mushroom and Tomato). I tried the mushroom pot and it was about as tasty as you could expect. I got great feedback from the table that all the different bases were spiced well and added good flavor. The Hellishly Spicy pot came in level 6, 12, and 18 (essentially mild, medium, and hot). To put it in perspective, my fiance is Vietnamese and can handle really spicy stuff (more than me), but the level 12 (medium) was a little much for her.  We shared the beef combo, which consisted of brisket, ribeye, and Japanese wagyu. This was a great option for two slightly hungry people to share, if you plan to add veggies.  If you're both pretty hungry, you may need a little more. We got the large udon noodles that were supposedly good for two people, but we found ourselves ordering a second one. Some of the table added lamb, shrimp, the veggie combo and mushroom basket.   The sauce station was good, though they regularly ran out of the small bowls, and we had to ask for them a few times. I mixed the ponzu with some chili paste and fresh green onions, and this was a delicious addition to the dish.   For everyone, the bill was about $350 after tax and tip. About $35 per person, which is comparable to AYCE anyway. Not bad.   Service was decent. It was a very busy night, so I can't fault them completely, but it did seem like they were a little irritated when we asked questions or needed things.  As expected in most of the Chinatown plazas on a Friday or Saturday, parking was a nightmare. I would recommend getting here at least 10-15 minutes early to make your reservation.   Overall four stars. It was definitely above average.

ypnvNLcCM5ucXsbkOzDY0Q.text: I went here last night with my husband and I must say the service exceeded my expectations...I called ahead for a reservation for 2 and the lady who answered the phone was happy to put us on the list. They have a system that notifies their guests via SMS regarding how long the wait time is. After we waited, we were seated and our server, Matthew, greeted us right away. Throughout our experience, Matthew was courteous and attentive. In fact, everyone on staff was hospitable. The dining experience, overall, was fun and the food was pretty good. I loved their array of veggies and sides on the conveyor belt. I can't wait to come back. :)

photos.caption: Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Set up
Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Green tea ice cream

r6vjD09mm8coLDW6gWu2jQ.text: This is the first time I came here and I really love it. The food is good and they have really good service. Every server is well trained and nice. They observed everything.  So you don't have to worry that you're running out of water or napkins.   I order the Beef combo, verge and mushroom combo. It is really good. If you haven't try it yet please do visit here!

Lg9-zps1y4NvK_9TwWdpbw.text: Cute little place that just opened up a few weeks ago. We decided to come here last minute for a nice dinner night and were greeted with a wait time of about 20 minutes. I can definitely see this place go up to 1-1.5hr wait times after the word gets out on this place, especially on weekend nights. Make a reservation if you could!   If you want to spend a leg and an arm, you should definitely check out Chubby Cattle! It's clean, new and the "restaurant" that everyone is talking about these days. Unfortunately, we had a mixed review about this place. First of all, we didn't order a dish and another server delivered it to our desk and got frustrated when we said it wasn't ours. Our original server came to check on us and he apologized profusely for the mistake. The other server just walked away with attitude and mumbled something in Chinese back to the kitchen. I wasn't uncomfortable with that.   Again, this is a Asian restaurant so I knew I had to expect sometime of stereotypical service, right? After we got our broth, my partner's heater didn't turn on and struggled to heat up for at least 15-20 minutes. No, I'm seriously not exaggerating. I felt so bad because he had to wait for his soup to boil. He couldn't use mines because he didn't like spicy. Poor guy.   For our main dishes, we got the beef and lamb combo for each of us and a bowl of mushrooms to share. We sat across from the conveyer belt too and it was fun to pick and choose bowls to eat. This was awesome since I grabbed a lot of the seafood dishes from here, which were amazing by the way!  Overall, this place was an interesting experience to check out. Aside from the rude interaction with one of the servers, the rest of the staff was super accommodating and friendly. The place was relatively clean too. Unfortunately, I wouldn't really come back here since I felt like the place was a bit overpriced.

lZH5pkOTFllDQTQXcy90Rw.text: Came to Chubby Cattle for hot pot while in Vegas and came across this place on Yelp.  Soup is very high quality and flavorful and the meats and handmade meatballs and other offerings were also great.  Our server Deni was attentive, helpful, and very pleasant and made the experience enjoyable even as the restaurant itself was very busy.

I7-Ek_FZ5U0_pAzyNQs2aQ.text: I had fun and nice time with my family. It was delicious. And Deni recommended good menu. He served kindly and treated us friendly. Thanks!

wFNUDtIHr6n4IYdmKjURow.text: If you are craving for some Chinese hot pot, them you need to get your family over here.  Take your time and enjoy everything they have.  Our waiter Deni recommended some crazy goodness Kobe beef.  It's the best cut I've ever had.  Service is impeccable.  Definitely coming back again. The food is awesome !

c7YOXTIVN_zvzDuCNR8L9Q.text: We enjoyed this meal and will come back. The ingredients are fresh, the various soups were delicious.  We tried the beef platter, balls platter, noodle platter, and udon.  We had the tomato soup base, original base, and hot base which is actually very hot at mefium. Deni our waiter was friendly and helpful. Looking forward to them getting their liquor license in the next couple weeks so we can use the bar.  :)

photos.caption: Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_pluyiWTrjOrdH-EtluAGw.text: Incredibly unique dining experience with the conveyer belt & hot pot combination concept, delicious & Deni was super knowledgeable walking us through the menu! Great ambiance, music selection & staff.   I had the fresh watermelon juice- perfect for ailing my hangover :)   We both tried the house broth- light herbaceous and flavorful.   We added the tiger shrimp, ribeye, veggie sampler, cuttlefish balls (I had to) & shiitake mushrooms.   Everything we tried was fantastic. The veggie sampler was mostly lettuces, an incredible amount for two people and most were varieties I was unfamiliar with, but enjoyed greatly.   We later grabbed crab stick & lotus from the conveyer belt as well.   Loved it. Will definitely be making a stop back on our next trip!

R0kFpv1tLXYd_ddOvxPEgg.text: I honestly love this place. The fish roe balls are the bomb. I'm pretty sure this is the best hotpot in Vegas

gKc58AF3bMzG8TDwlGAu2w.text: This is a one-of-a-kind experience in Vegas! I appreciate that it's not on the strip, which is good for locals. My first visit here was also my first hot pot experience. What I liked the most was that they have individual pots in the larger tables for large parties, while smaller parties can opt for the smaller tables with a shared pot.  The conveyor belt probably steals the show. Each plate on the belt is color-coded, which is priced according to the chart. In my experience, however, you'd get a better deal ordering a combo or two from the menu. For example, go for the beef combo and vegetable combo (feeds 2 adults nicely), which both come in a variety of meats and veggies, eliminating the need to take from the conveyor belt. I also recommend ordering a seafood combo and an order of your favorite noodles.  After putting in your order, go up to the sauce table in the middle of the room and take several bowls of various sauces to go with your pot. My Chinese friend chose the sesame sauce for dipping her meats in, which she said is how it's done in China. I went for sesame oil, garlic, and green onions in one bowl, and oyster sauce in another. Very delicious!  I ordered the original broth, which was well-seasoned with many spices (not spicy). I tasted my friend's Hell pot (medium); it was super spicy for me. One sip and my mouth was burning! I don't really eat spicy food and even after the server said the medium was similar to the spice level of hot Cheetos (which is probably the only spicy food I love), it was definitely a notch or two spicier. But if you love to torture your mouth, go for the spiciest one! I'm sure it's delicious.  The meats and veggies were yummy and very nicely-presented on the plates. Everything looked so good, including the interior finishes. I especially liked the pictures of cattle hanging from the ceiling. What better way to enjoy beef!?

9QJvYZocOQLqw4H3jjBG9Q.text: The food is super delicious, the absolute best hot pot! Staff is super friendly and great with customer service. Joyce is so so so great! :)

3-q8FlF4nGwJKqCj8VOdJQ.text: Our first conveyor belt! I absolutely love hot pot and the idea of being able to grab whatever we want is great. I had their house special broth. It went well with everything. Their chef recommendation for the beef was nice and juicy. The seafood platter was beautiful!!! The ambience is nice with their cute decorations.  Deni was our waiter and he broke everything down for us. Thank you again!   Overall it was a good experience and I'd recommend it. (:

YHHmiuiLo9VEndV_BI_O1g.text: This is my go to spot for hotpot. Quality of meat is good, broth is good, service and presentation is great. Our server Deni really helped us out when we were clueless on what to order.

93H9lA8ZX1RH_RYpzsq3bw.text: We got the original hot pot with beef combos and veggie combo. We added some sides from the revolver. And there was self serve sauce bar which is great. Everything was really good!! I'd come back again.

uXnexPWY5Njbaa-wRnJPlQ.text: Good enough food especially with a group of friends. Pricey for food that you cook yourself... Their customer service need improvement especially for the people who handle telephone inquiries and reservations. First they lost my initial reservation, then my group increased to 17 and was told that my group is too large

Bs7aVUMHRXo6oxMXg2zzhQ.text: Probably one of the best hot pots I've ever been to! As soon as I walked in, I could smell the curry aroma and lately I've been loving curry.   I went around 8pm on a Thursday and all the spots where the conveyor belts were taken so we were sat at the high bar. At first it was awkward because we were sitting with strangers but then it got comfortable after discussing what their favorites were  The service was exceptional. Our server explained to us the entire menu and his favorites which makes it easier for us to chose since we can be indecisive at times.   I got the mushroom broth and ordered a variety of meats including the meat combo plate, cuttlefish balls and house meatballs. Enoki mushroom was delicious and the MUST HAVE game changer was the lamb skewer. I would go back and order 10 of those skewers. It was so juicy. And please do get the beef tongue - literally melts in your mouth.   Also, in the center of the restaurant is a table with a bunch of different dipping sauces. Don't get the peanut butter sauce- it's definitely not like the peanut sauce you dip your spring rolls in. Do get the minced garlic and add that to your broth.   The complimentary moon cake at the end was a nice touch.

Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mushroom broth - definite yes if you&#39;re a mushroom lover
Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef tongue. Must have!!

zGvVkFHZhJkfkU3jkh52-g.text: I'm a tough critic, so often go off the strip for the gems of Vegas.  This place just opened and doesn't disappoint. YFaL2JCNe6cOohBqPtU_RQ.text: Came here because it was recommended to me by a family member. I don't usually like hot pot but this place was great! NCFgxXJJLXrPhD90augdwA.text: Went to Chubby Cattle, now I am a chubby cattle.   LOL I always find myself craving the broth and the bean curd rolls! You'll usually find me and a group of friends here at 9:30pm enjoying the happy hour! Love the tomato and green tea noodz.

9vHK9PoGH0LMxW4NfGdlug.text: I am loving this restaurant! I have been to most of the shabu shabu or korean style shabu, but I think this is my first Chinese style hot pot. The outside of the restaurant is simple but when you walk in the ambiance embraces you. Fun atmosphere with good music.  You get your own individual hot pot or you can have a shared one. They even have a happy hour for the revolving belt of meat, veggies and noodles. There is also a bar full of different sauces where you can happily make your own concoctions.   First you chose your broth and I chose hellishly spicy broth $5.99. Then I chose the entry level and with Seafood Combo platter $19.99. It was pretty spicy. The food came out beautifully on a boat and the seafood was definitely top quality, tender, and completely worth the price. I loved it.  My bf got the Tomato oxtail broth $6.99 with Beef combo $18.99. Very flavorful broth. From the conveyor beth we had a bread type dish. For desert we had Milk crepe cake with strawberry flavor $5.99. Total $64.89 not bad at all.  Our waiter Kwan is attentive and friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jZqRWD1AJof7MwNZburMnQ.text: Made reservations and they asked if we wanted personal burners or family style.  We chose personal burners.   They have a pretty extensive menu with several different combinations as well as regular entrees.  We ordered the original pork broth with had a lot of herbs and the tomato oxtail broth.  Both were delicious although the oxtail one had obviously lots more flavor.  Since we were 5 people, we ordered the beef combination, seafood combination, vegetable combination, noodle combination, udon noodles, pork belly and rice.   Everything was great although the vegetable combination was not my favorite.  I like bok choy and it was not enough, but we still had a lot if greens left over.  The coconut mojito is pretty good and I don't even like coconut but it's the most popular so decided to give it a try.   While you wait for your broth and order, go to the sauce bar.  They have some recommendations for good sauce combinations if you don't want to be adventurous.   Now for the conveyor belt.  What a cool concept.  After you order your broth and you want something else, you have options that pass your table on a conveyor belt.   They just charge you by the plate.  Food was so delicious.  It's weird how full you can get.      Downside is parking, it's awful, small parking spaces and completely full.  Went around several times before finding a spot.    Didn't take credit card although didn't see anything that said cash only.   Maybe their machines was down since they gave us 10% off.

6QTvp3U-4XW9ixu1uQKT4g.text: I'm not sure what took me so long to make my way into Chubby Cattle because I have loved the concept of this place for a really long time but I've never actually had Hot Pot before plus I don't really have a lot of friends in Vegas other than fellow yelpers who always came when I wasn't available so tonight I finally made my way in..  I started with the water melon juice which is fresh and delicious thanks to Angela's recommendation   I was blessed to get Angela as my server but before she even got here I stopped one of the bussers Che who stopped and helped me pick out my Glass noodles but when Kevin saw me asking questions he didn't hesitate to take the time to come over and help me pick out our meat choice which was The Beef combo   We sat family style with two types of brother went with house original and house hellish spicy pot and boy was it spicy but sooo delicious   Once Angela got back she also helped me get some potatoes and bok Choy.. she suggested I go with a sea food choice I asked about shrimp and she hooked it up with tiger shrimp and advised I peel it first before dipping it in ..  Once the beef combo arrived Kevin took the time to show us how to cook it which was super sweet but I almost passed out cause I didn't get a pick first before I dropped it in ..   Our food was all super delicious but we wanted to try the conveyor so we did the fried tofu aka Chinese donut  Once done we had left overs and they boxed me up .. a trainee named Rong took time to explain how it all worked   I also got set up with their membership by Bin   I can't wait to come back and try more options with more people

iag4S2khzbs-gmKk-TYRqQ.text: I've tried a lot of hot pot restaurants and nothing compares to chubby cattle. The quality and vast selection of menu items never ceases to amaze me. It was a treat to be served by Deni! He was quite attentive of our needs and had a great sense of humor. If you happen to make a trip to Las Vegas, this is the first place to try and if you're lucky Deni will be present and very excited to serve you!

88eHMfEkZtxwHg1AyO-RQg.text: This place is a must try!! Such an awesome experience and the food is beyond incredible.  Kwan is such a great server.  He recommended the top items based on what we told him we wanted.  He also took the time to create us a special made sauce from the sauce bar- which was so delicious!! We were in between ordering a few of the different sake drinks, he recommended two options that were fantastic! Ask for Kwan if you want to have the best experience!  Our order was the oxtail broth & the entry level spicy broth, the seafood platter and we also picked the quail eggs from the conveyor belt. All were amazing and would order again.

photos.caption: Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood Combination Platter, Mango &amp; Strawberry Sake

XdVNEbNVGK6D-YABGQ0MwQ.text: There are two great options that set this hot pot dining establishment apart from so many others that I have visited.  1. The conveyor belt.  It lets you see the hot pot options before you select them.  So many options constantly rolling by.  Love it.  2. The sauce bar!  This probably pushed my review from four stars to five. So many options to create a custom sauce that works for whatever you are cooking. I personally made four or five different sauces and really love them all.  We started with The house original pot and hellishly spicy pot (medium - plenty of spice for me) as our soup bases.  We ordered the premium lamb, prime beef short rib, tiger shrimp, veggie combo and mixed mushroom basket.  The veggie combo was just a bunch of different lettuces/cabbage which I would skip in the future and order the specific vegetables I want. However, the mix mushroom basket was well worth the money As were the meats we selected.  It would be nice to have a bigger beer and sake selection, but that would not stop me from returning.  Great food and value away from the tourist traps on the strip.

XLqvC1pd_cXartm31nU9HA.text: We are so, so excited to have found a vegan-friendly hot pot spot! I have to start my review with GREAT NEWS: the chef sent us vegan pork to try as they hope to be putting together a vegan menu soon! It was DELISH! I really hope they put the vegan menu together soon! I'd be in there once a week if they do! They have two vegan broths: mushroom and tomato. My husband and I both opted for the mushroom, which did not disappoint! It was packed with enoki, shiitake, beech and others! We got a ton of veggies, tofu and noodles and everything was fantastic.  Some highlights: fresh handmade udon, potato (don't sleep on this!), napa cabbage, winter melon, tofu skin and sponge tofu!  Now for my vegan Yelpers, they were so knowledgeable and happy to help us pick the perfect stuff! None of their noodles have egg or dairy in them! Fantastic sauce bar had tons of options to make a super tasty vegan sauce.  Lastly, our server Kwan was an absolute sweetheart! So kind and patient with us as it was our first time and we had dietary restrictions. WHEN (not if) we go back, we'll request his section for sure!

QIZxEG_6U8bW058P5GyWbQ.text: This was one of my best food experience! The hotpot at Chubby Cattle was so delicious. We got to eat with all our senses.   I had the  beautiful tomato pot It was flavorful with tomatoes, ginger, oxtail.. My husband got the house original pot.   We ordered the ribeye, shrimp, pork meatball and dumplings to be cooked in the broths. They also had a special wagyu only used in their Chinatown location-to die for.   I love noodles so I got a small order of fresh tomato noodles. So slurpy good.   You get to make your own dipping sauces from a cool set of yummy ingredients like chili sauce, special mushroom sauce, peanut, soy...  In addition there are items like fish balls, oysters, vegetables that go along a conveyer belt.   The drinks looked great too a dreamy peach, monitor, coconut water in the coconut, watermelon juice...  This is a special authentic place with yummy food and great staff.   A shout out to Angela who made our dining experience fun. She was very friendly yet professional. Service was great and the food came out in a timely manner.   In addition they were filming the show "no passport required" with Marcus Samuelson-how fun to see a little peek of that.

KSBhYyst-F6fqUZQYqCwbA.text: Holy Cow! (Pun Intended)   This place is so good! A delicious authentic Chinese hot pot restaurant in Vegas.  I went here with my girlfriend last weekend and to my surprise it wasn't so packed, the wait was only about 20 minutes.    The way it works is simple: choose your broth, choose your meat/seafood/sides, make your sauce, cook your food, enjoy!    My girlfriend got the House Hellishly Spicy Pot (Hottest One), and I got the same thing but with a medium level of spice.  Both tasted so good.  We ordered plenty of meat to go with our meal as well as udon and napa cabbage.  There's a self-service sauce bar where they have instructions on making the sauces or you can come up with a creation of your own.  Everything tasted so good.    There's also a conveyor belt that is located in the middle of the restaurant that has other food that you can grab and cook as well.  We didn't take any of them but it sure looks cool!  Parking is a real PITA on the weekends.  The plaza has other popular businesses which gets the parking lot full real quick.  I've seen times where people have parked across the street and j-walked.  Go here.  It's worth the wait and the hassle of parking :).

photos.caption: Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Combo, Napa Cabbage, Chubby Cattle Signature Juice Beef Balls, Udon, Beef Brisket.

dZ0DXe1LVUw1TtvJahfubQ.text: If I come here too often, I'm going to become a chubby(-er) Chris.  In spite of the telltale location in the corner of the popular and very parking-deficient Spring Mountain Plaza (Jones near Spring Mountain, also home to Chada and District One and so on), it didn't register to me that Chubby Cattle was once home to HK Star and then Imperial One until I saw the latter's name on my receipt. I only knew it as this "Mongolian Hot Pot" place that was getting talked about on Yelp and in foodie circles - until I finally went on the night of what was actually considered a grand reopening of sorts.  I was able to join a group of Yelp buddies to try out this Chinese take on hot pot, which differs from the common Japanese shabu shabu locally and the Vietnamese hot pot that accounts for most of my experience in this type of cooking. We eventually got seated at tables with support for individual hot pot support. This allows everyone to have their own choice of broth and to eat at their own pace. I find it more equitable than potentially having one person cook for the time, and more reasonable than the somewhat frenzied rush that I've seen in situations with one huge shared pot. Plus, you can still exchange tastes of different broths with your tablemates if you're so inclined.  Oxtail Soup Base ($6.99): interestingly, everybody at my table wanted to try what appears to be a new option, rather than their established and loved options such as original, tomato, or mushroom. I couldn't say that that the oxtail broth bestowed really distinctive flavors like a tomato broth might have, but it definitely added meatiness and was properly seasoned, the latter of which is essential because it's the vehicle for cooking everything else.  Beef Combo ($18.99, 13 oz): brisket, ribeye, Japanese Wagyu. I was advised that it was hard to discern differences between the thinly-sliced meats while eating, but I definitely tasted the rich marbling and tenderness wagyu before I realized what I was enjoying, and the ribeye was also enjoyable. The brisket is definitely tender and flavorful enough on its own and would be a reasonable budget option. These all cooked up quickly in the hot pot, so I was really just submerging them for a few seconds before pulling them out with some pinkness still visible.  Hand-cut Texas Dorper Sheep ($7.99, 5 oz): like the beef, thinly sliced. Unlike the beef, gamey flavor - but not all that gamier than lamb, although it was a slightly different quality. I definitely enjoyed it and would urge lamb-lovers to give this a try.  Mixed Mushroom Basket ($12.99): literally a basket of all of their mushroom options. I'm not so much of a mushroom connoisseur, so I could've been just as happy (and not so light-walleted) if I'd only picked up an order of enoki, but they were at least useful for texture and flavored my broth to the point that it tasted like mushroom soup by the time I was done with all the cooking and only had a little broth left to sip.  Veggie Combo Platter ($12.99) - couldn't exactly tell you which items are in here, but there were a few different leaves and herbs that add nuance and texture to your hot pot. This and the Mixed Mushroom Basket are probably best enjoyed with a larger group.  Green Tea Noodle ($3.99) - I wouldn't say that I tasted green tea, which tends to be a subtle flavor anyway, but the noodles tasted quite fresh. It's quite a small portion though, so you may need to grab double if you're hoping for a lot of noodle all the way until meal's end.  There is a sauce station in the middle of the restaurant floor where you can mix sauces and fresh components (especially green onion and cilantro) to your palate's pleasure. I was a bit unfamiliar with this, so I tried to follow their simple recipes which they suggested as pairings for beef (ponzu, green onions, and a little chili oil) and lamb (sesame sauce, sacha sauce, chili sauce) respectively. The beef sauce was pretty good, but I couldn't locate the sacha sauce for the lamb accompaniment and wound up throwing in soy sauce instead. I found myself not using the sauces at all about halfway through the meal though, because the combination of meats and broth were really that good.  Another note on the cooking: you'll want to adjust down your heat (ask a server if you can't figure it out) or else the water in your broth base will boil off too quickly, Play around with it and have fun.  I'd probably put Chubby Cattle at about 4.5 stars, but it's rather tough to imagine significantly better hot pot. The meats were very enjoyable from start to finish, the veggies were fresh, and the value was reasonable. I'll have to branch out to more meats and maybe even locate a seat near the conveyor belts next time, although that seems like a bit of an unnecessary gimmick in light of my excellent meal.

c2VyS9JW8rJoBbWf8XnSkw.text: I'm not sure if going there on New Year's Eve has anything to do with it but they were severely lacking in help. We stood there waiting to be seated even though there were 4 empty yet uncleaned booths. 15 minutes went by before we were seated. Several tables were left uncleaned from the moment we arrived to the time we left. Half of the sauce station was empty the entire time we were there. Several parties also asked for the sauce station to be restocked to no avail. We were given items that we didn't even order. I don't know what to make of this experience. I don't blame the employees. I blame the manager/owner.  My God get your shit together.

kYYNKtO5mS5CsJEQSUDzdw.text: I had Chubby Cattle bookmarked for a while, and decided to visit when a friend was in town. We came before 6PM so it wasn't too busy yet. We had the choice of small or large hot pots, and we opted for small (i.e. individual) hot pots, as the hostess said that it was better value for a party of two since there was no minimum spending requirement. We were also able to secure a booth next to the conveyor belt. I wanted to try out the conveyor belt because it was such a novelty for a hot pot restaurant, though if you sit at a regular table, you can still order everything off the menu.  Prices are reasonable, though it's all a la carte, so things can add up quickly if you aren't keeping track. Portions are decent too, so value is not terrible.  The interior of the restaurant is very modern and eclectic. It's not all that big, and there is no time limit, so at peak dining times, there may be quite a wait.  There are five great broths to choose from, and I opted for oxtail. There is an excellent sauce bar, and some complimentary side dishes and dessert as well.  All of the main food is ordered a la carte, and everything aside from the meats and cooked items can be found on the refrigerated conveyor belt.  My friend and I ordered a few things to share, and greatly enjoyed all of the food and broths. Service was also outstanding, as we were checked on regularly and given napkins plus water/soup broth refills. Our waitress Xiao was very friendly!  The one small shortcoming was that the  (beef pie) we ordered took forever to arrive, we waited over forty minutes! They did apologize though, and they tasted quite good!  I look forward to returning in the future for some tasty hotpot! Maybe more so when the weather is cooler. ;)
