-iFVRb-yUyjX8Jt1oV4rzg.text: Excellent variety and very fresh food. Service is quick and efficient. Highly recommended.

IxPIvCqZPoHbAAUmaNj7oQ.text: Had to try this place with friends from out of town since we've never tried anything that had a conveyer belt before. When you first walked in it smelled of soup and seafood. It was quite busy when we came, but there were empty tables so we were into our booth fairly quickly. Our server took quite awhile to come say hi and ask us for our drinks. I don't eat shabu shabu very often so I wanted him to explain what we were supposed to do. Instead, he just dismissed me and said go pick up your sauce and look at the menu and I'll come back. So the entire table went to get the sauces they wanted and came back. Then we ordered our soup base I guess that's what he called it. He suggested not to order the spicy if we couldn't handle it and so I just got one that wasn't spicy.    It took 4 times of asking to actually get our drinks and he never came back to ask us if we had any questions or if we were doing okay. That's one part of the reason they got a 2 Star rating from me.   We had to figure out the whole conveyer belt thing on our own and asked several other workers what things were since our waiter was non existent. We managed to get through dinner without our waiter and the food was okay not the best shabu shabu I've had.   When we were finally done our waiter showed up to give us the bill. We asked two split it between two people and evenly between two cards. Easy enough right? Boy was this wrong! We all were so confused and saw he charged my card twice for the same amount. We wanted to make sure he never charged our friends card before we left and let him know he made a mistake if indeed he didn't charge the card.   So we waited for him and when he finally showed up he kept pestering me to take my card back so he could credit back what his mistake was and charge the other card instead. I at first kindly told him no that's fine. Then he kept insisting. That made me angry so I told him no again and said you might instead charge me a third time since you have already charged me twice and I don't want to deal with that hassle so let it be and just learn from your mistakes tonight. That's the second reason they got the two Star rating.

photos.caption: Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brisket

IUBe09QVuG32k-Fizvqaqw.text: I just have to day that Chubby Cattle has been just an amazing experience. A big part of this amazing experience was our waiter. Deni. Very friendly, helpful, and even gave my family a "special sauce" for the kids. He definitely deserved extra tip for all the help. The food was amazing, and I personally loved the noodle combo. Everything was just amazing. If I could I would rate this place 6 stars for service. Amazing place overall and I would love to come back.

JYscKzkebXCU-zWtrtj6sQ.text: Wow wow wow!!! By far the best soup I ever had in my life. I hope to see this restaurant in California someday.

Pnbbb7eQGNeWXwbvhPz4_w.text: I had Chubby Cattle on my bookmarks list for a while now and finally had the chance to try it last week. It is not an AYCE establishment, but it is a revolving hot pot restaurant. (Think revolving sushi bar but the items are vegetables and other items for hot pot) I think it's an interesting concept to try to branch out utilizing the revolving aspect, but was kind of disappointed about each plate being a very different price. The wait for this restaurant, especially on a weekend night, was very very long.. over 1 hour wait time. Compared to the hot pot flavors and the items we have in California and the SGV area, I really don't think this place could really compete (even though it's not supposed to be compared). Some of the family-style shared tables are also very difficult to eat at -- we were a party of 6 that had to share one hot pot so basically the only people that were able to get the food they wanted were the two people in the middle. The 4 corner people had a rough time getting food.. :( There were other tables that had individual hot pots, but the wait time for those tables were even longer.. TL;DR: Ultimately, I think it was very expensive and not worth it especially if there's a long wait.

1OTmRF3sPud-pvOHhKHeHA.text: Best hotpot place in Vegas! I make sure to come at least once every time I'm in town. Good prices and high quality food. Highly recommend!

I8vF3bTsYb-ooVLWbRUO-A.text: Chubby Cattle located in Chinatown is a great experience at a great price.  Your selections are abundant and the servers are extremely helpful in your adventure.  Your experience starts out with the selection of the base pot liquid.  We elected the mild and a modified extra spicy pot.  They were capable of providing two liquids in one pot.  Once you select your base, you can visit the sauce bar to make up your own blends for enhancing your finished cooked items.  We selected thinly sliced lamb, beef short ribs, beef rib eye, mushrooms, seafood (Clams, Mussels, Tilapia and Scallops), noodles and veggies.  You place your foods in the hot pots and then strain them out for consumption.  When you attack your noodles, you place your noodles in a cup and ladle in the liquid from the hot pot.  Venture out from the strip this is a fun time with great food, presentation and all at a very good price.

photos.caption: Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FS_9Z8Z3bZG1ezszGhYiIw.text: Like this restaurant so much. The soup base are so good. The meat& veggies are fresh.

wsfhU7SkhPtkpIbxmVjpvw.text: This is my place to go for HOTPOT! you can get an individual pot or a group one with two options of soup, revolving food coming your way so you choose what to get besides the main thing, soup is delicious, meat taste good and is cut thin so it's done fast, the sauces table has few options for you to make your own and service is been always great, I totally recommend this place.

U-LV5zkD6WIJ6DSUMWyLeQ.text: Ok so the best way for me to describe this yummy yummy place is it's a hot pot/ Shabu shabu kind of style and if you want addition mix ins then you can order it or if you are seated by the conveyor belt then grab it.   You start with a base. I had the tomato. I highly recommend it. You can add noddles. I wanted to try them because they are freshly made. It was good. I could do with our without. The meat combo for $18.99 is a deal! You can't go wrong with rib eye brisket and wagyu.   Our server Xiao was the sweetest server. Can I just say that in general service was amazing. We mentioned it was a friends birthday and they were super friendly and had him choose an Easter egg for a birthday gift. He got a crepe cake which was bomb. It was the seasonal flavor of blueberry.   Overall I really enjoyed it. I would def go back because the broths are delicious. They have variety of sauces and selection for mix ins. There should be great options for any meat lover and first timers to hot pot. Next time seafood!

nWQu7URR0aZVj-PVON4PBQ.text: Deni was the best server, very friendly and funny and I totally recommend this place and will come back every time we come to Vegas. SSRGFoWLgXQOrTyibmImrg.text: Been wanting to try this place and I'm glad I did. It's a wonderful experience if you guys like hot pot. I got the original hot pot soup and ordered the beef combo, (which I recommend). The place has a conveyor displaying other food items that can go into your pot, like mushrooms, shrimp, and scallops. The service was really great and tentative! Our server, Mathew, made sure we didn't run out of soup and helped us with the cooking settings. They're really helpful here!  If you guys want to try something different, try this place out lol

Avij98rraeLbGmIbPSW2Ig.text: 10 out of 10. Would recommend!  My sister and I visited Las Vegas for vacation. We went to chubby cattle upon recommendation from a close friend of mine who is Chinese. I love hot pot, but my sister didn't even know what hot pot was! She loved it! She is vegetarian, so she got the tomato-based broth and tofu -- and we got the mixed mushroom basket and baby bok choy to share. I am a meat-lover, so I got spicy broth with lamb and beef. The restaurant isn't called chubby cattle for nothing! The waguy beef was sooo good. The waitress Queeny was wonderful as well, she answered all our questions and was very knowledgeable about how long we should keep each item in the broth and whatnot. She gave us stellar recommendations when we were ordering. Thanks for the food!

ye7iqQIVyoYfr4MX_43Axw.text: Awesome atmosphere during the weekday. Steady stream of people and not to crowded.. Weekends need a reservation.. The food is awesome and the secret is the soup base.. After that u pick and make your own dish to ur hearts content.. Try it out for your self or bring a date

7qtvGIN9_GkReKBdIq_H2A.text: Great service great food!  The first time I was here, i was somewhat disappointed in their food. I thought it was really bland and their sauces did not go well with the kind of broth they offer. I was not really planning on coming back, but came back because a friend wanted to try it out. However, my second experience at Chubby Cattle was great. Igot house original broth both times I went, but this time the broth seemed more flavorful that I didnt even bother going to the sauce station. We got the beef and lamb combo. The meats were soft and tender as they should be. I wouldnt really recommend their lamb skewers since they were a little dry and tough, but I would definitely get beef skewers again when I go back next time. They were so tender and juicy.   Also, we loved our server Kwan! He was very friendly and knew well about the menu :) Yay!

Ti-wjPomWxpop7YMO4Em0A.text: This place is so cute and one of a kind! Great service with slight wait when we got here at 730 on a Friday night  the broth is amazing and there's so many lamb choices. I'm so happy and will be sure to be back.   Xiao Xiao and the team were great!

r_--rykX9jS4EjU-6JTygg.text: Favorite hot pot restaurant. If you have not been, you must give it a try. Recently remodeled.   Great place for vegetarians &/or vegans. Plenty of options and every person has their own pot. Food is fresh and tasty.   Get the fresh noodles! Can't decide on one? Get the combo and try all 3.  Kwan is polite, attentive and genuine.   Pro tips: get the egg, stir it in. Cool down with fresh watermelon juice.

vG4iQpuKJ_Gj_S5CWOd2cQ.text: When entering Chubby Cattle, I felt like I was leaving Las vegas and entering Bejing! The beef brisket and original style broth was a wonderful combination. My boyfriend had "Hellish" broth on entry level spice and was pleasently surprised with lots of spicy, intricate flavors. The conveyer belt of additional ingredients was a really fun and unique experience. I was so stoked to see a full bar too, the bartender was awesome and made the experience all the better. Be spontaneous and give this place a try!

kQOTyIzFIBFJG915_GBEdw.text: Hot pot joint in Vegas, brisket all day and beef combo. Make your own sauce, I would suggest going with the fried fresh garlic, ponzu, and chili sauce. For the broth, opt for the yin yang and get the tomato and entry level spicy!

38eTc3YdCly-1Mf7fKaQcA.text: A definite yes if you're looking for a Hot Pot place in Las Vegas. This place just opened up recently and I went with a few other friends - all of us loved it. Each person gets to choose and have their own broth and personal hot pot, which I personally found very convenient as versed to having a shared larger pot.  I would recommend trying the strawberry smoothie. That was a personal fav alongside the conveyer that goes around with dishes you can easily select. Great price and awesome food, will definitely be coming back!

Qe4EhCgVpGFgEVjaTjuQ9w.text: The broth was very good. The service was excellent. We enjoyed everything, we ate.  The menu was out of a few items we would have liked to try. They are newly opened so guessing, they are working on that.

H5GSGVB78SQuhMF5oJzpjg.text: This was a different experience than the normal hot pot experience. Gf and I are big fans of hot pot so we decided to give this place a try. The hot pots are personal sized and are ordered individually along with the meats, while the sides and veggies are rotating around in a conveyor belt, which was a first for me.   We both got the original soup base, which was hearty and filling. For the meats we had hand cut angus and ribeye, both of which were super soft and yummy. Selection of sides are a little on the limited side, but prices were reasonable, especially if you come during happy hour (buy one get one free sides). The meal comes with free ice cream. Get the chocolate. That stuff is bomb.   All in all, a good hot pot experience. Would recommend.

l3hmEenBN_1jsvoFMXVY2w.text: Great place for hot pot!  Our server, Matthew was such a great help, out the gate, as we were first timers at the restaurant. jkPjWFySyZ8N4abUE9jGOw.text: Chubby cattle is one of our favorite new spots. The service is amazing. The only thing that beats it is the food. You can never go wrong with the beef combo platter. f11vr9RhDofc0-zsUuLWyQ.text: Chubby Cattle is a neat hot pot restaurant! It's so cool that they have a conveyer belt. I've only seen conveyer belts at sushi restaurants. The conveyer belt is convenient for those sitting at the booths and bar to grab anything. You can also order anything on the menu if it isn't on the conveyer belt, like meats. There is a sauce bar and they also provide recipes to compliment the meats. There's a bunch of different broths you can get, but they are known for their bone marrow broth. My favorite is the mushroom assortment! I usually get noodles, tofu, and a bunch of beef brisket. Especially with the enoki mushrooms. There's just a lot of different things you can order but you will not be disappointed. If it's your first time, they will gladly explain how it works too!

-kKyZ9MaqwhTxKXZO_STYw.text: Great food with even better service. Our server Deni was very attentive and made sure to explain the menu for us since it was our first time. A truly unique experience.   We had the tomato broth as well as the level 2 spicy broth. They're not kidding when they say it is really spicy. To add to the broth we got the meat combo as well as the mushroom combo. The two others we were with ordered the Kobe beef rice & some lamb skewers. Everyone liked what they ordered.  The hot pot experience was great and truly unique. This restaurant is great if you're looking to try out something different.

VMlVVukpapDRqG1aE0vQzw.text: Richard Pro here with another review.  Absolutely fantastic. You order meat off the menu and you can pick any sides off of the conveyor belt. For any sauces you want to try, you can help yourself at the sauce station. There are around 10+ sauces you can mix and match and it's great fun.  The meat comes out quickly and is sliced decadently thin. You have several options for the broth, and we opted for tomato and the house broth. The tomato broth was fabulous--savory with a kick, while the house broth was somewhat disappointing.   Interior--bright, cozy, comfy, modern. Service is excellent.

8dGWaleMpEvEe7oywTx1hg.text: Food was great! It was our first time there and our server Deni was fantastic explaining how it worked and what to order,what sauces to use, how much, etc. It was so much fun to experiment with different flavors. When we left we felt satisfied--not stuffed, food was light but just right!

lSwwWI1ZjdtfMv-W1VWQ8w.text: Wonderful experience, servers were professional and quick to assist. The food was outstanding, and the price was also fair. Ask for the watermelon juice tho. That was a goer. Can't wait til this place sells alcohol!

Over all I enjoyed it but next time I'm definitely going to go with people that know their way around a hot pot so I can't get the best combinations.

The broth is flavorful, the cut of ribeye and angus were of good quality and the vegetables combo was perfect for two. They also have their own sauce bar where you can create your own concoctions based on your personal flavor. Deni was very helpful in helping us decide what menu items to order and it was a great portion size for us. Would definitely come back again!

-scGViDz5J--MQ2sj4kZRg.text: Glad I came here! Great selection and atmosphere. Our server, Matthew, really took care of us. I will be coming back.

dG0r-VAnZ5TNnK5wji4fkw.text: Wow. Delicious soup, fun conveyer belt options, and excellent service from Xiao Xiao, this restaurant is top notch. What a great restaurant for a date night or night with friends! We will definitely be back!

Uy4P1p-Tm0gdzYyucfqeZA.text: This place is very different but very good. The soup is amazing and our waiter Deni was amazing!! Highly recommend this place a very different experience the tomato base was good stick to items you know if you are new to this and make sure you get noodles.

_C8g9b1YtjYiRmE84In0HA.text: The food was good, but portions were small for the price. The conveyor belt concept is cool but most people ordered a la carte (better portions this way); with a group of three or more, you get to sit at a table-the bar was a bit cramped so the people next to us kept bumping into us. Service was decent. Felt they could have checked up more often but overall, a chill vibe. They offer membership if you fill out a survey, and free ice cream if you give a Yelp review. (They request you give them five stars while standing over your shoulder so I don't know how legitimate all of these reviews are.) After all that, they'll also ask you to tag them on facebook. The free ice cream isn't worth it.

ntVnLt5Axd0VYZgE3qpDUg.text: Came here on a friday night and had an amazing time! The place is clean, modern style decor. There's a conveyor belt where you can grab all sorts of goodies for your hot pot and the protein selection is plentiful. Great quality in terms of protein and the price is very reasonable for quality and quantity. Tomato broth is my favorite, but I also enjoyed the seafood and mushroom one. Our server Matthew was very attentive and even recognized me from before! Will be coming back.

JSTW5AyQ8qjs6zfGKHmjSw.text: Lots of variety!!!!! Amazing tomato soup base!!!!!!! Very nice interior design. Will be back again for 2nd round :)

q3TQKjGmzglHqIvLTE9elQ.text: What a great place to eat. Fresh food goes around on a revolving conveyor. You pick what you want to try with reasonable prices and helpful staff. Our server Kwan was very nice and courteous.  Great place to eat!

bhlYgE1FUi-PuwBR0XIqbQ.text: You know, I can't say that I hate Chubby Cattle but I also can't say that I love it either. It was very middle of the road for me. I'm not even sure I would recommend it to friends to try out. Meh.   The food was good and everything but boy, your bill really adds up quickly and very sneakily. The restaurant is still quite busy so be prepared to wait if you come at peak dinner time or are just unlucky :P They have a conveyor belt options of items for hot pot or you can just order ala carte off the menu. From what I saw, most people order off the menu. A few people here and there would grab things from the belt, but not many.   You first order your broth, I opted for the mushroom broth but also tried the house broth. Then you start ordering everything you want to cook in your broth. I will say that their menu is very very extensive. From veggies to dumplings to noodles to all slices and cuts of meat, there will be something to tickle your fancy!  Everything tasted fine and I will say the food quality is there but nothing blew me out of the water. There is also a walk-up make your own sauce bar to mix and match your own flavors to make a dipping sauce.   Well to each their own on this one. I was left a little underwhelmed with a bigger hole in my wallet than I would think for hot pot.

photos.caption: Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Make your own sauce!
Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brisket and rib eye
Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veggies and noodle combo for your hot pot!

NV5g7oQBvjb5OJH_I3cU9A.text: Always love a nice hot pot during the cold season, I ordered the original soup & excellent choices of meat to choose from as well as veggies! Love the beef platter with extra corn, mushroom & baby bochoy! Yummy in my tummy! Outstanding customer service & if you like a little cold drink to go with your meal I suggest the Beauty & the beast it's delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4JoaoWyCpkM8d8A2tIEClQ.text: I have been searching for a hot pot place comparable to the ones on the East Coast and was recommended some other local places but was greatly disappointed. Heard great things from multiple people about Chubby Cattle and finally tried it today and it did not disappoint! It was absolutely amazing!!! Our server, Jenny was so sweet and helpful. She really took the time out to explain every detail since it was our first time dining with them! She recommended tomato oxtail soup base if you wanted something that was flavorful. It was definitely full of flavor! You didn't really need any of the dipping sauces (which you make yourself at the sauce bar) each meat, vegetable, etc. was amazing! We got the beef combo and shared it and it was so tender. Loved the conveyor belt that contained all the sides (mushrooms, shrimp, clams, veggies, etc) that you just grab when it comes around. Each plate was a certain color and each color signifies a certain price. The fish cakes/balls were fresh as well. Definitely worth the visit! I finally found my hot pot place..thinking about coming back here tomorrow!

photos.caption: Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7AsIKfiz569C4B690paMSQ.text: Love this place ! They have specials monday thru Thursday & happy hour late nights everyday. Their beef selections are good and they taste like great quality   The staff (for the most part) are nice. Very attentive for most of the servers.   Get the beef combo and pair it up with a glass of watermelon juice. (Yum!) Also, you get to make your own sauce

q41L28N_5uGsYn_rnmvrjg.text: This place does not taste like real hot pot at all. Not spicy and not flavorful. If you want to have a real hot pot, you're better off with buying hai di Lao hot pot seasoning and do it yourself.

Iolhk-99K-scHSMOL8yHnw.text: I don't even think I can write a long enough review for them haha. Everything was great, my waitress was amazing. We ended up spending $300 at dinner here, tried a bunch of meats, had a fresh lobster, had wine/beer/cocktails. We enjoyed everything immensely. This place will be here for a long time. The ONLY complaint is the parking but I've been in this lot many times. It shares the lot with Cue D's and karaoke bar.  We will always be coming back to this place! Everything is so fresh.

pkE3c_MV3f3zhnUgTE7P2Q.text: Chubby Cattle is THE place to go for hotpot in Las Vegas.  I always go for the Heaven and Hell (Yin-Yang) Pot which is hot, spicy, and numbs your tongue. My girlfriend always gets the Beautiful Tomato Pot, which is rich and sweet with the aroma of fresh tomatoes.  The meat and veggies are always fresh, and if you're not quite sure what other sides to order off the menu, there is a rotating refrigerated conveyor belt with smaller items ranging from $.99 to $4.99 to choose from.  Quail eggs, tofu skin, fried fish cake, and house fish balls are some of my recommendations.   Their sauce station is great--you can mix and match your own personalized sauce dishes.  Not only do they have a wide selection of sauces (i.e. peanut sauce, goma sauce, ponzu, sacha BBQ sauce,) but the station is always clean and well kept.    With great food, excellent service, and a nice atmosphere, make sure to stop by Chubby Cattle next time you're in Vegas.

8QzVWm2IS-dl-lrECEezhA.text: Yummy food ! I However, I wouldn't recommend the house broth if you are not used to Asian hot pot because it has too much "seeds" (I forgot the name) in it. When you bite into it, it somewhat numbs your mouth and then there is a hint of a metal flavor.   If you are a first timer I would recommend either the mushroom or tomato broth! Their presentation is beautiful especially with the combos. They have cute little baskets and use dry ice as decoration as well.   We had the meat combo, scallops, 2 mushroom soup, pork dumplings, rice (you have to order), crab meat, and veggie noodles. It came out to about $50 enough for 2 people. Everything was very tasty however you have to watch the noodles carefully because they tend to get pretty mushy if you leave it in too long.   I LOVE the sauce station ! They have a wide variety of sauces to choose from and to mix with. It was also a nice touch how they had sauce mixture recommendations.   They also have a happy hour for everything on the conveyor belt buy one get one free SUN-THURS 9:30-12:30.   Overall, I had a wonderful experience. Shout out to our server xiao xiao! She was very helpful with refilling our broth and with anything that we needed.

-I5pu873qAU2enUQCjdhYw.text: Super excellent sauce and meat and vegetable selection.  The cattle is amazing. Individual servings of soup make it customized for your liking.

JCLU4RL9ZJBqmIe8ihfgJA.text: Would've given this place 5 stars if it wasn't for our horrible experience with the hostess. (Skip this paragraph if you don't wanna hear my complaining) I came here with my parents & was told on the phone that 3 people could just walk in without a reservation. When we arrived, the hostess told us there were only 2 groups ahead of us. I assumed the wait would be around 25 min max. After 40 minutes, we still weren't seated. All these tables were opening up and I was pissed why we weren't being assigned to any of them. Another couple started yelling at the hostess because apparently their reservation wasn't even honored. After also complaining to the hostess and manager about the open tables & our hour long wait, we finally sat down at a table around 9:00pm. Don't make the wait seem so short just to have us wait an entire hour and eat such a late dinner. We would've gone somewhere else if we had known beforehand.  The conveyer belt is a cool idea. Kinda like Kula revolving sushi or sushi boats. After ordering meat and a veggie basket from the menu, I honestly didn't need much from the conveyer belt though. They had so many options like green tea noodles, beef dumplings, fish balls, barley noodles, etc. Then on the menu, they had so many different options of meat (even fresh dungeness crab). The broth was delicious!! I got the entry level spicy broth and it was plenty spicy enough. There's also a sauce station with a bunch of options and omg....everything was amazing. Love the fried garlic.   Our waitress was amazing - she was friendly, knowledgable, and efficient unlike the hostess. The manager was also really sweet and came by our table to personally apologize for our experience earlier. Overall, food is delicious and I'm excited for them to open up a location in SF next!  PS. Your clothes will STINK after eating here, so wear something you don't really care about!

Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef and sauces
Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Watermelon juice

VtIXBk9o4uedqus0Hu9A9Q.text: Great food and fun at this restaurant. We eat at many hot pot places and this was one of our favorites!!

IIfcxF4tUkw0cf5N_Us5ZQ.text: Took 4 kids and the significant other here to try it out. We eat hot pots all the time and wanted to try something new. We were drawn to this place for the conveyor belt we saw, but they seated us at a table that didn't have access to it. There is quite a stench when you walk in-my 7 year old hated the smell. Once your there for a bit, you get used to it. It must be all the broths. The waiters didn't speak Much English so it was hard to converse. Service was just OK. The food was good. We tried a bit of everything. My seven year old wasn't impressed, he felt it all had a lemon taste to it. He didn't eat. The rest of us enjoyed it, but it probably wouldn't be our first choice for hot pot.

Y6ICmDfWJVh2qFH3zJQ2nw.text: Delicious!!  This is one of the best restaurant I've ever visited in Vegas! I was introduced to hotpot at chubby Cattle and became absolutely obsessed. I came here for many times and always see a line for this place. The meat are high quality! I enjoyed the beef brisket, lamb and prime short rib. The service was great and here I want to give a shout out to David who was extremely helpful in explaining us how to order.  I would absolutely come back and If you have friends in from out of town, this is the place!!! Highly recommended!!!

LSWaqRn6L8psNQf60SpmcQ.text: Hot pot is my favorite and we have been to many places. This is by far my favorite place so far! The sauce bar puts this place over the top!!! And their service is incredible!!!!

t8-ngyrNzOM0j76mbf6n1A.text: Probably one of the best and most favorite hot pot experiences I've ever had! The sauce bar is spectacular, and has everything you need to make a to-die-for sauce (make sure to add fried garlic!)   My favorite part was the beef wrapped enoki mushrooms from the conveyer belt! Also tried the charcoal lamb racks, which was great but could be a little more flavorful. The service was awesome too!! Our server named Gia was one of the sweetest and most helpful people ever. Would come back just for her!!

V53GEhQaKNK9TK9VzDNb_Q.text: This place is more than a 5 star. We have tried so many places but this the only place we always come back to. Best friendly staff and nicest workers. We had Waiter Bin tonight, nicest guy and always checking up how we are doing. Best food, always recommend this place to everyone.

ZWtCBYvtgtwa9mM0N7NaLA.text: Came here for the first time and love this place. Very delicious soup. The waiter Deni is a super cool guy and his signature cocktail is a must try drink while eating here.

15OLVM_zC8FHo1-zdYWXKw.text: We found this place on yelp and tried it out for the first time yesterday. It has a yelp checking offer 70 percent off waygu beef. We ordered the soup bases, vegetables, and wanted to order different meats. As we showed the waitress the check in coupon she said she couldnt honor the coupon. It was for EDC weekeend only. The coupon doesn't state so, and its online right now, so we went back and forth with her. Finally she left to check for us if she could honor it. Again. Its advertised. That's one of the reasons we came here for. As she came back she said a short. I'm sorry we are out of the meat. So we cant use the coupon. First she refuses to honor it and then magically they are out of the meat. Then we asked her what meats she is not out of and she offered the beef combo plate that entails three different meats. One is the waygu beef. So we were like you have the waygu beef when its entailed in the platter but not the waygu beef that you ADVERTISE for the coupon. Well thats great. Lol We just let it go and ended up ordering the meat combo plate and a stella(Which they were out of too...) We waited forever on our meats. We were almost done with the vegetables before even got the meat platter. The conveyer belt was full off mist, so we couldnt see whats on the belt. In all. Done come here. There are hundreds of other great places in town that actually value their customers and honor what they advertise. (Funny thing. Its been 24 hours after our visit and the coupon is still up)

NOlqflaDCOPuhHuMUJbiIg.text: Have to be honest the conveyor belt part of this restaurant is what drew my attention. I was completely curious so I had to check it out. With all the hot pot places around the area now I was looking for something different.   I like the individuality of the meal, you can pick between two soup bases. One is not spicy and looks milky while the other is spicy and spicy is not an understatement. I love spice but ieven had to take out  a heaping amount of the chili peppers and various spices put into the broth. They even warn you that you shouldn't drink the soup, which was a bit of a bummer for me BC I like to enjoy my soup broth at the end. I just took out about a cup full of the peppers and spices and I was able to drink some of the broth.  The servings of meat is small in my opinion. The seafood presentation is beautiful however. They do have many choices of meats, vegetables, noodles, etc. And what you don't order you can take off the conveyor belt. Unfortunately not everyone in the restaurant can enjoy this conveyor belt feature, so if you are going strictly to experience that make a reservation or don't go during peak times.   This place can become quite pricey for what it is. Especially since there is another hot pot place down the road which offers more food for less the price and is jist as good. I will say the experience here is unique so check it out at least once.

gm2xDg9UG_bKxSQnLlORgw.text: This restaurant is too deceive people, 8 people actually eat hot pot can we eat to $1000, and also don't tell us the price of food, we still live in Las Vegas, if visitors are more expensive, I hope you don't come to this restaurant again, don't be fooled

QYqkFuz7-jsHq8A2QYD0eg.text: I am addicted to this place i come often everything is great from the cleanliness, food and it's presentation, to the service! I highly recommend!

WVOMPQ_KazI3ruu9DnJBGg.text: Wowwww. This has got to be one of my favorite hot pot place. My family and I came here on a Friday night and got the yin and yang hit pot with the original house soup and the tomato broth. The tomato broth was my favorite! We also ordered the veggie platter, the rib eye, the wagyu beef, the pork belly, and the green tea noodles. The rib eye was to die for!!! The meat nearly fell apart while cooking! Definitely will be back!

OP-zomBUzGHZx3KtdUJPZA.text: first time here, found out about this spot from andrew zimmern on the travel channel. happened to be in vegas this weekend so my boyfriend and i decided to check it out. so glad we did because the soup base here was amazing! i got the tomato soup base and my boyfriend got the regular spicy one. the beef here was good and didn't taste old. the staff were super friendly and welcoming, excellent customer service. they have a conveyer belt with small places of food. minus 1 star because there wasn't a lot of options and it wasn't stalked/refilled so customers can pick. but you also had the option to order from the menu. the reason we didn't is because on weekdays, their happy hour is buy one get one 50% off their conveyer belt options. definitely recommend this! it's a must try!

1xHGVS5TVVwQQtCK0DCVsg.text: This is our third time here and we always love it! Good service and quality. I like the idea of having your own pot and you can pick out your food from the conveyor belt. We had the original soup base and it had enough flavor. The beef is cut well and the balls are good.

LF5f8w4eyzH_ZF0Kle23qg.text: It's a pretty solid hotpot restaurant. I have been there couple times and tried few soup bases; all of them are pretty good. The spicy soup base is pretty spicy so be conservative if you decided to have the chili soup base. They make their own fish a shrimp balls and I like them a lot, way better than those pre-made stuff. Service was solid, servers made good suggestions and pretty attentive. There's a sauce bar where you can make you own dipping sauce, have quite a few ingredients so you can experience a little with your sauce and that's also my kids favorite part of the restaurant.

3kGactEqbai18wWLgoLvqg.text: Parking is terrible it took 15 mins to wait for some one to leave. But quick service once we got inside.  Good quality of food. Host was attentive. Water is a no no. I would go back again.

J2bi90Ay36eitQHm5I9s7w.text: We came here on 4th of July. We ordered lamb & beef combo, seafood combo,and mushroom combo, we also got noodles. They brought our noodles and then they didn't bring anything until we asked them so then they brought our seafood combo ( nothing like the photos posted on yelp or on Instagram). Then a few minutes later they brought out a beef combo but we didn't order beef combo we ordered a beef and lamb so they fixed that and we where going to wait for the mushroom combo but it took forever so we started to eat and we finished the meat and seafood and we asked about our mushrooms then they brought it out.( I feel like if we hadn't said anything we wouldn't have even gotten our food) We're pretty disappointed ....

aBjR31z4wupmEvNvKUb4uw.text: Got the tomatoe based broth, the seafood combo and beef combo. We loved the flavor of the broth. Very tasty. Adding the beef and pulling random veggies from the conveyer belt into the pot were delicious combos. The seafood was fresh and tasted great.

v1tyyy9-B80n4swpuYZZYA.text: After eating here yesterday I was setting on the toilet all night long...... there mush be something wrong, maybe I'm wrong but I won't come back again.

mUsv48WwHIUbODI6f654vg.text: Saw this restaurant thru facebook. The first time I saw one like this (conveyor belt) was somewhere in Asia. Now that it's here in Vegas, I said to myself, we have to try this experience. Then the adventure begins. I tried the house special soup base, the chubby cattle wagyu beef, the seafood platter and from the conveyor belt we tried the shrimp ball and squid also tried the cucumber salad which I added some cherry tomatoes and cilantro which was all good. Then the dessert - mango crepe cake - super yummilicious. For a first timer with this restaurant it was good and we enjoyed it. For the question that is most important to me when after the dinning experience that I always ask friends and family - would you come back and eat here? Their answer is a YES.

j7b6DaSvyzAeXx-zqSgfSA.text: We were treated with one of the nicest staff I had ever met. A younger guy but I can't remember his name. I do remember the staff there overall being super friendly and nice enough to smile at pretty much all times. Chubby Cattle is extremely welcoming and has really fast service. Sadly my concerns are definitely with some of the food. The spicy soup base had way too much peppers or chili-the floating ingredients already in the base. It was quite the hassle when with a mild spicy dish, I had spent a long time fishing so much of it out of the soup. The inconvenience affected how much time I spent actually eating and boiling noodles and meat in the broth. I'd hate to say it but this negatively impacted my overall experience. The meat, if you get the lamb, comes in such thin slices that it near dissolved overtime on the place and worse was not something I thoroughly enjoyed after cooking in the broth. I think that a better combination of food would have made for a better time, so this understanding and the thoughtful/quick service is what saves my thoughts on the Chubby Cattle.

45nwgYLKnuDiGqdvvTVEAQ.text: Just had dinner here and it was amazing! The beef balls and lamb we're to die for and Deni's service was great. Will definitely be back here again

wxybdWG1G2YN2NqIX23gzA.text: This is such a cool place!  It's hot pot and how the menu works is you pick a broth, ( I picked the spicy one)  You can add noodles for $1 ( I had green tea and it's with the add on but only one order per person)  Pick your meat ( I picked brisket)  And then there's a conveyer belt of other add-ons, you grab whatever you want out of it and pay according to the plate color chart. My broth was spicy but kinda meh.  My meat was perfect, the noodles were good. I ordered water with lemon and asked for lemons 4 times and never got it but that's okay. The beer was 1/2 off so I of course ordered 2. They have an AWESOME sauce bar you can help yourself to. Honestly this is one of the funniest restaurants I've been to, the food was pretty good.  I'll be back.  Try this place out you'll have a good time and it's all a good price.

bI3IueARHIDFVuZ2rQBGcg.text: I don't want to be mean, but... the fact is we checked in by 10.15pm one day after Christmas and we headed our trip  from Los Angeles. The service is fast an d good, but the food is way much expensive than LA even SF Bay Area. I ordered the original soup, and The taste was much less than Little Sheep Mongolian or Haidilao Hotpot. Also, the food caused me sick after while, and I have to stayed in the hotel toilet at 1am. Will never come back.

lOiK8AHX9Iw2VcfA_xo_Rg.text: Had an amazing dinner @ chubby cattle. Had the mushroom soup with seafood combo, meatball combo and some brisket.  The staff was amazing as well, especially our server Deni.  Will come back for more

o8owPIQxtlVc5tC8h89vuA.text: This place is amazing and thank you to the manager that will fo anything to make your experience with this place. A new place to go to for winter time . And great food ,soup to enjoy

trTg75y3dhGSY7oGd8DVgg.text: I liked the Chubby Cattle. The atmosphere was fun, variety of food items was good, everything was clean, the presentation was nice and the service was awesome!!

4Nqn1bY_xFaoB4UzXAkysQ.text: What a great new sort of DIY restaurant. Instead of a grill at a BBQ joint, you get your own pot of delicious broth of your choice. Build with meats, veggies, noodles etc. There is a table where you can share one pot family style which is pretty popular and we weren't able to get it. So plan ahead or reserve for that.

gm7pzC3c2yAPYJGAZ-YWAA.text: Delicious, clean invironment-- Good for the Family bonding!! Definitely will come back!!

kSNXzHQVivN0lrm7Ck0bVA.text: Love this place!!! So delicious and fresh and the sauces are so good. And Matt is really nice too

8vwgvrcGJM6JNP7pfMRUvg.text: I came here with my party of 6 right as they opened so we were seated quickly. We ordered the original and entry level spicy pot. First time trying this kind of hot pot but I thought it was delicious! Broths were super flavorful. Then we got the beef combo plate and the beef and lamb combo plate (both around 18$ if I remember right) and then we got veggies and other stuff from the conveyer belt which I thought was super cool! Overall super great experience with lovely staff. Will come back next time income visit!

OQ0IAplWUqW3rbaxRYgLGg.text: Exceptional service and great concept for Las Vegas. We had two kids under 3 and it was great. Exceptional value for price.

b5TPoOPo3NJg0XRNGjIWtg.text: This place was good! Conveyor belt was fun to watch. Food quality was good! We tried 3 combo platters, the meat, seafood, and meatball ones. The handmade meatballs were delicious! The service was very good. Our server Deni was great! Very attentive and kind. He was also very willing to explain the menu to us. There were a lot of good things on the menu. In addition, there's a sauce bar with a lot of options.

D-6D6oyLZs8iRMapb0nLJQ.text: I love this place, food was amazingly good! We had 4 different kinds of soup base and the wagyu beef is so tender .... love the conveyor belt where we we get to pick up different kinds of add on's ! Our server James is the best!! Very friendly and polite... definitely will come back soon!

KpvCJM3BAGVMnqm2DacR_Q.text: The best Hot pot in Las Vegas hands down!!!! The service and food quality were amazing. Def coming back to bring my friends and family. Thank you again Gillbert for the amazing service!!!

nVY28dneta23-IwHIZjQ3g.text: I've been here three times already, once during happy hour (9:30 pm to closing). With inexpensive hot pot bases, a wide assortment of small dishes, and a house menu you can order from, there is no shortage of variety in the food here. Unlimited sauces and toppings means you can customize your hot pot to fit your flavor preference. My only gripe would be they run out of popular conveyer belt items and take forever to replace them while the same unpopular items pass by on an infinite loop, never to be picked. This is especially True during happy hour.

gvwI2LZCZ0S9VLqKf3MCYw.text: This place is AMAZING! I've tried the original broth, entry level hell and the mushroom broth, they all taste great but the original is my favorite! The broth can also be flavored with a wide variety of sauces and spices they have available (for free!).  You can grab however many sauces and seasonings you want, which includes soy sauce, chili sauce, oyster sayce, ponzu sauce, green onion, garlic, peanut butter, and a LOT more.  I highly recommend trying them all out!  They have a wide variety of small dishes you can pick off a conveyor belt to cook and eat in your hot pot, as well as a menu you can order off of which includes meat, noodles, and other dishes.  All of the ingredients on the conveyor belt taste very fresh, and range from a measy 99 cents to $3.99.  My personal favorites are the crab, fish cakes, and fried tofu! The meat is really tender and delicious as well and makes a perfect complement to the noodles and broth.    You can get full for a VERY reasonable price here, since the original soup base itself costs only $3.99.  The servers are attentive and explain how it works to newcomers, as well as giving you a run down of the daily specials.  They also refill your soup when it gets low, which is a nice bonus.  After your meal they even offer you a free popsicle!   I highly recommend this place for anyone who loves hot pot or is just looking to try something new.  The first of it's kind in Vegas and it sets the bar high!

JPTdH_6fZE-n15hmQ4eb6Q.text: Great service, great quality food, overall very satisfied!!!!  Recommended must try!!!  Gillbert is a excellent server with excellent service at the restaurant!

Y0EBQOIdrSXM89pElaxviA.text: Cool atmosphere and great service. Deni was friendly and on top of making sure we were well attended. Definitely going to take my visiting out-of-town friends here when theyre looking for some unique dining experiences.

KOiDz83hqrU4685i0wgj9Q.text: Great hotpot for this weather!!!! Love the mushroom soup. Must try. Go on their happy hour 930pm and up. Parking is a little challenge but worth the wait.

E13SfoaZeoarQlAp-Hq0Qw.text: Great atmosphere and friendly staff! Matthew was awesome and very helpful explaining the menu. Will definitely be back!

3zoxg0SGjwFVRt4VsVDKMQ.text: Weather has been cooling down in Vegas and the family was looking for a new spot for dinner.  This place had good reviews so we decided to give it a shot.    Thank you Yelp for yet again a great introduction.    Chubby Cattle is in a busy plaza that we pass all the time.  We've been to District One and Cafe Moda before.  Chubby Cattle was a huge hit with the family and we'll be back!  Deni was our service and he did an excellent job of showing us the ropes.  We didn't have reservations so we sat at a table.  Not a problem.  At the center of the table is a warmer and you order two different broths.  We ordered an original for the kids and a medium spicy for us.    We ordered the angus, brisket, shrimp, veggies, noodles, dumplings, and more.  Everything was delicious.    It's a fun environment, super clean, and the service was excellent from hostess to server.    We'll be back!!

Tvidaa-TSLWbLkKmqDrLGg.text: Service is exceptional. They read their customers well. When you need service they notice right away and when you want to be left alone they stay away haha. Rarely is service this good. Usually its mediocre at best. Im always a 20 percent tipper. And although the food isnt cheap its definelty worth it!

FhurSVth2iUS0j8mQg8dKQ.text: We had a quality dinner here tonight with the parents. The wait time was shorter than expected (she said 20 mins but we were seated less than 10 mins). Our server Matthew was very nice and accommodating. One of the ladies (not sure if she was a server, hostess, or manager) took our order. She memorized it without writing it down and our order came out perfect. Definitely recommend.

s895yfOlnHBQ6N07_wmGGA.text: Beni was my server and he was great! This was our first time there and he walked us through the hot pot and it was amazing!!!

4zg9DKTBv0XCeGZMebesqg.text: It was our first time in this restaurant and we loved it. Our waiter Deni was amazing and made it very easy for us to understand the concept of eating there. Everything was delicious and absolutely top quality! We are definitely will be back soon!

Or better yet, open for 24hrs!!! Sooo good!!!

5hw7Vnfn6luE25BUWUegQw.text: This place was really good and had lots of different options. This is my second time here and I've been craving it since the first time I came. Would definitely recommend and would come here again!

EFJGzqcXrxNw3O1-LV2ppQ.text: I tried there twice.  The 1st time with individual hot pot and the 2nd time with the big pot for sharing.  You can pick up to 3 soup base for the big pot so you can try different flavor.  I like the oxtail soup the best.  The soup base is so rich.  The kids had so much fun to pick what they like from the belt.  The beef combo is so good and their noodle is so fresh.  I will go again for sure.

LDx-bMAKuaNI70UwMq9MpA.text: First time ever having hot pot and it will not be my last! Chubby Cattle is amazing, the staff is friendly and explains how the hot pot works in a very polite manner. I could not finish 1 pot by myself and my whole meal was just about $25!!

BJtq1BtJXRuLk5UTN9Rkiw.text: Great flavors along with fresh meat/seafood/vegatables. Conveyor belt with food items enhanced dinning experience. Alex also warmly welcomed us and delivered only the best hospitality.  This is a most go place! Thanks for a new and fun dining experience!

oBglwZVkrJ3yNSL7lNbwRw.text: Came here for my anniversary and I love his place.  Love the line of food and the meat is great quality. They often have specials for certain occasions. We just happened to some here on Valentine's Day. They had a special for two which included your whole meal with a bottle of champagne.  Or meat was draped around a Barbie doll almost in lady Gaga fashion of a meat dress.  Absolutely great ambiance and environment, family friendly and very interactive.

ZPMiLASuERGT5ywcjE2B9g.text: First timers and loved it. From the time we walked in the host was friendly. The place is clean, modern music playing  and it smelled good. Our server was Deni, he explained things well and had good recommendations. He had answers for every questions. He was always around when you need something. The sauces we created from the sauce racks were in point! We recommend the house original pot since you can create your sauce to spice it up. The spicy broth was too spicy for me to sip. We forgot to bring a birthday cake and Deni was quick to come up with something.

bjxZcobr3kpn9PiVvZWd-w.text: Delicious food with courteous staff. I made a reservation and I was glad I did, the place filled up and there was a line when we were leaving. The menu is expansive and if you can't find something on it that you like then you are way to picky! You can also sign up to be part of their VIP program and get 50% off your soup base!

VoZzdD4j-6e0hOdmfqMxow.text: I love chubby cattle's soup and vegetables! Their meat is okay and you can tell it's fresh! However, with high quality meat comes a high quality price! The house broth is plentiful and really good! The sauce bar was HEAVENLY! I love how they give you suggestions of what goes with what and they turn out amazing! The conveyor belt is also really fun and don't be surprised if you look down at your plate and see tons of plates! You don't even realize you took so many items from the conveyer belt. Their cuttlefish fish balls are spectacular and work well with the soup! I love coming here and even though you smell like soup by the end of it you'll know that you had a good meal!

oWrG7_axkgodUaRnmReLQw.text: Had dinner here and was a good spot for hot pot. Most of the small dishes came through on a conveyer belt. Order your soup base, and different proteins. Then go to station to create your own sauces. Also have "free appetizers" which was just pickled iceberg lettuce and edamame. Soup base was good, and the meats were very good. The beef combo is definitely the thing to get and not the seafood combo. That was very overpriced. Overall decent+ food and a fun experience but a little over priced. Small portions on a tiny dishes for avg of $3-$5 Good place but due to the reviews and hype, didn't live up to high expectations.

The sauce bar is awesome and has so many sauces to choose from. I love the ponzu sauce with chili oil. They also added edamame! They also have happy hour where everything on the conveyor belt is buy 1 get 1 free from 9:30pm-12:30 am everyday!! Highly recommend this place!

To drink I had the mango juice and she had the watermelon. Food came out pretty quick.   Only criticism is we didn't receive any instruction on how to cook the food. Mango juice was a little think and heavy. Other than that, food was good, servers and staff were friendly. Would definitely recommend. Between the two of us, check total came to $70 with tip.

FTsyPHUMp322Bs_Ktxp5qQ.text: I went to Las Vegas for the business trip last week and I was recommended by my friend about Chubby Cattle. And I STRONGLY RECOMMEND trying their seafood like lobster, shrimp, etc. Aside from the food, the staff is super friendly. They asked for the feedback and I can tell they try to offer the best customer services. Hopefully, they will open a new chain in New York City!!!

M8SZrkqaVVStI0Dybm5HQA.text: This place was great! Awesome concept, well executed. Deni made sure we knew what to do, and that we had a great experience here. QfoCTZC1OoxXtcSps_xXvQ.text: This was my third time coming to the restaurant and I have to say that it only gets better and better.  Our server Kwan was indefinitely the highlight of our visit this time. He greeted us and introduced himself professionally, and he was friendly throughout the entire dining experience. He always asked if he could refill our soups and waters, and always gave us tips on what we should pick up from the conveyor belt.   To top it all off, he was able to pull some strings to get us access to the buy 1 get 1 free deal a few minutes earlier than its usual start time.   I will be sure to visit again soon!

o6UfyynPqJd4NH3MjCEtTA.text: Wow, from beginning to end, this place is top-notch! The food is extremely fresh and delicious. We will be sure to visit the Chubby Cattle every time we visit Las Vegas!

Sylvia was also extremely attentive and helpful as she knew it was our first time as well. Will definitely be back, everything was fresh and absolutely decadent.

pzHwBfxSc8DMTBmMuMZx3A.text: It was a fun new experience. Food was good and I really loved the mushroom broth base! I took it home and used it to make another soup the next day for work. Just added my own udon noodles. They were super helpful in explaining everything and how it all worked.

ES0wP4QN7xF0gMaaeSdvew.text: The meal was great, and our server Deni, was on point with his recommendations. The combo platters were plenty for our part of four, and the conveyor belt had lots of cool options for additional food. No complaints.

Ksnkp0C0KE3qnZpo7OjJmA.text: It's ok.  Fun for one time.  Good food but nothing special.  The conveyor idea is fun but much rather just get things more traditionally.   Ambiance is nice.  Super trendy though

RD3JY2DeTLP_ggFG-tYu_w.text: I've traveled to China quite a bit and I love hot pot. My wife's never had it and we saw this place on the Zimmern list so we really wanted to give it a try while out here on vacation. The place is way off the strip which is great in my opinion, get away from the overpriced Vegas BS. We were not disappointed. Excellent service and they were very helpful in picking the soup/broth base We got the Yong yang with hellish hot and a milder house original. I can handle pretty hot and spicy so I got the medium, it's not that hot but of course everyone's opinion of hot is different. It definitely has some heat and a great flavor. We ordered the beef combo and seafood combo along with assorted mushrooms bok choy and cabbage. Everything was fresh and really happy with our order. The house hot tea was also amazing. They have a spice / dipping sauce bar that is pretty well stocked and is a wonderful compliment to you cooked items. We were here on a Monday evening and got right in without a reservation. You should call ahead though just in case as it filled up right after we arrived Highly recommend Chubby Cattle!

HrAcuX6BauXejI97BQkfEA.text: Where else in the city can you get authentic Mongolian hot pot. Pretty damn good price too. My lady and I sat down quickly -- we came at 6:30 on a Sunday night.  Xiao was our waitress and she was very attentive. She guided us through the menu and made sure we had drinks and that we ordered just enough food. She was fast and friendly. The menu is sizeable and caters to every palate including vegans (funny to think about a Mongolian vegan -- he probably rode a rainbow unicorn). The meat was good portion and great quality. The broths were flavorful, we tried the half and half. If you needed more flavor, the dipping sauce bar was a nice touch.  We sat at a separate booth but the conveyor is also a interesting feature. We stuffed ourselves for $66.42 before tip.  Not a bad night!

photos.caption: Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

C4CMhr2OiQIOdPwOxhW7Ig.text: Chubby Cattle is my and my husband's go to place for some excellent hot pot dishes. I've already tried four different kinds of broth but my favorite is the tomato. Our server Deni who takes care of us makes our dining experience a lot more fun. Come and visit sometime. Hot pot is soooo good here.

1M2x3QgKvGst2AsA6KqQgQ.text: This place smells so amazing when you first walk in. We got seated right away in a private room and was greeted by our waitress, Sylvia, right away. She's so friendly! She took our drinks and came right back to take our soup choices.   Then she gave us our time and when she came back to get our meat, fish, and veggie orders, she didn't write anything down! She MEMORIZED everything. Keep in mind I came with a group of 8 and ordered for everyone.  We tried some of their fresh juices. I ordered watermelon juice and it is so refreshing! The mango juice was more of a smoothie and also good.   For the spicy soup, a few in my party ordered the "deepest hell spicy" level and the general consensus is that it wasn't spicy, but extremely oily. To drink the soup, they had to scoop the spicy oil off the top first.   For the house special soup, it had great flavor! I did scoop some of Hubby's spicy oil and mix it into my soup (delicious).   We ended up ordering 4 orders of the beef and lamb combo, 1 beef brisket, 1 house meatballs, 1 house fish ball (which comes on a bamboo that you scoop/scrape yourself - so cool), 1 Napa cabbage, 1 spinach, 1 tong ho, 1 pumpkin, 1 mixed mushroom basket, 1 fresh thick noodle, 1 fresh vegetable noodle, 1 udon noodle, and 1 sponge noodle.   Yup.. That's what it takes to feed 8. 5 guys, 3 girls, one of which is pregnant (me)! But everything was so tasty. And I love the sauce bar. Unlimited?? Why, thank you!  When we were about done, Sylvia came back and offered ice cream. The flavors presented were vanilla with chocolate chips, caramel with pecans, green tea, and coffee. I actually suggested they get plum flavor, and Sylvia said she'll try it tomorrow! Lol.   Overall, great quality. Amazing service. And fun experience! We'll definitely be back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh uni
Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. House fish ball. You scoop it yourself!!

yFgcODhaAmFuTG8IkpaZPA.text: Wow! Want to try this place ever since we saw it in BAZAARS FOOD with Andrew Zimner(love his show)..and just wow! Food was amazing and the service was awesome too. We will be coming back here everytime we come to vegas from now on..

LPpx-IABRPq5omkpLyBq_w.text: Delicious dinner and great service and recommendations from Deni. Definitely try the oxtail soup base and meat sampler! You can make your own sauce to dip the meat. o_qahbOXGew4pDFD7w1EOQ.text: Good for a one time experience but will not come back again. The reasons are a few, first, the waiter named Deni was a little pushy in making us order the items that were in higher price. I've done my research prior to visiting so we kinda knew what to order but he keeps insisting to order the higher priced items so we felt pressured in that sense. This is a very pricy place for what you get with the food, you are paying for the experience and not the quality or value of food, my main reason why I'm not coming back. When we left, we still felt hungry even after paying over $100. For the price, you can go to a nice Korean BBQ Buffet.

8PvnceQX13FrGZz_UuvNKQ.text: When a place doensn't need any more reviews...  Service: Excellent Food Quality: Great Variety: Perfect Drinks: Thumbs up  This place is really cool. They have individual soup stations or a large one for larger parties. We had 6 of us eating, so we got a shared table and did the heaven and hell pots.  We ended up getting a large portion of meats as well. We did grab about 6 dishes off the belt to add to our soups.  They also have an sauce bar.   3 of the guys that we with us eat a ton, and they were all full. It ended up being around $35 a person with tip. That is fantastic.   Overall, this is a super fun place. It's great for groups or a date. And they take reservations for parties over 2. *heart*

arMlo8a00jqrc3oQ5dnJOQ.text: I have been here a total of two times and I am always impressed. Although there exists quite a wait for individual pot tables at night, it's definitely worth it. I typically order beef rib eye as well as the raw pork dumplings, glass noodles, and any extra vegetables. The conveyer belt around the restaurant is a cool addition to the ambiance as well as a great way to choose any extra add ons. Just beware of the sizing of the portions because my friend and I ordered 2 small sizes of bok choy and enoki mushrooms when in fact we probably could have shared one small of each between us. I typically order the spicy broth at mid level hell and it's the perfect amount of spice for me. I always look forward to eating here with friends with the fun communal environment, but your order can quickly become pricey if you're not keeping tabs of how many add ons you want.

0EGuqGEWoRCBK4Nneq9ypA.text: On a whim my wife and I went to Chinatown in Vegas to experience where locals eat. We don't like to do the things on the beaten path. I was in the mood for hot pot so we found a shabu shabu place and we took a chance. Chubby cattle had great reviews and it did not disappoint. We ate until we were so stuffed and just kept cooking vegetables in the broth. My wife had the tomato soup broth which was phenomenal, and I have their normal broth which came with Chinese spice. The sauce bar was interesting treat, as we were able to make our own sauces and experiment with our hot pots.  I would definitely recommend this for a date night, or a small group.

ZWd_Tb_CrmP0WozX9OcYtw.text: Awesome experience for a foodie!  Best place for hot pot!  Tried new Japanese curry base which was amazing!  Also a Great place for vegans, plenty of vegan options !! Bill, our server is very helpful!

The hand made noodle and hand made meat balls are pretty good as well. I'd also recommend their fresh cut lamb and overall the quality of meat is good. 3jPMkLpeWktmXwOYqFoEng.text: Wow. I can honestly say we had no clue what we were getting into when we visited Chubby Cattle. We were just two hungry white folk who had never experienced hot pots before (well, the Melting Pot-- but does that really count?) and we wanted to try something new. Reading the Yelp reviews-- we decided tonight was the night!  Chubby Cattle was amazing. The wait staff-- Harry and Angela were extremely friendly and helpful. We ended up ordering the combo beef platter with the mushroom broth and the house broth plus a skewer of lamb and beef. There was so much food-- we couldn't finish it all!  Really-- we were intimidated walking in but it was totally worth it. Try Chubby Cattle if you are looking for a new great place for lunch or dinner!

9dlu0-_W3A2TccAFykKZVA.text: Super inconsistent. Want to love it so bad! I have been here over 10 times. On busy nights, slow Tuesdays. Late nights and early dinner, but I never have the same dining experience. My reason for finally reviewing this place is after so many dining experiences; the fact they didn't have Szechuan pepper corns! Literally the main ingredient in Mongolian hot pot! Come on guys, get it together.          Now the broth was spicy and actually had some love, (they compensated by adding tons of chili oil and chili's) but it just drew the line. I love their beef combo great   meat program, but are often out of product.            Great concept with good product, but just never consistent. Try it out, maybe you'll have a good day for chubby cattle!

7FTLsNF6URbWTOIUpdYCVA.text: Great service, delicious broth options and wonderful selection of ingredients. Love the individual shabu shabu pots just like in Taiwan.

cD837PNbKTxJroCJzIyxVg.text: This is one of the best hot pot places in Las Vegas. I ordered oxtail soup base and my boyfriend got the mushroom base. After that we ordered proteins and veggies. We tried Beef Wagyu- this was very delicious but I didn't get to enjoy it much because once you cook it in the pot it shrinks very small ... so there's not much to eat. Beef brisket- this was good and was a stomach filler. The Quail eggs is our favorite. (Meatballs, land, fish etc). The broth soup is even better towards the end when all the proteins and veggies had simmered together giving a tasty result.   They also have a conveyor belt with food  over the counter that you can select from - and a self serve sauce area. Service was quick. Quality of food was phenomenal.   Check this place out if you're visiting Las Vegas and tired of eating on the strip. Located in asian Plaza.  The only downside is crowded parking.

E3cP9NejycgBy_bYe9aeIg.text: This was my third time coming here. The other two visits were amazing. Had to come again for the deliciousness and was pleasantly surprised with great service from Deni. He was attentive to having tables cleaned when dishes were complete and quick service.

WkIK42AxSPtSPR4tUaXXhA.text: After a few days in Las Vegas, anything other than more casino food was a welcome idea.  A friend of mine had apparently been to this place, and when he described it as a hot pot joint where food comes out on a conveyor belt for you to choose as little or as much as you want to eat, it was a pretty easy decision for the rest of us to agree to try this place out ourselves.  Being a dirty tourist, I can't speak for the location other than the fact that it was roughly a 20 minute ride using an Uber to get there from the south end of the Strip.  We ended up in what appeared to be very Asian part of town based on the stores rapidly changing from English to various Chinese, Korean and Vietnamese names.  Eventually we arrived at our destination which was inside of a pretty packed and busy shopping plaza.  The interior of Chubby Cattle is very light, bright and welcoming.  Immediately upon entrance, you'll see the conveyor belt rolling adjacent to several booths, with lots of little plates containing various vegetables, dumplings, proteins and noodles.  We were lucky to not have a substantial wait, and were seated pretty quickly.  Service was quick, and gracious about explaining their process and pricing.  Basically, broth can be ordered individually or to share, and they come in a variety of spices and flavors.  Larger portions of meat can be ordered, raw, to which you will dunk them in boiling broth for a minute or so, before they can be eaten.  The conveyor belt has small portions of a wide variety of foods that are also cooked in the broth from anywhere from 2-4 minutes.  The color of the plates determine what each plate costs, and at the end of the meal, servers count and tally up all the plates at your table.  It's a pretty unique idea as far as I'm concerned, as the only place I'd ever encountered conveyor belts were sushi restaurants.  But the idea applies wonderfully to hot pot, and I have a lot of admiration for a place like Chubby Cattle at executing it in the way that they did.  Overall, I was very pleased with the dining experience, and I ate generously for roughly about $20 spent.  I had a wide variety of noodles, dumplings and lots of meat, and don't feel like I got shortchanged or cheated in any fashion.  Service was outstanding and friendly, and this is the kind of place that I'd tell my friends about, and actually want to come back to in future Vegas trips.

1F452ZEUWSAkvMejOSn9wA.text: Let me start by saying I came here for the novelty of the conveyor belt, but I'm leaving as a certified fan.  We had several plates of meat, seafood platter, three different broths and about five items from the belt... And it was awesome and flavorful!. We'll be back sooner than later, especially now that we've refined our hot pot technique.  By the way... Don't forget to ask for the free dessert.

LXleAAiUX6h0KeF60XKKUQ.text: This restaurant looks nice and clean, but the waitress inside really worth negative star if there is one.  The food in the restaurant is fair, meat and veggies are fresh, credit to the kitchen.  BUT the service in the front is slow, we have to call the waitress a couple of time to make additional order and our soup in the pot never get refilled.  Eventually, we have to wait over 15 mins before the check arrives to our table.  THE WORST THING IS, the waitress watch me when I writing the tip amount on the check and suggest me not to give her less than 15%.  "The minimum for the tip is 15%, we have to share with others, many of our customers give up 30% tips"  WTH?  30%? are you serious? for a HOT POT?   I got really pissed.  I end up gave her 15%.  I felt very uncomfortable to having this kind of service.   Food is decent, but expect they ask you for 30% tips, it will show on the bill even with a grand total calculated out for you.

Opic1TgJgY_O-6RTSlmryA.text: Chubby Cattle is one of the best hot pot places I've ever been to! The conveyor belt varies between moderate to amazing food. The broth however takes quite a while to arrive at the table. The meat is somewhat decent, although sometimes the meat is fresh. I will definitely be coming back soon!

MO7leTQDhpH7BIXyphXKEg.text: I've never done hot pot before so this was kind of *confusing* for me (and next time I'm definitely bringing a friend who knows what they're doing) The food is really good even though I'm not sure if I cooked it correctly. The staff and service is excellent! The menu is huge and they have a ton of choices, I'll definitely be back once I figure out what I'm doing.

4fwIv8hbO5eNxKyPqkkrPQ.text: Coming here was one of the most best experiences of my life. My friends kept talking about Chubby Cattle and how they were so excited to take me there, and I didn't really know what to expect. Boy was I blown away!!! I honestly never experienced anything like it.  First you are greeted very warmly by their staff, and when you are seated you'll noticed that the tables have little separate hot pots. And I realized that each person gets their own hot pot!! This is the first time I've seen this and it's absolutely brilliant!! It was my very first time, so the manager Sylvia came over who was extremely kind and really walked us through with a lot of tips. So first each of our little pot is filled with delicious flavorful broth. There's a side bar where you can pick so many different soup bases that you can bring back to dip your food in and/or add it into your pot's broth. Now here comes the fun part! Throughout the restaurant there's this conveyor belt where all these different kinds of ingredients go through!! The choices are endless!! Everything from tofu, pumpkin, mussels, noodles, bamboo... you name it! My mouth was literally drooling on the table and my hands had to catch them all otherwise I may flood the restaurant! Now comes the jaw dropping part.  Earlier we've ordered meat that Sylvia has suggested and when they came out it was almost surreal. We had a platter of brisket, ribeye, and wagyu which were all just absolutely gorgeous. Each piece brought my taste buds to a new level of happiness, and that wagyu was so beautifully marbleized that it just melted in my mouth like butter on a hot pile of pancakes. Just absolutely stellar. Then came the Kobe sashimi. Holy moly!!! I wasn't really a huge fan of raw meat to begin with, but after having their Kobe sashimi, my mind was totally blown. The marbleized meat was so smooth and buttery that it just melted with pure fresh flavor and this little kick of wasabi on top made it so refreshing! Each platter of meat was just a delight, and I wish I had like 4 stomachs to fill up just so I can keep eating!  All-in-all my time at Chubby Cattle was just absolutely fantastic. If I can give a 10 star rating I totally would. Wow what a day. Thank you so much to Sylvia and Chubby Cattle for the amazing experience, and I would definitely recommend and bring my friends back here!!!

mCy81vvaTuRM_w-PwYS9UQ.text: chubby cattle is a new favorite. i walked in on a friday night and got a seat immediately in front of the conbeyor belt. You can take things a la carte for your broth as you go or order it all at once from your waited. Deni was very helpful and knowledgeable about the menu. i got the original broth with chicken breast and veggies. they have an awesome sauce bar in the middle of the restaurant where you can collect all kinds of spices and herbs to add to your broth as well. everyone was very attentive. cool atmosphere. yummy noodles. !

vycp8t_SEnYVWYBFlwUHjQ.text: Food is good. Deni is awesome !!!!!price  is reasonable!!! Come look for the food and him!!!!

Is0Jnpk8AI164005YtfeAg.text: Normally, I hate hot pot, but Chubby Cattle creates a dining experience like no other hot pot spots in LV. The restaurant is located on Jones and Dessert Inn in the plaza with District One and Asian BBQ.   When you first walk in, you're greeted by a host who seats you either at a both next to the conveyor belt of dishes, in front of it in a bar style or at booths nearby. I prefer to sit near the conveyor belt of dishes that come by because the items there are cheaper than if you order off the menu.   You begin by choosing your broth. I had the original and my husband had the ox tail. Both were delicious. My other friends had the spicy soup with a medium level (this was fairly spicy). Then, while you wait for your broth to come out, you can go to the sauce stand near the front and make your own sauce. I put the oyster sauce, garlic, and garlic chili. It was pretty tasty when you dip it with other things. I also made a side of the peanut sauce as well. Have fun with it!   We ordered the items we wanted in our hot pot.   Meats: Lamb and Beef (both were quality and tasty, but be careful. It cooks fast in your hot pot).   From the conveyor belt, we grabbed shrimp, tofu, fish balls, fish, veggies, mushrooms, qual eggs, etc. All were very tasty!   What I love about Chubby cattle is how everyone gets their own pot of soup and the freedom to put whatever they'd like in it. It's also stays warm in a little warmer on the table. The broth is always amazing and you get unlimited refills of it.   Price was affordable. Food and drinks for 5 people came out to $150 (includes taxes and tips).   I would definitely come here again to try the different broths and try different mixtures.   Happy Dining,  JT

oHRGCVvJnj8t0WoUhQzekg.text: Great option for Chinese hot pot; here's the lowdown ~  THE GOOD + seafood quality + vegetable quality + portions + vegan/vegetarian selections + open sauce bar (loved this!)   THE DECENT ~ broth ~ forgetful, but apologetic service  ~ pretty pricy  THE BAD  - conveyor belt stuff, the items you order off the menu seem more fresh   Overall, a great (but pricy) soup option in Chinatown. Be wary of over ordering, and bring an appetite!  TIP: ponzu, green onions, and garlic is always a safe base if you're a newbie at the sauce bar

i7kK9tV3coKKgbKgGYEy1A.text: The food was good as always! Meat quality is great and fresh. I got the tomato broth which is flavorful and goes well with the meat. Though they can work on the service. Took awhile just to get water after asking a few times. Other than that good experience will be back.

gowpozJPmUp467Glngo5Uw.text: The food and service was fast and excellence. Our sever Jenny was really informative and helpful with our order. I would recommend to anyone and everyone

ar2zo5EdIM53DICPEMt2NQ.text: Absolutely delicious!! Different, fun and yummy! We arrived 15 minutes after opening (5:15pm). The place was pretty much all to ourselves! But it didn't take long for this place to start hopping! We are currently in the keto diet so this was a great place for us. We ordered the hell out of some meat! Honestly my favorite was the chicken and thought least of their signature. My hubby ordered the original broth soup while I had the spicy. I am a huge spicy guru and they mild is pretty mild. If you're like me get the medium. Now he did explain that if it's not spicy enough he will fix it up for you.  Upon entering they were right at our side explaining everything to us. There is high energy dance music playing which was pretty pleasant. The waiter was very good, attentive and fun. He let us know if we aren't making a mess then we aren't doing it right!  They have a type of sauce buffet where you create your own sauces. That part was a lot of fun. A bit later I saw a long line to the sauce bar. I was very happy we had it all to ourselves when we enjoyed that part of our meal. The food is severed immediately.  They have a conveyor belt with plenty of extras.  We left stuffed! They asked if we would like desert but we couldn't eat another bite.  The prices are amazing. We had everything we wanted and kept ordering and walked out paying $50 including tip.  I highly recommend this place. It's fun, fresh and worth every dime.

We saw a advertisement on the wall near the front desk that they have the  special offer for member ship card, the server explain that if we would like to write something better on yelp, we can use $100 to take $118, but when a supervisor or manager come, he said there is no this special offer anymore. If you hadn't, why you put the advertisement on your store?  The server made the wrong oder for us, missed something, and Oder some food by mistake.   There is so crowed that no any space for the dishes on the small table. when we started to enjoy the food, there is no water, no juice we ordered.   We saw some guest was provided baby seat, and baby bib, but we hadn't, unbelievable to hold my daughter in my arm during the dinner.    Worst experience, we won't back again.

mNat_Nc87EHykjy6C2IfbA.text: A must go every time I visit Vegas. Meats and vegetables are fresh and conveyor belt assortment is plentiful. Sauce station is well stocked and clean. Staff is great and friendly. Anytime friends go to Vegas I always recommend eating here.
