RE6387WtTBNQAFrwVJ5mLg.text: There is a new game out there called "Chubby Cattle" where you stuff large amounts of meat into your mouth and say nothing... just chew, swallow, and let the serotonin do its job to your body.   Setting: I have been here during its grand opening and have returned for its re-grand opening. The decor of the restaurant has been updated with an improved layout to the sauce station. Previously the sauce station was on what looked like a plastic wedding cake design now in a more buffet style, but is a bit cramp as many diners will be all over experimenting with sauces and other additions. The party area does boast individual hot pot stoves for large parties and a large stove in the middle for the larger broth option.   Service: Pretty typical but it was a busy Saturday night, we seem to have three different servers tending to our tables. Drinks were a tad slow but nothing to lose yourself over.   Food: The oxtail broth, new cuts of meat, add new items on the conveyor belt (chicken feet, enoki mushrooms wrapped in bacon). Being a big oxtail fan, I chose the oxtail broth which was... a bit bland. The sauce station helped play a nice role as I experimented with my broth by adding spicy, salty, bitter, sweet etc... till it matched exactly what I wanted. Wagyu was beautifully marbled with a nice chewy but not so melt in your mouth texture.   Personal Choice: Tomato broth and the spicy broth are great! Brisket + Wagyu Beef + side of enoki + rice. Bam!   Overall: One of my favorite places to eat hot pot. Great quality meat and savory flavorful broth, this place has it all!

GM4kZeCpDcWvZasqu6_Daw.text: If you have not been here I highly recommend you try it out.  You can make an online reservation here on Yelp, I recommend you do that they do get busy.  The spicy soup is so good I got medium level 12 lowest is 8 my husband got that.  Stick with 8 that is spicy enough.  The Oxtail with tomato soup mixed in is delicious.  We got beef and thin cut chicken breast, next time we will stick with just beef but it was all good.  The mushroom basket was one of the best parts for me there were about 4 or 5 different mushrooms in the basket all tasted great in my spicy soup. The mango and green tea desert cakes are really good too,mango was my favorite.  The waiter was awesome great service from the minute you walk in to the minute you leave.  I also noticed they have private rooms availbe for private parties.

9zYbKsJK7Iny59VmK_qP1Q.text: One of the new places to try an amazing hot pot. The fact that they open from 5 pm-12 am is actually a plus, since it means that everyone in the kitchen is not haggard and the meats are all fresh. The service is acceptable, still a little rough I guess. Just a few things, my mushroom soup base, which my mom also ordered took about 15 mins after everyone in our table start eating. So they were almost done while my soup barely makes bubble. Our server didn't explain on how things are done in their establishment. For example, the conveyor belt, how to turn on the individual stoves and also what is in the menu, or ask at least if this is our first time or are we a returning customer. It would've made the experience a little more better. Also, the bacon wrapped enoki mushrooms of my boy friend ordered when our server was pitching the daily specials at the start of the meal arrived at the end of the meal, with the enoki burnt and the bacon not all the way cook. And this man, eats a lot of bacon. Daily specials, unless you actually have to harvest or kill a live animal should be part as the appetizer experience, to tease the taste buds on the next gastronomical adventure that would follow, not present it when the person is full and almost done with their meal. All in all, it was an experience, I can't really say if it's good or bad and I do understand that they have a little bit more refinement to do. The soups though were perfection, yes they are bland at first but that's what the condiment/sauce/spice bar in the middle of the restaurant is for, to create your own flavors and make the experience and your imagination tingle for a little while. I will be back and I do hope the next time, I could say it is beyond 5 stars.

PgJNrP7khDL01tp2ZOv2FQ.text: Our server, Matthew was very helpful and explained everything to us. We ordered the beef plate and it had three different meats. All the meats were not too fatty and were soft. We sat at a table that had individual pots. This allowed each of us to cook the food how we wanted to. We got there for happy hour (9:30pm to 12:00) which you buy one plate and get one free. It still cost $66 for three of us. But we were full. Definitely would recommend this place.

hTK4h6FAAbuIXaskk33DYw.text: I have to thank our local cousin who recommended this place to us.  We came in town during the week of Christmas and new year so we the wait over half and hour. They were so kind to give us little snacks while we waited. Their soup the hot pot had these herbs I remembered my mom would make for with when we were sick, so I knew the soup was super healthy. The vegetable and mushroom combo had so many varieties of different vegetables and mushrooms. The meat we had was soft and tender. They had a table full of different sauces you can choose from. I had the ponzu sauce and chili so it was sour and spicy combine with the tasty herby soup, I can't ask for a better experience with hot pot. Fantastic eat! I gave them a four star because we ask for one of their desserts but they said it would take too long to make. It seems like they were rushing us out because of the long line. However their service were all very nice. If I had some green tea ice cream I think my dinner would been a perfect 5 star experience.

zc4BnOBAU8EmPkPgJbSofg.text: Truly Enjoyable! Fun and somewhat unique experience. Went on a double date with a couple that we weren't sure would be into this style of dining. They too enjoyed it immensely. For four people we ordered two beef combo platters, two sliced chicken breast, one pork belly, a veggie combo and two orders of udon noodles. We definitely ordered too much. We should have just ordered two beef platters, a veggie combo and udon noodles and called it a day. Regardless, we enjoyed the The beautiful tomato broth and their house broth. It was fun to dip everything in and share the experience with friends. Will definitely do it again.   We would have given five stars but there were a few downsides. 1) parking. There is virtually no parking in this strip mall on a Sunday night. 2) the wait. We had to wait over 45 minutes for a table. 3) it took about 5-10 minutes to greet us and get us water. After the wait we had an incredible experience.

29ab8Fp4JnMiACHDedjmsw.text: Chubby cattle is what I felt like after leaving this place (not sure how many people have made that joke) anyway...this was a fun experience!  A lot going on if you're dining here with anyone who's new to hot pot, a little bit of a different experience then Korean BBQ since you're in charge of your own pot individually and own cooking.  I ordered the original soup base to start and placed an order for noodles, mushroom basket, beef and shrimp paste.  The servers here are really good with explaining how hot pot works and demonstrating items I've never had like the shrimp paste.  Everything was so good, mushroom variety was great,  meat was fresh, noodles were fresh and shrimp paste added a nice variety of flavor and texture to the meats and veggies.    The conveyor belt was also a nice addition, you can easily grab any items you'd like to throw in your pot as it passes you, nice and convenient!   I really enjoyed the sauce bar where you can make your own sauces, there was just a lot to choose from and can be overwhelming if you don't know which flavors go with what.  I had to go back twice to make a couple different sauces to accompany my meal.    I would definitely return, I feel like with all the combinations of soup bases and sauces you can choose from can make each visit a different experience.  I would like to try the most popular oxtail broth next time probably though.

XYMNA3U1StBASJRiZ6w27A.text: Hello Las Vegas! I'm Nette B. of Nette.Yelp.Com and I dined at your restaurant. I'll give the disclaimer now. I've been to really good hot pot restaurants and unfortunately Chubby Cattle is just meh. I've had hot pot in San Diego and Hawaii and my palette desires good tasting food. If you've never had hot pot then to you this is good. For me? Meh... It's alright. We came here for my birthday dinner. My choice while in Vegas so I can introduce my family members to Mongolian Hot Pot. We made reservations for a table of 6 at 8pm on February 1, 2019. We arrived at 10 minutes to 8pm and our table was not ready so we waited a few minutes. We opt for the individual pots so that everyone in my party would have their own choice of broth. DISCLAIMER: Individual small pot is not served in the ying yang pot. Boo! Other places I've been has the split pots for smaller individual. I will say that having tables with individual small pots is a great idea. Our server was Deni. He was nice and he tried to recommend and upsell us on some platters etc. I think they only one we fell for was the basket of vegetables in which we didn't eat it all and ordered extra baby bok choy instead. We should've stuck with our gut and order 2 large bok choy. He also tried recommending the oxtail broth and only 1 person in our party ordered that and she was not pleased. She took the spicy hot broth from another person to add more flavor. I personally ordered the entry level hot. Three people ordered the medium hot and they LOVE spicy 10 hot at thai restaurants and they were saying it was really hot & spicy where they were sweating. LOL but still liked the broth. I, on the other hand was thinking OMG this is extremely hot. I scooped up a lot of red peppers in my pot. See how red my pot in my photo. But I pressed through and enjoyed my meal. I had to ask to add more mild broth so calm the heat down. Demi didn't come by to do that when I asked that I had to flag down another server who kindly filled my pot for me. Also, we had to ask for our waters to be refilled. :( Food: A lot of pork belly since I can eat 2 plate fulls for myself. :) Basket of vegetables Rib Eye Mussels Tofu Squash from the conveyor belt and noodles. So, the noodles are made in house. If you are used to egg noodles then I would recommend the tomato noodles. They have different flavors and they also offer a basket of noodles. Blah, not happy with the noodles also. I had to dip it in my soy sauce I created. Speaking of created, there's a sauce bar where you walk up to in the middle of the restaurant when you enter and you make your sauce. I used vinegar and soy sauce. Others used the ponzu and garlic etc. I was pleased with my sauce but the area looked a bit dirty and no one was cleaning it up to make it look presentable. At the end we spent about $200. Not bad prices but the broth prices are a bit pricey. $6.99 for the oxtail broth. I would return again If I desire Hot Pot in Vegas. But my go-to would be in San Diego and Costa Mesa where the Hot Pot's are more desirable. Not bad but also not the best. Lastly, I spoke to another friend who lives in Vegas who agreed with my feedback. #nette.yelp.com #YelpBlackElite

RLydjhyRxk9JpyuYIZt9aA.text: I'm starting to think that for food to taste delicious, there has to be a balance between the taste and the price point. If I'm eating average food and it is costing me an arm and a leg, the food experience goes down because I'm thinking it isn't worth it. With higher price points, my expectations are higher.  The hotpot was good, and the sauce bar was really fun, but the price point is high. I spent about $40 for myself and I was half full. My fatass clearly needs more food to be content.   Anyway, the place is busy. I have only gone once and haven't been back because I don't want to leave hungry.

AMEF_IOVrjyEhGNeIIfZ-A.text: So I come here very often and always sit at the bar and always have the best time possible when Brandon the bartender serves me. Today went different. I seen open spots at the bar and management said we would need to be seated. If we want food. However only myself wanted food at the time. So we sat by the conveyer belt and ended up not having the same customer service as when Brandon. I felt as if the manager was watching me the whole time like we weren't suppose to be there. This is my Favorite spot! The food is amazing! But when feeling uncomfortable in somewhere your so used to it's make me re think the value.    I hope next time I get to sit at the bar as usual and enjoy the great service I received from the start.

9v4IYtT9r1wolgj3NEuJdw.text: I love the concept of this place. There is a conveyor belt with smaller portions of items such as noodles, quail eggs, veggies, mushrooms and much more. You just select the items you want and pay the amount according to the plate color. There should be a sticker on the table stating the price for each plate.   I chose the house broth which is a light and clean tasting broth. Very wild in flavor but still delicious. My friend ordered the tomato ox tail broth and she loved hers as well. I tasted it and it was a little sweet and salty. There were chunks of ox tail in there too.   The sauce bar here is HUGE. Probably the largest variety of sauces I've seen by far and I eat alot of AYCE hot pot spots. They had my favorites, the satay and ponzu. They had varieties of peanut sauce which I know a lot of people love. A hot pot spot is only good if they have good sauces to pair with it!! Love it.   I ordered the beef platter to share with my friend and it was more than enough to get us full. We also got a variety of selections from the conveyor belt, but not too much since we were not super hungry. The total came out to around $50 which is pretty steep since you can go to AYCE places for that price & eat as much as you want. But the quality here is great so worth the price.

VSW6uwbhwHC88t-K5imuTw.text: Living in Vegas, this place has been my go-to hot pot in the valley. I've been here a few times to say that this place has high quality meats and flavorful broths. Not to mention their self-serve sauce station! I particularly like it place due to its individual pot that is placed right in front to you, that way you don't have to worry about reaching toward the middle of the table to grab your food.   My go-to items on the menu are the beef platter, meatball platter and vegetable platter. These give me a variety of items to choose from without having to worry what to choose. Especially when you are indecisive, like me, and can never choose which vegetables to have. There is also a conveyer belt that goes through the booth seating where they have individual plates to choose from. My favorite broth has got to the the house special, its creamy, garlicky, and just enough flavor to cook my meal in. I've tried the spicy broth, which can be very spicy, depending on which level you get. The spice doesn't hit you until after you have consumed all your food! Haha  I do have to agree with my fellow yelper Debrah about the restaurant being clustered. Depending on where you sit, there is a lot of traffic of the servers going in and out down the row of booths. This is particularly in the middle of the restaurant where the window is, that's where the servers come to pick up the food. It does get a little cramped when a new party gets seated by the host, servers going in and out of the row, including the people already being seated trying to get to the sauce bar for seconds or thirds. Other than that, I couldn't recommend this place more.

vRQk2llJY4qyTos0loAAoA.text: Heard good things about this place from a friend and made it a point to visit when we were out in Vegas.  Made a reservation for the 6 of us without any issues.  They asked if we wanted individual pots (yes!) and if we wanted to sit next to the belt (another yes!).  Woot woot.   Our server was fantastic.  Explained everything from the get go and checked back on us quite often.  I ordered the entry spicy broth but also got to try their original.  Both were delicious and fantastic.  Lots of amazing flavor.  They have a sauce bar for you to create your own concoction so go crazy!  We ordered quite a bit of meat, beef and lamb.  Great quality.  You could see the kitchen at work slicing your meat and putting your items together.  We ordered the seafood combo and tons of veggies.  If you want a little side of something, you can grab it on the conveyor belt.    Everything was extremely fresh.  Our broth levels never got low.  I was impressed by chubby cattle.  A definite return when we come back and highly recommended if you're craving some hot pot in LV!

2oWqqth3UyZnkFoUlsyYWw.text: Great experience with Deni as our server! Very attentive and didn't hesitate to make great recommendations!

-SfsnzNMXywtDQPoYKIeWQ.text: Yum!  We had a great time here for dinner. We were a group of four on a Friday night. I did not have a reservation, so we weren't able to sit at a conveyor table. While that was disappointing, I get it.   However, that glitch aside, the food was wonderful. We each had a different soup base. I had mushroom, one had curry, one had traditional, and one veggie. We ordered a selection of meats and vegetables and got right to it. All the meat was tender and delicious. The veggies were fresh and crisp. All in all, it was a great experience.

3btri49c1hP2hstGEFReGg.text: Every time I think of this place I get hungry.   The thing is, I'm not typically a fan of hot pot. I usually find myself sitting down and served, but I enjoyed eating here SO much I think I'll be back soon.  When I arrived, the restaurant was about to close but they politely accommodated me anyways. I ordered several different dishes for my party of 5. We tried the house flavor broth and the tomato rib one (a bit salty but still tasty).  My favorite meat was the pork belly. There were a few selections of meat that were out so I'll be back to try them.   While the fish was good...there were too many bones for me to pick out.   Also wanna add that the 3 flavored noodles are bomb! They soak up the flavor of your broth so well.

FXkjJNfl3ZEq1F_lyQzNrg.text: Chubby cattle has really good meat choices and their hand made noodles are super delicious. Our server Deni was super nice and friendly. He made sure we were enjoying our food and made really good recommendations for our group. Definitely coming back again!

WuQm_-HmkS9f7jXjVloBbg.text: This has to have been one of my favorite experiences in a while! This was my first time at Chubby Cattle and it's safe to say I'm hooked and can't wait to go back! Whether it be girls night, date night, or a big group outing I already feel confident they will continue to deliver amazing flavor and customer service!   Each person picks their soup base to start out with (I chose the mushroom one and ). Each person has an individual warmer to keep their broth in.  You then proceed to the little buffet style bar to choose additional ingredients to add to you base. You can choose from so many times such a as sesame oil, minced garlic, green onions, cilantro, chili garlic paste, to name a few. The edamame(which I chose to top w sea salt,Chile  garlic paste and minced garlic) and cucumber salad at the flavor bar SO good!   After creating your broth to your tasting comes the fun part...the meat/seafood options!  We chose 2 lamb, 2 shrimp, mussels, dumplings, a veggie platter, a noodle trio, and a meat combo...generous portions we will know next time not to order so freaking much!   Then you start cooking all your ingredients yourself to your liking. We seriously ate for almost 2 hours straight bc of the portion sizes and of course how tasty it was! BE CAREFUL SHIT IS SO HOT (Temperature wise) OMG and they bring a refill of broth at no charge! Which pricing in general is very reasonable.   Billy our sever was extremely nice and made our experience enjoyable and not at all rushed, thank you!!

sla9CO3cF2y77upNy48fvQ.text: I am here for their third anniversary celebration.  It isn't my first time here and it definitely will not be my last.  Love this place.  My favorite hot pot place ever.  What makes this place unique is the quality of the food.  No matter what you get you cannot go wrong.  Make sure if you have a large party to make sure to make a reservation.  It seems every time we come this place is hopping. Some of my favorites are the beef tongue, the mixed mushroom basket, the seafood combo platter, and the lamb.  I always go with the Deepest Level Hell 18 (I guess it is because the devil is inside me) for hot pot base.  This soup adds tons of flavor without overwhelming the flavor of whatever you decide to throw in.  I strongly suggest you taste their grape sake.  Grape Ape.  An unique sake if I have ever had one.  Jenny is awesome!!!!  I may prefer Deepest Hell for my Hot Pot, but this place is complete heaven.

ULHjuND0IPjoRvUSBHH18w.text: Best soup broth that Vegas has to offer! The original is so savory, it's impossible to resist! bxXFFPHXj4w1qxKtKvFKIw.text: Delicious!!! Cool looking restaurant. Revolving meat track, and good selection of meats and vegetables. 1st time at Chinese hotpot, had a lot of fun

BkFlfuWg5_jh38Vm2GBA-A.text: Great food and service!  Cooking in broth at the table and grabbing food off the conveyor belt was a lot of fun!  Everything we tried was delicious!

H8GFATycAfSRtYKGe87nxQ.text: So. So. So. So. SOOOOOO GOOOD :)  I didn't really know what hot pot was until I came here and I'm such a fan!  First, the conveyor belt is just too cute. Very IG worthy. I was quietly grabbing plates of salmon sashimi as they would come by, unbeknownst to my fellow table partners lol I didn't want to share...  The heaven and hell pot is fun to share with a group. I like to get noodles from the conveyor belt and add broth to it from the shared pot. I'm definitely a meat lover, but the mushrooms are a must here too.  Service is good, even when it's very busy, and make sure you take advantage of the cold station they have set up with all the dipping sauces. YUM!

b_-2rObzWxiDTV3eQG4-jQ.text: "I've been practicing eating lamb after I saw Eater put this place on the heat map"  says Midwest poker bud, smiling ear to ear.  "Practicing?"  I say.  "Yep.  I bought a some. grilled it. and ate it.  Taste pretty good doused in BBQ sauce" his reply.  "OK, let's go.  Errr and good luck".  Snazzy, contemporary feel, HD monitors everywhere, plexiglass cutouts in the table to protect your mobile, and a conveyor belt filled with raw foods.    Simple hotpot concept.  Choose the broths, choose the proteins and veg (help yourself is seated by the conveyor belt and pay by the plate colors), cook in your personal or communal pot if you wish, dip in a sauce, and eat.  The broths sampled (house and "hellishly spicy" mid level heat) are wonderfully aromatic with the pronounced flavor of ginseng, cardamom, cinnamon, and other oil based spices (unsure of the extract but it has a bitterness and green vegetal finish similar to chrysanthemum).  It's not for everyone.  The broth is mildly seasoned.  Use of the dipping sauces is required to get the fullest flavor.  Warning, spice heat is achieved with dry chilies and LOTS of them.    Good selection of mushrooms and relatively fresh veg.  Very good selection of proteins including multiple kinds of tofu, free ranged chicken, USDA choice to Wagyu beef, lamb and a plethora of live seafood.  Of course, wanting the authentic, it's all about the lamb and mutton. (Mongolia is land locked isn't it?)  Tip:  If it doesn't live together, don't cook them together.  That is unless you want to create a very "unique" soup.  - Mutton (thick sliced) - pronounced gamey flavor, lots of external fat.  Cooked rare for best flavor. - House special lamb - thin cut, cooks instantly.  Very little fat.  Subtle leg of lamb flavor. - Supreme lamb shoulder - most connective tissue, least lamb flavor.  Finally, do not pass on the charcoal grilled skewers.  the spice rubbed lamb, moist though cooked through and tasty lamb ribs with its melting fat and chewy connective tissue just good eats.   Both are well seasoned to enhance the classic lamb flavor.  A grilled "French style" rack of lamb, very aggressively seasoned with a spice rub, cooked through but tender with the cleanest lamb flavor; too fancy.  Patient and helpful servers who are willing to take the time to explain the many options.    Eater Vegas has it right, deserving of the hype.

BZL1MJ1ttcxShWFwZa8s3Q.text: It's a pretty cool concept. Our server deni was really helpful because it was our first time. Don't order too much in the beginning because there's not a whole lot of space at the bar.   They have the prices on the conveyer so it's a good guide!  I would def come back it's a cute atmosphere

bg90boDPHWX7jdQAE16GMg.text: DELICIOUS HOTPOT and great service! I had to call twice to change our reservation time because my friends and I were having trouble getting an Uber. But the reception lady was super nice about and saved us a table despite being late to our third change of time.   We ordered a large pot to share the soup bases. You can order up to 3 bases for one large pot and we got the spicy one, seafood, and original.  And for the meat, we got beef, lamb, fish balls, and sliced fish.   As for vegetables, we got napa cabbage and enoki mushrooms. And a side of glass noodles.   The soup bases are everything I love in hotpot! Lots of chili oil and spice in the spicy base and lots of sea flavor in the seafood base. They were all thick in flavor but light in consistency. Overall great broth!   Besides having tasty soup bases, when you ask for a refill on soup, they actually give you soup instead of like other places where they usually refill with water instead.

BonLMXbRYOEHrYLdl-iJzQ.text: Stopped by here on the way back from tahoe. Food was ok. Thought it was a bit overated from others opinions. Meat was exceptional but service is stale to say the least

3Mh8pYyloculWBvH4e313w.text: FINALLY!!!! Some Chinese hot pot in Vegas!   The meats are great here and are reasonably priced. I love how many broth options they have. My favorite is honestly the tomato one. If you want it spicy just add chilly oil!   The have a great variety of veggies and sides to cook.  The fish balls are a must and I'm talking about the fresh ones and not the frozen rubbery ones!   The conveyor belt idea is pretty cool but the prices on the belt do not match the price in the menu. So I wonder which is better to grab off of?   The only downside about here is portions of their sides. For a large noodle, they told me it's good for 2 people. When I saw it, I thought this isn't even enough for me. Even when I ordered a large enoki mushroom, I was very very small and it made me wonder how much they would give in the small size?   The service is okay when they are busy. But they were good when it was slow.   What I didn't really like was they were haggling for a review in return for ice cream. Kind of annoying to some customers...

oa-upIZG3bWDRE0kFMuu3w.text: I was super excited to try this new hot pot place!  Since this place just recently opened, I thought there would be a long line or wait, but we were seating right away.  We were not seating at the areas near the revolving conveyor of dishes, but where we were seated was still okay.    I really like the set up.  We were seating on a high top with 8 recessed induction systems (4 on each side).  Very neat concept because you can just drop in the pot.  This makes  hot pot eating easier.  Also, I like how ergonomic friendly the sauce bowls are.  Makes it easier to dip things.    Another neat concept of this great hot pot place is the sauce bar.  Typically or traditionally, you are served with chinese bbq sauce, but there are plenty of other sauces available at the sauce bar, such as hot chili oil, sesame oil, garlic, salt, sugar, peppers, and more!  I definitely got some chinese bbq sauce, hot chili oil, and some sesame oil with salt and white pepper.    The menu if filled with a great variety of combos.  Also comes with a great variety of broth base flavors.  I decided to get the medium spicy broth, and it had just the right amount of spice to it!  When I got my broth, there were so many spices and flavors, I didn't know what type of spices and peppers they were, but the broth was excellent.    Got the beef combo, mushroom basket, and the lamb shoulder.  Beef combo came with brisket and ribeye.  Mushroom basket is pretty self explanatory.  Lamb shoulder for $5 came with a good amount to share with 2 people.    Overall, this hot pot place was an excellent experience.  I can't wait to go again!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Close up of medium spicy soup base
Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ergonomic friendly sauce dishes and spicy soup base
Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mushroom basket

Z1kZoBW8HQUOZD--jMJcUg.text: Came here on a Friday night and waited about 15 minutes to sit by the conveyor belt. Have been wanting to check this place out because there has never been an authentic Chinese hot-pot restaurant in town. I had thought the conveyor belt would be popular, but soon realized it's very under-used, barely anyone picking out dishes from it. Its plates are color-coordinated by prices, and honestly, each of them all seemed a little over-priced for the portion. Decided to order from the menu instead.   We ordered an original house broth and a tomato broth. For the meat, we ordered a plate of wagyu beef at a discounted special price, a plate of angus beef (apparently popular for first-timers), a veggie combo, a 3-noodles combo, shrimp balls, and a bacon-wrapped needle mushrooms for appetizer. Surprisingly, all of that was almost the perfect amount of food for two. The presentation of the plates were great, with our wagyu beef clouded in dry ice, and the veggies in a tree-stump basket..definitely went out all.   Everything tasted very fresh. The house broth is supposedly the healthiest broth option, made with beef, chicken and herbs. Its flavor is definitely more on the subtle side, but if you want a soup with a lighter and healthier flavor, this is the one. The tomato broth was delicious. There's a hint of sweet in it, but the tomato flavor tastes very real, a great option if you want more flavor to your cooked meat, veggies, noodles, etc. Both broths can just be enjoyed as soups as well, not greasy at all like usual hot-pot broths.   All the food came down to less than $70 for two people, definitely worth it for the freshness of the ingredients and the experience, in my opinion. If you're a first-timer to the restaurant, or to hot-pot in general, it may all seem a little intimating with the steps and process. But once you get the hang of how everything works, this is a great place to enjoy dinner, especially when the weather gets colder! Definitely one of my favorites! Perhaps one of the most authentic Chinese hot-pot restaurants I know!

Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. noodles combo
Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. veggie combo

VTCaw_1CJvFnw-xm62bmuA.text: I was super stoked when I heard about Chubby Cattle because 1) I love hotpot and 2) I love conveyor belts (come on, we are already cooking our own food, who is trying to do cardio walking up and down to the fridge while eating?! Am I right? Lol)   Food: Chubby Cattle has a big menu with beautiful platted seafood and meat options. They also have noodles, vegetables, mushrooms, etc. on their menu. Their conveyor belt is also very impressive and I saw taro pieces to seafood to various greens. My brother and I ordered the tomato and seafood broth, and honestly I found them both very bland and flavorless. The seafood was very watered down and tasted like the seasoning from ramen packets (I read from other reviews that the mushroom and house special broths were also bland). The tomato broth was much better and probably the only broth I'll consider ordering if I come back. We also ordered the seafood platter, beef brisket (because my fave beef tongue was sold out), and vegetable noodles. The seafood consisted of muscles, scallops, shrimps, clams, and octopuses. Both the seafood and brisket dish were very fresh and did not seem frozen beforehand.   Service: Mathew was our server and he was amazing. He answered all our questions, made suggestions, refilled our waters twice without us asking, cleaned up our table as soon as one of our plates were empty, and got our ice creams quickly. While all the servers seem stressed and all over the place, I found that our server kept his cool and smiled whenever he passed by. Thank you Mathew!  Overall: I'll definitely come back because the prices of the conveyor belt items were fair (ranging from .99 cents and up), the meat and seafood platters were great quality, and it was just a great experience to enjoy with family and friends. Hopefully they add more soup options or at least perfect their other ones because it sucks when the soup bases are so bland.

hKu2oQk--kmJB98zHH5RYg.text: It is a new and exciting place to eat here in Las Vegas, N.V.! I like that we can definitely have a real hot pot experience now. The lamb sliced and the Hot and Spicy levels being just the right touch for me to feel like I am back in Beijing enjoying my Favorite Hot Pot spot.   The prices are a bit high for just vegetables but it's ok because the meat selection and all you can get sauces make it all the more worth it.   Table settings are a bit tight for the space, I would say they are utilizing the square footage but the space is still small and tight. This makes me feel Claustrophobic which usually makes me not want to stay in these types of restaurants, the food and service make up for it.   Recommend for a try and also know they have Veggies for all my Veggie people.

The sauces were numerous and you can create your own concoction.

fAF714peDf0SNgMxNvS_rA.text: This hot pot is pretty authentic if you ask me! I grew up eating traditional Chinese hot pot at home and this place hits the spot for me! I like the individual pot you can order and put whatever you like in there! The conveyor belt was a cool idea but I didn't get anything from it, since everything looked pretty old on there.   Service was awesome, our waitress was very accommodating and explained the menu to us since it was our first time. The sauce area was very convenient and lots of choices. I enjoyed the quality of the food and I especially loved their handmade meatballs!   I believe they also have regular hot pot style where there is one big bowl in the middle for everyone to share! I am definitely coming back to try out more of their meats!

XtyFG1fXX56wYjYncyC2jg.text: Our first time with the family  going to a hot pot restaurant, so we had no idea what to do. We went on the 4th of July weekend. Deni was our server, and he was very helpful and showed us how everything worked here as well as gave his recommendations, based on what we liked. Everything was very tasty, and we had a great experience. Deni recommended great desserts too. I believe it was a taro layered cake and a green tea layered cake. I would recommend this place if you are in town.

EmO-kiJkLU9AEcnVOwcgDg.text: With the weather finally starting to cool down in Las Vegas, Chinese hot pot is a great idea to warm yourselves up!  Location: Chubby Cattle is located in the same busy compound as Snow White coffee shop. Expecting the wait to be extremely long because of past reviews, we were surprised when we arrived and were seated immediately. Right away, the stand in the middle of the restaurant with the multitude of sauces available to serve yourself with caught my eye. The star of the show, however, was the revolving conveyor belt placed in between a few lucky tables. Although I did not have the chance to experiment with the crazy contraption, it seem apparent that the plates were color-coded according to price. Want something? Open the door by your table, pick it up, and the price will be marked!  Food: You first choose the type of broth you want. Not wanting to burn internally and having a pretty low tolerance to spice, I chose the entry level hellfire broth. Though seemingly fiery with its bright red color, I found it to be very flavorful. Although I don't know what is specifically in the broth, it was a great base to the foods yet to come. The menu offered plenty of choices, from individual choices to combos. From the seafood combo to the brisket to the enoki mushrooms ordered, food was consistently a high quality. All came with enough to share between 2 people. At the end of the meal, we were also given free ice cream!  Service: Service was excellent. We were checked upon constantly to ensure we were having a good dining experience. Food was delivered promptly. The servers all seemed very willing to help and were all very knowledgeable about the menu and the options available.  In the coming winter months, this will be my go-to place for hot pot. Great concept, delicious food, and awesome staff. Will be returning soon!

RYkhkjSpe9e4jb40mntJTw.text: Very unique and fun restaurant. Takes hot pot meals to another level. There is a conveyor belt of refrigerated dishes you can choose from to add to your hot pot (just like sushi conveyor belt, you pay based on the color of the plate). The servers are extremely helpful and attentive. You start off by picking the base broth (original was very good). The you can add the protein/veggies as desired. Can order what is on the menu or pick from the conveyor belt. My daughter and I started with the combo beef plate $13 and raw pork pot stickers which was  perfect for our two personal pots. After you order the broth, head on over to the sauce station and prepare your dipping sauce. Lots of choices so can get overwhelming. I choose the ponzu, garlic, green onion, and a bit of chili paste. Came out perfect. Also ordered hand-made noodles and bowls of rice. Once the pot was boiling, started adding the ingredients and then the thin sliced beef one slice at a time since they cooked very quickly. Then added fresh shrimp, tofu, rice cakes, sausages, mussels (all from the conveyor belt). Made the soup very tasty but be cautious with the soup though, it's boiling hot...literally. We enjoyed our meal and will return next time in Las Vegas!

rbuCv0abXt6vLxtwn59ECA.text: The food is amazing.  The service is great.  The place is clean.  The food has a lot of variety.

k2tqD8KBRJ9zn2ysZj6rMA.text: First time here with my family and friends. Once we entered we got greeted by their very friendly staff immediately. Our server was Deni and that man i tell you he is the best. Recommended thing that would make more sense and save us money. Also pours our soju in our glass when we were low or empty. Always there when we needed something and gave us 5 star service for sure!!!! We are definitely coming back to see you DENI thank you!!!!

Y90DPU6c3YTHpe2sNB4tBA.text: i am definitely a fan!   i absolutely love hot pot. chubby cattle does everything that's great about chinese style hot pot and then added a conveyor belt for that little extra fun. they provide all of the different sauces that i grew up loving in a chinese home. they give you all the different selections of meat and seafood and veggies. the broth is something you won't find easily elsewhere in vegas. it's a very herby broth with delicious flavors. growing up, i hated the stuff but now i just love it!  they are busy! i would highly recommend making a reservation, even though sometimes the hostesses mess those up too, it's still much better than standing around waiting for a table.   before the weather starts getting too warm for hot pot again, check this place out. you won't be disappointed.

r4arpalX7jfByiyxmBNlTg.text: This is a GRRRREAT spot. Found on a post by @eatervegas we tried @chubbycattle. You get your own hot pot and ingredients come to you on a conveyor belt. So yummmm! Restaurant was cute, clean and the staff was super nice. Fun eating!! Oh PS... I'm a finicky eater, don't like onions and certain spices and I did fine. I had the mushroom broth (not spicy at all) and they have a sauce bar so you can add flavors as you wish. Also, they have little signs telling you how long to cook certain foods (e.g. chicken 30 seconds)... so smart!!

wOsJRlUykUzUWmItqteHDw.text: Try this place for the first time, like it overall, but table space is a little too tight, not enough table space, would also be nice to train server to teach how the heater control works since its in Chinese, but they don't seems to be willing to do that :( my American friend kept panicking about how to turn up or down the heater, if only the server can take time and explain it to us.....service also a little slow at times, we got the meat before our soup came, sign up for member ship to get half off on soup by leaving review on Yelp, will still come back though, good food, fun idea! *they use melamine bowl, if you are paranoid about getting cancer, bring your own nice ceramic bowl from home (melamine bowl release chemical when in contact of high temperature food)

I always get the tomato broth, my hubs and 13yo get the hell broth #6 (which is a great spice level if you normally prefer super spicy food!). Soda Beverages come in a can with a glass of ice.  No free refills here. Hostess was very abrupt and not friendly. Server was very kind and genuinely took interest in serving us.  Total for 2 came to a little over $75 with no alcohol.  I can say we will not be back a second time.

OPuLOWUDoeL_TbmqjQit5w.text: Our server Kwan was professional and extremely friendly.   We noticed that there was a special starting at 9:30 PM (buy 1 get 1) but we came in a bit earlier. Kwan was nice enough to offer this deal a bit early to accommodate our party. Not only that, but he was also extremely helpful in recommending menu items and telling us all about how the conveyor belt worked.  I always appreciate good service and Kwan delivered. 70kQrHMdPEWxepvLTe_kaw.text: Had to wait a few minutes after we arrived to sit at the conveyor bar. Hostess took the time to go over setup and menu. Immediately met our fantastic waiter, Kwan. He explained the process and got us started. The sauces are great and the beef combo was perfect for two people to share. The rest of the items we just pulled from the conveyor belt as it went around. We thought this system actually was very smart as other hot pot places your table becomes inundated with items since they bring everything out at once. Here, you can have a pretty organized eating space as you take and eat at your place. The conveyor belt is not just a gimmick. Everything tasted fresh and the broth was delicious. Look for Kwan as he is super friendly and made the experience at Chubby Cattle over the top. Will definitely be back.

QwxrvKsNzoend6n6ofdsKw.text: I've never been to a conveyor belt hot pot place so I was so excited! You can do family style with one huge pot or individual small pots.  My friends and I decided to do the individuals pots so we could choose our own soup bases. I'm a first timer, I'm glad our server Deni was super nice and gave us a few great suggestions to start. This place has everything you could ever want in your hot pot which is great but also overwhelming for indecisive people that eat with their eyes like me lol. If you're like me, I'd recommend going with the combo platters, skip the menu and then pick and choose what you'd like. The homemade meatballs were a hit or miss. It was assorted so some were yummy and some not so much. However, I was pretty disappointed that they were much smaller than expected. I'd skip it next time.   Overall, I'd come here again!

sn45SY5_yPEdrfCJFHEucw.text: I agree with some of the other reviews about Chubby Cattle. For the price, the only thing chubby is their coffers when you leave. The meat is good and sliced as thin as the lima bean scene from a Mickey Christmas Carol where Mickey slices a see thru thin bean to feed himself, Donald and Goofy. The other thing in common Mickey has with this place is the price of a Disneyland ticket and your check when you leave this place. If you see familiar with Shabuya in LA, then this is a subpar experience at twice the price and half the quality in a return investment.  Sure the food comes through a rotating conveyor belt and you order the soup base and meat with the waiter. I can go to Sonic and they deliver your food on roller skates.  I honestly don't know the difference between the meat quality here and Swish.  The sauce station is a mix of confusion. There are just too much different choices to choose from. I ended up with a pretty nasty flavor since you can't really taste the sauce. Everyone seems to have their own style of satay sauce. Rarely have I found one that was tasty and nothing more than just peanut sauce mixed with oil.  I went with my two guy friends, ordered $70 worth of food and left hungry. All three of us vowed not to ever go back again.

LBtWCS92buBa3DKVXEF3Fg.text: This place is packed so go there early- got there at 5:30 and it opens at 5 and it was already packed  It was good- they not cheap on the sauces we fed 6 people around 160 dollars  service is really good  I would go again

SZnDUiSzCLlD6f-I81choA.text: This is one of the best Chinese style hot pot restaurants you can find in the US. You can find everything here from garlic king crab, kobi beef, to rack of lamb with spicy Sichuan style pepper, and sashimi. The food always comes on the most unique serving trays with special decorations, woods, and floral displays. It's always exciting to try new dishes. Or you can sit by the conveyor belt and pick out whatever you want for your soup. A very fun restaurant with great food, and always poppin.

BadEHp7OtetGpPR3B0Q_wA.text: Soo glad a friend recommended this place, because it's sooo amazing. First you choose your broth we had the house hellish in entry spicy and let me tell you that broth is SPICY!!! I love spicy but I don't know how you could even do the "numbing spicy." Lol Deni our server was wonderful very helpful and knowledgeable he answered all of our questions. We also had the shrimp paste since Deni recommendation it to us and it was weirdly so good, these are a must try. Honestly everything was delicious, this is my has become my favorite place. Just keep in mind that parking is very limited and give yourself enough time because it does get busy.

lUsYL59JVbibwRv0k7tzSw.text: First time here and on a Tuesday evening at 7pm. The parking lot seems like it could fill up quickly on a busier night because of all the businesses in this small center.  My friend called ahead and made a reservation for our group. The host at the front was sweet, she tried to get me to participate in a spin wheel game. One spin per party apparently and you can only spin if you follow them on social media.  I was the first guest there from my party so I asked to be seated at the table and I ordered a coconut mojito which the server boasted about. He proclaimed that people drove in from California just to have this mojito. I tried it, it was alright. I don't really like sweet drinks so he definitely sold me on this one. It did take a tad bit long for them to get it for me, as my entire party had arrived and we even got shots of soju, our pots, meat and baskets before it arrived. The server was kind and very excited to help, unfortunately he spoke a tad bit too fast and jumped around a lot when explaining the ordering process and such. I still don't even know if you could have the option of sharing a pot.  We each had a pot, I chose the beautiful tomato something and we split a veggie basket, some meat and mushroom basket. Besides the items you could order from the menu, there's a conveyor belt of frozen/raw foods you could add into your pot. My broth was awesome, I would most likely get a different one just to try something new if I ever returned. There's a sauce station which I thought was pretty neat because they had a lot of different ones. They also had some sides like edamame and stuff. There's large and small booths along the conveyor belt and I also think there was bar type seating too. I didn't visit the restroom during this trip. Overall, the place seemed kind of tight/clustered. I feel like the servers were almost colliding with each other. I might bring my family back here for a try, not sure yet really.

AQsILzcOB5e1WMSJxRCmuQ.text: The food is overpriced. Came here for lunch, same price as dinner, but no free appetizers. Four small pieces of tofu cost $1. A small bowl of vegetable is $2.99. Scallop is not fresh

kfpnGpxRfLjf7ua3aHnFjQ.text: Absolutely loved this hotpot spot. The food was fantastic for a reasonable price. I wish I had taken some photos but we were so hungry that we forgot! Our wait was ~50 min on a Sunday night, so we just played pool next door for a while. The food was great, but what was better was the service! Our server was Deni and he anticipated every need. Water was always refilled, empty plates were immediately taken out of the way, and he was great at recommending dishes. Not only that but he has a great sense of humor from start to finish. Every employee thanked us on the way out and wished us a good night. Thanks for the great hotpot experience!   Don't forget this place is cash only, so plan ahead. Also we couldn't find parking, so we parked in the lot across the street. This are the only two cons, but the food made it worth it!

3gmm7P9Knh_B2wgWhLWfyQ.text: Very attentive service and guidance by Deni (I believe this is his name!!). An experience that was fun for the entire family. Thanks!

o58fBtZ-bGuCTlfAb5Fx9Q.text: Good food.  Vegan soup bases are a little bland, but you can customize to your hearts content. Other broths are more flavorful.   Alcohol bar is just ok.  Get beer from the bottle rather than mixed drinks.   Music is pretty bad.  Honestly, its distractingly awful.    Tons of food to choose from, veggies, meats and fish cakes and fish balls.  My favorite is the house-made fish balls.  They're like fluffy clouds of dead fish dreams, in your mouth.   I'd come back again, for sure...if only to feast on dead fish hopes and dreams.

8UmGu29-PBzIq9XpDa-AaA.text: Update: switched from 4 star to 5 star. Came back again and the fluke I mention below was exactly that, there was no issue at all with the food coming out timely the second time around. Also got to order the house made noodles and oh my gaaaaw life changing, could piss you off though having to deal with subpar noodles everywhere else you go but they are so good you can't not get them.   This was delicious! Party of 6 ordered a seafood platter, lamb, ribeye and grabbed other stuff off the conveyor belt. I ordered the tomato oxtail broth, delicious, sort of rich though just a heads up if you want a lighter broth, but I still recommend it with that warning. A couple people order the mushroom broth, I read in reviews it was sort of bland, in our opinion it was perfect. Makes it more of like a shabu shabu broth but it still had plenty of flavor and I will be getting it from now on because it was super yummy. Spicy broth is spicy but good. It'll make you sweat a little.  We grabbed watercress (delicious!), spinach, baby bokchoy, noodle, tofu, peeled shrimp and maybe more from the conveyor belt but you can order it as well. Everything was fresh and cut or separated for easy cooking and eating.  1 star docked for kitchen/wait staff communication. We waited a long time for the ribeye to come out, like all of our meat was gone and it had not come. When it did come we got 1 out of 3 trays of it, (they are shaved thin and with 6 people 1 tray is about 1 slice per person plus 1 or two more thin slices) so it was gone quick and it was another long wait before the other 2 came (which they brought both that time). But they were super apologetic and seemed to just have a communication issue with one another, like I don't know what, but they seemed surprised we weren't getting what we ordered and talked amongst themselves to get it done.  Anyway we are totally coming back because this place is awesome and I am sure that was all just a fluke problem with our order. Everything else went smooth and staff was super nice and showed us an awesome dipping sauce that everyone loved. Highly recommend this place!

zZSNjZW5WY4DQdC6TmeNCQ.text: EXCELLENT! Best hot pot I have had.  Ordered the mouth numbing broth, it had such a deep taste past the hot, very very good!  All the items we ordered seemed extremely fresh, must have had a bucket to lotus root!  This was not on the radar for tonight's dinner, so glad Whatsherface stumbled upon it!  Humbly submitted,  Moi

G9m12qCLXCsXejiR_VNOVg.text: The food is incredible!! The service is great and friendly.   We had a great night! Our server Deni was great too! I always recommend this place!! We got a seafood combo, beef combo, Kobe beef, sea bass, and chicken. They get very busy at night on the weekends. Parking on the weekends is sparse and a lot of times I have to park across the street.

eg4lJeZP-kD_j5W0zKJ9PA.text: Fantastic service and even better food! Such a fun place to go and eat. When you're here make sure you look for Kwan, he is awesome and always makes sure you are satisfied. 10/10 would recommend!

BdPtLay9tM8SHURGLyFLkQ.text: It is absolutely awesome place to have perfect dinner. Also all of staff is really kind and friendly.  Especially Kwan explain more detail about all service and good benefits after we finished all dining. I will come again. Thank you !!

CUGaQZ_cO-kRfRwE0YDnuA.text: This was my first time going to hot pot and it was amazing . Our server jiaming was so nice and helpful showing us how the menu worked ever recommending food. He was a great waiter . ill definitely be coming back (:

QZ2gSjm6XUzXXISfAbBAlw.text: I was real skeptical about this place because I'm not big on soups but I have to say this establishment is delicious. I went with the original soup base. It had a light beef broth type of flavor. I threw in some udon noodles, rice cakes, imitation crab, 3 different types of beef, and my own concoction of garlic, soy sauce, chili paste, and sesame oil. ( there is a sauce bar at the front of the restaurant to customize your soup) I was having a lot of fun making the hotpot my own way.  My wife had the most popular oxtail soup base. It had a hint of tomato flavor. She added corn, beef, and glass noodles. I tried some of this and it was delicious as well.  One of my friends ordered medium spicy and he recommended not to order any of the spicy soup bases because there is a huge amount of oil that sits on the top.  Definitely order the oxtail base or original base and make it as spicy as you want from the sauce bar.  The servers were very friendly and helpful with understanding how to order from their menu and answered all our questions regarding the different ingredients.  The big question is would I come back again? I think so.

VFTtiTM1MCr0dcDlrVnDsw.text: Sadly I am not impressed with this place at all.  The meat is thinly sliced but the price is a little $$$.  You pay for the meat and the soup plus all the vegetable dishes your want.  We got here kind of late today, so there was already no appetizer at 9pm.   Sorry, we did have the spicy seeweed salad.   The lamb was the last photo, and really a bit thick and also small.  More like something I would stir fried.    The vegetable dishes are small yet around $3 a plate average.    The tri quality beef we ordered were average at best.    It's a fast choice but all these shabu shabu places are making me want to buy a meat slider.  I also think this place has heavy MSG, I am thirsty already and still inside the restaurant

yYkZmrLg00Oc2MjCWc0yew.text: Easily favorite hot pot spot in Vegas. Broths are all good, good noodle selection. They have decent specials as well. I wouldn't recommend coming on a weekend because it's pretty busy especially in winter. Lunch usually has no wait but only offered Friday and Saturday.   Japanese pork jowl is the best meat and a must have. "ITS DA BOMMMMMB" Beef combo is always safe. Noodle combo is also extremely good. Fresh vegetables are always offered. I would maybe stay away from the handmade meat balls in my opinion but many people actually love it.   Favorite soup would be the mala spicy one.   IMITATION CRAB STICKS. are a must. way better than the real shit. I come here so often it's actually ridiculous.  Huge shout out to my girl Jenny for taking care of us and being very responsive.

_QcQygAPs5e5v5rW505a6w.text: Came across this place in an article that gave top 10 places to try in Chinatown. We love hot pot and the concept of individual bowls was even more convenient, and I have never seen a hot pot conveyor belt. Glad we picked this place because I would have never known that it was featured on Travel Channel with Andrew Zimmern. So it must be legit.  They have two types of table. Tables that seat 4 or 6 that has a hole in front of you for individual hot pot. Or you can sit at another style table on the other half of the restaurant with the traditional family yin-yang pot that's shared in the middle. The server didn't even ask us and immediately seated us at the individual pot table.   He explained the meats and how to select items. First, was to pick the soup base, seven to choose from. As a first timer we went house original ($4.99) and tomato oxtail ($6.99). Second, meat selections are order from the server. We went with the beef combo ($18.99) of three types. That was enough for my mother and I. For veggies, you pull off from the conveyor belt. The plates are color coded and range from $0.99 to $3.59 each.   The meat was tender and great quality. Soup base was yummy. The tomato oxtail was the winner. If you want additional spice or make dipping sauce, there's a station for that.   I'm not a fan of the conveyor belt because it seems like fresh veggie items, no longer become fresh. Even though it has a lid, it's not the same. The conveyor belt can be annoying if you see an item and it passes you but no worries, because you can always order it from the server instead of waiting for the item to get to you again. The soup base is what gives it 4 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Finished plates!
Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outside

zw-z7n4dnONIBF_UmWw1Yg.text: I can't believe I haven't reviewed Chubby Cattle after all of our visits. We've been here so many times and it is that good!  Ok I'm going to tell you the only negative about this place - the parking sucks! They're in a plaza with many other restaurants. So if you get here on the weekend during dinner rush, prepare to circle around the parking lot or park elsewhere and walk it here. My suggestion is to get here early, maybe before 6pm and you'll find parking spots. Lunch on the weekend is pretty good as well.   Now onto the positives! Their tomato oxtail broth is so good and this is what I always get every time. They also will refill your broth if it's running out with the same broth you order. Some places just either add water or chicken broth.   The meat quality is so good! My husband's favorite is the lamb. Mine is the brisket and rib eye. We save some money by ordering the combo. It's plenty of meat for the two of us.   The other things you add on like meat balls, vegetable and noodles are all good. The price for those is pretty reasonable as well. You can always get them from the conveyor belt that go around the restaurant. My favorites are: udon, fish balls with roe, bok choy, Napa and mushroom.   You can also create your own dipping sauce. My combination is: sesame paste, garlic chili paste, ponzu, garlic and green onion.   I can't say enough great things about chubby cattle. It's one of the best hot pot places I've been to. You should definitely try it out if you're around.

photos.caption: Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Extra vegetables.
Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The meat

Uy_qx8XXHjlDa3hwFclajA.text: I really enjoyed our experience here! The individual hotpots made it different and fun! The mushroom basket was awesome and so big, and the mushrooms had a nice variety and freshness. I highly recommend adding that to your order.  The beef and lamb combo was also a winner, as was the tofu skin! Great friendly staff as well. I would definitely come back here!

photos.caption: Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mushroom garden!

Zgt9BFNhE9u-XqRhaYN1rA.text: Dafaq is this crap? I can't blame the place for its shitty parking lot...or the other asian drivers, but after 25 minutes of braving the parking lot, got in and saw the conveyor belt thing that everyone keeps talking about.   TL;DR...this place is trash. There are veggies and crap on the conveyor belt and you order meats separately. The service is so, so, excruciatingly slow. Everything was really disappointing. The meats all taste the same, the broth sucks and the conveyor built selections was so unappealing. Had I not risked my life in the parking lot, and had I eaten even 10 hours prior, I would've walked my happy ass out of there.   Gross. Gross. Gross.

Oes6N6TnS288M8eNqBmHVg.text: This place is awesome. Before trying this place I had recently built an obsession with numbing Hot Pot flavors. And knew I had to go here as soon as I found it on yelp. In short, this place provides good flavor with above average quality product for an affordable price. They also provide a free sauce bar with numerous sauce options. This place   provided me lots of satisfaction and fulfillment, except in one area.   The service was quite good and attentive, but because we told our server it was out first time here he WOULD NOT stop trying to sell us on some BS promotion they were having for the Kobe Beef and Halibut fillets. We told him no 2 times. But as my girlfriend's mom came back to the table from her bathroom break, the server came back and asked us a third time. Obviously he knew she didn't speak english well and took advantage of that to sell her on the "delicious halibut/kobe beef at an amazing price".  I don't mind trying to sell/advertise your product, but don't try to mask it with some Fake promotion. Also, We already said no! Leave us the F**k aloooone!

-EE_1JpFNvO0e7JsPnaDxw.text: Had a good late lunch here yesterday with my friend. As first timers here, we wanted to explore on our own and try to figure things out. I guess we should have asked how to use the sauce bar because we kind of just concocted our own and ended up not using them anyway. We kind of just started pulling stuff from the conveyor that we thought would sound/look good with our Oxtail Broth. We also ordered the beef combo.   The broth was so wholesome and full of flavor. The thin sliced beef were so tender even with just dipping in the broth for some seconds. We got the same flavor in a shared pot but with a separation. We kinda wished we got two different flavors of broth so we could try. To sum things up, it was a pleasant meal and would definitely come back and even suggest this place to friends and fam who ask for food joints to eat at.

_KWXT_f3OxDVF9qTkUt_Zg.text: A great hotpot restaurant on many different levels!  Young, hard-working staff.  Very polite and ingratiating.  Management has trained them well!  Great dipping sauce station.  There are some premade sauces but also has ingredients where you can build your own sauce such as soy sauce, sesame oil, etc.  Love the flexibility.  You can order everything a la carte but my brain felt lazy on this day.  We opted for the noodle combo.  You get a good mix of different noodles.  Def recommend this combo option!  We also got the meat combo--again, did not feel like thinking!  LoL  I didn't take notes on the broth so can't help you there! XD  Holistically, this restaurant is top rate!  When in the mood for hotpot in Vegas, this will always be my first option!

PZqlr5m8KIfiiMiprALtvw.text: Overall, it's a pretty nice hot pot spot. It had a nice variety of food and additives to choose from, but dang, are you going to pay for it. Most hot spot places see a set price for, basically, everything you want. Here, you pay for, every, single, item. Even the broth you choose to cook in will run you roughly $5. All meats, veggies, noodles, mushrooms, etc., are charged separately and it quickly adds up. The food you do get is very tasty - especially the noodles. Just underwhelmed by what you get for the money.

photos.caption: Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. (Left) Beef and Lamb combo, (Right) Beef Combo. Cooking in the Mushroom broth

q_o_MmsGGLuswIQ9IOQIqA.text: Rain drops, drop top, I love eating chubby cattle hot pot      This place is probably one of my favorite hot pot places in Vegas -- I got the tomato oxtail soup, and the flavor was incredible. We also got the egg noodles, wagyu beef, and a bunch of other small things I forgot HAHA. The tomato egg noodles are made in house, and have a wonderful texture.   The service was also really great, and everyone was super polite and speedy.   My only minor complaint is that it does get kind of expensive (it was around $30 per person for the two of us, and I was still hungry tbh). Other than that, if you're a big baller, would highly recommend going to chubby cattle.

photos.caption: Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wagyu beef, tomato egg noodle, and !

hZOoloPeOoBLKiGjvh2Aog.text: Military discount honored:)  Delicious fresh vegetables, noodles and meat. Great attentive service and friendly.   Came in during the summer for lunch. Not too busy. We were seated immediately. The atmosphere and music were great: clean, hot pot in the middle of the table, we all had easy access to it and assist in the cooking. Comfortable seats. We were seated next to the conveyor belt with easy access to add additional items. Not all the seats have that access. We order the meat combo and vegetables and the burst of flavors exploded in my mouth. The meats were fresh and so were the udon and glass noodles. There is a serve yourself bar with their special sauces and what a great addition to the meal: savory and spicy.    I ordered the Jasmine green milk tea and it was the perfect sweetness for my dessert.   This place is located in China Town past the plaza and this was a great find, given there are so many choices to choose from in China Town. It's a hot dry day today and I personally like to have a light meal when the weather is hot, so this was a perfect meal for me.

xlUUM3Z1b7Yv0fMmzL2_aw.text: I'll round this up to a 4 but I really want to give it a 3.5. This is a standard hot pot place. STANDARD. It's as hotpot should be, and I like hot pot generally so its hard to mess up or be "bad" unless they serve poor quality meat/vegetables. I don't think its a life changing hot pot experience; I think there are better places out there in the West Coast.   This is not all you can eat; you have to order each item (things cost differently depending on the plate you choose).

q4oNyv63frbWaeDDrQDAPA.text: Deni is the best server ever. He's very knowledgeable, attentive, and friendly. He completed the dining experience this evening. The food is always amazing, and the prices are reasonable.   Edit- we love harry. He's the best. He always makes our day.

tqzBFukMTyh-qKpm-XtzoA.text: Ok sorry for the lack of photos guys, we inhaled everything before pulling out our phones.  ( `)  For broth, we got tomato oxtail and house hellish spicy. Bomb flavor on both, and the spicy broth really had that classic hot-pot 'makes you sweat' feeling. A very good thing!  On special, there was A-5 wagyu with egg(pictured) and Chilean sea bass. Beef was delicious and sea bass was really fresh.   To top it off, we ordered a-choy, fish ball with roe (yesss), fried tofu, shitake mushrooms, some quail eggs, and rice. Then grabbed some sauces and wood ear from the sauce bar.   I love how they have sauce combo recommendations on the sauce bar, it's really helpful to know which sauce compliments which meat!  Also, our server Deni was awesome! Came in the clutch with recommendations :)  Ps. Don't forget the soju

OChyZC8Wyd7fp331tgK2tA.text: My cousin saw this on TV, featured on a show with the very annoying and condescending Andrew Zimmern. Despite this, I agreed to try it since my cousin is the Best Guy ever. He has been bringing dinner to my mom and late father for over 15 years every Sunday. A saint. But I digress.  The place was full on a Friday night, and the wait system was based on whether or not your party wanted family style hot pot or individual.  They recommend the two-broth pot for the family. You order meats, veggies and add-ons. You make your own dipping sauces from a bar with suggested "recipes". Although I will pick apart the down side, it was four thumbs up in the end.   Pros: ice cold beer, TASTY broths, wonderful wagyu beef, shrimp balls and housemade wontons.  Cons: poor maintenance of the sauce bar (dirty, needs a sneeze guard... really? Keep your kids off of this.), longer than needed wait from wasted space used on the bar and superfluous conveyor belt, nonstop poorly behaved kids, inadequate ventilation.   Next time: I'll probably go later in the evening. I'll sit closer to the door. I'll get one of the spicy broths.

tda1fWywATh_-7Mu0LVD5A.text: Heaven or hell to start off, AND YES, the hell-soup side of your hotpot is HELL AF! I love it when my mouth starts hurting. I would really be careful in choosing your 'hot-scale', the HELL is defaulted to the '6' out of 10. I honestly would have preferred to be on level 4. The taste of their soup was absolutely amazing, it was very very rich and it goes perfect with either seafood or the meats. The servers are quick and also helpful with the good mix in sauces that will pair perfectly with your dishes.  The meatballs are handmade per order, we got a lobster one and their house-special. Truly, I will return and probably bring my friends and family here. I would try to sit by the conveyor belt maybe for next time. Great spot, great location, great tasting restaurant! Come visit with a hungry belly!
