OlLOTe-dXDTxEYSkzjtv8g.text: Friendly and super attentive staff. Lively  atmosphere.  Nice variety and selection of fresh ingredients, meats and sauces to choose from. The original soup base is tasty and not overpowering. The place gets packed so arrive early or make a reservation.

ZXYbNHw1Ie66J4oylVSlvQ.text: Never had hot pot before. Didn't really know what to expect. Pretty nice place, very clean. Service is very good. Servers are very attentive and friendly. Tomato broth was delicious! The "hellish" spicy broth was loaded with peppers! So many options to spice up your hot pot! Pretty decent price for food! I would recommend!

vNc_QpPTuuGwgR6NKORLyg.text: This place was amazing! My husband and I had the pleasure of being served by Kwan who was super helpful. He explained how everything works, gave us tips on sauce mixes and was ready to help us with any questions we had.   Serving sizes are perfect, atmosphere is energetic and the staff is extremely attentive. This place is now on my list of favorite places to eat in Las Vegas!

qny7vP0lf_u6GIsy27wD3w.text: Cute place for lunch/dinner! I like how you get to make your own sauce  I just wish there were more flavors of broth to choose from.

wq2VQNj1GgJgQ141lUnaYw.text: Very good. First time trying the hot pot technique and our waiter Deni was extremely helpful showing us the way. Food was fresh and delicious and filled me up perfectly so I was still able to go dance afterward.

jvMQlZF3RcUhE4oM8jLebQ.text: Great selection. Service was spot on, super clean, and packed. Great add to Vegas. Having been to Chengdu this is the closest thing to come to Vegas. The spicy broth is warm but comes in three levels. We tried the entry level and didn't have a ton of Szechuan peppercorns but the hotter versions might. The mushroom broth is awesome as is the mushroom basket. All the noodles are fantastic.  No alcohol license yet but they let you byo.  We will be back.

uS4xHeF6prE30BfV8YroKA.text: Chubby Cattle is awesome! It's your typical hot pot kinda deal, but the conveyor belt is a nice touch depending on if you sit next to it. Since it was our first time, our server Kwan helped us out! He explained everything pretty thoroughly so we knew how much food we were getting despite the pretty ambiguous menu. But overall, nice job chubby cattle. Nice job

Daf80ypejY5MfzNKdO0wSg.text: First time here. The food was delicious and and our server Deni was super helpful and friendly. Will definitely be coming back

zB5EWqoeZKm4TQ9T8g4Kug.text: I think this is one of the best hot pot spot in town. The original broth is so soothing and very tasty. The meat quality and also the veggies were great. If craving hot pot, this is the spot.

rRxD4ZoHwCNVYbXoF6B9zg.text: I brought my parents here to try it out with my husband and I really wanted to like this place. I was excited about trying it but, unfortunately it was a let down. Our first mistake was not making a reservation, when we got there I really wanted to try the conveyor belt but they had no room. The biggest complaint about this place is their customer service. The ladies at the front had difficulty communicating in English. I asked them if we could still get our own soup broths at the table and they said no we could only have 3. I figured that would be good enough since there is only 4 of us, but when we got to the table, you could only have 2 soup broths at most. The ladies are just speaking in Mandarin at this point, which annoyed me because my husband does not speak Mandarin so I had to translate everything for him. I also felt like the ladies out front had an attitude and just didn't really care.  They brought us a menu. Yes, just one for 4 people. I don't understand why. It should at least be one menu per couple? We went with the mushroom broth and the house hellishly spicy broth. We ended up ordering 2 orders of the beef combo, 1 vegetable combo, 1 seafood combo, 1 assorted noodles, and mongolian lamb skewers. So here is the weird part when we ask what is in the combo the server lists out some stuff and says if you are lucky there will be a, b, or c in it, for every combo. Isn't it kind of weird to have a combo be some kind of lottery system hoping you get lucky? Of course we just got the standard for all the combos. The service was just okay, they didn't really take away the plates we were done with.  I think the food was definitely tasty and fresh, with a reasonable price. I checked my credit card and we paid 127.49 for four people which I think is a decent price. I did leave 18% tip even though I felt like the service was lacking. My husband wanted to try to order the meats in the combo separately to see if there was a difference and made it a point to do so by ordering them separately by name, but our server just ended up bringing another combo, we didn't complain about it, just let it go and ate the combo. Our server came by and told us that if we give them a yelp review that we would get free ice cream. I declined, he seemed pretty shocked, but I am not about selling my reviews for rewards. He left quickly without asking us if we would like to buy any desserts. We waited for awhile, over 15 minutes and he never came back, not even to ask if we wanted our check. We ended up just walking up to the front desk to get our check.

xZBTJFI2K8ZHSD33nF9aXg.text: I just wanted to try it because of the conveyor belt. They had really good quality meats and seafood. The conveyor belt was cool but I didn't really use it because Anything good you had to order it. I didn't feel like the soup had any flavor but maybe my expectations were to high. It was just an okay place.

SA_BG7R6fQDrwmR3zWRu9w.text: First time here and I absolutely loved it! The service was great, the food was great, the whole environment was just great! The way you eat is really unique, there's a conveyer belt in front you with all kinds of veggies, meats, mushrooms, vermicelli, & even fresh salmon. There's also a menu for you to look at with different selections of soup, beef, pork, chicken, & seafood. The prices are reasonable too, so it's not too unaffordable. There's also a sauce bar with all kinds of different sauces you can choose from and behind that is a complimentary side dishes bar with a variety of different Asian side dishes to cool off your palate. Another cool thing is that they a car window where you can see one of the workers cut up the fresh meat! & for the drinkers out there, there is a full bar! All in all, this is a great restaurant to take your family for an outing or just to have a yummy dinner!

z1t2B-BhRdOGjHAN8RDp1g.text: Everything is really unique! Especially the revolving dishes! This is the first time that I've seen a hot pot restaurant with individual pots. One of the dishes you must get are the cheese filled beef balls!! Ordered the beef and lamb combo, the portion is bigger than expected.  The waiter Gilbert was really nice to all the customers(hope you read this!) definitely will come back again in the future!

uwyCnrOo4Krw8NAF2mUulg.text: My favorite hot pot place! The host is so cute and nice service !  The tomato flavor is the best in Vegas !

figuyzY-FqX9IMSWAv9WZg.text: I really liked this establishment! It can be a bit pricey but that's expected from a hot pot restaurant! The decor is cute and service was okay. Only downside was that the hostess didn't acknowledge us at all when we walked in. We stood there for a good 5 mins with no one attending to us and we were literally in front of the hostess all she did was stare at us occasionally, it wasn't even busy at the restaurant at all so that was a bit of a bad first impression.

gX5qjphtFut9av6a0q06UQ.text: Got the original pot and beef/ lamb combo. It's totally worth it if you come on a day with buy one meat get one free deal

zz3A-y_Tfh8E5MNJSXE1OQ.text: First time here with the family. The staff here was very friendly and attentive. The most unique thing we came across was the ability to make our own sauces. Overall, they had a large selection of meats, seafood and broths which was delicious and satisfying. By the wise words of my younger sister as we finished our food, "10 out of 10, would eat again."

QH5W0qEgf0yGQXbE1qiwsQ.text: Deni very kind and very good service  And he always come to our table ask for service The food is very fresh and good Nice music and very clean

g6IrYfgROAeEuR5OUmqaSg.text: It's our first time here, it really expresses me, the food is the best in Vegas, and the service is best. We will come back often.

_iTvUcU8PVrKNfAggHsA_A.text: This was my 2nd time here. If you are planning to dine here,  come a little earlier as its a challenge to look for parking space.  The interior changed a bit compared to when they first opened. It's still packed from the 1st time I was here. We sat by the counter and we had individual burners for our own hotpot. There were 3 selections for broths and a variety of meats, seafood to order. The rest of meats, seafood, vegetables are on a conveyor belt which was amazing idea. It's hard to figure out sometimes what you want unless you see it.   They had a buffet for sauces, create your own. When we were there they ran out of bowls to make your own sauce and had to wait until they bring more.   This is best comfort food for cold weather.

SJClQF8e_9BF0agNb4AAlA.text: Dinner for two!  Appetizers were great! Cook/Serving time were very quick enjoy the hospitality. Hotpot: It was good overall ! I had Dragon Seafood Pot. Presentation was great meats were fresh! Interior: Love the interior. Very unique and cozy at the same time. Bathroom: Clean with nice scent. Service was awesome will visit Cubby Cattle again next time I come to Vegas!

3ELm9MuNVmEPHk0QQ8LTzw.text: I must say that this place is definitely poppin' once it opens. Call ahead to see if you can make reservations if you do not want to wait long! This place is fun, crowded, and unique but still very pricey for hot pot! I do like their spicy hot pot soup, it isn't too spicy for me, but I am a spicy lover after all! They even have a soup selection for vegetarian and they have different flavored noodles bringing more uniqueness! There's also a little area to make your own dipping sauce, which is always a plus. They have a lot of variety and the conveyor built adds a nice touch. I didn't know, but there is happy hour that is buy one plate get one free. So make sure to see into that if you do go and want to save even a few bucks! The experience was good overall, but nothing overly amazing!

w-lNG_N717D6JhwA2Tgg7g.text: So good!  We got the oxtail broth and spicy broth, both very rich in flavor.  Highlights were the sliced beef, grilled oysters, and hand-drawn tomato noodles.  We pulled a few extras from the rotating conveyor belt as well.  Highly recommend and suggest the trip here off The Strip!

Hf2hpTqkYSYaSF4iH0k9ow.text: Yes, this place is expensive. But I personally think you get what you pay for, which is awesomeness! The sauce station is the absolute bomb, I love the conveyor belt style of the restaurant, and I love the plethora of meats they have. You really can't go wrong with this place. I introduced this place to my family and now they're hooked. We go there for special events, or if we just feel like being fatties. The servers are really nice and accommodating and their playlist for music is pretty fun. I heard your Porter Robinson playing, good on you. I usually go for the numbing spicy soup base, and my boyfriend gets the oxtail soup. Both I highly recommend. I wasn't too impressed with the House Special base, but it didn't detract from the awesome food party going on in my mouth. Their handmade noodles are pretty legit, too. Love the green tea noodles. Keep it up, guys!

bozhSFP8je07skf1XpgrFw.text: Deni is the best . He is very nice and patient and let us have a very good experience at Chubby Cattle. We are sure to come back again.

LjJGSCV9W_bkR7auL9C_0w.text: This is my favorite place ever! We visit here weekly and each time ask to be seated with Deni. He knows what we like, always has our order ready to go, and does it with a smile. If you want amazing hot pot, delicious pork wontons, fabulous fried tofu rolls and Deni's impeccable service Chubby Cattle is your place.

PqG-hkDrkCa042nBFEnncw.text: Sooo good!! Fresh everything, a conveyor belt of greatness and a condiment bar. What else could you ask for??! Soup options for meat eaters and veggies! Totally worth the wait if there is one..

0517tqnV3eO-e62Gawyvug.text: We are celebrating birthdays and it was a great experience! Fresh seafoods, meats and veggies! Deni is our server and his service is 5 stars! Very recommended!

NQhDsmO7D_2ijOWnz4pMvA.text: Decided to eat at the Chubby Cattle on a whim and was pleasantly surprised by how much I loved it there! I've been to a couple hot pot places--both ayce and not--and was happy with the variety of selections and quality of meat. The service was absolutely amazing from the host to the server and anyone else who came to help us. On a Sunday afternoon, my boyfriend and I got seated right away though I can definitely see this place filling up! We got a family pot so we could choose three flavors of broth (I would recommend house and oxtail broth because the spicy one was a little too much for me to handle) and chose the beef combo. Everything brought out was in perfect portions and even if you ask for more, it came out quickly. Plus there is a sauce bar where you can concoct your own dips or follow simple recipes to bring out the best in your food. Definitely one of my new favorite spots to eat in Vegas! Coming back again next time!   The only thing I would warn customers about is the parking lot. It fills up real quick but with so many great food spots in one plaza, that's bound to happen.

photos.caption: Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4tvcUebdh70VbMui-uklWw.text: In LOVEEEE with this place! We had a weekend trip to Vegas during Lunar New Year, made reservations on OpenTablet.com, but somehow our reservations were lost. LUCKY for us, we came at the right time and they had a few tables open. We got some side room, so we were in there ourselves. I was pretty happy with that since it was fairly loud outside. It was a "build your own sauce" place, with a whole table with probably around 20 items to put in your sauce. Options for hotpot broth is traditional or spicy, the ingredients had a HUGE selection of meats, vegetables, non-meat proteins, homemade meatballs, noodles, plus some! We had only so much room to fit in our belly, therefore we chose the "interesting" noodles, basket of vegetables, homemade meatballs, and choices of meat. We each had our own pot due to the tablet set-up. I would LOVE to come back!!

Kept asking our server and other people that work that night regarding where about is your soup. Our server kept on telling us it's coming out but they didn't even have our soup ready! Then  the table to our left sat down not To long after us order and for their soup within 5 mins. What kinda service is that? Finally our soup came out. I order oxtail soup. Apparently it ran out and our server didn't let us know! His excuse was they ran out of the ox tail. But he didn't even check with the kitchen. Matter fact the soup wasn't even oxtail base it was tomatoes soup base. White rice ran out but hell the couple sitting across from us got rice. We didn't get ours. They didn't want to cook more per the server. It wasn't even close to closing time yet. Server should went to the kitchen to check himself. But instead he just assume and blame everything on the kitchen. Just because he was too busy taking orders. We were so annoyed we didn't even enjoy our food. I would ever go here ever again!

eUXh9BDlWeva7QxqwaC2Mw.text: This place was a gem that my wife and I found on yelp. Had great reviews and I can see why.  The service is awesome. Our drinks were refilled without us asking. The beef combo was yummy and the mushroom sampler was so epic. There was an over abundance of mushrooms, and some were types that I have never had before. The presentation of the food was excellent as well. Not to mention the selection of sauces and condiments is unrivaled by anywhere else we have ever been. Thanks for a great experience.

vjp2BfY7EG2MJ7BlFqbTJQ.text: Awesome spot for hot pot. Can be intimidating if it is your first time, but the staff is very friendly and helpful. The basics are choose a broth and the waiter will bring it out and set on the heating element. Order your meats and veggies to be cooked in the broth. Enjoy.  The conveyor is fun just grab what you want and the waiter counts the plates at the end. If it's your first time try the original broth or the mushroom. The beef and lamb combo for meat is very good. Recommend reservations as this place is very popular.

RKU2UHdYq4gnAMJMuBbyzg.text: Came to chubby cattle for first time. It was a great experience as first timer. Xiao, our server was attentive and great thing was that they refilled our broth at no cost!! Will definitely be back as hubby and i had a wonderful experience!

ftT91PKAtQ8mpdiSY-ck8w.text: Amazing restaurant! Since it was our first experience coming here, we were uncertain how the system works. But then, our awesome server Deni made us really good recommendations to help us out. He's super friendly and easy to talk to! We love the concept of a conveyor belt hot pot. It's super crowded, so try to make reservation!

LSK0b50EVG26Ezg4qkjUfg.text: The food was good and it was a lot of fun to eat there.  I took my kids.  However, I would say it should not be your first hot pot experience.

9DwbQD9UtZehMrF14pPSrQ.text: We ate here for the first time to celebrate my daughter's birthday. We are big fans of a good hot pot, but unfortunately up until now choices in Las Vegas have been very limited. Well let me tell you that all that has changed with the arrival of Chubby Cattle. This hot pot restaurant exceeded our expectations from start to finish. Fortunately for us, we made reservations prior to our arrival because it got crowded pretty quickly for a Thursday night. I think that speaks volumes about how popular the Chubby Cattle has become in the short time it has been here in Vegas. The interior of this establishment was well decorated, with the right amount of chic, but not over-doing it. Our booth seating provided more than enough room for the four of us. Unlike other hot pot places we have been to, this table had individual burners for our own hot pots. However it looked like they had tables for one big shared pot if that's your thing. Shortly after being seated, our server took our order for the types of broth we wanted (TIP: The "mild" spicy broth still has some kick to it) as well as our meat and veggie selections. The cool thing about Chubby Cattle is that, in addition to taking your order for the types of meats and veggies you want, they also have a conveyor belt (like Genki Sushi for those of you who are familiar with that chain) with other items you can pick from, ranging from varieties of mushrooms, to seafood, and quail eggs (honestly we weren't big fans of the latter but wanted to give it a try - YOLO!). They also took our drink orders (the watermelon drink was very tasty and refreshing) and shortly thereafter they brought out our individual bowls of soon-to-be boiling broths. So while we waited for our order to come out, we made our way to the sauce bar (which had an interesting pipe sculpture, modern art thing perched atop) to create our individual dipping sauces. They had a very good selection of sauces and spices to create our own masterpieces! After they brought the meat and veggies out, we set about the task of cooking them up in our own personal hot pots. I noticed that a lot of people weren't eating rice, which I usually like to have when I'm dining on Asian cuisine, so we didn't order any. Although it would have been nice, I suppose it's a good way to ensure you fill up on meat and veggies and not just white rice. After our bellies were full, a young woman (perhaps the manager) came to our table to ask how our dining experience was and we replied that we were very pleased. Since this was still a grand opening period, she offered us complimentary ice cream for dessert. Not being the types to turn down gratis dessert, we happily accepted the chocolate ice cream. Peanut flavored ice cream was also offered, but since that sounded a little too exotic for us, we just went with the chocolate (still wondering if it tasted like peanuts or peanut butter). Overall, dining at Chubby Cattle was a very pleasant experience, with great food and ambience. A little pricey, but when you're in the mood for hot pot, you almost don't mind. Happy Eating!

h-VI6u-JdfQsOF36aPitDg.text: Don't come here!  Food was not good.  Soup bad was ok,  but you have to pay separately for everything.  Even the rice!  Don't wast your time or money. Go to the Red Pot instead!

8tsr_dOxsHwRhdNOw0zy9g.text: This place is a definite must if you love hot pot. The food was great and the quality of the meat is top grade. The service was very good. The staff was  friendly and attentive, especially having to deal with 9 hungry savages. Joyce, the restaurant manager, was very friendly and really made you feel at home. I definitely recommend this spot to both novice and expert hot pot fiends alike.

O9QL5xq8A38r0JahDe_w5w.text: So good! Get the pork dumplings! Yum! They don't have their liquor license yet, but you can BYOB. I loved the spicy soup base and was pleasantly surprised that they had lotus root. Matthew was great!

rZph58DxmFqVl1zvffbBog.text: This was our first time eating hot pot but definitely won't be our last! Right when you walk in, I immediately noticed how cute (and clean!) the place is. We had a reservation so luckily, our party of four sat right away on a busy weekend (which made it so much better considering trying to find a parking spot was horrible). Best part was that we sat right by the conveyor belt and made this experience even better! Thankfully, our server, Matthew, helped us figure out how to order and was VERY patient with us! I got everything he recommended (house soup, enoki mushroom, thick noodle, beef tongue and mango juice to drink), and everything was BOMB! Don't forget to make your sauce at the sauce bar! I made it just how they recommended for beef items, and it went perfectly with my soup! I also loved the idea of the conveyor belt coming around with more meat and veggies so if I didn't want a large portion of something off the menu, then I could just grab it off the belt. Be careful though! That belt stops for no one!!! Can't wait to go back here and try the other soup bases and meats!!!

r5cuU0qNnefYFKmDqcyD-Q.text: i waited 2 hours only ate vegetables. Too slow. Spicy soup is not any spicy. I tried the most spicy that it cost $21. Too bad and too hot place.

dys3cXZ2JlDiiqw-qdp_7w.text: Will definitely come back! Great idea of individual pots! Good food and good service!

0_n5zOH740CZnC9vU-H57Q.text: We come to chubby cattle all the time. The food is great ( love the ribeye), the service is the best and the atmosphere is FUN. I have never had a bad experience.

QFipyxCQacnr94M1rSLDhA.text: Been here 3 times. Here's my favorites: Broth: mushrooms Beef combo for $20- thinly sliced and juicy!  I'm seriously satisfied with just that but you can grab whatever else from the conveyor belt. Here's other items I've tried:  oysters: fresh and yummy seafood combo: great presentation, but I didn't think it was worth the price. I didn't like the octopus, super chewy to me. mushroom combo: not worth the price, I would just stick with choosing the mushrooms I like from the conveyor belt (my favorite is the enoki). meatball sampler: the presentation was beautiful, but didn't taste all that great, we liked the meatballs from the conveyor belt better.  Also learned that you can only make reservations for parties of 4 or more.  Parking is always terrible so we usually park on the other side of the strip mall pass Snow White.

Xrc-O9qEIZKy6KaFui8QGQ.text: I am normally not the type of person that likes to spend my own time writing a review as you can probably tell since this is my first review on this account. However, I just feel the need to express my concerns this time due to the way my incident was handled during my dining experience...  First off, this wasn't the first time I came to Chubby Cattle, I had no prior unsatisfactory experience here before until today. My girlfriend was craving hotpot so our first natural choice was Chubby Cattle since we both really enjoyed it previously. Our server Matthew had us seated and we began ordering like usual...  We normally never order any items from the seafood menu as we prefer their meat selection more but this time we decided to give their seafood combo platter a try since the guests next to us ordered one and the presentation was really beautiful. Along with that we also ordered some beef briskets, veggies and bunch of assorted items from their conveyor belt...  The dining experience was going nice and smoothly with service and most of the food being on point like usual. This took a dramatic downturn when the supposedly "beautifully-presented seafood platter" was brought to our table...  It had a assortment of shrimp, clam, scallop, crab leg, fish, and mussel. Anticipating the taste of this dish, we put a little of each into our broth and let it simmer for a good couple minutes. The shrimps and scallops was amazing but the RED FLAG comes when we go for the mussels...  I put a little of our sauce on top of the mussel and attempt to scoop the whole thing into my mouth as if it was a oyster. As I try to separate the meat from the shell using my mouth, I noticed a weird texture when I chew down on it, something I wasn't familiar with as I had plenty of mussels in the past. It felt really hairy and crunchy at the same time, so I immediately spit the whole thing back on the shell to see what it was that I bit into. I was thoroughly disgusted when I saw a bunch of black hairy leg-like thing protruding from the flesh of the mussel. I wasn't able to identify what that thing was. And from another piece I took out from the broth, I saw a random whole-small crab inside the mussel itself. Without further or due, I ended my meal there without finishing anything else from the seafood platter as well as what is in my broth.   I informed my server of the situation and all he came back with is that the manager said it was a natural occurrence as they are the things they eat...seriously? So I had to personally request to have the manager come over and told her that explanation was unacceptable. I mean come on, If I were to order pork intestine from a restaurant, I expected it to be thoroughly clean despite knowing what is consider as a "natural occurrence" that takes place in it.    She told me that the mussels are from a supplier at New Zealand and they were the one who supposedly cleaned and cooked it before shipping it to Chubby Cattle...but hey, how about doing some inspection on it yourself before serving it to your customers? It is only a standard process for the price you guys charge. Not to mention she also told me this type of incident also happened previously to other customers as well so all in all, this should bring a RED FLAG to you guys to either switch suppliers or have a thorough cleaning of such products when you receive them.   The manager kept trying to push the responsibility to other things instead of owning the experience. She did however apologize and say she will reflect my concerns to the team and said she will see if she can do anything for me. When my bill came nothing was altered, and I can see from a distance she just kept talking with her co-workers, laughing and chatting along. This just makes me feel like she wasn't sincere at all and that your management just doesn't care anymore. It wasn't until we told the server Matthew that your management said she will do something in regards to the bill that they then finally went ahead and removed the seafood platter (we only partially consumed the shrimp and scallop, everything else was discarded because we were disgusted) from the bill.    I work in the hotel industry in a 5 star luxury resort setting and I understand how important customer service is to maintain and generate loyal guests. With all due respect, I don't expect the same level of service standards from Chubby Cattle, but come on, your server itself saw those disgusting hairy legs coming from the flesh, it could be potentially hazardous as it is something unidentifiable. Trying to brush off and escape the situation instead of proactively dealing with it just tells me a lot about your company.   I had always suggested Chubby Cattle to my friends, family and numerous guests that come to our hotel when they ask if I know a spot for delicious and unconventional Asian cuisine. This is such a big disappointment...I don't think I am able to recommend this place anymore or even come back at all

_UJkeCiSoAJFjvCFc2Y3yQ.text: Service was veeeryyyyy mediocre. Though it is expected from an Asian restaurant, there are a lot of upcoming Asian restaurants that have more modern style serving, therefore a better service. We had a reservation and they sat us about 20 minutes past so that was kind of crappy, a lot of their sauces/ toppings in their little sauce section was empty, and our server didn't really understand that we were 3 different groups (2 couples and 1 guy) so a lot of our food was combined. Which we reiterated it wasn't supposed to be family style.  The food, however, was AMAZING. Left extremely full. The homemade noodles were really good, the broth was amazing and very flavorful, my bf and I added brisket and the meat combo. And I got quail eggs, mussels (which I would definitely skip) and mushroom.   Altogether, I will be back. Just wish they cared a little more about their reservations, topping refills, and common sense with how we wanted everything split.

KjCufWGPA--z4flPXdqFvA.text: ORDER the BRISKET!!!  First time trying the conveyor belt hot pot. Overall experience a 10/10. Mushroom broth plus all the different sauce was definitely enjoyable. I had the opportunity to try the brisket, ribeye, and pork belly. Ranking in that order just in case. There were other plates, not worth mentioning.   Hopefully the choices on the conveyor belt would change. The options/choices were the regular stuff you can get at 168. Can I byoi?  Bring your own ingredients? Charging an arm and a leg for my fav imitation crab meat.   I don't know if there would be a next time, easier doing at home. However was a very unique first time in this establishment. Had to try it out.

mTLx2sEhNoQJEj2iHkZWmw.text: Hot pots featuring traditional Chinese medicine ingredients for tonifying the body has been around for a while. The Chubby Cattle, literally translated as Cow Demon King, is one of the best.  Ingredients are fresh, and the flavors are delicious.  Do not spend extra on the fancy $25 Waygu beef.  We tried it, and it was no where as tasty as the ribeye at $9.99.  The large condiment bar has every flavor you want for dipping, but be careful or you will go home stinking of delicious garlic.  Negatives were - broken credit card machine forced me to drive to an ATM at 11 PM in Vegas.  Seriously, what self respecting business doesn't have a mechanical swiper?  It took about 10 minutes at 10 PM to find parking due to the packed lot.  You may consider parking near by.    Our second visit was smoother, with a working credit card and a much more varied edm mix.  We will be back.

U3GZAyC4Nd-l0nc42vRIjA.text: WOW!!! We have been to many hot pots but this was the most impressive. The broths are well seasoned and plentiful. The meat is really reasonably priced. Plus, they have the conveyor belt option for veggies, noodles, tofu, etc. They also have a self serve sauce bar with a dozen different sauce/add-ins. So many options to keep your taste buds happy.   Zoe was a fantastic and attentive server. She always checked in to make sure we were enjoying ourselves.   Highly advised that you make a reservation through Open Table. Otherwise, the wait is about 40 mins.   If I had the money I would take this back to Los Angeles and franchise the hell out of it.

UzAPiudfJXbkOdE6zjo_2A.text: Wow, we've been to many hot pot places (as you can see on my help) and this place, is the BEST!!! Their sauce is so good especially their peanut sauce. I've tried many before and this is really on point. Their soup base is soooo good too!!! Wow. We were really impressed and ate a lot (as u can see on my yelp as well). We also want to thank Alex for his hospitality, kindness and professionalism. Everything he recommended was delicious!!! Thank you so much, Alex!!!

6NjCs8PobHePtr11-3mLTg.text: It's a unique experience in the U.S. but common in Asia. Many options on broth in which to cook your veggies and meats. My favorite was the tomato-based broth, which added nice flavor to the otherwise bland veggies. For the unitiated, I would advise that you first try Chubby Cattle with someone who knows the ropes and can guide you on how to make your own dipping sauce and what meats to order. It can be a bit overwhelming if you come in cold turkey, though the staff is friendly and can help a lot.  Biggest danger is choosing too many items with no knowledge of the price. It gets expensive fast and a glance at your bill can end up inducing acute indigestion. It's one if the reasons I tend to avoid dim sum.

HJQW60DuSlWhArsKmBtPTg.text: Caught off by surprise!  We were somewhat skeptical about this place and was having doubts that it may not be good due to our hot pot experiences in the past although this place had caught us off guard and it was tremendously delicious. They have many sauces from you to choose from to dip with your meat and other side of condiments, they also have a belt line conveyor belt that you can choose your side dishes to go along with your broth.  We left happily that we've chosen this place.  It definitely had hit our hot pot craving!  We were very satisfied and will come back again once we visit Vegas next time!

AJyKLqq1EgmySb8d0_JqhA.text: Excellent food! Small place but the food finely make up for it. Will go for the 3rd level of spicy on the broth in the next visit!

owkeg5mvl-v3pf1pBLi_uQ.text: Apparently, owners do oversee reviews and responded to my review left in regards, hopefully they reorganize there better way of booking reservations and also offered us to come back so they could make better of the situation and bump our 3stars rating up to 5stars. All I can say is, first and foremost, I'm happy to whoever responded to my review, yet, that will not change my first time appearance review experience that's honestly True.   I will try your place again in due course time!

irAE_mvVgbidhPHc3VKrnA.text: A friend of mine brought me here for the first time, and I am hooked! It starts off with picking your soup base which range from mushroom to their house special. You then get to pick the items of your choice off the conveyor belt. This place is also vegetarian friendly! Your hot pot is set in front of you, and then you throw in your items. Their mushroom soup is my absolute favorite. I will be back here soon! Kwan was extremely helpful with explaining how the process works, attentive on making sure our needs were met, and overall a sweet person!   happy hour: Sunday-Thursday (9:30-12:30) BOGO free

photos.caption: Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A night ending in full bellies and good conversation!

zXKeQJP8JR9ONXOrlytOJA.text: CHECK OUT MY SAUCE!!   Definitely coming back here when I'm in Vegas!!! When walking in, the food train had already caught my eye. It wasn't until I turned my head right to see a bright godly light shining on their sauce bar..  I'm known for being a sauce boss and to see their sauce bar amazed me. However, I did think it repeated itself but I walked around and nope!! Not at all. ALL different sauce so I added each one into my bowl.   My favorite thing at the bar was the enoki mushrooms wrapped with beef was my favorite dish; we had to get two! We also got the lamb and beef which was good. The charcoal lamb racks were delish as well. Thanks to Gia our server, we had a great experience here and will be coming back with friends and family!

photos.caption: Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Left bowl - soup bowl Right bowl - sauce bowl

gqGqfaaG1DvrzKZV1otkpg.text: Hot pot is something you don't hear to often in the Las Vegas foodie scene let alone Mongolian food. To my surprise, I was very excited about this restaurant opening especially finding out that they would have a conveyor belt full of various dishes.  The family and I decided on this place because we were pretty much Chinese, Korean, Japanese, Vietnamese and even Filipino out. We have been wanting to try something new and different for a awhile. Since I'm the designated unofficial planner for my family. I pulled up my Yelp account and came across Chubby Cattle that I bookmarked.  When we got to Chubby Cattle, the staff immediately greeted us and we were seated upon entering within 2 minutes on a Friday night. We got place with a table that was next to a conveyor belt, because not all seating arrangement have a conveyor belt. Our server Kwan, was very friendly and attentive to our needs and explained to us the concept. We decided on the Halloween Special Combo at the time since it was suggested by our server. We got a huge pumpkin carved out wit a variety of meats, shrimp & dumplings. Included was a bowl of various vegetables. I personally like the fact that the Hot Pot was built with a divider so we had the option of 2 soup base. One was tomato paste broth and the other was a mushroom flavor broth. Both were delicious and paired well with everything that came on our combo. There was a few dishes we added ala carte from the conveyor belt like quail eggs which happens to be a favorite of mine and my sisters. Overall the whole experience was amazing and definitely will be a topic for discussion with our extended family and friends. The cool thing about our dinner was how my parents actually enjoyed their meal. Even though they are biased with many Asian restaurants.   The only thing I noticed that could be improved on is their clarification of the menu. It could use more description of what is being offered and specifically how big of a portion each combo can feed. Plus the options of adjusting according to group sizes would be beneficial. However, everything was great and I would recommend everyone to try this dinning experience out!  Kwan, Thanks again for the awesome service! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Table top cell phone holder

i1l40caC5ClORBZSoAZ7SQ.text: Came around 6:30 pm and our server was Deni.  He was quick, efficient and checked on us often.  Very friendly guy.  Partner and I come here often and highly recommend Deni as a server.

LRpQ4GIC-RBhXIh-stML-w.text: Very helpful for a first time vistor. Very delicious. Definitely will be returning on my next trip.

6_A0LWrOa_q2wwC01iIt8A.text: This was a yummy place. Lots of choices and sauce choices. Mixing the sauces was a lot of fun  I got the midlevel hell and it wasn't spicy enough with the mala (numb spice) so if you are an avid hot pot water, go for the spiciest level of hell   The meat was very good. We got the beef and lamb combo and it was very good. For the two of us, we could have gotten two orders.   We also got the large fish ball order. It tasted like the regular fish balls you would find but they were 4x the size so I recommend you just getting the small. If we hadn't ordered the large, it wouldn't have been too much food. The large comes with 8 and the small comes with 4.     Very busy but service was great with our waitress Angela.  Very attentive and if you sit on the high top with other guests, there is no wait.   It is BYOB and there is a Walgreens around the corner no cork fee and they give you wine glasses :) service was great

CLSH4ld6KPpdtLJ2Ejf3eA.text: This is  husbands and I  favorite hot pot place. We love their fresh quality food. Our favorite dishes are the seaweed salad, the beef, and the udon noodles. We also love the broth. The guest service is great and we had a wonderful server named Deni and he was very helpful and kind.

uhrJrak21cx2ZrZY5C3seA.text: My first time here and it was amazing! Deni was our server and he was great recommending items to us. Deni made our experience even better. He recommended us the seafood combination and we loved it. The coconut Mojito is a must as well! Everything was delicious! Very pleasant atmosphere and great service! Definitely coming back !

CL4lcKOBB5oZajH6jxV9qQ.text: My friends and i had decided to come here on a Thursday evening to try it out since it has been highly anticipated for a long while. We had heard rumors of Little Sheep styled Hot Pot would come to vegas and this was supposed to be it.  My friends had arrived earlier and had been told that it will be about an hour wait for the tables next to the conveyor belt because it is almost purely reservations ONLY and there was an opening in an hour. My friend had put her phone number down and we went to District One for a snack. About 1 hour later, we returned. The hostess states she tried calling and the phone number did not work. Another friend looked at the number and tried calling. Worked perfectly fine. Does the hostess know how to call out of state numbers on a land-line? Does she know how to use a phone? She doesnt seem to be much experienced on customer service as her attitude towards customers is very poor. No apology or excuse. Just chugged along like a headless chicken.   We waited another 10 minutes in the cramped space by the entrance with others coming in through the door squeezing behind and in front of us before we were taken to our table, which was still incompletely set up. The person setting up apologized for the incomplete setup, which was appreciated as it was not his fault we were taken to an incomplete table.   We sat around for 10 minutes before our server came up, asked for our drink orders, and brought us 1 menu. The menu's are designed non-traditionally and mounted to a paddle. So holding it is a bit weird.   While deciding on what to order, the waiter had asked us what soup bases we would like. But he said the house original and house spicy were out and only mushroom, seafood, and tomato were available. We had almost got up and walked out. The manager had came  up and said it would be ready in 10 minutes, if we were willing to wait. So we did. We had asked the server what the difference in size was between what was going around the conveyor belt, the combos in the menu, and the separate orders. He had to go get the manager to help us. The manager told us the difference was 5 oz and 10 oz for combo. The asian in us were highly confused as the math totally did not add up. It was about $11 for the lamb shoulder and beef brisket, as told to us by the waiter which the combo consisted, but it was about $17 for the combo. HUH!? An order had came to the "window" and he had showed us the size. It was a large plate with lamb shoulder piled high and he said it was a single lamb shoulder order. We thought, oh wao... Single order lamb shoulder is actually pretty decent sized at $5. Assuming beef brisket is about the same at $6. Manager seemed quite clueless too  We ordered 1 order of each, along with 2 large orders of watercress and napa cabbage, and a large order of fresh thick noodles.   When the soup bases had arrived, they had looked a bit "clear" to me and my friend. As we were quite used to the white herb-y broth from little sheep, this had surprised us. It had a slight transparency to it and not fully white. When i tasted it, it felt watered down and tasted more salt/msg-like. Thats disappointing. Smelled great ! tasted meh  We had got some oyster mushrooms, enoki mushrooms, glass noodles from the conveyor belt but nothing else looked good. One of my friends said some of the oysters look like they are going bad, as some were turning yellow. Selection-wise in the conveyor belt is quite minimal and seemed to repeat quite often, nor seem like many people are going for it either.   When the meats arrived. Give or take maybe 12 slices of meat per order and was NOTHING compared to the plate he had shown us earlier. The one he had shown us was on a round white plate, meat "rolls" piled high. Ours were on a long rectangular plate, with meat flat and layered. what the hell? we had asked about the size and the waiter said it is dependent on the slicer/worker in the back. I joked with one of my friends that we could tip the meat slicer and get quite a bit more. lol of cos we didnt do it but it was quite tempting.   The veggies did not look that fresh. Especially the watercress. Bunched together in a "cup", it was quite hard to "separate" to share and some parts were turning yellow. Napa cabbage was in a bowl, cut. Kind of hard to screw that one up.   Most disappointing was the "fresh thick noodles". definitely not fresh. nor were they thick. We LOVE the fresh thick noodles at Little Sheep. this is incomparable. in a large order, it was 3 "bundles" of noodles. all dried. and they had the thickness of maybe somewhere between angel hair and spaghetti. definitely not thick. Fresh? uhhhhh  In the end, our waiter had apologized to us as well for the confusion and minimal amount of info and knowledge he had. He stated he only started working there 3 days ago so his apology and willingness to help us was much appreciated.   Definitely wont be coming back any time soon, if ever again. Won't recommend anyone to try

Niryv-IAYK89ucFM5ZbMdQ.text: When I was in Vegas back in April, I was looking for a good dinner option - preferably away from the strip. I had planned most of the meals during the trip but came up short one evening. Of course, I yelped and found this place. Fast forward to today and I still think of this place from time to time. After my meal, I remember telling my parents that this was the best restaurant that I have ever eaten at. I still stand by that statement today. The servers were great and explained in great detail on how to order and the customization that is left to each person since you can get your own hot pot! This worked out perfectly since my parents and I are like the three bears - my dad likes super spicy, my mom likes a little spicy, and I prefer mild. Overall, I had a fantastic dining experience. I have been to resolving sushi bars before so I loved seeing a conveyer belt used for hot pot ingredients. I would highly recommend this place to anyone who visits Vegas.

O-tCg_wfKoXQaj23eS0OmA.text: I have only started going to this place about 2-3 months ago, and it is now one of my favorite hot pot places in town! The meats are always fresh, and the portion size does not disappoint. However, what I truly love is their broths. I definitely would recommend their oxtail broth. It's very savory, and it adds a unique taste to the meats they provide. Deni is one of our regular server, and he's beyond amazing. He's very attentive, and caters to all of your needs! I'll definitely be coming back again very soon!

M_5EjgAtOKZtoAGJ0-MPZQ.text: Hands down - best Hot Pot in Las Vegas! A new take on a classic Mongolian speciality. Modern Mongolia :)   I'm from NYC and have had tried my fair share of Hot Pot restaurants near the NYC/Queens boroughs. After spending time in Vegas for work travel, I was nostalgic for authentic Hot Pot.   Chubby Cattle is a modern take on Hot Pot cuisine. For me, this gem hits all the checks.   1) MODERN ATMOSPHERE. You can't beat a conveyor belt - such a novelty that I haven't seen elsewhere.   2) THE BROTH. I'm a big fan of spicy hot soup base. This place offers multiple levels of heat (different broths that were boiled over x amt of hours depending on the heat). Haven't yet tried the spiciest level, but definitely recommended. Aside from that, I definitely recommend trying their Bone Broth for those who aren't a spice fan and prefer creamier soups.   3) THE PLANTS! Cute mini terrariums everywhere!  Check the lights :)   4) SEAFOOD SELECTION. The restaurant offers a great selection of premium lamb and beef dishes. However, they truly shine in their special seafood offerings. Lobster, Jumbo sweet shrimp, and more - a perfect high end selection for those  looking to indulge.   Will definitely return with friends and family! A great spot for group dinners (they even have a private tea room setting).   Love love love! Only recommendation I would make is that they bring a location to NYC!

photos.caption: Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Live lobster - super fresh, super delicious!

iQkloYpARPPj3Szvp9TRWw.text: The resto is good. Have wide selection of soup base for your hot pot. Other than having a hard time to park, and sometimes it gets really busy so u have to wait, the food is amazing, meats and veggies are fresh....

TTHgXJGn497Mc1vYyxzKpQ.text: Amazing. Food was great. Portions were plenty. Jenny made the best suggestions. House made noodles!

7nv4ZzkJr-GAz8F9lxHlXQ.text: This place is awesome. Love the Tomato Base Soup. The meats are really good, too. We had the brisket and the lamb along with some seafood. The servers are also great. Will definitely comeback.

2omXcX3KuCP5ywdx7NayWg.text: Got lucky and got seats here when we came in. It was pretty busy and full when we got here. We chose to do the individual pot for each person. My cousins got the spicy broth and the other one got the mushroom broth. I got the plain broth. I really liked the mushroom broth, probably will get that next time. We shared an order of the beef and lamb combo meat. Then the rest we just picked from the conveyor belt. It's such a cute place and it was pretty cheap for three people since we shared. I would go back here again for sure.

rpRCJ9vNKWOReMNKPNbBpg.text: Excellent place to dine . Portions are good for the price. 1st time here and our server, Deni, gave us good advice on what to order. Was going to order 2 meat combo plates but advised us 1 would be plenty.

a9rzS0EX4B5wNGNl1oL5Ew.text: We had a great time last night and our server was really accommodating. The food, atmosphere and the cleanliness from this place was excellent. I enjoyed the condiment station, wish someone could take a photo of the list so I can enjoy incorporating the sauces  at home lol. Our server was probably tired that he had a blooper by himself. We ask for a fork and he discussed the pork meat so we gave him a sign of fork so he smiled and came back with chopstick lol. It's even more funnier when he himself realized he grabbed the wrong one and kept on apologizing to us. He was such a good hardworking server though. I will come back in the future.

photos.caption: Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I had a.great time last night here. Our server was really accommodating. Food, atnosphere, cleanliness of the restaurant was excellent.

oG19oSKHW5sx9EpInVT46w.text: It's not you its ne I just not a really big fan of hot pot. Great service though and really like the bibbs they give you.

EZoyUSYmPOI8578LNn-rPA.text: Great new hot pot concept in Las Vegas. We went two nights in a row. Admittedly, the poor reviews here on yelp are harsh, but True. We also experienced customer services issues. However, I wanted to write a positive review, because I know they are new and genuinely trying. They have only been open 3 weeks. While it is a bit disorganized, I appreciate effort and honestly. I would take that over staff who feel entitled and are rude.   Issues we had were with them loosing our reservation,  missing parts to our order, having to request things multiple times, and also servers bringing out food that was not for us. Also, if you order any combos, expect to play tetris with your plates, as there is an extreme lack of table space. This is all mainly a communication error, and I am sure the staff just needs more time to get it together. They all seem very nice. I do not like fake people. However, one can only be so forgiving as there are multiple choices in dining in Vegas, and top notch service should be expected. Actually in my opinion there are too many serving each table and they are too busy to communicate with one another, so you will be asked for your orders twice, you will be brought your orders twice... Like I said....communication is the missing link.  The food is excellent. Presentation is amazing. Everything was fresh. We did the seafood combo, beef and lamb combo, the fresh meatballs, veggie combo, and noodle combo. All were very reasonably priced.   Do check this place out. It is a very interesting concept. I believe it will get better. I hope it gets better, as I do plan on coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood combo

jIcH8BvfE2GlMn3f89mW8g.text: I came here during their grand opening special and they had a buy 1 get 1 free on the conveyor belt items. it was my first time with the revolving belt, what an awesome concept.  they have about 8-10 different sauces. i pretty much tried every single one and was happy with the variety of flavors and the variety of dishes.   It wasn't too busy and they were able to accommodate me and my guest fairly quickly.  Oh, and you get green tea ice cream at the end!  Hot pot is now becoming a favorite of mine. =)

I had the wagyu beef, purple yam noodles, and pork dumplings. Will definitely visit again next time I'm in Vegas!

ZkKkBSvf3BJrox_nb9zqbw.text: A fun place to go on a date. A good section of quality food. It was neat seeing the conveyor belt go by as you toss the ingredients in the broth.

7sC-q0PG6TPEXRRrrn7Mvg.text: Our new favorite hot pot place in Vegas! Everything tastes great and we really like the customizable sauce bar and the conveyor belt of a la carte items. q6_ffsEVQSIAHoyXuBWj7g.text: KWAN , is probably the only reason why I would come to eat here excellent experience for a first time

L4sdfNkNbxoDy2xMLHb59A.text: We are at chubby cattle for my birthday. First time being here and the service and food is awesome. Our server, Deni is super friendly and guided us thru the menu. We will be back.

gd0Yr67E4BwDfdpEyeTngQ.text: First time to do shabu-shabu in vegas..excellent service, fresh food. I like the various sauce options that you can pick by yourself..in addition to the different dishes you can order other than shabu-shabu. We had grilled beef, oysters and shrimp-had no complaints and the execution was spot on! This place is highly recommended for a kick-back chilly evening!

E8TbNp03ZQeBdBmD_-JV5Q.text: Great new spot if you're in the area.  Similar to a shabu type restaurant but with more variety and options. My group needed up going a little close to close so the full menu wasn't available but the broth choices we had were great and the items coming out on the track were still fresh and tasty. A little overpriced for what you get but definitely a unique and worthwhile choice.

4Gr8Lp1ZXWF-d_t7xIy9VQ.text: My best friend and I went to this awesome hot pot restaurant. The server gave us a brief short introduce about their restaurant and food and helped ordering food for us. The food was delicious and the music they played was great with this dinning area. The meatball combo which comes with those little spoons are so cute. The beef combo and beef lamb combo are good-value dishes at the restaurant - highly recommended to people who is reviewing my post and haven't tried this restaurant before. My servers name was Gillbert. He was very friendly and willing to recommend their food to us. Overall this place was great! I would definitely go back!

RePUgflxEfgZW5Wtm9zBhA.text: We were expecting more from this restaurant after reading the reviews.  We ordered the wagyu beef and ribeye.  Do not order the wagyu.  It was totally not worth it.  The meat was chewy and looked more like bacon where half of it was pure fat.  There was no marbling of the fat and the pieces were so tiny!  The ribeye was very good and that was worth the price.  The side dishes on the conveyor belt were not very appealing.  We only chose the green leafy veggies to add to our hot pot.  The spicy broth was very spicy so I would recommend the least spicy of the choices.  Will we go back?  I don't think so.

IcUA66oFP5hUJMGIeI34og.text: This place is worth a try. The food is great with a responsible price. The service was great, we had Deni, he was very informative and his service was great. Would definitely come back again!

S24Rp36UmsHvHmb17oN3iQ.text: As much as i am fan of their food, you should make reservations or else you have to wait for about 2 hours during the evening time. This happened to us as a couple of times already. We've asked them a couple of times and they said we we're next after an hour. Another 45 minutes have passed said we we're next. 5 groups were seated ahead of us as they indicated they made reservations. It is sad to say we walked out because we were felt neglected as others are being seated. From a customer service standpoint, this is unacceptable. Other than that, their food is good but their seating system needs adjustments.

Xk6j-9YCwJHroki5r8foVQ.text: I have been to a couple hot pot places but this is by far the best. The beef and lamb were outstanding and the base (spicy) was excellent.  Really enjoyed the conveyor belt making its way through the restraunt. Made it a fun experience to mix and match the different items. Our server Mathew was great and I can't recommend this place enough!

qdDbuA88S9H2AUDaEDICcA.text: The hot pot was pretty good, it had a lot of herbs and spice in it that made eating really difficult. In general the food here is pretty expensive and unfulfilling. I would recommend this place if you're dying to eat hot pot and if you can't make this at home then this might be the place Or any other hot pot place that's a lot cheaper

hrPEsJ3K5PtJSwpGNA_Wkw.text: Deni a real one and the food bomb. I like the soup. I like the sauce. There fast despite of how busy it is. The reassurance has a cool convertor belt for additional stuff for the soup. It all around has a great atmosphere too.

aTSAbB2Fei1odc_XaVeAjw.text: Came with the family to try this new hot pot experience. the soup bases were awesome. Each of us ordered a different soup and each thought it tasted great. Really cool conveyor belt with fresh additional items for the hot pot. I really liked the variety. My kids want to come back and each try another soup base. Our server Deni was awesome and made some great recommendations for a good first experience. Come early or put in a reservation bc it gets busy here.

photos.caption: Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood platter

LBV_e9wu8VxSddAzLUuxrQ.text: Last night a group of friends and I came here for the first time. The food was good, we were all impressed with the setup of the conveyer belt, and I was excited to recommend this restaurant to my family who I thought would enjoy it. I really wish I got the name of our waitress because what she did completely turned me off from ever wanting to step foot in there again. We were thanking our waitress as we were walking out and I did not think much of it that she did not really acknowledge us. But she kept trying to look past me over towards our table and I had a feeling she was looking for tip money, which was placed under the receipt. My group of friends were saying our goodbyes outside when our waitress comes out and what she does just BLOWS. MY. MIND. She starts demanding more money because she is not satisfied with her tip. She just stood there holding up the receipts and did not want to leave until she revived more money. All of us were completely shocked that she had the nerve to chase us down and harass us about a tip. Tip is not mandatory, so where does one get the nerve to be that unappreciative and ask for more? And why would anyone even think they deserved or would get more after acting that way?! The tip amount was good and fair for the service provided. Our group was not skimping out on the money. Even if we left nothing it would not be okay for her to do that. Our group should have talked to a manager but we all just wanted to leave. This was not acceptable behavior and I hope this is not the standard for how their staff treats customers.  I really created this yelp account just to share this bad experience. That's how much it bugged me.

a6qZjPxbFh4ciZsaJ74kBw.text: It's our first time eating here, and let me tell you... It's pretty great. The food is good with lots of choices. Something I've never seen before here in Vegas! The staff are all so punctual and genuinely nice. Our server, Deni, was also very delightful. Can't wait to come back here!

3sKcjBypmCdLIRl2AEqFNQ.text: Broth was good. We had the original & spicy one. We sat at the conveyor belt table, but didn't get anything from it. All the sliced meats and seafood had to be ordered with the waiter. They have a do it yourself sauce station, but we just ordered special sauces from the waiter. The do it yourself sauces are complimentary, while the ones you order are charged per person. Our waiter was nice and patient.

zJ2TG_UFEzspv4Jee5RsXg.text: Been awhile since we had a meal at chubby cattle, like always food and service was amazing! Always loved the hot pot and converyor belt experience. Cant wait for the next visit!

T2Iyq8zaTEhZUw9dlyitmQ.text: Hot pot place for the win!!!  Try the tomato oxtail base. It's AMAAAAZING!!! Words cannot describe how good it is... either that or I was really hungry.   Deni was our server and he helped us out with so many recommendations!!! From noodles, beef sides, and seafood... he will not let you down. This was a great place to stop at on a rainy night.   You pick your own sauces at the sauce bar. Everything else is served to you. You can also ask for more soup base if you need it.

9oJ2yF0YYXCNAHaW3RAZcg.text: A few different reviews here. The House broth.... delicious! The choice of noodles that I went with was the green tea noodle. Was it tasty? Yes it was tasty but the serving amount was enough for my 2 year grand daughter. I like the the concept of picking my own ingredients, which there was quite a selection to chose from. My husband wasn't too thrilled with the idea to begin with and he's still not thrilled with this place. Then we had to go pick our own condiments and appetizers from the bar. Let's just say they need to keep that area a little bit more tidier than it was. Choice of appetizers were limited to 2. They do have a conveyor belt around the general sitting area but since we were in a large group we were sat in a private room. They take your broth order first and once that arrives, the waiter comes in and takes the rest of your order. He takes everyone's order except for one of my friends. We had to go and find the waiter to finish hers. Then we asked for forks for a couple people and took me asking twice before we even got it. After all the orders arrived, we realized everyone got theirs except for my husband and my friend, who's order they originally forgot to take. This wasn't a good experience and the questions still remains... we me liking the food and the bad experiences we had, would i go back? Let's just say it'll be a while before I even consider this.

QBr4jeQFRRh5wrFYBnPsGg.text: Deni was our server, excellent customer service always made sure we had what we needed and never let our waters empty as well as making sure we never needed to wait to order more delicious foods. Ordered the wagyu plate per recommendation was amazing and came out fast.

-DlDJXdx8jfjYKk5eBdS5w.text: Me and my coworker were wrapping up our Death Valley trip in Vegas and decided to try Chubby Cattle since my IG handlebar name was @chubbybokchoy... all in all best hot pot we have had to this day even when compared to some of the popular hotpot chains we have back here I n NYC! Our host Dani was very warm and welcoming, we thought he was one of the owners, though he claims to be "a small potato". I personally loved the spicy tomato soup base and all the seafood and meat were very fresh and delicious! Can't wait to visit again next year! ^_^v!

3NyUDmCQfXcZlVnnmSr88g.text: First time here and it was a great experience! Bill our server made sure we felt at home and guided us to a wonderful dinner. You will leave full and will want to come back for more.

OCPACAphKEZRLefmHW4A7Q.text: I just came down last night on 5/4/19. Not going to lie but the food here was amazing. Our waiter Deni was very polite and well mannered. He recommended us a bunch of food options and I'm very pleased that I went on with his recommendations. The wagyu beef was good and so were the color array of dumplings. They have really great customer service here. They always replaced my chopsticks although I kept dropping it. Thank you

FTuUjkbGRYnEThVQwehXvw.text: Hot pot is always a good option and this place was fun, full and delicious. We waited about 45 minutes at prime dinner time. I could see it getting longer as this place a little on the small side and it feels like hot pot is not an experience you rush. So after waiting and waiting, we finally got seated at a highbar with little pot areas. There are group tables, but we were seated in the individual ones. We decided one person to get the spicy (medium) and regular which was more bone broth tasting. We ordered many many items to go into our hotpot. Some were a success, some where not. The best success was the beef platter. My sister wanted to order two because she was hungry. One was enough for both of us. We ordered a variety of vegetables, head on shrimp, calamari and noodle platter. I would skip the calamari, it comes very watery and gets lost in the pot by the time it's cooked. The noodle platter was just ok too, different colored long noodles (red, green and black). I would just get udon noodles next time. The king mushroom, bok choy were delicious but the cabbage was overkill. I really liked the fried tofu as it absorbed a lot of the flavors. They will refill your soup if you ask, but by the time they refilled it, we were so full. One thing I would definitely do is skip the spicy soup and just get the regular one. I was not a fan or all the schechuan peppers. I'd rather have dipped it in my own hot chili or pepper sauce.  Their sauce bar was pretty awesome. About 20+ different condiments you can use to make dipping sauce along with a few suggested instructions. If you're a newbie or uncertain, go with the suggested sauce written on the bar. Also, they have fresh watermelon juice but I opted for a Blue Moon. We ended up spending quite a bit of money but I think it was because we were hungry and wanted the full experience. If you like sharing and soup, this is a great place.

fZ0QtsUqJ3ZJB1e2pHiPdw.text: The food here are really good and I love all the broth . There's a lot of options here. Everything is good but I hate the wait. And they're really unorganized about bringing the food. They don't bring up everything at once I have to always remind them to bring my food. I do like the sauce options, there is so much to choose from. Overall I do like the place , will be coming back

VgOKAcliRf2IOKChiQZtNQ.text: Deni was AMAZING and took care of us. It was our first time here and he walked us through the ordering process. He even showed us the best bangs for our buck!   For soup bases, we ordered the tomato oxtail and hellish spicy. Everyone enjoyed the tomato oxtail soup and I enjoyed my Hellish spicy soup base. It had a little kick but my tolerance is high so it might be spicy for some.   For our party of 5 1/2, we started with the Beef, veggies, mushrooms and noodles combos. All good portions and very tasty.   Conveyor belt for small side orders with prices determined by the design of the plates. (We added a few of these to our order and got a little carried away)  Overall, great experience and we will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood Platter

8lm7XhFVbKrjI5FWP1MZVw.text: Words cannot express how delicious this was!! My husband and I have been to quite a few hot pot places here and in Japan and this was definitely high on the list! Great food and love the conveyer belt that allows you to freely add to your hot pot at your own convenience. The broth was DELICIOUS!! Highly recommend and would go back in a heartbeat!

IwUtXgR0VJ_VnM2KArtuVg.text: Me and my friends are addicted to this place, their spicy broth is the best in town. Their staffs are extremely friendly and attentive. In particular Deni the server, greets you with friendly smile and he tries to make your dining experience worthwhile by suggesting daily specials and discounts. Absolutely enjoy going here.

f-jEeb3l3yS9xNZ_S2U1Mw.text: Had a blast at the chubby cattle with the family. The kids enjoyed it.  A full hands on experience. Our Server Deni was super friendly and attentive. Totally considering coming back. #bestfoodever

photos.caption: Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Best Food Ever Our Server Was The Best

IuAgSgYuHS75kNklHVSwtQ.text: This place is not my cup of tea. Quality of the meats are low. I ordered a Wagyu plate and beef tongue. My Wagyu is fake, you can totally tell by the looks of the Marbling. I don't think I got the real deal. I had Wagyu enough times at a Japanese Shabu restaurant to know what's real. I don't think I'll ever purchase Wagyu from a Chinese hotpot restaurant anymore.  Our server wasn't very attentive either, and kept wanting us to order from the revolving belt. They are smaller plates, and not worth the money. The only thing I love was my broth, and my mushroom basket. Not to mention I had to wait for about an hour for 5 individual pots. I understand they get busy, but it's not worth of my time.

0XbzZWWcUT0sDZYQZeCDjA.text: Gave this place 2 tries.... the price is definitely pricier compared to competitors and for the meat quality... meat is definitely harder  The variety of sides to order depend on the time you go... I went regular and happy hour  Happy hour is horrible- barley any sides to pick and just same ones keep rotating  Customer service is good but for $35 per person I would rather go eat authentic jap shabu with better meat quality

8sDj1rnijbJzuTts8UutIA.text: Best food ever. This is our first time here and I am really impressed by the food taste!!!! People are very nice, helpful and thoughtful here. Jenny is the one who give us excellent service and she mentioned the student discount and saved us lots of money. I love this place!

ORD_zH-RFXq5i3Mw6_SD2w.text: Tried out a new restaurant today. The very 1st conveyor hot pot restuarant!! Definitely not a place to go if you're in a rush. The place was a bit busy when we arrived. Waited 20-30 min fir a table. The hostess was friendly & helpful, she even brought us a cup of water/tea. We ordered original broth & tomato broth. The original had an extra herbal kick to it, my tomato was delicious but I did add some chili powder to it. Conveyor plates were $0.99-$5.99. most items ordered from server arrived looking fancy. Surprisingly our beef tongue were only $6.99 and shrimps were $3.99 for 4 pc. I recommend the mushroom combo basket. It was our 1st visit and I already plan on coming back. I recommend it for a date! Fun place to eat, cook them yourself and don't be afraid to try new things

Our favorite are tomato, mushroom and house original. We also ordered the beef combo, sea bass fish, lamb racks, and some other items from the conveyor belt are wontons, green tea noodles, taro, fried tofu, shrimp, sashimi salmon. Everything were very delicious.

pS7wIKAYOnETdDy3_H7XPA.text: I just moved here from Hawaii where hot pot is very popular. That's what we were craving so I looked up a few places on Yelp. Chubby Cattle was on the top of the list. Mind you, they open from 5pm-12am. We got here at 5:30pm so we were able to get seats quickly. If we came 15 minutes later there would be no more seats. This place was a hit! The broth was flavorful! We had 3 to our party and everyone had their own hot pot because a mini pot is built right into the table in front where everyone was sitting. And I loved the concept of the conveyer belt! I'm going to miss Hawaii, and if I'm every craving a little taste of home I will definitely come here.

ucG0uj_2nvsTqWB5RNidxA.text: This place is pretty damn good. It's a shabu shabu joint so me and the boo already knew how to work this. Deni was our server, nice guy who was very descriptive with the menu.  Most places don't go into depth like he did and we really appreciated that.  The staff is on top of everything, refilling our broth, making sure you don't need any help for the first timers. I love that it's an open kitchen and we can watch a little of what goes down. Theres a sauce station where you can create your own sauces..I think the only thing I prefer, is eating at a table where there's more wiggle room. There's a warm ambiance that flows through this place which is hard to find in a lot of restaurants. Definitely coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Making a mess, soup and a conveyer belt of optional dishes to choose from

ft8OUsdCVfnGkGIcWdpmzw.text: Best place ever. It is a very high quality place with amazing food. I just love the way you get to dip your food in special sauce. Amazing waiter,Deni.

wwIwgdt9JeO1Y-NveazusA.text: A super fun place to dine with friends. The ordering can be a bit confusing but the staff was a great help. There are tons of selections, the veggies are all very fresh and the seafood was perfect. Next time we go we will sit at the conveyor table.

oI3vQdmCjIkotJ0PBEEnwg.text: We have seen others post about this place on fb and decided to try it out.   Deni our server not only asked if this was our first time,  but also took the time to describe their menu and how the ordering process went.  We sat at the bar by the conveyer belt which was a bit cramped,  but we enjoyed the experience.   Servers were quick to clear out plates as we pulled them up.   Will definitely come back with a bigger party and out of town guests.

photos.caption: Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LN76CQKR_SWBKJq2HcByNQ.text: I just ate so much my stomach hurts.  Given the meal I just inhaled, I really don't mind. Chubby Cattle is my new favorite hot pot spot.  Everything was fabulous, and I wish I could give it 4.5 stars, because there are only a few opportunities for improvements.   The mushroom basket, sea bass special, and Beef & Lamb plate were totally worth it.  I did find bones in the sea bass, though.  I don't recommend the Veggie Plate unless you really like lettuce and cabbage; you're better off picking up greens from the conveyor belt.   Deni, our Server, was really communicative and great at walking us through the menu. They have a conveyor belt that circles the entire restaurant that is really awesome.  It is hard to keep your hands off it while waiting for your soup. We each tried a different soup base, & all were very tasty.  We will be back again!

nQvhO3jfQCpA1EwFLJofqg.text: Back again at this place. It's cold so it hot pot time!!! Sauce bar is up graded and it looks cleaner. Expect me every week! Awesome place will definitely recoommend!

gRyJWr7p3rls_mBdjou4Tg.text: 1st time tonight at Chubby Cattle. Been wanting to try and it definitely exceeded my expectations. Our server Deni was very helpful going through the menu and recommendations. Dinner was very tasty and I can't stop eating. We will definitely come back. Thanks Deni.

KPAHoDHXSp_LZ3D_bkHByg.text: Deni was our primary server. Wow.  He addressed our allergy concerns and made sure we ordered what we wanted.  The other staff consistently made sure the empty plates were cleared and answered any other questions.  Definitely coming back!!!

K0kVqmnL9m-_xFJ3CPX-Zw.text: This was our first time here and it was amazing!! Perfect place for a cold Vegas night. Our server Quinny took really good care of us and provided great recommendations when we were ordering our soup base and meats. She also helped us cook our fish noodles and shrimp balls and was very attentive. The house special soup was very flavorful and the meats were fresh. The conveyer belt idea is very creative and convenient. Lots of selections for toppings and veggies. The manager, Joyce is also extremely friendly and made sure we had a good experience. Food and service were both fantastic!  I highly recommend this place!

v2I20aZ_ms8qa87v32HJ6Q.text: If I am into hotpot, I always come to this place. They have the closest Chinese/Mongolian hotpot that has never been Americanized I believe. EPAcRou0IbAhaqalfwoyww.text: Went to this place last night. Ordered an appetizer beef skewer. After 35 min I asked server about it and said that I don't want it anymore. She insisted that it was ready. I kept saying I didn't want it. 10-15 min later it arrived. It was not beef. This was lamb and I told her I don't want it. She said too bad we already cooked it. w5oG9MIxMi_cezsM469jDg.text: We have been consistent patrons of Chubby Cattle, we come to eat here at least once a month; especially during happy hour on Sunday to Thursday from 9:30 onwards. What became our favorite here is the hell soup and mushroom pot; they are satisfyingly tasty but not too overwhelming that you can truly finish the whole lot of broth. They have quiet a selection on meat, seafood and vegetable and all always come to our table fresh. Their watermelon juice is also worth the try. We will keep coming back here.
