B75pcbOKhuJXfqOT5HRG6w.text: Me & a girlfriend have been looking for a hot pot place for a while. We have not found a place in Las Vegas that has satisfied our wants until this place! From the service to the variety of selections, we were definitely pleased. She got the house broth & I got the tomato based broth, both broths were delicious & unique to the restaurant. Most places we go only have a few of the standard selections so it was unique to them. Their side dishes & meats had a variety that we were satisfied with. Also their price on the small dishes were fair - while we ordered small sizes for each of the dishes, it filled enough for both of us. If you have enough room for dessert - you have to try their green tea ice cream. It tastes like a green tea latte! Delicious.   Queenie - our server was awesome! She answered all our questions & did not bat an eye when we requested for anything at the table. The managers who walked around & assisted their team from cleaning to refilling water was surely noticed on our part.   A few things that we noticed - the communal dining table was a little awkward because of the space. If it's just for yourself or even two, it was ok. Considering how much we ordered individually, the table space for another group to share with us made for a bit of an awkward experience. In terms of their side dishes - we hoped for more variety with their fish balls & greens.    Overall, great experience & great food!

MimllbNtRb0r60Huhuxtcg.text: Chubby Cattle is the Bomb spot for Hot Pot. You know it's good when there's a line out the door. Celebrating my daughters Birthday, this is where she wanted to go. Second time here and it did not disappoint. Highly recommend plus our server Matthew was Awesome!

AQ5J6K_kElwHZCbx2wRA4w.text: This is my favorite restaurant.They are offer hot pot soup and all kind of foods on the rail.Great atmosphere.

bVa96Rf81iFwo0Lh1I7dlA.text: First and foremost, I believe their rating is a False high.  The server tells you about half way through your meal that if you leave a review on Yelp while you are there and show him at the end of the meal you will get a free desert.  He then tried to clear our food while we are still eating and asked if we were ready for our free dessert.  When we were finally done he approached us again about the dessert to which we replied we didn't want dessert.    The actual food was just ok.  The broth was a little boring, we both got the spicy broth, I got a little spicier than my husband.  There is a "sauce bar" which is pretty awesome that you can make your own sauces as well as a couple of prepared sauces.  At the end of the day it was just kind of a stressful meal experience.  You get very little room and they try to recommend a meat platter, vegetable platter and seafood platter; we didn't get the seafood.  There is no room to really do much and you are cooking your own stuff so you can't move much while you are trying to cook.  Not to mention if you want anything off the conveyor belt there is no room to put it.  We only got two items off the conveyor belt and both times didn't know where to put the dish.  There were two ladles in the broth, one regular and one with holes to scoop out the chiles and such.  The last hot pot restaurant we went to had a little container to put your utensils in which was very convenient as well as a pair of scissors for you to cut things up, something they might want to look into.    We've been to hot pot before, Yojie, and had a really good time.  Overall I think this place just doesn't do as good of a job, it's a little to gimmicky and hip.  I think it's way sketchy when you are pushed to do reviews in front of the staff, I wouldn't go back.  On a final note there was a very intense smell in there, kind of a cross between body odor and bad fish, I almost left before we were seated because of it, kind of wish we had.

QHOhBEUO2MreC_gzpApS7g.text: The reason they have close to 5 stars is because they bribe people w/ free ice creaming. First of all, there's no flavor in their soup. It was disappointing service. They say me at a high top table that was clearly made for a large party. It's awkward sitting that close to other parties. I was extremely disappointed in the lack of flavors. Shabu Shabu Paradise is still #1 in my book and can't be beat!

AB4grK1998xuL7NJlJQy9A.text: Now I understand why there are so many reviews. Restaurant virtually demands you write a review ... preferably 5 stars. Far from the rating I would give. First and last visit to this place. Must accept some of the blame myself as it was my first experience at hot pot. Spent $60 for myself only. Interesting concept, but due somewhat to my inexperience, it just did not work. I overcooked the meat making it virtually inedible. Tough and tasteless (beef tongue and premium lamb). Shrimp were good, but I do not like peel your own. They were fresh as were the scallops, which were quite small. Best dish was the kobe fried rice, which was quite good but not great. Pass on the watermelon juice which was watery and served at room temperature. Blah!  Based on all of the Yelp reviews, I decided to give it a try and did but wished I didn't.

jUKfqRkUWokBpLPqIewrMA.text: I'm a huge fan of hot pots but this place fell short for me. We got the seafood and the beef platters. The presentation of the seafood was great but I will say that this place is overpriced for hot pot. They charge for EVERYTHING including sauces. You pay per plate including small items like lettuce, mushrooms, you name it. Our bill for two people was $80+ which is quite pricey just for hot pots. I personally think there are better places to eat for that price. It was decent but wasn't amazing. It's good to try but we wouldn't come back for it.

sN98DiJ5hz8lCWIt3vl4jQ.text: This was my first time ever trying a hot pot, and I chose this place specifically because of their conveyor belt attraction, which we all know is a very scarce find in Las Vegas.   Being a first timer, I was very overwhelmed by the options on the menu. The list was so extensive, I had no idea what was good and what wasn't, so it was one of those moments where I literally went with my server's recommendation. Gilbert, by the way, was fantastic, having a vast amount of knowledge on hot pot, and helped make my experience less intimidating.   I ordered a variety of meats on their list in the end, not really knowing what to try. In the end, I think I can safely say that the Beef&Lamb combo was the winner for me. All the meat was such great quality, sometimes it felt like a shame for me to put it into a boiling pot instead of grilling it. Haha.   On the other hand, this may just be silly old me, but I assumed that you don't really drink the broth because they gave us straining ladles, and there was no other utensil in sight for us to put the soup into our bowls. So yes, silly me, but also silly them for not giving us the right ladle (it was on my second visit where I learned you drink the broth too). It would've been helpful to know the first time before we spent a whopping $70+ on our meal, trying to get full but still left unsatisfied.   On our second visit, we brought family, a party of 7 seated in a booth for 6. There was only one pot to share among 7 people, which we all felt was very inconvenient and uncomfortable. We had the right ladles, at the very least. Perhaps consider adding a 2nd hot pot for tables accommodating to larger parties so they don't all have to huddle around one small pot.   Despite the inconveniences, I loved the piping broths and A quality meat of their hot pots to the point where I couldn't give Chubby Cattle any less of a score than a solid 4.

SmcVkS7IOH27OaZ3dwl02A.text: This place is great! Went with parents & hubby tonight.   All the different broth were delicious & aunthentic & not 'white-washed' if u know what i mean . Be careful with the hot&spicy one, it was too spicy!! The oxtail broth was the best i think, the original broth was pretty good. If you bring a non asian person like i did, they should stick with the safe tomato broth lol  The veggies were all fresh, the food was good quality over all. The condiment bar was excellent with green onion, cilantro, garlic, salt & pepper and alot other irrelevant ones that i didnt use lol i loved it tho, i kept going back to it.   The service was surprisingly great! Our guy was Deni with the man-bun. He was friendly & very attentive to our every need, i mean every single one, i had kindda a dumb "accident" that shouldnt be mentioned here. Deni made sure my 'need' was satisfied.  He was very patient with us first timer & explained it to us commoners lol it was a great experience, give them a try.

G4_j1dJEgcXuzwUVbU-3PA.text: Kwan was an amazing server. I've been a few times and it never disappoints. If your food isn't good it's your fault!  The spicy levels are no joke I always get mid and enjoy the fire but secretly wish to dilute it! Shhhh. Don't tell anyone. I love the goodies floating in the broth. There green onion, clove, Chinese peppercorn and a bunch of other unidentifiable pods and spices. Get the fish ball with filling (roe) always a must with hot put. Kwan was friendly and made the perfect beef suggestion.

91WGO4B83DTi3K8KdeVdyg.text: This place is a solid 4 stars with the food and experience. But the service was perfect. We had Matthew as our server and he was always there when we needed something and he answered all of our questions.   It was our first time here so we had many questions... now that we know what we like, I am sure we will love it next time.   I ordered the  Mushroom Broth Thick Noodles  Beef Brisket Super good!!  Added shrimp, spam, dumplings with a few other mix ins. We really enjoyed making our own sauce! I put the exact amount of everything that I like in it. Perfect for the hot pot base.

XYHDvKwn_IqnXyfNr4m88w.text: For me, one of the most important part for the perfect hot pot meal is the soup base. So although I do enjoy a bit of spice in my dish, I usually start with the restaurant's original soup base for my first visits so I can taste their flavor without any other ingredients shadowing it. The broth was very flavorful with the right amount of seasoning and a nice herbal kick. Absolutely delicious! I'll have to try my luck with the spicy soup next time I come back.   As for the menu items, the restaurant offered a good selection of quality meat and seafood. My friends and I ordered a whole array of dishes ranging from beef brisket to crab and everything was fresh and presented beautifully. My favorite would have to be the Kobe beef and oysters. Highly recommend both!  I'm so glad my friend brought me to Chubby Cattle before I left Las Vegas! I'll be returning next time i return for sure. It's about a 10 minute drive from the Strip, so take a cab, Uber, or drive there yourself because it's definitely the place to visit for a good hot pot experience.

7OyVpHgsIJZskWUIXCbCRw.text: Come here at least once a month and it's the best chinese hot pot in Vegas. Very good value, especially if sticking to foods from the conveyor belt

-us2QIFFzjEXQMobijZgEg.text: Deni was an awesome server! I accidently ordered the wrong side dish and he didnt hesistate to bring me the ones I actually wanted. Food was also awesome as always. rN4XiY8ixCumpci0bYmaYQ.text: Awesome in every respect--customer service (Deni) quality of meats, veggies, and mushrooms and soup bases were amazing

9943weti_-dbX0751dhZwQ.text: If you like Hotpot then get thee to Chubby Cattle! We went for lunch on Dec 26th as they were open from 12-3pm that day.They have a great selection of broths to choose from and a wide array of yummy goodness ( and sometimes weirdness) to simmer. I prefer beef, tendon and veggies over pork blood and duck flipper, but hey, there's something for everyone! The coolest part is that you can sit at the bar in front of a refrigerated covered conveyor belt and grab things as you see/want them. They keep track of your consumption by the color-coded plates. I really enjoyed the food! We were desperate to return but were dismayed that they only seemed to open at 5pm everyday. We were confused as we had been there at 2pm the day before. In any case, it's a fantastic experience and worth getting away from the Strip for!

jGYZ7nXXJqXweQwYn5aB5g.text: This place truly exceeded my standards. I thought it was a typical hot pot restaurant that just opened up. I mean they do open at 5 pm everyday which is kinda late and they have happy hour from 9-12  They have a bunch of frozen dishes you can grab off the conveyor belt kinda like genki sushi in Hawaii! But basically you choose a broth (which they have like 5 types) and you choose your meat dish (beef combo) and you can choose your noodles (noodle combo) and you veggies.  My server was deni and he was SUPER helpful with explaining to us how to order and what is most popular and he was a very good server! He made our experience more enjoyable!  There's also a whole area JUST for sauces! You can go and pick all your sauces and they don't charge so you can try all of them if you want.  Half way through eating I thought I wouldn't be able to finish!!! There was so much food and it was so filling. I thought the bill would be over $100 since there was so much to eat.  Surprisingly the bill came out to $60 and for the amount we ate it was DEFINITELY WORTH EVERY DOLLAR. This place is of course just another hot pot spot that just opened but it really beats all the other hot pots in town. This place has VARIETY, and not Just variety it has great workers, good atmosphere, good price point, and the food has NO MSG! Tastes fresh made straight from the kitchen. Definitely coming back for more! 5 stars!

yn4e-0kcLeeu-suY4NyP2g.text: Good quality and service, sit where the belt is to help yourself best deal around for hotpot.

OPExoL1-bpDzVQvWkbT3qw.text: This place by far exceed my expectations on hot pot! Just visiting from out of town and happened to look through yelp and found this place.I loved everything about it. The spice flavors, the cute little conveyor belt. On the other hand.... I came and sat down at 9:10 in order to do the happy hour (Sun.-Thu. 9:30-12:30) they do not tell you that in order for you to do the happy hour you must be seated prior to that exact time. Well I ate quite a lot plus stayed awhile and was unaware so I was upset and asked to speak to the manager. Luckily the manager helped me out and I felt very bad for getting upset but I did greatly appreciate it. I just figured it was kinda weird as I come from working in the restaurant business... you should put it out or even tell your customers about that certain situation. However, in spite of the situation I could not give this place a bad review for something like this. I did enjoy it very much! I hope they open a location where I'm from. And rest assured whenever I'm in Vegas I will definitely be back.

nQdYjj3Lw78dPXuKLQvYQg.text: Very good experience. Love this place and Deni was awesome. Great food and atmosphere.

Vnm6pFPG5gFMZ2WOQyRyBg.text: I really love the margarita crush at the chubby cattle, Brandon is an awesome bartender!!

V08wd-ebCobsIfFtt4IQ-w.text: One of my favs in town!  Sauce selection, quality of meat, presentation and broth choices are all on point. My favorite is the oxtail and original broth.

iDBX_bnDlj4r_uc2PN3lUw.text: Deni was dope. I want to be him when I grow up .   SERIOUSLY SO HELPFUL. We were new to Chubby Cattle and he explained everything. He kept checking on us constantly even when he was super busy. Cool guy.

y9-4C4c5NtH-8TaGMdjYiA.text: Finally came by, because of all the good hype! Unfortunately I wasn't able to sit by the conveyer belt of food. We got sat at a high table which was a tad uncomfortable as there wasn't much room for my legs. I HIGHLY suggest requesting to sit by the food conveyer  belt , as you can pick out the food/sides you want in your hotpot. And come on, so intresting!  They have an excellent variety of sides from meat, vegetables, and seafood. There is even a "bar" for sauces and small appetizers made available for you. It is self serve!  There is also an actual bar inside too. You get your own mini hotpot to yourself, and can choose from their chicken, oxtail, spicy, or a half spicy and half chicken broth. We did order a veggie combo, and wow. Its literally a basket of veggies! If you order it, its enough for 4+ people.  Service was a little slow, and our hotpot broth  took some time to come out. But they are more than happy to help you once you flag them down. I'll definitely come back again another time!

p1nanUNoxclgRQEEgSMvzQ.text: It was really good, the wait was not too bad, the food was all super fresh and so were the sauces. The seating at the bars is pretty close, you will be bumping elbows but oh well. The broth was excellent, and the whole experience was great. Too many hot pot places have old ingredients but this place was super fresh and tasty and the meat was all great. Will for sure be back again!

hoQ3BeNAPxFitXZ2Cxcung.text: Despite the absence of conveyor belt sushi's in Vegas, they somehow have revolving hot pot. Go figure. For those who have never had revolving anything, here's the breakdown. Each plate is color coordinated by price and there's no limit to how much you can have. I mean, you pay for each plate, so no one will stop you. If what you want is not on the conveyor belt, it may be requested.   We picked up noodles, fish balls, and veggies. Clear noodles were the cheapest at $.99, while the fish balls were about $3   You choose your broth, meat and anything extra, like rice, you want to buy right away. Remember that broth is refillable so don't skimp on those slurps of soup. To fill your broth with extra flavor, there is an unlimited condiment station that is full of different sauces. My favorite has to be the peanut butter, garlic and peanut bits mixture with a hint of chili paste. The flavor was just perfect.   I walked out of there at least a ton heavier....but damn, it was so worth it! Don't forget to look into daily discounts. They have a great one for students!

H5R62r3Fr0kEVGnkQIdvAw.text: Very pleased with our experience here. Great selection of meats, a delicious and unique broth (the tomato oxtail), and excellent and attentive service (thanks Deni - we were lucky to have you as our server) We will definitely be a back again soon!

OcX1EobZSay0HDEy_FqDgA.text: This place has phenomenal service with high quality food. Not only that, but everything from the plates to the conveyer belt to the tables are clean!   Let's start with the food -- the broth has a divider that allowed us to try three different broths. We got the heaven, hell, and mushroom (the mushroom was my personal favorite). The heaven and hell pot is called yin yang and you can get that by itself also! The conveyer belt is CONSTANTLY packed with food and restocked so you don't have to wait forever which is a problem I've had in the past. I ordered wine and they do NOT skimp on the wine like other places do and actually know what to recommend. Their serving sizes for the beef and lamb platters were perfect for four people.   Moving on to the service, impeccable. One of the most considerate staff I've ever come across. They always came to refill all THREE of our broths and drinks. Unlike other restaurants that only check up on you when you wave them down. They explained the entire process for those of us that haven't been there and made the overall experience that much more enjoyable. The manager is also so great! We had a small hiccup with the mix up of food and she (sylvia) came straight out to fix everything and apologize. This is one of the only places that I've experienced this kind of genuine service.  Overall, this is a wonderful restaurant with a cool and friendly ambience. I would recommend this to everyone craving hot pot!

photos.caption: Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wagyu beef and lamb
Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This dish is so unique ! Bamboo flowers w fresh shrimp paste !

8cQUsHKjo4Ea62vZ7K3fHQ.text: Always wanted to try a Hot Pot and this place was really good. I loved the style of it and how they brought everything out. I really liked the tomato soup. Had so many yummy flavors! Mushroom one was good because it had tons of mushrooms in it but wasn't very flavorful.  Definitely will be returning!

P4A1LTh8hhrueT-fDbaktA.text: Very first time here. Sister visiting from Seattle wanted hot pot. This place is sooooo good! Food and service top notch. Get James to be your server, he's very attentive and friendly. And if you're celebrating your birthday you get free broth! Be very aware, came here on a Thursday night, had reservations but the parking lot was super full!! Be ready to drive around for 10 minutes for a spot.

bS9PcHZJvgFf6GMH1R86XQ.text: It is OK, but pricey!  The broth is too salty.  Way too salty.  It is something new to try.  Go for all you can eat hot pot is better.

Xdc9n5YajWvK1jHo4FIn1w.text: Unfortunately it seems to have gone downhill. I loved this place before but the past two times I've gone have been disappointment. Around 9:30pm the conveyor belt seems to stop in being refilled with new things and there is not much selection and starts to go bare. Next it would be wise to let guests coming in at that sort of time that a certain part of the kitchen closes at 10 and I wouldnt be able to order certain things. It took me so long to get a waiter that it was already 10.  We were never checked on if things were okay, though other tables were. The only time a waiter stopped by was to take our inital order, to drop off the order and when i stopped a waiter. Now the waiters in general are very nice. But I wish they would be a little more attentive. The 10 o'clock issue wouldn't be an issue in the first place.  Food in general, what little I was able to get was still good.

JOpgQdbrjTmLMzmj8winLQ.text: Wow, what a great time.  Our waiter David was so helpful.  The food was great and if you are a first time hot potter like myself the staff will guide you through the process.

7b2sY1ERZp97XB8Cv9KiCQ.text: This is shabu" restaurant & I love shabu". It was my first time.  The host will sit you & the server will come to give the menu also asked have you ever been there. If you said no, they will explain how it work.   The First thing to do choose your broth.. original, oxtail, tomato, spicy (3 levels) for individual pot also they have yin yang (1 pot for sharing with your party).   If you eat meat or seafood, they have chicken, beef, pork, seafood. You can order combo beef ($19) for your party, I believed have 3 differents type of beef in one plate and with only $1 you can choose your noodle (they have 3 different flavor..original, green tea, taro).  They have a menu alacarte for raw meat & other food like pot sticker or cook lamb or rice bowl dishes but the fun part, they have a conveyor belt next to your table ( which I like).You can grab anything you want, they charge each small plate depands of the color's plate. In that conveyor belt have vegetables, shrimp, scallop, beef ball, oysters, different types of mushroom, shrimp ball (have a surprise inside, REALLY RECOMMENDED delicious), quil eggs.   My friend like his tomato broth & I order spicy broth level 6. I like my broth but I wish they put all herbs like garlic, bay leaves and more other stuff in the pouch so it make us easy to grab out food because it is hard to find your food with a bunch of herb in the broth. Don't worry about getting not enough broth, they keep refill the broth for us.  They have buffet table style for your sauce to make your broth or dipping sauce like hot chili oil, sesame paste, green onion, minced garlic, cilantro, mushroom sauce ( HIGHLY RECCOMENDED!! You can mix with your rice) & other sauce also they have bachan like cucumber salad, beans sprout (kimchi flavor), edamame. Oh BTW rice is separate, 99 cents each.  It is fun place to experience with a bunch of people & yes they have bar

WkiOYOcx568JKtqQXdbWow.text: Chubby Cattle!!!  The first time I heard the name of this restaurant, I thought it was a steakhouse.  Surprised to find out that I was incorrect.    Found out the following from their website: "As a reformer of the traditional Mongolian Cuisine, Chubby Cattle is the first restaurant in the world to combine a refrigerated, conveyor belt-based hotpot with the finest traditional hotpot from Asia."  Now I knew what to expect after reading this.  The restaurant is located in a crowded strip mall.  Finding a parking spot during the peak time that we arrived was a challenge.  Once inside, we were seated right away.  We ended up ordering items from their menu.  Yeah, we did not try one item from their conveyor belt.  Got to say that it did look cool, though.  Everything was labeled nicely.  Depending on the color of the plate, prices ranged from $3.99 to $9.99  Tried two different broths.  The House Original and the Mushroom.  Personally, I preferred the Original.  The meats tasted so good cooked in that broth.  Also tried the Seafood Combo platter and Potato Noodles.  All good!  Don't know if I would return.  I am not crazy about "cooking" my own food.  It was a good experience, service was terrific, and the food was delish.  Give them a go if you are in Sin City!

Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Priced by color.  Pick what you want from conveyor belt.

3tD_RzBAfsFvdnZI0LQmXQ.text: Loveee this place. It's so fun to go here. The food is the best. Our server,  Angela, was the best. I recommend this place for a fun experience. This is my second time here and I will definitely be coming back soon. We chose the mushroom, house spicy, and oxtail soup base for our hot pot option and also ordered a variety of meats and veggies. All the ingredients were fresh and beautifully presented. My favorite item on the menu was the Kobe fried rice. It was so delicious! It's truly a fun experience. Often it will be busy with a bit of a wait, but so worth it!   This Chinese inspired cuisine has the option to choose your dishes via a conveyor belt or directly through your waiter. It has a modern and trendy ambiance with decor that is welcoming. The smell of the food makes your mouth water while enticing all the senses.   The best part of this establishment is the service. The hostess was very attentive and sat us down quickly. Our sever was very friendly and attentive to our needs. She gave us excellent recommendations and made sure we were happy. Thank you Angela!

sOxx3cVYWZVsfcK1ZEEYlA.text: Your modern day hot pot!  Revolving belt full of variety of vegetables and meat.  A bar full of different choices of sauces.  Good broth.  Priceless

UbRvQ8jbWhO8KcMYLdPIzw.text: This place is very unique you are seated at a table that had little burners at it... you choose a broth, noodle, meat ect then the server brings it all to you raw, you cook your soup at the table. It's fun and something different to try. Prices are a little high so not an everyday activity for us. Friendly staff. Not so clean restroom however the floor boards are loose and easy to slip.

CDQPR33iKJmwx--XQfpf1A.text: Summary: Good: Everything about the food, staff, concept.  The slight bad: there's often a long wait, because it's a new restaurant and very popular.  Definitely worth a visit.  I've had a lot of shabu-shabu (Japanese style), but not as much of the Chinese style hot pot.  On a previous visit to this shopping center for a reservation at the Thai place (also great), we saw a long like outside Chubby Cattle, investigated, and discovered it had just opened.  Filed it away to try later.  A month later, still quite busy.  Showing up without reservations seems to mean a 30-40 minute wait (there are some good tea places nearby to wait for the call...); I don't know how hard it is to get reservations.  Well worth the wait.  Essentially, it is hot pot where you order meat from the waiter directly, and then use the conveyor for additional plates of vegetables, mushrooms, tofu, etc.  There is also a sauce bar to make custom excellent sauces (Thai fish sauce was my favorite.)  Quality of meat seems to be excellent -- tried the beef combination and beef/lamb combination, as well as the hand-cut angus special.  We also had skewers of grilled beef and lamb (also excellent.). Watermelon juice was a good accompaniment.  The staff were all very friendly and efficient.  Given that every seat in the restaurant was full, I was amazed how fast they were with food and drink requests.  Looking forward to going back.

pSqbyyGM2V3SjjzD7Ljuag.text: The food was great, and the oxtail soup base was excellent. Deni provides excellent service and recommendations and checked up on us throughout our meal to make sure we were enjoying our dinner.

Flln9QuIcjDCdgbQPNLQLA.text: Came here to meet up with a group of friends after work. We were all really excited to come try it out after hearing about it in the news and just wanting to try out a conveyor belt concept for hot pot. It was still relatively early in the night (close to 7pm), so parking was not too bad. Upon getting to the front of the establishment, they still had a red carpet laid out and the cut ribbon from their Grand Opening was still hanging out. There are two sets of glass doors you need to get through to get into the restaurant. Upon opening the first set, you are blasted with nice cold AC and the fragrant smell of hot pot. My stomach immediately grumbled. With an amazing welcoming smell like that, what could go wrong, right?..  Well, once we entered through the second set of doors, we were 'greeted' by the hostess with "How many?" and "Do you have a reservation?". We proceeded to tell her there were four in our party, and no, we do not have a reservation. She then says "Well, I can seat you at a shared pot, away from the conveyor belt." otherwise, it would be impossible to seat us because there was "a reservation at 7:15, another at 7:15, and one at 7:30." Then she walks off and it seems like she went to talk to some people at another table? I'm not sure what she asked them, but she came back and said "It will be a 45 minute to an hr wait before I can seat you." Did she just go ask that table when they would be finished eating? I will never know. We gave her a name and cell phone number of a friend in our party, and the hostess told us to come back at 7:44. If a table opens up earlier, she will give us a call.  Fast forward to 7:44 we walk in through the double set of doors (blasted again with the nice aroma of hot pot. Stomach again, grumbles). There are a few parties standing around the crowded entrance waiting at this point. She looks at us, and asks if we are ____. We said yes, and she says "I tried calling you, but it didn't work." and walks off. I looked on the podium where she had her reservation sheet, double checked the number, and manually dialed it on my cell phone. What do you know? My friend's phone immediately wrung. She then sat a party before us, and then brought us to our tables. After we got seated, a bus person came over and said, "Sorry, I'm not done setting the table," and proceeded to finish setting it up. We received one menu with our party of four people. I looked around, and I see another party of five also only had one menu. Sure, we can share two to a menu, but four people on opposite sides of the table looking off of one menu? Nope.  We've had quite a few questions on the menu. What specific meats are in the beef and lamb combo? (lamb shoulder/beef brisket) What is the difference in weight between ordering a combo vs each item individually? (combo was $16.99, lamb shoulder was $4.99, and beef brisket was $5.99) Our server did not know the answer to the weight question and had to ask the manager, who responded with "10 oz for the combo, 5 oz for the rest"... Wait, what? That doesn't add up. Why would I pay $16.99 for a combo with 10oz of meat vs $9.98 for 10 oz of meat when ordered individually? Our party opted with the individual orders of meat, along with some napa cabbage, watercress, and 'fresh thick noodles'. The veggies were also confusing to order, as the menu listed 'small' and 'large' prices, which differed from the conveyor belt prices for the same veggie. Soup bases: We wanted to order their 'House Original' soup base and their 'House Hellish Spicy Pot' with Mid Level Hell 12 spicy. We were told by the server that they were sold out of the House Original as well as the Spicy soup bases. How can you be out of the original soup base? We almost got up and left then and there, but the manager came by and told us there will be a 10 minute wait if we wanted to get those soup bases. What's 10 minutes compared to the wait we've already had, right?  The soup bases came out first. I was surprised at how clear it was. It was a bit bland, but I added some garlic to it, so all was good. Can't go wrong with garlic! Next, the meats and veggies came out. For $4.99 and $5.99, I believe they give you a decent sized portion. Of course it will always be cheaper at a supermarket, but at a restaurant, the price wasn't bad. The quality of the meats were just average. I could get better quality elsewhere. The veggies were a bit on the not-s-fresh side, as some leaves were starting to yellow and brown. Also, when the 'fresh thick noodles' came out, they were dry and thin. I don't know about you, but 'dried' noodles does NOT mean fresh in my vocabulary. Items we saw on the conveyor belt when we entered were nowhere to be found once we got our soup base. Keep an eye and restock it please!  When we asked for our bill, the server apologized for his lack of knowledge, as he started working three days ago. All in all, it was an interesting concept to try, but I probably will not be returning any time soon.

UbFF2y7TsgdUt80wBiMOpg.text: Yay can't tell you how happy I am that a Americanized Chinese restaurant opened! The food was 10/10 I can't complain about anything. However if you can't eat spicy food I would not recommend the spicy broth even at entry level. I can eat pretty spicy food and I was dying when I was using that broth, but thank god my friend got another one. Our server Matthew was great! Everyone in the restaurant was very nice as well. It takes a lot for me to write a good review about a place, so that means if you're reading this you should most definitely try this place! I took off one star because the sitting situation is a little all over the place, but nothing a reservation can't fix. Also they have pictures of cows in the restaurant which made my friend and I feel kind of uncomfortable, but overall you'll love this place if you love Chinese hot pot!

viLfaNMonPSPAEmCQl2kfg.text: You had me at conveyer belt. This Mongolian style shabu is top notch, with soup base delightfully flavored with dates and currants. Highly recommended

PO_hD3ykEIglkK0AQIJMmA.text: The Chubby Cattle was my first experience with hotpot and it was by far the best and most delicious! The entry level soup base was too spicy for my lil buns but very enjoyable. The conveyor belt in the middle of the restaurant is an eye candy when you first walk in! Deni, our server was great and very attentive!! Will recommend and come back again

qefKbuJaPHvrG5ZJyJqcwQ.text: I got the spicy broth and I felt that it was too salty. I also felt that I didn't get as much for the money, since you have to pay separately for each ingredient you want in your hotpot. Overall, I felt like I didn't have as much "fun" as I thought it was going to be. I did like our server, who smiled and was polite.   Pros: Customer service, ambiance Cons: You do not get as many things for your money

LDivnVE8ouRjRb8f-BsvMw.text: Intimidating to peruse the menu and seeing everyone seeming to know what to do. Soon enough, we got the hang of it. We ordered the original broth and the beef combo. I am carnivorous and my husband likes vegetables and be were both satiated. Alex was very helpful and helped us create our special sauce, some barbeque sauce, sesame oil, soy sauce and peanut powder. It went well with the beef, squash, lotus root and cabbage.  The vanilla ice cream was refreshing. Will definitely be back.

LLMERK3cnXlrlcx9RvAYLg.text: Came in today to try a new spot, I'm not an "Asian" foodie kind of person but this has turned me around. The soup broths are very flavorful. Very large selection of proteins and vegetables for liking. The conveyer is very helpful for those who need a little extra to fill you up. I would recommend this place for friends.

mspki6JFEuy1xgSfI2gkqg.text: We enjoyed our dinner immensely.  The food and service were both excellent.  Having had lived in China, this meal brought back some some of the best memories of that experience.

ZDDEhIymJoEltnnZaq5p9g.text: Awesome place. Best hot pot I've ever had, The mushroom base with the mushroom basket was divine, the lamb platter was too good for words. I would come back just for the awesome service. Silvia "the manager" was very sweet and helpful. Kwan is an awesome server, he was very helpful and attentive. I will definitely be back and bringing my friends.

vgT2wTK8H8FrFPx2cw_xuA.text: Excellent hot pot for authentic Chinese food enthusiasts! I was impressed by the wide array of sauces and toppings for the hot pot dishes, as well as the meat selection. The decor is perfect for a hip date or a casual night out with friends, and the space is perfect for entertaining private parties, small shindigs, or even single eating (because they have a cool conveyor belt with dim sum-like dishes).

-R1nVQr0pytL5WRB-24VSA.text: My girlfriend and I had been planning on coming here for about a month, and the perfect opportunity came up to double date with my best friend. I was not disappointed in the slightest - the food was great and the atmosphere was on point. Deni was our server, and he did a wonderful job making sure that we were able to enjoy our meal.

9l5JSRINvzpvo3IST5FAEA.text: Our first time here! It's definitely worth a try for a hot pot place though a little on the pricier side. We had no idea what we were in for but our waiter Deni was extremely helpful! He let us know about the assortment of different broths and meats to choose from :) Place is pretty and the service we received was nice. It'd be a great place to bring groups to.

j46nsIId_ZUPOXvUX6-5wQ.text: This place is great! I really like the conveyer belt idea and the food tastes good as well. I've been here a few times already and can't wait to come back once again.

H2AOTra5qqKK4K_hDdBnmQ.text: We called & made a reservation, but they couldn't find it when we arrived.  After a bit of a challenge from the hostess we were sat. Our server was helpful & a second server James was too. We ordered the beef combo,  mushroom combo basket, and  house meatballs with the house broth. Food was delicious & would highly recommend this place.

M36HDfcPcVEmXwjswBaKmQ.text: I think this is the best hot pot restaurant I have ever experienced in my life.  They have many selections of meat, seafood and vegetables and the quality is excellent.  Our waiter, Denny, gave us excellent service. You should try it.

PjEyp7HNhonFTV3owu95ag.text: This was an amazing and unique experience! Xiau xiau was an excellent server! I loved to concept of having my own hot pot. The variety of meat was outstanding.

5pH_VR2eosmcjjk0BbmPdg.text: Great food and great service. Everything's fresh and a good entertaining dining experience.

UPYH18gcdkhLJ0dgmh3XqQ.text: Mongolian hot pot at' it best. French lamb chops is  a must have. Very flavorful and a beautiful spice to it not to overwhelming but delicious and tender. Broths are very flavorful and delicious. Food quality and presentation is exquisite. Too Kevin awesome customer service and very helpful. And all the staff are very attentive and very pleasant. Awesome place. We will be back thank you Chubby cattle for a wonderful experience.

LD4Zl8i5KmDwQyuiuiGbag.text: TL;DR - The food is absolutely incredible and the hot pot + unique conveyor belt set up makes dining here a fun, upbeat experience. As a completely american white guy, I HIGHLY recommend. It was very accessible to even a typically American palate while some of my friends got authentic looking hot pot food. Seems great for groups of 4-6 on the regular tables w/ conveyor belt (which I was in )or groups of 6-8 on the "served" tables. I think I saw a private room too but not positive about that  I ordered the original soup base and it was absolutely delicious. After I was seated I got one of the pre-made sauces from the custom dipping sauce station and I pretty much started eating the sauce straight before I got any food. It was a peanut type sauce that I could have eaten bowls of (diet though). Some other reviewers describe the soup broth much better than I can so just go read their descriptions. Only had the "original" broth but I have confidence the others are just as great.  The decorations made me laugh too - there's a hip mixture of hangin plant and pictures of cows in pastures... probably supposed to relate to the name Chubby Cattle! There were plenty of TVs too that had sports on. Not too into that but I had a great view from where I was sitting.  My friends and I have had hot pot a few times before and the conveyor belt added a whole new element to the dining experience. We even got a huge basket of mushrooms in a cool wooden basket that looked out of Lord of the Rings. ABSOLUTELY HAVE to try this place asap :D

hMo76jkK7Acw_jRC2ZRqfA.text: The food here was pretty good and the service was amazing. Our waiter, Damien, was very friendly and asked us if we needed anything every so often. My friends and I came here and we tried 3 different broths - entry level hell, sea view, and house original pot. We also tried a variety of sauces - Thai chili, house special, spicy beef. The entry level hell was a lot more spicier than we thought. The flavor was good but less peppercorn and chili pepper would be better. The sea view and house special were both delicious. The conveyer belt could use more veggies and the price is expensive for what it's worth. I would come here again, but only if my budget allowed for it.

sybVh5Un02lX0yxIvmv9Nw.text: Fun take on two great things, hot pot and the conveyor type meals!!!  They have quite the selection of soup bases and we tried three types of the soup bases.  The original, quite healthy and traditional tasting.  The tomato base, very flavorful but definitely for the tomato lover.  The mushroom base, is very healthy tasting too.  The quality of vegetables, meat, and seafood is very fresh!  The mix is constantly changing according to the staff and chef, you can definitely tell there is a lot of local and seasonal flavors.  Mathew, our server, provided great service with a smile and was very friendly!    Really fun place, you can do individual style hot pot or community/family style.  Small groups to a large groups, this is a great spot to go!  We'll be back again!

GSIS3t9GuUWAmvoU1l34ZA.text: Wow! I've never had chinese hot pot before and didn't know what to expect, boy was I blown away by this place!  What an experience! The food was so fresh and flavorful. The rotation sushi hotpot bar was supper cool and convenient. They had so many varieties of food you could add to your soup to customize it.  Not only was the food great but we had the most helpful and kind waitress. She recommended many things to us so we could try our food the traditional Chinese way and she was so happy and sweet the entire time.   If this is your first time having chinese hot pot, please come here!  10/10

0y7uFgpBkVkJtk1GDfYbZw.text: Something new in Vegas, a conveyor belt with different varieties of food to choose from.. hot pot !! The meat has to be ordered with the server though and also the live seafood.. but everything else is on the belt.. we were lucky enough to sit at the area so it was convenient. If you don't then you must order everything from the server. Our server Xiao Xiao was really nice and explained  the process of everything from the beginning. Only thing I would changed is the size of the counter at the belt area as it was a little small with all the food being ordered. Other than that.. this place was great !! Would come back again.

DzT3qdYTLSILMOmwMBz6og.text: Stopped by here for my first ever hot pot experience. I didn't know what to expect and it was even more confusing when I saw a conveyor belt full of food. The have a nice infographic on the menu that explains how to cook everything.   I had the entry level spicy broth with some Chinese yams. It's similar to kbbq but you cook the meat in a broth instead. For meats I had the lamb shoulder, ribeye, shrimp and wagyu. Everything was good.   If you write a review you become a "member" and they give you impressive discounts on your broth as well as a free meat every day.

Xw9cLGEj9d7BfwvBuP2sNA.text: I was sooooo excited to try the Chubby Cattle - and it was AMAZING. I loved watching all the different food options traveling along the conveyor belt. Way more fun than just reading things in a menu. The staff was so nice and helpful. When we got there , I was actually asked if I minding waiting ten minutes for happy hour - OF COURSE NOT- I LOVE DISCOUNTS! and their happy hour is great- most everything was two for one! They also have a dipping sauce bar where you can make your own sauce by adding all sorts of ingredients. They will help you if you don't know what you are doing- don't worry. There is a large variety of yummy things and it's great for vegetarians too.  I will be back!

hkZtqxI7uhrALw-3fCJbBg.text: Went to this place twice because I liked it enough the first time to come back again - the second time with my family (a total group of 7).   FOOD: I really enjoyed this place because of how many options you get given the conveyor belt. You start off with a soup base - the first time I tried the spicy soup base which I didn't like too much but 2nd time I got the tomato soup which reminded me a lot of Thai tom yum soup yum! We ordered the beef combo which comes with a generous amount of meat for around $17. My go to items for the conveyor belt are the rice cake, tofu, and fish balls but haven't really had the chance to try everything. All in all, I understand how people can get lost or feel overwhelmed with the menu.   SERVICE: Main reason for a 3 star rating instead of 5 is because of how my family and I were initially treated when we came in. We came in around 11:30p looking to try their buy one get one on the conveyor belt stuff. When we came in, I told the host we had a party of 7 and a lady said "Uhhhh 7?" And continued to quickly walk away saying something I didn't understand. Right when we were seated, the same lady told us that we need to "please hurry and order quick" because the kitchen closed in 10 minutes. What? Your hours say you close at 12:30a? Then, a male server approached our table immediately and asked us if we were ready to order even though we weren't even given menus yet! He then started to tell us that they weren't doing the buy one get one special since it was a holiday, but it was Dec 29? By this time, I was so annoyed and ready to leave but decided to stay since we drove all this way and was really excited for my family to try this place. The male server then continued to tell us that we need to hurry because their kitchen is closed and I asked if we could still get stuff from the conveyor belt and he said they were closing it down very soon and we may not have time. So we quickly got our food from the conveyor belt and during this time, we were told multiple times by the same and different people that they closed in 5 mins. Ok, ok I get it that's why we're rushing. The lady came back to our table and asked "did you order yet??". I was shocked - your hours say you close at 12:30. Keep the kitchen open until then or change your hours! I know not to expect much in terms of service for restaurants in Chinatown but this was just unacceptable.

gMccjgYQQmX79PJ-2ge_Cg.text: Omg, what a concept!  So easy to order, meat was fresh.  And you could order 2 different broths for different tastes, especially when your eating with multiple people.  Just have to be careful, it's so easy to just pull played off the conveyor belt that you don't realize how much it all comes out to.  Otherwise it's pretty decently priced.    Definitely going back!

_XuCe0G4CdaR7jBAo4aZvQ.text: This hot pot place was soooo good! There's endless amounts of options here! And it might be the first conveyor belt we have in Vegas. My friends tried the mid-level hell's spicy broth.. But it was too spicy for them... My personal favorite was the mushroom broth. There's also this sauce station where you can make your own dipping sauces. Mei was an excellent server and she suggested the shrimp paste. Definitely try it  We also shared 2 beef combos, 1 seafood platter and one mushroom combo. It was more than enough food for us. I would definitely recommend this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh oysters
Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy beef combo

qnPa4AM3j95Q3p4wptO5ZA.text: Such a fun environment! Very friendly staff and they were extremely knowledgable about the menu which helped in my decision making with what to order. Everything was very fresh, especially the veggies. I had the spicy soup base with a spice level of 5, it was very very spicy but so tasty. We had the variety of meatballs, pretty much tasted all the beef options as well. You HAVE to have their sparkling sake too! Will definitely be back soon!

aEiIEYAo4pIc1AvwaTguwQ.text: I want to tell you all--the food was delicious. I ordered the tomato base and my bf got the house special, we liked the tomato soup more. From the moment you walk in it stinks in a good way. Like a yummy savory smell very appetizing. The conveyor belt was a cool way to try different foods like revolving sushi except for soup sides. Also, we had Kwan as a server and he was really great!! Best service ever!  Overall,  Food: 10/10 Service: 11/10 Wait times: 8.5/10 Overall experience: 11/10

6BN8DXFEcUHHdJAvzfawDw.text: Craving some hot pot, friends and I came through but, didn't know how this hot pot place worked. The waiter Deni was the best, he took his time explaining how to order, recommendations, and also brought some extra special dishes which were his favorite. I don't write reviews but our waiter Deni was too awesome not to acknowledge, taking his time helping us and being very attentive.

pNc9XMwvEZ6arCsiMsY9IQ.text: The food here is amazing and this place is neat and clean. The service here is great and I would give a five star rating.

flo_rbaey3_dJJ2HiGcTWg.text: This restaurant really was an experience. It was unique from other hot pot restaurants. I will definitely return to bring my friends and family!  TABLES: You have the option to sit at a table with one large pot for everyone to share or you can sit at a table with many small pots for each individual to have their own (you'll have to let the host know before you sit down so they can give you the right table). Private rooms are also available. Make reservations or come after 9pm because this place gets packed!  ASSEMBLY LINE: In the center tables, there is a refrigerated assembly line of food the goes around a large portion of the restaurant. Customers have the options to open the refrigerator sliding doors to get the food right at their table. The food items are priced based on the plate color. My advice, stick to the menu, nothing from the assembly line is good.  SAUCE STATION: In the center of the restaurant, there is a sauce station for you to create your own sauce. I was amazed by the variety of their sauces. The peanut butter sauce is my favorite!  HOT POT/FONDUE: For hot pot, you have many options from the menu. It first we though it was going to be over priced, but after looking at the menu and seeing the portions they gave us, it was actually a pretty decent price for the food and experience. SOUP BASE: For the soup based, choose the tomato soup or the spicy soup. Avoid the mushroom soup! MEAT OPTIONS: For meats, you have to try the mouthwatering brisket. They recommended the rib eye, but it's no where near as good. For the meats, they are freshly slice to order. SEAFOOD OPTIONS: Now the seafood, if you want to try it, go for it, but my opinion, stay away from ordering seafood, it's not that good. I had the seafood special, it was very pretty in presentation, but nothing was good on it. You can also order the seafood individually. SPOON OPTIONS: They have various, meats and seafoods served on a spoon that you'll cook in your hot pot. It looks pretty, but it's a waste of money. VEGGIE OPTION: We got a veggie basket that included all the different veggies and it was really good. You can also order the veggies seperately.  DRINKS: They have a full bar if you want something to pair with your hot pot. The hot tea is served in a genie like pot. They offer various fresh juice. The mango juice was really good!  SKEWERS: They really advertise the skewers, but it's not that special. I'd advise just sticking to the hot pot.  DESSERT: THEIR ICE CREAMS ARE SO GOOD AND THERE ARE REALLY GOOD FLAVORS.  SERVICE: The host/manager Alex is extremely friendly, very organized, and hard working. He really makes his customers' dining experience a great one. Our waiter Kevin, was very diligent and he really knew the menu well. However, Kevin has the tendency to talk to you while you're eating and sometimes, he needs to give his customers the opportunity to eat. Everything was organized and it was a fun and relaxing experience. After coming back to this place, I have to say Matthew is my favorite server:)

photos.caption: Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stella Artois
Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meat platter
Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood platter

yF7QZF6NaGIZVGZCJFMFqg.text: Lets first say that the reason this place is getting decent reviews is they are either bribed (with ice cream apparently) or, they are getting stars for a gimmick - namely the conveyor belt.  If we talk about food quality, service, price this place gets demerits in all three:  Food Quality:  I tried nearly every type of beef and lamb they had to offer - and frankly they were just ok. The sort of OK that you'd expect from an AYCE hot pot place, except this place isn't. In fact, if you travel two miles to the palms, there is an AYCE hot pot place that blows Chubby Cattle out of the water - the quality is good, and theres even more variety of vegetables and meats to choose from.  The broth, which is critically important in a hot pot place was just okay. So far, no one has lived up to the pretty mild standard of Little Sheep (I wish we had one of these in vegas!)  Service: Service was pretty bad, but I did go opening week so perhaps they will work this out. Slow to check up when I was out of meat (which you can only get via ordering, because the conveyor belt only carries small items like little pots of veggies or small things like an oyster).  Price: Way too expensive. I ended up leaving having spent around $80 for myself, trying all the items I wanted and actually was not that full. Each plate of meat costs like $10 (or so) and only comes with perhaps 5-10 thinly cut slices. I would've rather gone to any of the other hot pot places in town, namely the AYCE at the Palms or Yojie and would've had a much better meal for my money.  Long story short: This place is okay, but its overpriced. The service wasn't great, and you have tons of better alternatives: namely AYCE Hot Pot at the Palms which has better service, better food, better price, better options, or Yojie (which is more japanese style) but has significantly better quality.

NtBRVfBwk6z2TDb3AOomig.text: We were looking for another restuarant, but it was closed and we ended up finding this gem. The restuarant itself was pretty, but the food was better. The quality of food was amazing and fresh, the noodles were made on site behind glass. Our waiter was extremely nice and made us feel comfortable, throwing in a nice anecdote. I have to say that if we lived in Vegas or nearby we would definetly visit this place again.

5_cLkSd15sRuZQFU_LR0ag.text: I like the soup here. Very fresh and clean Vegetables and good stuff to eat here too. Good for cold weather coming. Delicious foods here.

EgWUTqAh2Z9gT25TBxVOtw.text: Everything was so delicious! The staff is very nice and mindful! THANKS, that was a great new experience with another cuisine.

photos.caption: Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YfLUDOO6bHxerj1Pi_vVUg.text: Best hot pot I've had in a long time. Our server Matthew was very helpful and courteous.

47NUONjIjerbWFI0aTkhFA.text: This is the one that i consider as "real" hotpot place in Vegas. Food is fresh and delicious and everyone is so nice. Best thing is that you can get your own sauce at the sauce bar.

BhDIIlulCY4GMf_axHscMw.text: This is my second time doing a converyor belt syle setting, but not my first hotpot meal. First impression: sleek, clean, inviting, and modern. The decor is beautiful and the place is well ventilated and bright. There is plenty of seating and I was seated promptly.  Our service was spectacular. This being kind of my first time, our server James was very patient and friendly when taking my questions. He explained the process and the food items, and took the time to wipe the glass of the conveyor belt line which condenses up pretty quickly. He checked up on us frequently and made sure our water was always topped off.  We had a large table for the two of us. We got a split pot, half mushroom soup base and the other their "Heaven and Hell" spicy base at mid level heat (it was too hot for me!) We enjoyed the brisket, beef tongue, and angus beef. All were delectable, especially the hand cut angus steeped in the Heave and Hell. We turned to the conveyor belt at our side for our add ons and everything was great and reasonably priced.  Tl:dr great times and I posted to share the experience and get half off my soup base...which I should get next time since I am in the loyalty program now. Woot!

k3_XI3pWAIMDmBBRdHkoRg.text: This is the best hotpot in town! Natural broths and wide selection of meats and seafood plus other side items like Taro, rice cakes, mushrooms, pumpkin, veggies! Broths are very flavourful, my favorite is tomato then mushroom. If you think you have passed judgement on hotpot from trying other places... You have to go here and give it another try.   Make sure you tell them if it's your first time!

yhVGgIhvYo3yhtCyZuIyfw.text: Came here with my friend on a Monday night to try this conveyor belt hot pot themed restaurant. The inside is nice. They decorated it for the Halloween theme right now. There's bar seating and table seating with a conveyor belt of raw ingredients floating by for your hot pot. There's also a sauce bar off to the side where you can build you own savory dipping sauce.   When we sat to order the waitress explained how this restaurant works. Its individual pots per person. You get to pick the broth and spicy level. Each broth is 3.99 to 6.99 depending on type and spicy level. Next you order all big items, meats, veggies and hand made meatballs from her. The items on the conveyor belt are smaller items like mushroom, bean curd, tofu, raw fish, veggies etc. So for the two of us we got the meat combo, veggie combo, and on her recommendation, the small portion of the shrimp paste. From the conveyor we got the beancurd, quail eggs and fishball with roe inside. My friend also got the mango juice and a bowl of rice. The flavors of the broths were good. Very flavorful. They are also very generous for refilling it. I thought the ingredients were fresh and delicious. Meat was good, veggies were good.   The reason why I give this three stars is for the price. For the two of us it was 80 bucks total. That's a whopping bill for hot pot. You might as well go to an all you can eat hot pot restaurant for less than 30 bucks a person. They charge you for everything.. Broth, rice. Don't think I'll have the urge to try this again.

Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hell broth

cGHIaJ6Us_7cKMF-JJoRbg.text: Loved this concept of hot pot! The staff was attentive. There was a bit of a wait to get seated but not a big issue. The broth was very flavorful and meat was fresh. Will surely come back.

ZEz6zWbxpg_SiW0NC08WeQ.text: Best Mongolian style hotpot in town! Loved the tomato oxtail broth. Great atmosphere, our server Deni was very outgoing and friendly. Def helpful and attentive. Will come back soon!

OcpPghn4aslpAxCXroBbog.text: Great food my family has visited this location twice and will continue to come back.

vZUganUMHCiaRhA8NGp67A.text: First time coming to a hot pot place with a conveyer belt. The meat quality was great and the soup is pretty standard for Mongolian hot pot. We also had the lobster for 15.99 and the seafood platter. These are both recommended. We would definitely come back again whenever we hit up Vegas.

jhMljIMzcntEk_4R-_a2RA.text: The best hot pot in Las Vegas! Loved the oxtail tomato soup, veggies are fresh, fresh seafood. Everything is this place is great! Mango and green tea cake is yummy!

7uhCnNFOWPnUnDU6uKLfvQ.text: The best hotspot spot in Vegas! I recommend it for family and friends! Jenny is outstanding. Her service is exceptional.

TcnMkGq9CIZcEXyr3KNZrA.text: We keep coming back here! The service has always been great and attentive. Moving from California I needed to find a good hot pot place and I am glad myself and my significant other found this place. The food has been consistent and the oxtail soup base is top notch. Being able to order a bunch of meats or veggies and cook you like is a lot of fun.  They also have tables with individual bowl spaces if you don't want to share with everyone in your group.  If you like hot pot or have never tried it, I highly recommend coming here.

ssgQVXs1QGv6squHDbnE1w.text: The food is good but it really sucks that they don't take reservations for 3 people.It has to be four or more.That being said , we waited for over an hour on a Thurs night.I don't see why, they still sat us at a big table so 3 or 4 people wouldn't have made a difference

photos.caption: Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lcNg_rWHDOY0jhH3FUxTrQ.text: Having seen and heard many positive reviews on Chubby Cattle, we decided to eat here for Valentine's Day. Despite coming on a holiday, the host was very responsive and the wait was only 20 minutes without a reservation. After the short wait, we were promptly seated and provided with the holiday special; however, we decide not to drink so we ordered off the regular menu instead. Our server, Deni, was very knowledgeable and answered all our questions about the hot pot process.   We got the original and mushroom broths, beef brisket, rib eye, and premium lamb. We also got additional items off the conveyer belt. Everything we got was tasteful and fresh. The atmosphere was very social and contemporary with a hint of traditional Mongolian culture.   After being seated, we noticed that the restaurant soon got more packed, leaving multiple customers waiting. We were lucky to only have to wait 20 min but other people had to wait much longer and it took a while for us to get our check at the end of our meal. Other than that, we had a splendid experience and will definitely visit again.

photos.caption: Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hand cut wagyu
Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef and Lamb
Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef slices

QIUH2BlJ4S-erjeeX7swQQ.text: Ummmmm I don't get it. Bill the server was nice and attentive but other than that....food was different. You can order meat and veggies and boil them in your choice of broth. The concept is cool! The place was also very clean and my son liked the coconut juice. As far as the taste goes....no thank you. Too weird for us.....didn't really speak to our tastebuds, but what do I know ...the place was packed!

RHr77scZLUqMz5v60Ac6Kw.text: Chubby Cattle might be the new "Hot Spot for Hot Pot" and rightfully so.  The new restaurant is beautifully designed and offers aesthetically pleasing dishes ready to be cooked table-side.   After choosing up to three different broths along with your meat or seafood selections, a create-your-own sauce station provides a multitude of flavors to mingle with your tastebuds. If that isn't enough, a conveyor belt full of variously priced items may tickle your fancy.  My fellow diners and I chose two broths:  "House Original" and "Heaven and Hell".  I thought their House Original (beef/chicken stock) had a light, subtle flavor but perfect for sipping on.  The spicy broth was was actually a bit too spicy even for me and also a bit too salty for one of our friends dining with us.     The meats we cooked were delicious and the many dipping sauces elevated the taste.   My wife ordered some scallops which pretty much got lost in the mix of broth, noodles, veggies and meat; probably a first and last time to order those.    Similarly, we felt like the conveyor belt items were lackluster.  Assorted vegetables and tofu looked unexciting and didn't seem necessary to enjoy the meal or make it better.  Beyond that, our only wish is for them to serve some nice beer to go with the food!  Our servers were very helpful and did explain their restaurant concept fairly well.   Waters were filled promptly and the food came fairly quickly after ordering.  If you're craving Chinese hotpot in the Chinatown area, you can't go wrong by checking this place out soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Noodles, beef and lamb.
Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yellowtail w/ jalapeño.
Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummmmmm!

gmi0_kq8oDRwjp9a3HwIKg.text: I had the mushrooms base broth and see bass it all amazing! Ready to go there again and try something else

GKzlDuaH95g4bnEshDCs1g.text: Awesome food, great customer service, a lot of options to choose from. Bring your friends :)

photos.caption: Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. cheesecake and chocolate mousse

iTtet7uiTvx4NW574BjjsA.text: Pictures of the menu.  Probably would've given 5/5 if we had received everything we had ordered. Our server was Kwan and he greeted us very kindly. We were the first ones to be seated after it had opened at 12, then 7 other tables immediately were sat. So I understand the lapse in memory with our order. We were fine without the noodles and were able to get a tin of rice instead. Food was very good. I enjoyed the playlist they were playing. We were expecting more people during lunch on a Saturday, but it definitely wasn't as crowded as we thought it'd be. It's a very unique experience and this was my second time trying hot pot.

htWJZUr-0M1kX3gTXGXHJw.text: Had a great dinner on 3/8/2019 at Chubby Cattle.  Angela was our server, and she was wonderful!  She gave us great recommendations and took care of us all night long.  Hand made fish balls were tasty, and the special sea bass fillet also stood out.  I also liked the variety of house-made noodles.  Chubby Cattle is really a treat!  Thanks, Angela!

CCtCQdLKpBABtTIa62pp3Q.text: Just yum! Can be intimidating but man this place is legit. I'm vegan and gluten free and they had a lot of options for me! Can't wait to come back! KWAN was a great help! It's clean it fun, it's the best hot pot I've had.

RDrsv6cs9m3fKnYjxnueEw.text: My first time ever trying hot pot was this place! I had the oxtail broth which was delicious! Best broth! Also tried the house broth but oxtail is definitely delicious. Had spinach, cabbage, beef tongue , beef brisket, bamboo shouts (which weren't very fresh). You have to be careful about all the sides to add because it can add up really fast. The veggies were good but not super fresh. Only down side. I will definitely be returning.

TC1Ot2nO75Ez_CGTpLYE7A.text: Get their tomato soup base. It's bomb!!! Conveyor belt is the way to go if it's just a few people. Yelp check ins are a bonus too

HPif8k0pUo78OG7NANu2qg.text: Amazingggg.   Love this place! I was craving some hot pot for dinner so my bf and I came.   Parking is very difficult during dinner hours so after we circled the lot multiple times, we just parked across the street and it was okay.   The broth is so good and two mid20s spent about $90 for dinner. However, we were both extremely full after.   Quality is excellent and the servers were so great.   The wait time can be a bit long but it's worth it.

EAwlYh4bgpUJAqZxeOKlEg.text: This place is soo good! Great service too! They make it easy to pick what you want and all the food is absolutely yummy!

-hN3MviMsa3uZUie-IIUtg.text: Food: Chinese hot pot very similar to "Little Sheep Mongolian Hot Pot" in Cupertino, CA. Their original soup base tasted the exact same. We ordered combination beef plate, combo vegetable plate and combo seafood plate, soft tofu and another tofu. We ordered the family pot which is one pot for 5 people to share with half original soup and half mushroom. We all agreed original was best. The sauce bar was awesome and something Little Sheep doesn't have. I made my sauce with ponzu, green onion, cilantro, chili oil, sesame oil and garlic. So tasty!!  Ambiance: clean and casual with loud music. We only used the conveyor belt once to get extra corn.   Service: super friendly. Kwan was our server and spoke both English and Mandarin Chinese which helped with my in-laws. They were good with water refills.   Cost: $80 for 5 people.   We'll definitely be back and maybe to try the individual hot pots so we each get our own.

QmKINuDmgYF5ltJ-euRADQ.text: Service is great.     The place is spotlessly clean and the food is fantastic.      The shrimp paste is outstanding.      Its not cheap,   but its worth it.       Not a great place for a first date ( it can get messy and you wont have any privacy but is is fun ! )       it can get CRAZY busy on weekends so plan ahead.             Go have fun !!

Mzvn_WxwRWXo4BdDXg_VCA.text: This is my favorite hotpot place in Vegas. The quality of meat and ingredients in general is great. I've been here several times but this is the first time trying the split pot. My favorite is the tomato oxtail soup and the beef combo platter. It can get pricey if adding a lot of add-ons, but overall has great service and taste.

photos.caption: Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tomato Oxtail Soup, Beef Combo Platter, Original Soup

zwng6mlcV_SeVF5wF925wg.text: This place was incredible! Fresh, amazingly prepared ingredients. Wagu beef, lobster, lamb all were the best looking meat I've seen. And Deni, our waiter was very knowledgeable and helped us through the meal! A great place for anyone to explore!

Rop8IKDo4OuYngmE0nMDJg.text: Coming here on Saturday night you will be victimized by a hostess who has no organization ability to seat people and her incompetence will cause you to wait over an hour.  She has no understanding of seating so the food is not worth it.  If you die tomorrow, do you really want to waste time here??? Food is not worth it

YHYD4VZxDCam2KtmgmbuZA.text: Extraordinary service, attentive and at a times intrusive - but only with the best of intentions.  Loved the combination of 'cook it yourself at your seat' with 'here, add from the conveyor belt if you want as well.'  MANY choices of soup base, tons of options to customize your meal.  One drawback is that this is not a speedy process or a quiet one.  If you are trying to socialize AND are hungry, not your best choice.  If you want really good, really unique and really personalized - this is your place.

EJqLQitJrwTNROK8xZ_bNw.text: Deni was awesome serving my boyfriend and I. He suggest all the right things and taught us a thing or two. Amaze balls balls. Ha ha ha

photos.caption: Photo of Chubby Cattle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

R6LFGlsr-utfRQcUdUm3tg.text: I took my son here for his weekend birthday celebration. This would be the third time we've been here. It's a wonderful experience. The conveyor is fun to use. The two large screen tv is entertaining. The location is always busy. Their broth is genuine and unique.   Maybe my "Wow" eyes is gone about this place. I'll admit their sauce bar and broth is worth praising for. I'm starting to realized it's a bit overpriced. The seating is crowded. I would recommend the table with the individual pot for a roomier comfort though the padding is weak. The server tends to forget to check up for additional order, drink, etc. The "entertaining" tv's are distracting. The restroom needs maintaining. Sticky floor is just a disgusting feel.   Thank you Chubby Cattle, I think I'm going to discover other places for a hot pot and set up my own in my home as well. It was a wonderful experience.

FV0lBJ1YsDRddWIz5dWZdg.text: One year later and the food is still good! The best is the combo plates. Always fresh. My favorite waitress is Angela! She's super attentive and helpful. She actually remembers us and goes out of her way to say hi and help us with anything we need!  Deni was good too!

_YZhORr1rLihFbzhm-DXwQ.text: I think this is one of the first times I've had hotpot out at a restaurant. This style at least. You have your own individual pot here, which is something I really liked. They have two vegan friendly options. One is a tomato broth and the other is a mushroom broth, however the mushroom broth is finished with a chicken oil or something, which our server did inform me about, and which is easily eliminated. It's also conveyer belt style, so if you see something going by that you want, you just grab it. It would be nice if the items were labeled though. And not every item that's listed on the menu is on the conveyor belt, so feel free to order those items from your server. You would also order any meat or seafood from your server as well. There's also a sauce bar so you can make your own personal sauce which really helped my broth too! I was impressed with all the different veggies and tofu options - really good shit for my vegan self! After I ate here, I couldn't stop thinking about hot pot for weeks. NOMNOMNOM See my mukbang here: youtu.be/VzznMeiqLy0

4td6aBOIfEowYC1BZB6qeg.text: Traditional chinese style hot pot with the traditional chinese vibe.   Broth choices:  Spicy tomato House original  Meat portions are pretty generous.  Veggies are available on the conveyor belt or can be ordered with your waiter.   They have a DIY sauce station which you can go no holds barred on your toppings/ingredients  Service is decent. Seating can get a little tight if you have a big group. Can get crowded at times.  Parking is challenging.   Overall good, but didn't strike as a "must have" spot

8aaIN-t02i9T0aI1XSnkQQ.text: Hands down one of my favorite hotpot places besides redpot and nabe here in Vegas. Tbh, reason why I came here is because of the matcha place nearby. Also, saw my friend's review so why not give it a try? Not only the food handling is great here, but also because you know you're getting quality food! Went here with my bf and he went gaga over this place. Their broth, UMAMI! We've been here couple of times with friends as well and they like it! Will definitely be coming back again.  P.s Bring in cash. Sometimes their card machine doesn't work.

r4_2kcRYToxrjQjUn4aICw.text: Deni is so awesome he always is on the top of his game with his service make sure that if you come here, your server is Deni, he'll hook it up with a smile and great deals!

UEk1GagwLXCHrNgElc-M0w.text: Not bad at all!  I give this place a very strong 3 stars!    Location- great location on Spring Mountain and Jones where my favorite Cantonese restaurant HK Star used to be.   Service - excellent service and they explain everything very well.   Good choices. So many choices in Veggies, beef, chicken, sheep, seafood.   Sauces- you can be the creative chef and make up your own sauces concoction at the sauce bar. However the bar is easily crowded with just two people so be prepared.   The broth - We tried the Original and the Mushroom and both were very good.  The chain trailer conveyor belt of food- an awesome idea, but I found it to be a bit too complex. Why not make it all one price and so we don't have to think?  Everything is very good here, just that when we were here, everything seemed a bit rushed, a bit busy, and I was not relaxing. The sauce bar was getting to me as it was simply too crowded with people kind of pushy and that is a real turn off.  I would give it a solid 4 but I need to go back and try it again. For some reason the four of us were just "okay"    Definitely try it out. I am in search of my new favorite hot pot place.

kNH_BTy_wCm0fd8dW8y2GA.text: If you don't know anything about hot pot then make this your first stop in your next foodie adventure. My wife and I go literally almost every week and have tried so many tasty things thanks to the server Deni! If you can make sure you ask for him, he makes our dining experience so much better. Make chubby cattle your next date night spot, I promise it won't disappoint.

72bb6E6DeOa2LUJGNZs7ww.text: This is my go-to Hot Pot Place in Las Vegas.  Love, love, love this place.  The broth is super flavorful and the selection of meat and vegetables is amazing.  Hot pot at Chubby Cattle always brings my family together.

XWrrhk5O98lK4gKCyGOJBQ.text: This place is really good!! I'm originally from LA (SGV/626 area) so we have a TON of hot pot places. This may be an exaggeration but there's probably one hot pot place every 3 shopping centers there and I've tried a fair number of them. Food in Vegas doesn't really compare to food in LA with the exception of Chubby Cattle! Let's start off with the soup broth first! We ordered their house original broth and it was g-r-e-a-t! It was full of flavor. You could taste the herbs and the richness of the animal bone in every bite. As the soup boiled down their waiters were very responsive and came back to refill us every time. Their meat selection and seafood selection was really good. The beef tasted fresh and their seafood looked fresh (personally didn't try any). Their selection of veggies was a bit limited but they made up for that with some bomb.com house made noodles! My favorite were the green tea ones.
