YHZ6yqYtzFaN7znUbSBgrg.text: This is an updated review.   We went today Sunday 11/2/18 for their happy hour, which is now feels like a scam.   Apparently after 9:30 PM (which is when their happy hour starts), there's no new plates will be added to the conveyor belt.   They claim themselves as the conveyor belt restaurant but during happy hour, people will be force to order from their menu cause there's nothing left in the belt!   Disappointing and probably will not come back.   ------------- Loved the food here. The original broth is the best choice IMHO. Mostly because it will not overpowering the taste of items you put in the broth.   The conveyor belt experience is definitely why I keep coming back :) so fun and so many choices!!  If you can ask for Kwan. He is the best server here!  Also upon giving a Yelp review, they kindly give a free ice cream/dessert   -------------  A very fun experience. LOVE the conveyor belt!! Too cute. Just wish the windows are clearer (maybe use anti-fog?) so we can see the items better but it's okay. It might be good too to put names on the dish. Cause some people might not be familiar with the meat/fish/seafood balls.   We got the meat combo. It was so good (big too). I love the brisket the most. We also got the combination of house special balls. The best I thought was the spinach cuttlefish one    Kwan was a very nice waiter, explained to us the process (belt and sauce station).   We will come back! And bring friends

gCiyeQ10ncfpAkdbgBRNIQ.text: Ive been to chubby cattle a couple times now. Each time never dissappoints. We were immediately seated and waters came out. This was a friday night and it seemed unusually empty (maybe because it's a little hot in the desert lately).   We chose our broth base; my friend got the spicy broth and I got the tomato broth. I got some sauces for my pot; as the soups arrived I started to take items off the conveyor belt. Most items were about $2.50. Its fairly inexpensive. You can order items off their menu as well.  There is a plethora of options; plenty of proteins to choose from as well as a myriad of vegetable options. I had fish balls, mushrooms, bok choy and meatballs add to my broth. I usually order the menu for some fine thinly sliced meats but wanted to just try the conveyor belt this time.   I was happy with all the options. The service her has always been great for me. It will remain as my go to places in Vegas. Join their membership to get $5 off broth! haha.   I'll be sure to come back. Thank you Chubby Cattle!

xFJfnbTtGVLQ1b_6q1fZyA.text: What a cool, unique and great place! Went there with my girlfriends to celebrate birthday and had amazing time.  They have verity of foods to choose from (menu as well as rotating table) and everything is very good.  Definitely a spot to try if you are a foodie and not afraid to cook your own meal ;) I believe our server's name was Deni. He was very helpful and super nice!  My birthday friend got a free shot and a slice of chocolate mousse cake (which was delicious!) Highly recommend to try if you are looking for something different and out of the beaten path (for an American anyway...)

AqCWkwJjcEpsbp8FpRYHNg.text: Quality of food is excellent. There are so many flavors. I recommend getting the category basket combos as opposed to individual items (e.g. meat combo, mushroom basket, etc). The soups are so flavorful, the restaurant is very well kept, and service is always solid.  Deni especially is chill, attentive with napkins, water, and the little things as well. Again, solid service all around.  You'll fall in love. I recommend getting their membership, which gives you a discount, making the prices lighter on the wallet. Love.

BIg69uzfENfAx4t8dgjlXQ.text: What a delicious find! Plus it was so affordable especially for how much food you get. Service was incredible. We sat at a shared table so we only had one big pot of broth, but they have dividers. We asked for the original broth and the spicy broth. The waiter warned us the spicy was probably much too hot for us and instead brought us out some hot sauce base to mix in ourselves. It turned out perfect! Our favorites were the beef, shrimp, and udon noodles! Although everything we tried was great which included lamb, scallops, cabbage, pork belly, mushrooms, and a few other random veggies. The sauce bar is extensive and they have some suggestions on how to mix up a tasty sauce. I loved their beef sauce concoction. I would definitely come back!

LwndFlrBlEFjkj59m2wFmQ.text: The food is really good!! The tomato broth is my favorite, no need for sauce because it's so full of flavor.  They just need to work on their service and I wouldn't recommend getting anything from the revolving belt because it doesn't look fresh.   But other than that I would recommend!

SO7afVhChI1yNj_-j3qbzQ.text: I would recommend Chubby Cattle any day! We originally saw this featured on Zimmerlist and had had a successful go with another restaurant he profiled. We came in around 5 on Memorial Day and were immediately seated. Our table ended up trying the ox tail tomato soup, and the entry level spicy soup- both were delicious! FYI on the entry level spicy soup, it packed a moderate amount of heat.  We tried three combos: beef, beef & lamb, and seafood. All were great, and our server Deni was very attentive. We never had to ask for any napkins or refills. The sauce bar also had a wide variety, and our favorites came to be the spicy mushroom and the ponzu sauce. I also tried the coconut milk mojito which was amazing. This was a fantastic dinner, and I only wish the east coast had more restaurants like this!

9G65LG4QRaYeOrscs-IuEw.text: Absolutely blown away by the variety they have, and above all the flavor of the broths. I had the Vegan tomato broth, and yes, it was Vegan! Amazing flavor, and I paid the extra buck to get it spicy. Waiter confirmed the spicy sauce they bring out is Vegan (Crossing fingers!). The sponge tofu is a must! Out of all the Hot Pots I have been to, this was the best one. I have been to at least 4 in Los Angeles (La Habra, Rowland, and Hacienda Heights), but this one was spectacular. Thanks for the Vegan option!

7tCbbK9h_ukTGtRkpRytww.text: This place was so fun! Food was awesome and presentation of food was so pretty. Kevin was so helpful for us rookies!  Thanks for a great dining experience.

I was drawn to this place on Yelp from seeing the rotating belt and it's great that you can make a reservation on Yelp too!  What impressed me was the good selection of lamb and the good service.  Everything else was mediocre. The soup base (original) is similar to the little sheep Mongolian hot pot soup. It was good but nothing spectacular.  I was disappointed at the beef rib eye which was super dry.   Also annoyed how they only put one small pot in the middle of a booth meant to sit 6 people. It was kinda hard to reach the pot if you are sitting on the edge.   I guess I just feel there are more comfortable and tasty hot pot I've tried before.

6lMfaL7twKLX5POo2ZkYww.text: Went here with friends for dinner and had a good experience! It's been a while since I've had hot pot and figured with the cold weather it was about time!   The food was pretty good, but my main complaint with this place is the lack of sets or combos. You basically have to order each ingredient separately which allows for customization to the max, but for people like me, it just takes more time to figure out what you want. You gotta be careful too since the price can rack up pretty quickly! I ended up playing almost $30 for my individual broth, beef brisket, 2 side orders of noodles, and 2 side orders of mushrooms. I wasn't full after my meal, but the food was good and at least the sauces are free XD. I like how they have some ingredients like veggies, mushrooms, noodles, and oysters on a conveyor belt so you can grab whatever you like.  It was kind of hard to understand the waiter due to his accent, but he was very nice. The wait staff could check on us a bit more since they stopped coming towards the middle to end of the meal. We had to flag someone down to get a refill on the broth.  Overall I'd recommend this place for hot pot if you are around the area. It can get a bit pricy so try to go during happy hour when the conveyor belt ingredients are buy one get one free. I wish they had sets you could order so you can get a bunch of things at one price.

3IlZ-MKAqAFAg2Bp_UtJ5A.text: This is my second time of the same experience which can't understand why they are doing such stupid thing to a big return customer. I visited here a few times and I tipped a lot in hoping to be remembered by the staff but it is already second time I had a hard time to be seated since a half the restaurant is empty. I guess they are playing a busy renowned restaurant game or something. We asked nicely to be seated by the conveyor side before visiting by the phome and confirmed but when we arrived there even though 2/3 of the restaurant is empty  telling us to seat at the bar.  Very bad way to treating customers. I will NEVER go back here.

WMhHWYiCvSvh_9TUkTlw8A.text: Overall: If there were a Chubby Cattle in Southern California, I might actually get hot pot more often. They have solid soup bases and fresh food at a decent price point for a build-your-own hot pot place. It's more of a 4.5, but I am rounding it to a 5.  Food: 4.5  How It Works: You pick a soup base, which is priced per person, and then you order protein, veggies, and noodles to put in your broth. There's a bar for you to get condiments, including sauces and garnishes.  House Original Pot: This is a traditional broth with dried jujubes, Chinese herbs, corn, and a few other veggies. It might not be for everyone because it does smell and taste a little like those Chinese herbal medicines, but I thought it was nice on a super cold night. Tip: Add a little fried garlic and green onions to round off the flavors.  Assorted Mushroom Pot: As it name states, it is a broth made with an assortment of mushrooms. This is one of my favorites because I love mushrooms.  Dragon King Seafood Pot: If you love seafood, this is the broth that you should pick. Their online menu has 3 different choices as 3 different price points, but they only had 1 choice ($6.99) on the day that I visited.  We ordered Beef Tongue, Seafood Combo Platter, and Veggie Combo Platter. All of the food was really fresh. I definitely recommend ordering the platters to share because they are a better deal and they allow you to try a decent variety if it's your first time. We definitely did not spend a lot (~ $60), but we were stuffed.  ALSO, the owners gave us a free order of wagyu beef because they found out that we were visiting from a different state. Yay!  Service: 4.5  Our waiter was very patient with us and even made some recommendations to help us save money because it was our first time. However, I wished that he explained the restaurant concept to us in a little more detail. He did not explain the conveyor belt or the sauce table to us, so we had to figure that out on our own.  However, the owners do seem to care a lot about what their patrons think. A woman, who I assume is the manager, stopped by to ask us about our meal. She also promised that they would read any comments that we left on their comment sheet or on Yelp. Hopefully, they actually act upon the input that the customers give.  Ambiance: 3.5  The restaurant is located in a quiet plaza not far from the Strip. Even though we came fairly late (~9 pm), there was still a short wait of about 20-30 minutes. I believe that they have a couple of private rooms in addition to the common dining area. The restaurant is pretty cute and decently clean. However, the restaurant could benefit from better ventilation as the smell of all the broths can be slightly overwhelming when you first step into the restaurant. Furthermore, the bathroom is surprisingly dirty in contrast to the restaurant.

JOXkR2UlrSDALIdSanVuLg.text: Ah-amazing place to eat hot pot!!!! Food, Customer Service (especially Andrew:) and the Atmosphere is just PERFECT!!! So grateful this place was recommended to me to try and now I've been here 6 times. I just love it here. Nothing can compare.

jF51mxYR8p3RYtc7yxI3VA.text: 10 out of 10 would recommend this restaurant!  The food was fresh and beautifully presented. Service was wonderful! Ask for Dani he was attentive and gave great suggestions on what to order and interesting sauce combinations.

EV8caR-L1PYMUhmQohPjdA.text: Awesome idea! My mother and I had a fantastic time at Chubby Cattle! The service was phenomenal and the experience was just so much fun and like nothing I've ever done before!  You can eat as much or as little as you like. Just choose your hot pot broth, select some meats of the menu, grab some sauces from their sauce bar and pick and choose the plates as they roll by on the conveyor belt. Hungry for more? Then just keep grabbing those plates and they'll tally the plates up at the end. (If you're wondering how much each plate costs, just check out their little plate key below every window).   My mother is in from Texas and she loved the experience and can't wait to go back. Besides just having a great time, the staff were all very helpful and super nice and attentive. Kind of rare for a Chinatown restaurant to be honest so it was greatly appreciated.   Would I go back? Absolutely without a doubt! Would I recommend it to my friends and family? Heck ya!

vEJ_B-ljSnNPQYEer-kq-A.text: Unique experience with exceptional quality ingredients. We ordered the meat combo, veggie combo, home-made noodle combo, oyster mushrooms, ox tail broth and the house original broth. Dessert was Mille Crepe Taro Cake. Loved every bite! Our kids loved getting side items off the conveyor belt as well and watching them make the noodles from scratch. Very kind and helpful service. This is why I live in Vegas, for dining exeperieces like this!

YXEhr6Ucp0LWLfbAZZr9jA.text: When I lived in the Northeast, I used to travel all the way to Montreal to find hot pot. Now that the weather is getting chilly in Vegas, I find myself in search of hot pot once more. Chubby Cattle is the newest hot pot restaurant in town. It's funny that it advertises itself as "Chinese fondue" and the interior decor is a little bit ridiculous, but whatever appeals to the masses.   For those who have never tried hot pot, Chubby Cattle is a fun and interactive introduction. You start off by choosing a soup base. If you're sitting at one of the individual stoves, you can pick any broth except the Heaven and Hell, which is reserved to be shared between people on one of the larger burners. I stayed clear of the spicy broth and stuck with the House Original. Next, you choose an assortment of meats, vegetables, noodles, tofu, mushrooms, and whatever else you feel like putting in your hot pot. Otherwise, if you're sitting next to the conveyor belt, you pick whatever looks good that passes by.  For ingredients, the meats are high quality. I enjoyed the beef brisket, prime short rib, and lamb. The presentation of the mushrooms, vegetables, and noodles were aesthetically amazing. The mushrooms and vegetable combos look as if they had just been foraged from a farmer's market and come in a wooden basket. The arrangement of the assorted meatballs make it easy to cook by hooking it onto your pot without losing it into the abyss. There's also a sauce bar where you can mix and create your own dipping sauce. My personal preference was the fresh garlic, green onions, and white pepper in the ponzu sauce.   Overall, dinner was fun and delicious. Everyone got a scoop of complimentary coffee ice cream. Our waiter was very nice and helpful and service was excellent. My one gripe about Chubby Cattle would be the cost for the amount of food we got. Everything was fresh and delicious, but we were pretty hungry even after a couple of rounds of meat and vegetable/mushroom baskets. It came out to be around $30 per person, which is on the expensive side considering it's hot pot (traditionally, a cheap homemade meal). Also Little Sheep (the franchise Mongolian hot pot) is all-you-can-eat for cheaper. If you're hungry and you eat a lot, you might want to look elsewhere.

rgrnnYZTc73meiI13pxleg.text: Great food and excellent service!! Deni gave us great recommendations on menu selections.

Q4b18-ZxyMB3u4yKwLBH-Q.text: Chubby Cattle was a really cool concept with delicious food. This place serves hot pot served on conveyer belts. Once you get seated, you choose your broth and after they bring it to you, you choose what you put into your hot pot. Each plate is color-coded to the price they will charge you.  I chose the "entry-level hell" broth which was actually super spicy because of the Szechuan peppercorns that were included.  When I went, I didn't get to try the conveyer belt but the food they brought was really good. We got a seafood platter with scallops, shrimp, baby octopus, squid etc. and plates of brisket/lamb and wagyu beef. We also got a few baskets of veggies. It was fun cooking your own food. For much of the meat, you would just need to stick it in for a few seconds before it got cooked.  Since this place is Mongolian inspired, there were a lot of lamb dishes including some lamb chops and lamb on a skewer.   Don't leave without trying the watermelon juice.

MeRVAd1vjnJn6KvApwwQxA.text: The broth we chose was ok, but understandable. Theres a sauce bar in the middle so you can flavor the broth to your liking. So full with great food!

There's 3 levels of spicy (mild, Medium, hot).  Service was up to par as well. We had Deni as our server. He's was friendly and tentative . Will definitely come back soon!   There's compartments behind the seats in the Booths for your belongings so it doesn't smell when you leave . And they also take reservations which is great because it can get pretty busy!

rhXkqNvO7dhGPk_30eCjEg.text: Terrible experience! -place was dirty and unorganized. -quality of the food was minimum, poorly prepped, and overly price. -service was extremely terrible.  Since the place was quite new, reservation is recommended. If you do not have reservation, waiting time will be about 10-15 minutes.

Iq4LvBGRDRt25AGKJln9lg.text: I cannot comment on the quality of the food because we were never seated. My friends and I decided to get a nice meal in China Town last night and thought to check out Chubby Cattle because of its uniqueness, good reviews, and because I love Mongolian food and was dying to try the Mongolian pancake.  My friend arrived around 7:20 p.m. and put his name down for a table of four. The rest of us arrived a few minutes later. They told our friend it would be a 35-40 minute wait, and we were willing to wait for any table that opened (conveyor belt or not). A little before 8:00, I went in to double check the wait time for our table. This is when a series of customer service mistakes started.  First, the greeter pretended to not have our name written down. When I pointed it out, she said, "oh yeah, we won't be able to seat you until 9:00." which would have been about an hour and 40 minutes after our arrival. I asked her why she didn't inform us that the wait had changed because we didn't want to wait that long. She just got rude and combative and said that everyone else had reservations.  When I pointed out that other people who had arrived after us somehow jumped our name in line (my friend's name ended up being second from the bottom, despite people arriving after us) and asked if they had reservations she said no. At this point I was getting pretty upset and I asked why they were ahead of us and she just shrugged it off. Then she rudely handed me a business card and suggested that they were a reservations-only restaurant and that if we ever expected to get a table we should set a reservation.   I was fuming at this point and after she argued with me for a few more minutes, I walked out to prevent myself from getting even more upset. We ended up walking over to Hachi, which is in the same strip mall, and the experience there was soooo much better. At Hachi, they apologized that we had to wait five minutes for a table and gave us menus to look at while keeping us updated about the process.   I would never recommend going to Chubby Cattle based on their service. It seems that other people also have this problem, and I'm guessing it's a management issue that will not change. I understand that they are busy, and we were not upset about having to wait, especially on a Friday night, but we were outside and they had my friend's phone number so they could have easily informed us that our wait time had increased by over an hour. Hot pot restaurants are a dime a dozen here in Vegas, so we will definitely take our hot pot adventures somewhere else.

11ge0RBxCVZb94dzD2L_vA.text: Hot pot meets conveyor belt. We went for happy hour. Make sure you try the meatballs. They were amazing.

PdQqyBDJ_si7NPCBUGib2A.text: Great concept,  fresh food, and the presentation was really nice.  We had a private room, with 6 individual pots per table. We chose mushroom, original, seafood and tomato broth. For food, we ordered dumplings, seafood, beef, and vegetables. The center of the table houses a large steamer, which was stocked with raw rice. The steaming food cooked and infused flavor into the rice, giving it it a unique flavor and texture. The meats were presented on special trays. Veggies came on carved wooden bowls. Noodles were served uncooked, and were dipped into the broths.   Tomato broth is the best. I didn't care for the seafood broth.  My only complaint is that the table would be better served with 4 or 5 pots, rather than 6, to accommodate the trays of food and baskets of veggies.h

B6fXk0Qy-HakneiF8uUq1w.text: I had such a good time trying this place!   First, you pick your broth and get your pot all nice and heated up.  The broths provide a nice base that you can adjust to your liking using the expansive bar of sauces and seasonings. I tried both the original and the mushroom broths (very tasty).  Then, you choose from a wide variety of meat and seafood to add to your pot, and everything gets cooked in the delicious broth you have concocted.  There is also a conveyor belt of veggies and add-ins like fried tofu skins, bok choy, lotus root, and so much more I couldn't even identify. You can pull anything off the conveyor belt that looks interesting and add to your broth, and your waiter tallies up everything you added at the end.  Kwan was an excellent server, and was always on hand to answer questions. My friend and I experimented with our pots and chatted for about 2 hours here and never felt rushed.  Highly recommended for a unique and delicious experience!

GrwO5jTBCYT82-CkZfIRXA.text: Having lived in Taiwan, I can tell you that the food is like the hot pot (huo guo) I had there! Outstanding service from Angela and the conveyer belt delivery system reminiscent of a place I visited in Japan. A definite place to repeat! Xie xie!

-JkuigEWhe3CsjDUv2wSbQ.text: Been here twice and have had horrible experiences. On my first visit I sat by the conveyor belt. I would later find out that it was a bad decision. I like how they had lots of options and you choose what you want off of the conveyor belt, but there was barely any room for the plates on the table. The seats were squished together and my neighbor and I kept bumping each other which made it hard to be comfortable while eating.   I love spicy food so I chose to go with the medium spicy soup base. Their medium was more like a 10/10 on a spicy scale. I was unable to enjoy anything because it was so spicy. The more the soup kept boiling, the spicier and more inedible everything became. I spent most of my time drinking water, and that's if the waiter even came around to fill my cup without me asking.   I wanted to give it another try, so the second time around I asked for a table away from the conveyor belt and was planning to order a non-spicy soup base. I didn't make a reservation but the lady at the desk said it would take about 30 minutes. 30 minutes went by and the lady offered a conveyor belt seat. I explained that I'm willing to wait for a table because of the terrible experience I had last time. She said ok and said it should be a few minutes since they still had to clean a table that was just cleared. 15 minutes go by and the host says our table is ready. The waitress leads us to our "table" and to our luck she seats us by the conveyor belt. I tell the waitress that we specifically asked for a table and were waiting for a seat away from the conveyor belt because of our last experience, but she said that they can't seat us at a table because there was only 2 of us.   After all that waiting they thought that we'd cave in and just settle for what we didn't want. No thanks! We simply walked out and had dinner elsewhere. Never coming back.

7xhOoec5UPNMHAB8SLGZTg.text: My friends and I were walking around and suddenly stumbled upon this place. I was really hungry and didn't mind spending a decent amount of money on food and realizing that this was hot pot I was ready to spend.   The food was actually really good. The wagyu brisket and beef combo is packed full of meat that goes really well with the six different soups that they provide for hot pot. They also have a really cool conveyor belt system that brings food for hot pot to you. They have happy hour for the conveyor belt where you can buy one dish and get the other for free! Note that happy hour is only on Mondays through Thursdays from 9:30 to 11:30.  Our server Brandon was actually so nice and took care of everything we needed. He heard our calls from miles away and all the food was brought out promptly. He also knows the menu really well and gave us an in depth explanation of the restaurant and the food that we could order.   The aesthetic of the place is great. The music is lively and it is well lit.  Overall. Really great restaurant with really awesome food and servers. Definitely satisfied.

wzSgx2aDP5EpXO5j02gjpQ.text: Wow! Fantastic fresh food! So many awesome veggies, meat and seafood. No frogs, pigeons or turtles served as they do in Beijing but everything else is superb. Ask for Jenny. She is a hot pot expert and made us feel at home.

ziPaDWFwOHEG3QMybEVwcA.text: If you're a fan of hot pot, you need to moove on over to Chubby Cattle! I've been by a couple of times now, most recently for their reopening with their expanded menu featuring more meats. Not that they needed any, but it's definitely a place to take your favorite carnivore. Note that they also have extensive seafood and veggie options, too.  PICK YOUR BROTH: The tomato is a go-to, but if you like spice opt for the medium, which completely cleared out my sinuses. They are not kidding. I wouldn't go hotter than this. Props for having individual broth bowls as well as half-and-half options. MAKE YOUR SAUCE: The station in the dining room has several sauces, herbs, and add-ins to make a dipping sauce for your meat. I like combining all the garlic and chili options, then topping with cilantro, green onion, and fried garlic. There are mouthwash stations in the bathrooms so your garlic-heavy food won't ruin your post-dinner date night plans. EAT YOUR MEAT (and veggies): The bounty of hot pot add ins here is insane, from baskets of veggies and platters of protein, all photogenically presented for your  pleasure. The combo plates are your best bet, allowing you to mix and match. Check for specials, like Dorper sheep and crawfish. Some of my favorites have been the wagyu, brisket, quail eggs, and shrimp paste. Don't forget the enoki!  Reasonable prices and attentive service are just bonuses here. If you're coming in solo or as a couple, sit by the conveyor belt. Consider a late-night visit for their half price happy hour. Families and groups can request a private room for celebrations.  Hot pot isn't something I have often but Chubby Cattle has definitely raised the bar for my expectations when I do.

mlMZtFlIDDjpDZVvfsMaLA.text: Already one of the hottest tickets in Chinatown, but planning a nationwide rollout and unwilling to offer a 2nd rate experience as ownership hopes to bring Hot Pot culture to the American mainstream, it was on the invite of Mgmt that a party of 4 sat down in one of the private rooms at Chubby Cattle Mongolia Hot Pot House on South Jones Boulevard, a variety of tastes, ages & even religious preferences represented with all getting their fill of food that was not only well sourced & delicious, but also a whole lot of fun  Dating back 1000s of years in terms of its first references in Mongolia, but obviously much older in terms of the simple idea of cooking Protein, Vegetables and Herbs in a large vessel, Chinese Hot Pot in its current format is said to have gained nationwide acceptance somewhere during the Yuan or Ming Dynasty & although variations on the theme now exist throughout the Mainland, Japan & even the Philippines the idea of communal cooking remains foreign to most American's, a situation that Chubby Cattle's focus on individual pots with shared ingredients soon hopes to change  Originally opened in August 2016, but briefly closing recently for an internal remodel that brightened up the space while ownership went so far as to source A5 Wagyu from Japan & their own line of Dorper Sheep to ensure quality of product as the conveyor belt-style space grows in reach, it was on opening night of version 2.0 that hundreds of patrons sat down to get a taste of one of five Soups & nearly seventy diverse items to cook tableside, everything from Mushrooms & hand-cranked Noodles to Pork Blood & Geoduck included.    Fortunately spared the forty-minute waits and close set tables, the later not particularly a turn-off as the action behind glass at both ends of the room may be as entertaining to some as the persons with whom they are sharing a meal, it was just past 7pm during the height of the rush that a server explained Chubby Cattle's concept before presenting four different Soups & turning the electric burners up to three, the aromatics soon perfuming the air with bubbling to commence just a few minutes afterward  Allowing the staff to make selections at will, one member of the table abstaining from Pork & Shellfish consistently pleased from beginning to end with her Tomato-based Broth & items including an impressive variety of leafy Greens and Mushrooms including King Oyster slices & pillowy Wood Ears that became soft and thoroughly saturated after just a quick bath in the Soup, other Soup bases ranging $5-6 included Mixed Mushroom & the traditional Pork based version as well as the "Hellishly Hot" one with dried Chili Peppers, a similar base used in the daily special Crawfish Broil with Corn, Shrimp & Mussels all intermingling with fresh Crustaceans just flown in from New Orleans the prior evening.  Making two trips to an AYCE Toppings and Salad Bar as the table waited briefly for ingredients to arrive, both the Seaweed and Cucumber Salad very good with the former lightly spiced & the later pickled and refreshing when transitioning between various ingredients, other choices such as Korean Hot Sauce, Soy, Garlic & even Sugar were available for those looking to augment flavors completely to their liking, a bit of steamy Hellishly Hot with a tablespoon of Peanut Butter proving a great way to enjoy Tofu, whether fleshly sliced or fried  Pairing the meal with Wine, the Red going over well with most while the Riesling with a bit of residual sugar stood up well to both the Hot and Traditional broths, it was not long before a plate of Beef arrived featuring Brisket, Ribeye and Japanese Wagyu, a bit of resistance needed to resist simply eating the latter as it was, the first attempt to not overcook the thin slices a notable failure with the heat subsequently turned down to 1, a 30s dip yielding just the right amount of cooking to maximize both texture & flavor  Next offered a platter of chilled Seafood, the communal table adjacent going all-out with live Shrimp and Lobster but missing out on the fresh Scallops & Clams that took a while to yield themselves to low heat, it was only the skimpy Crab that proved the slightest bit disappointing, the previously frozen meat a bit mushy in its texture while the Tiger Shrimp, when properly cooked, were snappy & delicious complete with head & tail  Told that the hand-cut Sheep was something special, a simple glance at the brick-red muscle and rim of fat indicating a quality breed with a backstory that includes cross-breeding & genetics that were specifically sought out by the owners of Chubby Cattle, it was with pots set at two that raw flesh turned into juicy morsels with an up-front funk but clean finish, the hand cranked noodles available in 3 varieties rounding things out and great not only as filler, but also based on fact that they cook up well in just minutes while still maintaining a bit of tooth even if they spend a more lengthy amount of time in the broth.

yTuYVVAkgb7EIZzMTZ49Aw.text: This place is unbelievable how everything is fresh and the people are nice I can't keep on expressing how great this place is unbelievable Andrew was phenomenal.

cPfeOFpNXer-b3vee_prMQ.text: Amazing place. Have had a lot of hot pot places but none like this. Everything is fresh and the meat quality is excellent. You get your own personal hotpot. Another cool thing about this place is the ability to make/get your own sauces/mixes. Our server Deni made the experience more enjoyable. It was our first time and he was very attentive and explained how everything worked. Even made great recommendations on what to order. Being in the restaurant industry it's great to see establishments provide both quality food AND service.

6wAAH2445M8PRKbyLwoeIw.text: Great selection, nice sauce section, and everything was great the only downside was that the meal was just a tad overpriced.  I definitely liked the mushroom soup base but it does need a little more flavour.  All in all was a great experience because our server Matt was the man! He was humorous, friendly, and quick!

69fflwr5kYmmaOPJdIgWrQ.text: The food is absolutely wonderful, great hot pot place! Highly recommended. Our server Bin was wonderful as well, gave us great service along with great explanation of the dishes! It was fun and a great family/friend place to eat!

K9aXoHZTKb4E2j1mdLjNDg.text: Great place to eat. The service was good. The food is fresh n tasty. I would definitely come back again.

DFxuii8ox0Cu81fq8hjCXw.text: Everything was amazing! They have a building your own dipping sauce station and it is genius!!! I am stuffed and still want more! Our server Bill is so helpful and attentive! Will come back soon!

XMtXELWQovkQOFjdnrketw.text: Great service. Our server, Bin was so helpful and gave great recommendations. Broth was flavorful and we had the house broth to start.   I recommend the lamb with the house broth. We also had beef.   Their guide to mixing ingredients for the sauce bar was really helpful. The restaurant was super clean and service was fast. I can't wait for them to open in Denver!!

FeqsdxSqXK4gSGMp97zdAA.text: This is he best hot pot restaurant in town. Everything is fresh. Beef is top quality. There's rotating conveyer belt that brings food to cook so you will never run out of food and keeps fresh. Our server Kwan is great, very attentive and nice. Can't ask for anything better. 5th time we are here

DVxC8baiGlYfpzXPnc8syQ.text: One of the best hot pot experiences that I've had.  You get your own individual hot pot or you can have a shared one. I recommend getting your own.  They offer a variety of soup bases; and if you choose the house hellishly spicy pot, you can customize the spice level. I started with the entry level hell 6 and it was pretty spicy.  They also have a build you own sauce bar, which is awesome. The concept of the restaurant is the conveyor belt food delivery system, where you grab what you want from the belt. We didn't get to sit at a table with the conveyor belts because there was a 30 minute wait since we didn't have reservations. We sat at a regular table and ordered off the menu, which had the same if not more than what was on the belt, so we didn't feel like we missed out by not getting the conveyor belt experience. The variety of meats, seafood and vegetables as well as the service was great. I wish they had Chubby Cattle in Houston because I'd go all the time.

7r_1SPHajSWvH-SKyi4Kpw.text: Love this place for Chinese shabu. Good quality meat. Deni our server was very attentive and nice. Will come back for sure.

uE5x8RYK-0yPT4aToLUsOw.text: Love the atmosphere here, food is amazing l, my friend and I ended up sitting in the bar but no problem at all, the kind staff and the food makes it all up. We had the spicy hot pot and the meat is so fresh and you got to try the homemade meatballs combo!

NhYw1OToDFSOJJf1HQLzgA.text: The spicy soup turned out very yummy. The side dishes was so small ( especially the noodles). It cost us $80 for 3 people. The only reason we come here because of the soup and sauce. They should be more reasonable with their dishes. Service is on point and fast. Location is good but parking is pretty hard to find. So avoid coming here during busy weekend time.

rCuxmG9ULPUo_HMnZhNPlQ.text: AMAZING! I'm originally from NYC and there is a Sichuan hotpot place that is my to go favorite top choice #1. And I must say, this was my first time trying Mongolian hotpot and it definitely can compare close. We had a duo pot with the original broth and the spicy broth. The original broth was SUPER flavorful and contained a lot of ingredients. The meats were super fresh and the conveyer belt selection was something new to me. A fun take on a delicious meal.

eUM7v4EJwjXJ_JPoWQM1Yw.text: I highly recommend this place if you're wanting some hot pot. I've been here a few times and I've gotten the original, tomato, and mushroom broth and all are very good. It's really fun to be able to choose which kind of items you want for your hotpot from the conveyer belt and it's a plus to be able to make your own dipping sauce. Definitely try this place out and you won't regret it  :)

DR4gRbSjorbUpxR5mDjang.text: It's a colorful upbeat Hot Pot restaurant with an active conveyor belt filled with different meats.  We ended up here based on the great reviews and we're not disappointed. The conveyor belt looks like so much fun, but very intimidating, if you're a beginner just like us, I suggest you take recommendations from the waiters and let them walk you through the order.  They have a wide variety of condiments from soy sauce, minced garlic, teriyaki sauce to spicy special chef sauce.  You have to pick your meat, veggies and noodles.    We also ordered a Large Kolbe Rice Beef that was so tasty deeelish, every bite was filled with Kolbe beef. Highly recommended.

3m32O-CBOrIoYzagU_SZJg.text: Sign clearly says happy hour after 9:30 Sunday thru Thursday for buy one get one free conveyor. Asked the waitress who ask some other guy who looked completely confused. Apparently he's the manager and he looked at the sign like he's never seen it before. So... The sign says it's happy hour but they don't have it? Good thing I asked before I sat down and ate. Bad thing I waited until 9:30 for the happy hour... False advertisement!

-2hiIaHZrmJx3EAWbzJR7w.text: Really good hot pot. I had the tomato broth really flavorful. The steak wrapped enoki mushrooms were amazing.  The dishes that go around have a good variety and the prices are clearly labeled.  It's not cheap for a hot pot if you do a variety of items but it was well worth it.   I did the beef, some dumplings two different kinds of mushrooms and I loved it all.

OqqU2t2KPvDfbEhzYEDpHA.text: Their customer service is great and food is awesome, good for spending time with family. Nice decoration and warm atmosphere. I would like to come back again whenever i want hotpot.

0ER1D1d0xkfvzY7EKkFwkQ.text: I can't say enough good things about this place. The lamb, the noodles, the soup are all amazing. Kevin makes the whole experience even better. Chubby Cattle is my newest obsession. Can't get enough.

6jYlzWSXH5gNHKyJMHv1QA.text: Yo Guys.. imo this is the best hotpot chain in Vegas period!! Deni the server is really nice and he recommended the coconut cocktail which is his and the Bartender signature drink.. it is really bomb!!the Best cocktail ever.

y2amiRJxd_RjIeDxYpNolw.text: This was such a fun dining experience! I got the original broth and was surprised by how much flavor it had. They have a great selection of veggies and meats and the make your own sauce station is great! The only reason I'm not giving this a 5 star rating is because our server was slacking a bit. It wasn't busy when we came in, yet it took him awhile to get our order and he forgot to bring us a dish. Overall, I really enjoyed dining here and can't wait to go back!

GXsI_LHBcW_Yamus1OWC5g.text: I ate too much, but it's hard not to when every morsel of food gets soaked in fiery flavour. Deni was the server, and he was very accommodating and made sure the hot pot base was full and spicy enough.

JGgQD3YhLqypsMjsUOq2vg.text: First time here! My wife and I really enjoyed the hot pot here.  Deni our server was very friendly and was kind enough to walk us through the menu.  We ordered the ying yang pot, both sides were very flavorful. All other items ordered were very fresh and delicious. We will definitely be back, hopefully getting a table with the rotating dishes!!

1CK5POu-fIjuqbQmzz1ESg.text: The best hotpot place in town. They have the best wide potato noodle, beef brisket, and beef tongue. Always order tomato soup, which matches well the all noodle :) thank u Deni for ur great service :)

oIVbHMOBXJiCurnn9Rc3Gg.text: Hotpot first level spicy is very good although my wife still thinks it's too hot.  We ordered the beef and seafood combo and it doesn't come with any fishballs nor tofu but boy it's a lot of food!  The noodle combo was ok with 5 different variety of noodles and the veggie combo is a must have.  Deni is the best!  Very friendly and informative.  Will definitely return again!

Y1SF_Xn9lX8KPy23atwVaQ.text: We waited for an hour and 20 minutes. The food was fresh and our server, DENI, was very friendly and helpful. The mango juice was well concentrated and fresh. The service was a bit slow since it's busy. I hope next time we come, we don't have to wait that long like today.

fWP1PGsIVqLicXGswgX7fA.text: The BEST thing about this restaurant is their service. The food on the conveyor belt is great too, but the service makes it so much more enjoyable. Everyone is super friendly and helpful. Don't know what you are doing? No problem...just ask. Definitely coming back with friends and family. There's a good variety of foods that will suit everyone's taste.

DT8iOwITbqtw96WOTuu4uw.text: I love the chubby cattle. our server, Deni was very nice and efficient to make sure we had everything we needed and made sure our table was cleared off. i recommend this place to my friends all the time.

PfoJVP2aNrkJoBgjxEpCjw.text: From a Chinese's perspective, this hot pot place is So So. Food is not fresh and the portion for the price is really poor. The dinning environment and service quality are definitely better than most of the Chinese restaurants but I'm not really came here for that. Now I feel the Red Pot is the best hot pot in Las Vegas now. Don't think will come back here again.

_ZJH_Ri5NcttJLDtQa3G8A.text: I was so excited to try this place but was sorely let down. The quality of the seafood was "fishy" and the meat was "gamey." For the price we paid for the proteins, I expected more. The experience was unique and the server was attentive, however; the process wasn't explained well to us and we were left scratching our heads and had to "figure" out what to do with the food and guess at what we were taking on the conveyor belt. It was an interesting experience, but one time is all we needed.  We likely won't go back :(

E4otGemrDmQr8LmN5c0tuA.text: Had a lot of fun here! Deni was very helpful since it was our first time at this place. Most importantly the soups are fantastic!

J1wVeKuVKyZMmhxLm06JBQ.text: Very friendly but forgetful. The food quality was exceptional. I understand it is busy but our server kept saying he would get back to us, about every 20-30 minutes. Aside from that, everything was good.

T9EGnHhNpTRtaxV5S22OOQ.text: This was my boyfriend's and I's first time here and the overall experience was refreshingly different from most hot pot restaurants here in Vegas. The interior is modern with an Asian twist. They offer a conveyor belt that supplied side dishes that you can add to your pot, as well as an additional menu filled with meats and seafood. Our server was Deni, he was very attentive and helpful being it our first time. He went over the menu and was friendly at all times. I would highly recommend this new place to any foodies out there! :)

7uH3y-xyanVI5IR4eSEqIw.text: Very unique place to dine. The broths and meat were on point.  Kwan was very helpful and informative.

zzszs6Kn4sNuK4-VZGj6zA.text: Sorry Chubby Cattle I am not a fan  I really wanted to love you and have you become one of my go to spots. I wanted to share you with my friends and family and sadly this will not be happening.   Coming from Boston where I feel our shabu shabu is the .com I was really hoping this could be the spot .. Wahh   Ok on to my review   It was a Friday night around 10pm. I know late night dinner. I was feeling great. I just got out of a massage ( super popular here) Time for some yummy hot pot.  I had book mark this place and love the concept of the restaurant with the conveyer belt as there is nothing like it in Vegas.   We got seated pretty quickly. I was excited as we got seated at the conveyer belt. It was fogged up and you couldn't really see inside but you could open the lid and check out the selection. The plate color indicated the pricing.  The waiter we had kept trying to tell us you are new here so get like everything combo. The combo veggie and mushroom came in these wooden like basket. The combo beef plate were huge not ideal for a small tables. He seem to discourage us from the items in the conveyer belt. Why ??  We ended up getting the mushroom combo, watercress and meat combo. They did not have a liquor license so BYOB. I tried their watermelon juice ( this seemed water down ) everything else seem fine and fresh.  BF got the tomato base soup and I got the mid level spicy broth. The broth were nothing to blow you out the water .   Now here is where it turns  So when we were waiting on our items we headed over to the sauce station no bowls so we sat back down since none of the staff standing around acknowledge us looking around for bowls and say oh do you need anything( we figure oh maybe they bring you the bowl)  The waiter goes oh go grab your sauce guys. We head over along with all the other newbies and crowded around the station. No bowls Wth ! I look at this guy and said where are the bowls and he comes back with tea cups  ok so I take it. We sit back in out seat ready to go no bowls for our soup ( is this not a hot pot soup spot ? ) or soup spoons . I ask for these items 5 times from 5 different people. Finally I gave up on the bowls just give me soup spoons . This guy says oh let me go wash you some ( why did he feel the need to tell me this ) I wanted to say do you want a cookie !!!  In the middle of eating in our tight cramp area with all our items the waiter comes and ask would you like to do a survey for special on your birthday !! I was like seriously right now I'm not even done eating. My answer was NO.  Than the waiter comes back and interrupts us Again about they are sending him home early and if he could get us our check. Of course we were done and over this place so we said that was fine.  He than comes back to tell us he is giving us free ice cream and to show some support on Yelp. At this point I was at boiling point ! What turn to be a nice night ! They killed my vibe

YHo4LlCTfe2kbxEmqbiRuw.text: I liked it the first time I came, but the second time (last night) not so much. My bf and I ordered the spicy broth and mine was pure grease. You know when you put oil in water? Yea, it looked just like that. It tasted just like it too. It was terrible. When trying to tell the server I didn't like it she just kept insisting it I was too spicy for me. Maybe a language barrier? She even scooped the peppers out even though I kept saying "it's just too greasy." I really think she just didn't want to get me a different soup because once I made it clear I wouldn't eat it and wanted a different broth she seemed bothered. After that she didn't really come to our table nor seem too happy when she did. But back to the food, the original broth I got instead was really great with seafood sauce and cilantro. It tasted VERY similar to Pho (my fave) but when the bill came it was nearly $20 per person. I could've bought actual Pho for 1/2 the price. Overall I just didn't find the food or service to be worth a $20 meal.

P-lC7b4w8oktbLdIh3K1TQ.text: Good menu variety. Fresh vegetables and meat.

mefaSJokavyoU15omgZRtA.text: Kwan was our server and he recommended us many good dishes and suggested us which soup base to get. We ended up ordering the beef combo and brisket, it kept our tummy very warm for the cold days   Excellent customer service and food!

Bc9ZnxyREGzCl1Yxs0wn9g.text: Really cool experience and delicious! Make your own Sauce bar is amazing and if your not sure what to get, try a combo platter.

EFLhttOhDDlI76McPZTdzQ.text: I normally don't eat at soup spots but when I do. I come here, great welcoming staff and delicious food. I'll be back for sure!

TBfow6w0ALOeuf6zbniyJw.text: For first timers, they recommend a platter and grab and go from the conveyer belt! It's overall a great experience and the food is good! Denny is a great server!
